description:
I love this place because it's reliable; it's big enough to always be seated in a timely manner and it's pretty easy to park. Also, their service is excellent, every, single time. I've been coming here for years. The food is fresh; the portions are generous; the price points are reasonable. What's not to
love? 

And I'd be lying if I didn't say that this is a local's joint. You know I dig that.
author: Tough C.

description:
I've been to Pacific Catch quit a few times since its conveniently located near my work place, I'm never amazed and feel that the food and service is usually average but quick so I don't mind going every once in a while. However the last two times I went left me with a bad taste in my mouth (literally) and the service was less than par.

My friend and I went in recently over the weekend right before the dinner time rush. The restaurant was busy but not packed. We were seated pretty quickly at a table of our choice. After 15 minutes we still never had a waiter come by or anyone bring us waters. I went up to the hostess, who was very pleasant, and asked her kindly if we could have a waiter sent to our table as we were ready to order. Our waiter came by to take our orders and that was the last time we saw him. A little later someone brought out our food, which the fish tasted particularly not fresh that day. My friend wasn't happy with her meal either, we both left without finishing our meals. Our waiter never came by to check on our food or ask us if we were ready for the bill. We had to flag down another waiter to grab the bill and alas thats when we saw our waiter next. Needless to say I will not return again.
author: Joanna M.

description:
We used to love this place. Would come here at least once a month, and we had a few waitstaff who would recognize us. Food was a little pricey, but it was good and the service was fine. It was a fun little family indulgence. 

Our first time back in about a year. We should have known something was up when we saw empty tables on a Sunday night. We were sat right away, but had to wait for 8 minutes for someone to come by our table. Looks like it was the manager. He took our drink order, as well as our appetizers and dinner order. Apps were out quick, but we didn't see our mains for a God's 20 minutes after. 

Food was ok. My sweet potato fries were cold. Wife and son were not impressed with their meals. I'm writing this review in from of empty plates. Had to go up and ask for the check, still with plates at the table. I guess it's safe to say service is crap as well. 

What a pity! We won't be back.
author: Eric M.

description:
Their rice bowls have changed unfortunately. We went last night for our usual order of the Japanese wasabi bowl and the Hawaiian teriyaki bowl and noticed that the menu looked updated (thank god!). We also noticed that our bowl ingredients were different but figured it might have been an improvement. 

My boyfriend's bowl was an entirely different meal. We counted under 10 tiny sliced mushrooms and 2 slivers of avocado and smushed down sticky rice, giving the illusion that there was more food on the plate. The protein was dry and flavorless. This was one of the most cheaply made meals we have had in San Francisco and embarrassing for a restaurant to charge for this. It is not an adequate replacement for their previous menu and unfortunately it was now $18 instead of $16.50. Smashing food around in a plate is a great tactic for making kids and animals believe they are eating more. It also looked designed by a child and putting it on a fancy plate does not transform the meal into something worth charging the price we paid.

My Japanese wasabi bowl had so much dressing that it felt like consuming soup with a fork. What happened to the avocado and nori that made my bowl texturally appealing as well as yummy? There was way too much rice in my small sized bowl (the word bowl is generous - it was literally a shallow platter) and the ingredients felt so separate that I was unable to combine them. The proportions and qualities were way off unfortunately and I wish I knew it was more appropriate to ask for a spoon for the amount of dressing. 

We will not be back unless the menu changes back and will look elsewhere for great rice bowls.
author: ashley d.

description:
I don't intend for this to sound like a slight, but I always seem to forget about Pacific Catch.  Whether it's because they've been around for so long or because I've b een here so many times, it's gotten to the point now where they just kind of fade into the background for me.  Which might explain why, despite all of those trips here, I've still never written a review for these guys!  Although, I could've sworn I wrote something about them at some point over the years...

While the place is starting to show a bit of its age (though they did convert part of their entry way into an outdoor seating area with a fire pit), Pacific Catch hasn't let its menu get outdated.  Along with expanding the choices for their long time staples (rice bowls, fried seafood, fish-centric entrees, sushi rolls, etc.), they also keep a rotation of daily chalkboard specials and added a "raw bar" menu, which features varieties of ceviche, poke, taktaki, platters/towers, and more.

Given how many times I've been here, I've been able to try a number of things on their menu, so I'd like to think I have a pretty good sense of them overall.  From their appetizers and fish tacos to their fish & chips and daily chalkboard specials, the food at Pacific Catch is generally pretty fresh...except for all of their fried stuff, like their Mixed Catch plate that my buddy likes).  However, whether it's been when I've dined in or when I used to get takeout, I usually end up getting the same thing every time - their JAPANESE WASABI BOWL with Poke ($16.50).

Filled with Seaweed Salad, Avocado, Daikon Salad, Ginger, Sesame Seeds, Shredded Nori, and Soy-Wasabi Sauce, this isn't bad, but lacking compared to what you can get from poke joints.  While their poke (tuna) is generally pretty fresh, everything else is hit or miss.  The seaweed salad and avocado are good, but I'm not a fan of their daikon salad and the sauce is just okay (I personally prefer ponzu-based ones).  What's more, the rice can be a little inconsistent (can be overcooked).

Despite how their food may not strike me like how it used to, I certainly appreciate how steady and consistent Pacific Catch has been.  From my first trip here, to the time we sat at their bar and watched the Giants clinch the 2014 World Series, to this most recent trip, the food hasn't changed much, for better or worse.  Still, it's nice that whenever I do come back, they're (probably) going to be as reliable as ever!
author: Mike L.

description:
If your dad is in town ask for sea food, this is the place to go.
Great location near the golden gate park with great selection of fresh fish.
We started with Cabo calamari which was made perfect accompanied with Spicy aioli sauce.

My dad took the coho salmon with fries and I had the kanpachi which is one of he best Hawaiian fish you can find around.

Service was quick and efficient, will come back for sure !
Thanks
author: Eyal B.

description:
This is a good option for a meal in the sunset area if you are looking for something more commercial. It was bustling on a game night, mostly in the bar area, but we didn't have any issues getting a large table for a party of two. 

We ordered two rice bowls and a two taco platter - way too much food in hindsight, but we enjoyed having all of the options. I found my Japanese wasabi bowl with salmon (grilled, btw) and 1/2 brown rice 1/2 greens to be very filling and I liked all of the toppings it included. The ingredients were fresh and they don't skimp on anything! The name is a bit of a misnomer though, as there was no wasabi that I could taste or see in my bowl. My mom's WestCoast grilled salmon bowl looked equally delicious but with an assortment of other toppings. 

The tacos were quite hefty in serving size as well. The two tacos could have been a meal on their own, but were served with a side of fries (or salad) and a small bowl of black beans. The Traditional Baja taco and the Grilled Steak taco were both excellent choices, depending on your palate and dietary preferences!
author: Sherry L.

description: Good food for a chain restaurant. I was impressed! Friendly service and everyone enjoyed their food. I had the teriyaki tofu rice bowl and it was good and large portions. I will definitely be back.
author: Irene L.

description: Nice service, cozy place. Loved the rolls (sushi) and tacos & fries were soooo good! Definitely will come again
author: Ekaterina M.

description:
Definitely a great place to go if you're craving quality seafood! All the options here are super fresh - there is a wide variety of poke, fried seafood, soups, etc. On weekends and also Fridays in the evenings this place is usually pretty full, so don't be surprised if you have to wait a bit! My girlfriend and I ate here on a Saturday night at 7:30pm and we could only get outside seating.

For our food we ordered 3 different items! There were all pretty good, definitely really fresh and well prepared. The service was alright since it was super busy, but all in all the meal was nice!

Coconut Shrimp: A bit pricey for what you get. They give you 8 really delicious fried pieces of shrimp for ~$10. Even for SF standards, this is pretty steep. The playing wasn't too great either - it looked like the shrimp were just thrown on there. However, the taste was really good.

Salmon Chowder: Definitely a must-get! The chowder is rich and hearty, and has tons of seafood flavor packed into it! Not too thick or runny, and contained lots of potatoes and vegetables. They were a bit skimpy on the salmon however, only placing 4-5 pieces on top of the chowder.

Combination Poke: Honestly, compared to getting poke at a restaurant that specializes in poke, this fell short. The pieces of fish were cut very weirdly, too small and not enough to get a good bite. The flavor of the salmon was masqueraded with overly rich sauce that they provided.
author: Gregory T.

description:
Finally came here, despite living two blocks away. I thought it was going to be a a place that serves like cooked, whole fish, instead of more poke/hawaiian. 

Got the rice bowl with poki on top (salmon avocado). The portion size was good, but I could barely taste the dressing. The rice was also cooked really weird, kinda soggy. 

My bf got a fish sandwich thing and it seemed pretty good. He also got seasoned fries but they were a tad bit too salty.

We also got a sushi roll: some spicy salmon on a california roll kinda thing. It was pretty decent.

I think this place could be good, if you know exactly what to order. Unfortunately, I don't know what that is. I would give it another chance if this was located in some more remote area, but it's hard to resist other restaurants next door that I love.

This is a nice roomy restaurant though! So roomy and large that it felt ginormous to SF residents who are used to whole in the wall kinda places.
author: Stephanie K.

description:
I am never disappointed when I come here. A cosmo martini is only $8!  Wow!  Score. I also had the Japanese wasabi poke rice bowl and Brussels sprouts.  I got
The rice bowl 1/2 brown rice and 1/2 greens. It was just right and delicious with Hawaiian poke. The Brussel sprouts was also really good. We finished everything!
author: Donna L.

description:
Pacific Catch is a nice venue, and our waitress was great. Sadly the food let us down, and the wait was far too long for a simple order.

My girlfriend and I split three shrimp tacos and an order of fried calamari. There wasn't anything wrong with either dish, but they weren't especially memorable. Maybe our expectations were too high. Not a bad place to go, but we won't be returning any time soon
author: Rich S.

description:
Went here for dinner on Friday night and it was great. Here's why:

First of all, there's a parking lot which is unheard of in the Sunset area unless you're a super market or a drug store. We found a spot as soon as we pulled in. Next, the restaurant was so lively and bustling. I just loved the atmosphere from the get go. It was busy on a Friday night and the wait was long but they told us there was space at the bar so the two of us took a seat and skipped the entire line. We didn't order any alcohol but the bartender was definitely entertaining to watch. Free show/entertainment with dinner and no line?! Already a good start to the meal.

We ordered tacos (traditional Baja, Mahi Mahi, and cabo shrimp), the Hawaiian poke appetizer, and the Korean bbq rice bowl. The poke was a great wonderful mix of flavor although a tad on the saltier side. The fish was fresh and a nice texture that was not too mushy or chewy. Of the tacos, my favorite was the cabo shrimp as that one was moist and juicy while the other two tacos were a bit on the drier side which makes sense given that it was fish. The Kbbq bowl was huge and had a lot of rice. The meat on the bowl was delicious although I did find the sweet egg quite odd.

The meal took a while to come out due to some unknown reason but the manager noticed and comped our appetizer so great customer service there. The bartender was super nice too. 

Would come here again!
author: Lily F.

description: Decent little seafood place. It has a new/ modern style. Fresh fish daily and a good variety. They give free edamame, which is cool if you like that. I ordered a Thai tea, it was actually surprisingly good besides being a premade tea. The menu had poke bowls a few sushi rolls rice bowls, salads, seafood towers(expensive) cocktails steak and of course fresh fish platters. My husband ordered traditional Baja fish tacos, he said it was good but the black beans that came with it as a side were no bueno. I ordered a poke chashimi, never had it before but it sounded good. It was a larger portion than I expected, everything tasted fresh and delicious, would have liked more seaweed salad. Only giving four stars because our waiter wasn't that welcoming, and seemed like he was in a rush even though the place was empty.
author: Zarafina H.

description:
From out of town, we were hungry after driving from Reno that day.  We happened to hit happy hour, cheaper prices.  We had poke, calamari, and a sushi roll.  The poke had a nice avocado sauce with it.  Salmon in poke was chunky with large pieces, many stringy.  We didn't detect much salmon flavor, just a fish flavor.  Being from the Pacific NW, we know salmon--this was pale in flavor at best. 

Moving on to the fried calamari, it was delicious!  It had a nice crunchy coating and wasn't oily at all.  Squid was tender, not rubbery.  Good choice!

Then, the California roll.  Pieces were tall, and not tightly rolled.  A little hard to eat as it unrolled on the plate.

All in all, it was fine overall.  Fish was clean, and fresh.  Just not my favorite, for my tastebuds.
author: Elizabeth K.

description:
Come at 7:45pm .
When we are waiting for the table outside near the fireplace but the waiter is doesn't look at us ( we are in the line first), she clean the table and took other ground in this table that we want, didn't ask us anything . Second thing make me felt disappointed with my tea . I order hot green tea but I received is not hot tea, just like the water. The food is fine , nothing special but  the service seem very bad here.
author: Amelia D.

description: Ordered an expensive $14 for 2 tacos plate. Both the tacos were cold. The baja fish taco could've used more flavor. The steak taco, which had rave reviews on Yelp, was okay, not great. The fries were standard (I got cajun seasoned), but other than that. Not worth $14.
author: Hanna M.

description:
Apologies in advance to anyone from San Diego, but Pacific Catch is my baseline for good fish tacos. I know it's technically a Bay Area chain restaurant, but there's no denying that Pacific Catch manages to keep locals coming back whenever they're craving some unpretentious seafood: abundant seating (with the chance to choose between a livelier, younger happy hour crowd on the left side of the restaurant and a more family-oriented booth seating on the right), complimentary pretzel Goldfish and edamame at the beginning of your meal, and a plethora of menu options.

Sure, you can order a rice bowl, sandwich, or maybe even a slightly overpriced poke bowl here, but I truly think the fish tacos are where Pacific Catch shines. Having driven past Pacific Catch all the time when I was younger, I didn't think to finally check it out until a few years ago when two of my friends shared that this was where they got their fish taco fix. 

Whatever you do, do not turn down the opportunity to pay an extra $1 for sweet potato fries. They are beyond flavorful and help you forget that you're eating at a chain restaurant. I also like the quaint Honolulu Tribune newspaper wax/butcher paper that the fish tacos come on because it feels like how a mom-and-pop fish stand would serve 'em. I like to get the three taco platter ($17.50 with the sweet potato fries) with traditional baja and cabo shrimp. With the cod and avocado-tomatillo salsa, the traditional baja is my personal favorite because it seems juicier and fresher, but I'm also a sucker for the cabo shrimp because of the generous amount of avocado it comes with. $17.50 certainly seems like a lot to pay for three fish tacos, but I've never been disappointed with the quality of the fish or found myself hungry again a few hours later.

Speaking of prices, the Mai Tai here sure is tasty and will fulfill all your rum-related dreams, but at $11, I have a hard time justifying it because it's not exactly of cocktail bar caliber. So get a pitcher of it instead -- $40 for five servings!
author: Amy C.

description:
Low quality food
I went there with my girlfriend last week 
Ordered ahi salad 
Do you believe me they served the almost rotten Avocado to me ! 
And the Hamachi Crudo was bad and unfresh at all 
 
The hamachi was cloudy white (hamachi has to be clearly white)  and it came with the yellow avocado as well 

So no doubt why i gave tips super low (sorry about that) 
The service its okay not bad
But trust me  Their food is hella gross
author: Noah P.

description:
Ugh, I live nearby and drop in from time to time. The food and drinks are (generally) consistent, but one key thing isn't: the service.

Today it took 15 minutes to bring me the water I asked for when I sat down (it arrived with my food). After I ate, it took another 15 minutes for someone to come to the area I was seated in to take my card to pay. No one stopped to check how the food was, to refill the water, or anything.

There were babies / young children wailing, so a relaxing meal was out of the question.

I had the poke trio, and the two tuna options were good (Not enough Serrano peppers in its namesake dish) but the salmon was kind of oddly chewy.

In the past when I've dined at the bar, the bartenders are inattentive. You can finish your drink and they won't be around to ask for a refill until after you're ready to pay and leave.

There are better options nearby for sushi or poke bowls. There are better options a bit further away bit still in the Sunset for fish tacos. There are better options for drinks. I won't be back. Disappointing.
author: Steven J.

description:
I came here for lunch on a weekday. It wasn't crowded at all, so they seated us very quickly! 

The staff was very nice and attentive.

I tried a few different things on the menu. First of all, their lemonade is very good! It's on the sweeter side, but tasted fresh. As an appetizer, we got the crab cakes. They were cold and a bit more crunchy than I'm used to, but they still tasted great. For my main entree, I decided to get tacos. I really wasn't a fan of them. They were very dry, the chicken was a bit chewy, and the fish wasn't cooked too well.

I've been here once before so I know their food is amazing. I think it was just a bit off on this visit. On my first time, I got the Wasabi Ahi sandwich and loved it! It's very moist and tasted amazing.

Next time I go, I'll avoid the tacos and probably get a sandwich instead.
author: Remy B.

description: Yummy goodness! I've been coming to this location for for the past 7 years and every time I get yumminess! With friends, we get a booth in the back but when I'm by myself, I sit at a table in the bar section. I almost always order their Salmon Salad..it is so delicious it is my favorite salad in the world. The sauce is what makes it bomb! Can I buy a bottle? Some other notable favorites are the Hawaiian teriyaki rice bowl, fried oysters, pacific crab salad, fish and chips, mahi mahi and steak tacos, and seasoned fries. Service is always good except one time, nobody came to give me my bill and took a long time to flag someone down. But, otherwise they are attentive.
author: Annie L.

description: Great fish at moderate price. The service was nice and quick and the venue is suitable for couples and families with kids.
author: Markku K.

description:
My boyfriend and I decided to drive from Napa to SF to explore The Academy of Science on very rare mutual day off together. Once we got to the city, my boyfriend was starving and wanted to stop to eat before we reached our destination. We searched restaurants near by and found this little gem! So happy we did! 

We decided to start with the calamari, which did not disappoint! Hands down, one of the best I've ever had. The fried peppers and Brussels sprouts mixed in were absolute money! Our waiter, whose name I sadly did not catch, was awesome. He was very knowledgeable of the menu and helping us decide what to order. We decided on the Hawaiian Kanpachi which was cooked perfectly, the kamichi fried rice which was ahhhhmazinggg and last but not least the Mexican "elote" corn... Holy shit, I kid you not.. was like an orgasm in my mouth!! That fricken good!!! Overall, we were incredibly happy with our food and service! We'll definitely be back next time we're in SF!
author: Heather M.

description: Good food, family friendly, free parking, near tourist attractions. Reasonable prices, clean.
author: Liz B.

description: Great food. Great atmosphere. Cool patio with outdoor heaters. Super good and super fresh sushi. Will definitely be back again. (From JERSEY)
author: Zephaniah J.

description:
Pacific Catch is a favorite of mine for happy hour (m-f 4-6pm) they have a large selection at reasonable prices. The vibe is very family friendly, very clean and neutral. Not too busy or too empty. Their margarita of the season is always great, strong enough and consistently tasty. I enjoy sitting in the bar area, even outside happy hour, because in my experience that is where you get the best service;) The restaurant is larger than most in the area and the menu can accommodate a range of tastes, which is great for family visiting or dining with a group of friends. I gave them 4 stars for inattentive servers, the place is priced high enough that you should expect them to keep your glass of water full and deliver the check/take your order in a more timely fashion. More often than not we wait more than 15 minutes for our check. The bartenders are all GREAT, and really brought up the team average. Secondly, the price points are slightly high for the quantity of food you get. For example; the appetizer ceviche (photo) is one of my favorites, but is quite small for 2 people and usually scant on chips. The Calamari is better sized and just as tastey! 
Pros: Great HH (recommend ceviche, calamari, Baja shrimp tacos, sushi rolls), tastey Margs, roomy
Cons: slow service, smallish portions 
Overall: I go a couple times a month, so it's plenty good if you ask me! 

Note: Their HH menu changes from time to time, which is sometimes exciting and sometimes disappointing.
author: Whitney B.

description:
This review is for the food/experience not the waiters who were all very nice and clearly understaffed.

 Long story short: this Pacific Catch stop isn't one you'd want to visit.  The ambiance is lacking (fluorescent lights, minimal decor) and the restaurant itself feels very crowded. I know it is San Francisco, but the bathrooms are basically in the kitchen and there isn't any signage to point them out. 

We had a reservation at 6. We were served our food at 7:30. We ordered appetizers which were brought to the wrong table by the food runner on accident (we watched this happen as we were super hungry and it had been an hour since we ordered them) and the person promptly ate one thus ensuring that was now their dish. That is (somewhat) out of the restaurants control, but they neglected to make it right right away. The staff did apologize, but we waited another 20 minutes for the replacement app...along with our long awaited meals. 

I ordered the steak ($29) which was pretty pricey and asked it be MEDIUM with some pink. It was a hockey puck. I felt bad saying anything or sending it back, but it was cooked to a crisp. I ended up sending it home with my parents for my dog to eat. There was virtually no flavor and it was tough to even cut. The kimchi rice was good, but would have tasted even better with a properly cooked steak to add in. 

There were no drink specials on a Sunday and beers/wine are all ~$8+ with cocktails being $11+.

I felt bad for our kind waiter who clearly knew that we wouldn't be back. Hope they can figure it out!
author: Abigail S.

description: Great happy hour- yummy fresh fish for reasonable prices, 4-6p and 10p to close. Inner sunset residents head on down, great deals in the neighborhood. Sadly, they discontinued $5 Friday mai tais when you're wearing Hawaiian gear, but still a good spot
author: Abby R.

description:
This place is wildly consistent.

Great portions. Fresh fish and vegetables. BIG fan of the Wasabi Bowl with Tuna and Salmon (and go half and half, brown rice and salad).

Not going to blow you away, but they consistently deliver.
author: Mike V.

description:
We came here for my gf's bday dinner celebration and sat outside by the fire pit. 

Food: 2/5 - Between the 2 of us, we had calamari and a rice bowl each. I got the salmon Korean bowl. The "spiced" cucumbers and "pickled" radish didn't have much flavor at all. Although the bowls looked good, not everything in it tasted good. 

Ambiance: 5/5 - Sitting outside as the sun was setting was so relaxing. When it started getting breezy, there was a heat lamp above us and the glass fire pit to our side to keep us warm.

Download their app for free desert! We got the macadamia nut ice cream brownie on the house :)
author: Anna C.

description: Visited this place yesterday with a girlfriend for a birthday celebration and I was impressed. Ambiance nice, food and drinks were great. Hhr prices are to die for. Parking sucks in the area only a few spaces in back of restaurant. Dog friendly place too.....I'm particularly thrilled about eating with dogs but I guess they are only allowed in patio area. Will be back enjoy myself.
author: Danyell C.

description:
I don't know what has been happening lately, but Pacific Catch's poke quality has been bad the past 3 visits.

I come specifically because their poke is usually fresh. I noticed their original is always good. However, the California poke use to be my favorite. The first time I actually had to get it sent back. The second and third, I sucked it up. Poke is one of my favorite food and I am 100% sure it was not fresh.
author: Darlene T.

description:
Came here for SF restaurant week. Food here is delicious!

We had 2-course lunch. They offer two options, and we tries both.

First one had:
Grilled Kanpachi Yellowtail 5/5
Forbidden Black Mango Sticky Rice 3/5 

Second one had:
Kanpachi Tataki 5/5
Kanpachi Citrus Poke tacos 5/5
Mochi Fondue 5/5
author: Yu S.

description:
With seven restaurants in the Bay Area, Pacific Catch can only be called a chain restaurant, with all that that moniker conveys.  I am not a fan of chains.  But what chains lack in charm they usually make up for (if they are good) in consistency of experience.  From that standpoint, Pacific Catch is on the higher end of the curve for what a chain restaurant experience can be.

This location in the Sunset is always crowded and has systems in place (a buzzer) to notify waiting guests when a table is ready. I actually hate to dine with a buzzer, but I have to admit that I do like an efficient process and getting seated, so there are trade offs certainly.

On the plus side, we were seated quickly, ordered quickly and the fresh seafood was solid. Some things were, in fact, an excellent value (the fresh Crab Melt for example) while other things arrived and we found them disappointingly small.  Their ceviche was fresh and well seasoned, but uncommonly small down what can only be described as a minuscule handful of chips.

As a local chain, Pacific Catch certainly has more upside than down.  Despite an original restaurant with a point of view being our preferred dining experience, we can give credit to a chain restaurant and even seek it out, if it's a good one.
author: Rachel H.

description:
This is an update on my last review. This restaurant has gone to a central system for ordering food and it has not helped. Since the people you talk with are not on site, they don't know how busy it is or if they are out of something. So my last two times I have ordered food it was really frustrating and on top of it, people at the restaurant don't seem to care about the frustration. While I really like the food, I don't plan to order food from here anymore. 

In general I really like the food, but it is really inconsistent- sometimes sublime other times just ok. If you are ordering take out, they will screw up your order so double check your food before you leave.
author: Marianna P.

description:
My first time here. Lunch with family 
Service and the food is excellent 
Very popular with the locals. .
author: Remy B.

description:
Solid. Solid. Solid. I've never had a bad meal here, and their ever-evolving list of seasonal specials always provides at least one standout dish per order. 

Seems like everyone is perpetually happy in this place--customers and employees. Is it the complimentary dish of edamame and pretzel goldfish? Is it the Mai Tais? It's probably the Mai Tais. The Lemongrass Mojito is excellent too. 

Obviously the poke is a must-order. Don't cheat yourself, get the trio. 

Sweet potato fries are a sleeper hit. What's in the seasoning???

I recommend dining in the bar area where local sports are always on, or the heated patio which is super dog friendly.
author: Patty J.

description:
Went for Happy Hour.  The Poke bowls are amazing.  Really  enjoyed the  California  Style Poke which is a deconstructed California Roll minus the rice.  The Ribs too much sauce and just ok.

Service was great.  The servers bartenders, busser and manager work as a team.  Bartender Riley was  excellent and Manager Mike went above and beyond to make sure everything was great
author: Sandi E.

description: We got the Japanese wasabi brown rice bowl. And the trio fish and chip, The deep fried oysters so good.
author: Honey H.

description:
The food was ok, but it took 30 minutes for our food to arrive at the table. Our server was nice. He answered our questions about the menu and took our order when we were ready. 

We ordered tacos, chicken tenders, and tofu and rice. Nothing seemed overly complicated, but it took 30 minutes to get our food. We noticed the dishes for other servers came out much faster. People were seated, served, and had left in the time we were still there. I don't know if it was our server or the kitchen had something against our server, but the food came out noticeably slower for our server's tables. 

The food was ok. Nothing blew us away. I liked the shrimp tacos.
author: Payal V.

description:
After leaving the Academy of Science, Priscilla H. and I had no problem finding dinner nearby. Just down the street is Pacific Catch, and even though only street parking is available, we lucked out by finding an open spot on Martin Luther King Jr. Drive. It's just a hop and a skip away from the restaurant.

The restaurant has a very cool vibe going on. They have beautiful paintings of aquatic life on the wall, and the whole place feels like it should be located on the water. Our server was Jesse, and he was great. He was friendly, funny, and he made sure we were taken care of before taking off. 

We started our meal with a small dish of shelled edamame and goldfish pretzels. An interesting and unusual combo, I know. But the two together actually made one tasty treat. From there we went to ceviche, and it was so good it took all our strength not to lick the bowl. The ceviche was fairly simple yet tasty, and the amount of shrimp they offer you is incredible. It comes with a side of chips, but I preferred to eat it alone.  I ordered the salmon and avocado poke for dinner. I've never had poke before, but I must say I am now a fan. For someone trying to watch what they eat, it was the perfect option. Plus, Jesse offered to bring me a side of brown rice that went perfect with it. I turned it into a little salad bowl. If you love sushi, but you want to lay off the rice-heavy rolls, this is an excellent substitute. The dish came with won tons, which I saved for snacking later. 

The meal came to an end with a beautiful dessert. Jesse recommended one dessert, but we decided we must try the Dulce de Leche Spring Roll, because how often do you come across something so unique? It was beautiful both visually and gustatory. It's a puff pastry, filled with caramel cheesecake, wrapped up and deep fried, and then topped with a generous portion of the most amazing ice cream ever. The ice cream was incredibly smooth, and if it's not homemade, it's the closest thing to it.  The whole meal was spectacular, but that dessert is mind blowing. 

Pacific Catch offers what every restaurant goer wants: Great food, at great prices, with great customer service.
author: Jonathan R.

description: I had the Vietnamese sandwich and to me it was really good and spicy. Their coleslaw made the meal taste extra good too. Their water was good than some places I've had. On the other hand my grandma had the Salmon salad and it was dry and tasteless. I felt bad for her we had to order her food some where else afterwards. My husband ordered the chipotle chicken and his was soooooo good! Loved the flavors that meshed together.
author: CJ L.

description: Terrible service, food takes waaaaaayyyyyy too long. They seem unorganized. People who ordered after me received their food first. I hate that.
author: Mike R.

description: Their seared Ahi Sammich is bangin'. The gf got some fish and chips which she has relayed to me that they were indeed delicious.
author: Gary B.

description:
Two things on the menu:

- crab salad is huge and made with real crab. They are very generous with the crab 

- fish and chips which you can order more Alaskan cod at around 2 dollars per piece. The only problem is that it's a bit overcooked for my tastes
author: Darwin L.

description: Great place!  Good food - good service - good prices!  I eat here each time I come to SanFrancisco (which is at least once a year) and have never been disappointed.  P.S. The fish tacos are great.
author: Denise A.

description: Pacific Catch is supposed to known for Fish N' Chips. I actually forgot what I had it was like an alternative of Singapore Noodles with spicy pepper on it. I thought it was okay. I rate it as 7.5/10. I got to admit the " Mexican Coffee " and Ice Cream was really good. I think it was only seasonal. But it was SOOO GOOD. I give it 10/10.
author: Julia D.

description: After a day of sightseeing we stumbled across this spot.  The bartender suggested kiwi cocktail w vodka instead of gin and it was amazing.  Ordered the fresh fish sampler.  Also amazing!! Best stop on our journey around town!
author: Lynann K.

description:
Came here for Valentine's Day and got a reservation through open table. 

Food:
We got the calamari appetizer which was good, except the people behind us got almost twice the amount we did.

I got a shrimp taco a la carte and a firecracker salmon roll. The shrimp taco wasn't that great, fell apart and the shrimps breading fell off them. The roll was probably the best thing we ordered. It was flavorful and good. 

My boyfriend got the petrale sole with dungunees crab. We expected that to be like half fish half crab, but in reality it was like a spoonful of crab and pretty small portion of fish too. It was a $30 entree and he was still hungry. Just wasn't explained clear enough on the menu I guess. 

Service:
We got seated exactly at the time of our reservation which was nice. Our waitress was nice but didn't really explain the specials and the menu. 

Overall our food was alright, not sure we will be coming back anytime soon :(
author: Hayley D.

description: I really enjoyed the poké at this restaurant! Even though the bowls looked small, it's actually filling and packed with yummy veggies. I ordered the japanese wasabi and it wasn't as spicy as I thought it would be. They also have a pitcher of margarita and we split that with 5 people and it was pretty strong! The interior inside the restaurant is very upscale and this is a great place to meet with a group of friends or date night!
author: Jenny L.

description: We ate at two Pacific Catch restaurants. The newer one was pretty tasty. One in our group had the crabcakes salad and really enjoyed it. The original restaurant was where we ate the second time and it was not nearly as good. The menu is smaller and it was explained that was because the kitchen is smaller. While on the way to the restroom, I walked by a shelf in the hall that had two vats of uncovered sauce and also a square clear plastic container that held a big plastic bag of frozen fish. I placed my hand on the side of the vat and the water was warm. Not a good way to thaw any kind of meat. I was also surprised that they weren't using fresh fish for all of their meals. Our waiter was pretty good and attentive. But the food, was just so-so.
author: E T.

description:
Great great service but the food was just EH for me.
This afternoon I ordered the sole with crab mash . The mash was decent but the sole lacked flavor and the broccoli was pretty bland ( am I the only one that seasons my broccoli?) Unfortunately , After eating , I was still looking for something else to snack on the portion was pretty small and I was left Unsatisfied . I wish I would of went with the crispy tacos instead maybe those would have been better and more filling.
The first time I came here it took 40 minutes to get my fish and chips the manager was apologetic . This time my food was just blah‍
So I don't know if I will be back.
author: LaNiesha P.

description: The setting is great with great food all around.  I had the Thai curry rice bowl and it was absolutely amazing.  My waiter told me that the bowl was going to be discontinued in a month and I hope that will not happen as this is my favorite rice bowl here!
author: James M.

description:
Pretty decent place with pretty good food. The service isn't bad either. The fish tacos are gluten-free as are many items on the menu. The margaritas are fine, but nothing to write home about. My daughter loves the fish and chips and my husband likes the poke & the ahi salad. 
They have a parking lot & if you're lucky you may even get a spot.
author: Heather S.

description:
First off, service was great! Hostess and waiter were both very nice, and the waiter checked up on us regularly. Unfortunately, I come back for food/drinks... good service is a bonus. 

Now onto happy hour... drinks and food. The Mai tai was great; it's not too strong but you can definitely taste the alcohol so you know they're not skimping on it. $7 for a glass or $34 for a pitcher with 5 servings ($1 saving). The food was overall subpar although portions were good--average $5.5-$6.50 / plate. 

Calamari - not crunchy; tasted almost stale (like it's been sitting out a while).
Salmon avocado poke - this was good. Fish tasted fresh. The chips that it came with was thin and crunchy, which I liked, but it tasted greasy. 
Inside out roll - the spicy tuna on the outside wasn't spicy and it was creamier than I liked, like it had too much mayo. 
Rising sun - the shrimp tempura wasn't crunchy on the inside, but I liked the fresh raw tuna on top.

In short, this wouldn't be my pick for happy hour but if my friends suggest it, I wouldn't fight them on it (if they've been here before and know what they're getting themselves into).
author: Angie Y.

description: I happen to be in the area and stopped by with a friend to grab the poke. It was delicious as usual BUT I am not happy with the mahi mahi island tacos. When I took my first bite I realized how completely raw it was. Not good! Luckily, a waitress came by and asked if everything was fine and took care of the bill. I'm not quite sure if I'll be back. I guess I should always check if the food is cooked from now on. Although, one would assume that it would be.
author: William Y.

description:
Pretty pricey place.. the two of us ended up sharing the Thai coconut shrimp & a tempura shrimp roll from the appetizer menu. Food was really tasty and even though we just got appetizers it still left me satisfied. 
The restaurant itself had a nice ambiance and it was very clean. Service was good.
author: Mirelle M.

description:
"Will that make me bloaty?"

You know you do this too. When you pick what you will wear you have to ask yourself if the food at the restaurant makes you bloaty (no bodycon dresses)

Maybe it's just me. 

Pacific Catch. Impossibly fresh fish, friendly service, and a good full feeling that doesn't make you bloaty and lazy. 

I always have to have the poke trio along with an entree. The Californian with the imitation crab isn't that great so skip that one (despite a bazillion others who swear by it) 

This is my go-to restaurant when I want something fuss-free and good. 

They have a teensy lot beside the restaurant that I've scored a spot 50% of the time I visited.

Everyone has been here for a healthy delicious meal, right? Right? 

You should go if you haven't. Today is a good day.
author: Jennifer C P.

description: Are you in San Francisco, California and looking for a great place to eat? Well Pacific Catch is NOT the place to go. So many problems, from its overpriced un-tasteful menu to it's slow terrible service. Trust me when I tell you, it's going to be hard to find something good to eat on the menu. However I do recommend the Pollo Asado sandwich. Easily the best and only good thing on the menu. Sad to say I won't be returning, PACIFIC CATCH was a sPACIFIC disaster, definitely won't CATCH me here...
author: Elijah G.

description:
I have heard so many great things about this place.... (my last two trips to SF) 

This place is loud.  I apparently yelled at a hostess and made her cry when I was just talking over the loud music.   She gave a horrible face &  I asked why she was making that face. 

The manager was saying she is sensitive & really did not do anything other than tell me his employee was upset. 

We had a GREAT server & that was the best part.  She was super nice & on top of everything. 

Poke was average , salmon was dry & no flavor.  Bowl with Mahi was ok.  Maybe we ordered the wrong type of food....it's packed in here. 

We most likely won't come back.
author: Jul S.

description:
I walked passing by the restaurant. It looks like a decent restaurant but quite empty inside. 

Waitress basically just tried to ignore me. I eventually brought attention of someone. She basically threw the menu on the table then walked away. OMG!!! When I opened the menu, it appeared the paper was all soaked. 

I was not angry. Out of curiosity, I changed to another side of the restaurant. Just wanna be sure it's just a bad waitress not a bad restaurant. Then I saw a few other waitresses walked passing me a few times although I raised my hand. I felt like an invisible person. It does not bother me. I had same feeling like step on dogs poop accidentally at wrong time and wrong place. 

As a consultant, I have a few assumptions,
1. They don't like Asian. Or previously they had bad experience with Asian customers so their waitresses felt it's legitimate not to serve Asian customers. 

2. It's just another bad restaurant we see from Yelp from time to time. They are in the service industry but don't offer good service. The management has no idea what's going on. Their waitresses just came by, punched the clock and called it a day.

3. I assume their food is still ok. It's quite a large restaurant with good decoration. It must be a reason it could last so long. If service is bad, what else could support it? Having said that, a good restaurant with bad service and good food, does it make sense to anyone?

I still felt perplexed to that waitress. I met a lot offensive people in my life but not like her, an waitress working in a restaurant which seems to have a fairly good ranking in San Francisco. I felt like she wanna slap her customer on the face but still expects him to dine in afterwards. She should be ashamed for her service.

My conclusion is it's a bad restaurant. Whoever read my comment, please stay away from it, either you are international traveller or local resident. You deserve something much better in San Francisco. For me, this restaurant will never show up in my life again. Just like what I said, I step on dogs poop at wrong time and wrong place. Only thing I feel disappointed is it happens in San Francisco.
author: Ian Q.

description: This restaurant is incredibly popular, but I think they are resting on their laurels. While the food can be really good, the wait staff does seem quite stoned at times. Perhaps having a policy of being sober on the job would help out.
author: Jon W.

description:
My first visit was a few weeks ago for my friends birthday. We went there for lunch. The food was great but it took over 45 minutes for it to come. When we asked if our food was ready the server came right out with it. He didn't apologize for the wait or seem to care. Although it was good,  we were not able to enjoy our meal and had to rush back to work. 
I wrote a feedback to the company and they gave me a complementary entrée. I went back with my friend on Saturday night and it was a much better experience. Our server, Jessie was awesome! He checked in with us and we were very happy with everything. I'm glad we had a much better experience than the first time. We'll be back. 
Thank you Jessie for your excellent service.
author: Nancy T.

description: First time dining here and the first time trying poke.  The food was great and enough variety for even my children. I had a Poke Bowl, kid's had chicken teriyaki, french fries, and sushi.  The service by the wait staff and the bartender ( Riley and Max) was fantastic, we were well taken care of.  Tuesday is 1/2 off bottles of wine - score!  There was also a small parking lot and street parking. I definitely recommend this location.
author: Nancy S.

description:
The food was delicious.
Great flavor and we loved the sushi. Cocktails were very well made. Friendly staff and a nice overall vibe!
author: Susie H.

description: Waited for ever to get seated but once we did the wait was worth it! Fresh Hawaiian infused California dishes, I really enjoyed myself!
author: Karlos G.

description:
So kind to my family, including 3 kids under 5. They are always ready with high chairs, edamame, and pretzel goldfish for us. The fresh catch salmon was delicious. Hubby and I enjoyed the poke trio. Will be back soon with our crew. 

It's a great place to eat after a morning at Cal Academy. Metered parking lot on 7th.
author: waiming B.

description: Staffs are friendly, and inside the restaurant is clean. Also, they have many seats, so it's good for groups. About to dishes, every portion is big, and we can share dishes. I ordered Poki bowl, and I could eat about 3/5 because of big volume. One thing, for me, their sushi rice is too acidic.
author: Yumiko H.

description: Fresh and delicious seafood. Drinks good too (a bit pricey) but alcohol is worth it :) good date spot and great service - so stinkin close to the park!
author: Megan C.

description: I love this place. The food is reliably good. The menu changes frequently.  The cocktails are consistently fantastic and are comparative to what you'd find at a swanky craft cocktail bar. What I truly love about this place is the service.  The waiters are knowledgeable and attentive and the bartenders are very friendly and skilled. Tonight I took my best girlfriends here and red haired Ben was EXCELLENT! My friend has multiple food allergies and he was able to hook her up with exactly what she wanted in a way that didn't make her feel like a total  PIA. He was attentive, gave great recommendations and was able to balance being professional and fun at the same time. We love Pac Catch! Thanks again Ben. Shout out to Robyn as well, we miss you!
author: Mary W.

description:
Loved their Soft Tacos  you'll never go wrong with this Dish... And for the first time ever did I Finished the whole fries... it got to be this good ... but the best part is when you get Good Service.. Lexi our server was there to suggest.. she's checked on us and refill our water with out even asking ..nice sharp eyes... on our way out thanked us for our business.. will be back  !!!!

Mahalo Lexi
author: Donovan L.

description:
After living in this neighborhood for several years, I've come to appreciate Pacific Catch for another purpose: it's a great meeting spot. 

If you have reservations and have a table waiting for you, Pacific Catch is great to grab an actual, real meal. The menu is varied enough (obviously with a heavy emphasis on seafood) that there should be something for everyone. The servers are excellent at what they do, and, while service may be slow, you and your companions can use the time to talk, get to know each other, catch up, and what have you. (Better have good conversation material ready if you don't want to spend your waiting time looking at your phone.)

However, you can only take advantage of happy hour in the bar area. And boy, is it a great happy hour. They have a great (not huge) selection of beers, wines, and cocktails, so there should be something to suit everybody. The happy hour bar bites are decently priced, as well. People love sharing the french fries. Poke (comes with wonton chips) and tacos are other popular options. Their bar area is free seating, and there is usually plenty of room for a large group (I'm thinking at least 8 people) to chill--especially if it's at that huge table in the back.  I think reservations can only be made for after happy hour, so if your group comes early enough, you can snag the big table.

Geez, you can tell I've hung out at Pacific Catch a lot, huh.
author: Jade V.

description: The Poke is out of this world here- no one can beat the freshness, quality, and selection of poke in SF. The staff are friendly, professional, and always have great specials to recommend. I love coming for the happy hour out on the patio and sitting by the fire in summer evenings. They also have a parking lot- it fills up, but it's helpful if you can get a spot! The fish and chips, oysters, and coconut prawns basket is really tasty tacos are really good too. For the cocktails, I love the spicy pacific mango number and the seasonal margaritas are always on point.
author: Lisa H.

description:
Slow service.
Dry fish.

Yelp wants me to say more in order to post but this pretty much sums it up
author: James M.

description: Great happy hour food (and drinks)! It does get crowded then, but staff are helpful and friendly..and maybe a little bit exhausted from the rush and crowd
author: Julia M.

description: I've been coming to Pacific Catch for years as it's one of my favorite restaurants in SF.  Every few months an old friend of mine drives down from Sonoma and we eat here.  And I come alone about once every 3 weeks. I've never had a bad or even mediocre meal here. My favorite dish is the Salmon Salad. The salad is always fresh and the wild caught salmon is always cooked as I request, a little rare.  The portions of all their dishes are generous as well as delicious. Their appetizers are also really tasty.  My favorites among them are the Sticky Korean Ribs and the Tempura Ahi Rolls. I should also mention the staff at Pacific Catch.  The waitstaff couldn't be more pleasant and gently attentive, always noticing when you may want a refill of your green tea, etc.  Two days ago our waiter, Ben, was so very friendly and helpful to us.  As we were leaving I asked to speak to the manager so that I tell him what a fine waiter he had in Ben, but I was told that the manager was in a meeting and so, at last, I am giving Pacific Catch the 5-star yelp review that it's been deserving for several years!
author: William D.

description:
Pacific Catch West Coast Fish House is a solid place to get good if unspectacular seafood dishes like soft tacos, poke and rice bowls and sushi rolls. This franchise lays in the heart of San Francisco's Inner Sunset neighborhood right off the of the 9th Avenue Entrance to Golden Gate Park. Pacific Catch is a fine franchise and it's been in this location for over ten years, so despite the competition of the surrounding neighborhood this place is doing just fine. But the question is, is it worth it?

I went for a pre-planned birthday party, so we were able to make reservations for our party of seven at 7pm on a Wednesday evening in July. Although I've been this restaurant before, I haven't been in a while and I like some of the newer things they've brought to the interior, like a nice outdoor fireplace in front of the vestibule area and all of the funky artwork on the walls and hanging from the ceilings. Upon opening the menu, I did notice that the prices are high at Pacific Catch. Be prepared to get sticker shock as this place does not represent the most affordable meals for families in or from out of town. The average price is sixteen dollars per main course, but the food was dependable and an interesting blend on the traditional seafood fusion dish. 

Since there were seven of us in our party we had to get appetizers and the Cabo Calamari, as always, is an easy choice with crispy calamari, lemon slices, fresno chilies and chipotle aioli were decent if somewhat lackluster. The Original Hawaiian Poke Trio was a nice surprise because it came in three ranges of flavors with ahi tuna and sesame-soy marinade spicy seasoning, but at 19 dollars isn't the most affordable starter meal on the menu. I do give credit to Pacific Catch as everything on the menu does sound unbelievably tasty, even their fish and chips dish is described with a mouth-watering sensibility.  

After thinking and thinking (and thinking) about what I wanted to get that would be a good representation of what Pacific Catch has to offer, I decided to go with the Island Tacos Trio mainly because at 16 dollars you can mix and match three any tacos on their menu. Although they all sounded decent, the three tacos I went with were the Traditional Baja Taco with its Crispy Alaskan Cod, cabbage jalapeno tartar, and avocado tomatillo salsa, the Spiced Chicken Taco with grilled Mary's Chicken, cabbage avocado, chipotle aioli and pico de gallo, and the Pacific Steak Taco with marinated skirt steak, crispy onions, cilantro cabbage, sriracha aioli and lime cream. All three were solid pics with a little spice, a little crunch, and a decent amount of flavor. 

Pacific Catch is a decent place with a thought-provoking menu that combines Asian Fusion, Tex-Mex and fresh seafood entrees. The service, ambiance, and overall quality and presentation of the dishes were basically all on point. I asked at the top is it worth it, and I have to admit at that rate the answer remains no because of the overall type of food being offered doesn't match up with the prices. I simply wish the price points were a little more friendlier to the average tourist that tends to frequent this neighborhood. I would consider going again, maybe for Happy Hour or a late night bite. But there are other more unique and mom and pop style options out there in the Inner Sunset area that are dying to be supported by the community and newcomers alike.
author: Jason F.

description:
I've been here several times over the past few years and I've come to the conclusion that it's never a bad time to have some tasty ahi, as long as it tastes fresh. The menu features mainly California seafood dishes with some Asian fusion touches here and there. This corner venue is large and spacious with very high ceilings, but they keep the place pretty cold. There is also some cozy outdoor seating under some heaters, but keep in mind, it is right next to the bus stop. 

They start you off with some complimentary shelled edamame and pretzel goldfish, which is a cute nod to the seafood menu, but I'd still prefer bread. I also think edamame is more enjoyable with the shell on.

$16.50 Japanese Wasabi rice bowl w/ Hawaiian poke - seaweed salad, avocado, daikon sprouts, ginger, sesame seeds, shredded nori, soy-wasabi sauce:
The bowl has a decent portion of bite-size chunks of sweet, juicy tuna. The soy-wasabi sauce is mild and not too strong on the wasabi. It is also seasoned with green onions, chives, and sesame seeds. Everything tastes fresh including the pale slivers of creamy avocado and crunchy, crisp seaweed salad. Be sure to get a little bit of everything in each bite, otherwise you're left with a lots of rice at the bottom of the bowl. 

$15.50 Ahi Tuna Salad w/ seared ahi, greens & romaine, avocado, cucumber, daikon sprouts, ginger, sesame seeds, soy-wasabi vinaigrette:
When I want something lighter, I'll go for the salad. The ingredients are pretty much the same, but with lettuce instead of rice. But with a salad, I go for the seared tuna instead of poke, because it creates the illusion of a meatier salad. Again, try to eat a little of everything together, otherwise you're left with a ton of greens, or as my friend calls it, 'rabbit food.'

A lot of people like the sweet potato fries. They're alright, but sweet potato fries are becoming a ubiquitous offering across the board.

Happy hour deals are pretty good if you are in the area in the afternoons. Poke is about $8.

$9 Baja Shrimp Ceviche - lime, serrano chili, avocado, cilantro, tortilla chips:
These bite-size shrimp are springy, meaty and seasoned well. The verde sauce is on the runny side and is quite spicy. I could eat this on its own without tortilla chips too, but the thin, crunchy chips make a nice vehicle.

$12.50 Hawaiian Poke with wonton chips - original ahi tuna, sesame-soy marinade, spicy seasonings:
A small bowl of juicy ahi cubes covered in sesame seeds and micro greens are accompanied with some fried wontons.

$7 Mochi Fondue - vanilla, chocolate, coffee mochi balls & chocolate dipping sauce:
I've tried this out of curiosity, but if you've ever had store-bought mochi ice cream balls, I'd say skip it. The taste is pretty similar with the addition of a little bowl of chocolate sauce on the side for dipping.

The tasty rice bowls are still my go-to items to order here. If I were in the area, I'd come back to try some of the other menu items too.
author: Joy W.

description: I'm not sure how this restaurant has stayed in business. We had a couple of friends in town so we brought them there. We had never been, so we thought it would be fun. The server warned us the kitchen was slow, so we had some expectations of a longer wait. It was strange, though, since the restaurant never filled up and there were plenty of empty tables the entire time we were there. After waiting, however, the food arrived and all four entrees were stone cold. The server wasn't happy and he got the manager involved. Unfortunately, even with multiple attempts to fix the food, nothing really happened. We got new pieces of fish, but the side dishes were still cold. When we complained, they brought different side dishes. One entree had to have the fish brought out three times in total. The final time it wasn't actually cooked through all the way. The server was very apologetic and the manager gave us four complimentary entree coupons. They didn't charge us for most of the meal--though they did charge us for the appetizer and glass of wine. Honestly, for what we went through--not actually having an edible meal after waiting for more than an hour--we shouldn't have had to pay for anything. We left the complimentary coupons on the table. We won't go back.
author: Corey H.

description:
I've been here multiple times, and enjoy this place for several reasons:

1. It's good for larger parties since the place is spacious and the wait time isn't too long.

2. Happy hour 4-6pm M-F on a variety of appetizers and drinks.

3. Wine bottles half off on Tuesdays? A server told me yesterday. It could be a temporary special.

4. Heated outdoor patio and garage.

I have tried and liked:
-the poke trio (original is my favorite)
-calamari (it's okay)
-poke rice bowls
-fish and chips 

Service is hit or miss. I had some pretty monotone servers yesterday. But, overall, you can't go wrong with Pacific Catch.
author: Corinna T.

description:
This is a really nice restaurant . The place itself is nice, had a great bar with some good beers on tap, and has a nice outside seating area with a fire pit. 
The location of the restaurant is great; near golden gate park and also near a lot of shopping on Irving. 
The food here is fantastic. Their sushi rolls looked amazing. 
I ended up having the fish and chips. It was great. I recommend the seasoned fries with it. 
Their ahi tuna salad was delicious as well. I would recommend this place if you're in the area.
Parking is metered parking on the street.
Highly recommended
author: Kevin S.

description: Just OK! Calamari was not impressive at all, ceviche was OK but the fish was too tough and my "wild salmon" looked farmed to me, not strong enough taste and not deep color as the wild one I usually buy from Costco.
author: Gabriel M.

description: Very nice wait staff, although things can understandably get a little impersonal during the dinner rush. Patio seating permits dogs (yay!) and has heaters and a fire pit for the dropping evening temps. Had the seasonal margarita (strawberry and spice... just the right balance to make it delicious!) Shared a pitcher of that, guacapoke appetizer (great but smaller than we expected), the Brussels sprouts appetizer (yum), and one sushi roll between two people and left more than satisfied. A great place to stop for dinner after a fun day at Golden Gate Park (within walking distance).
author: Veronica K.

description: Food was excellent I had the steak  sandwich  which was good. They had some type of aioli sauce which was spicy  however it makes you want to continue eating it. That came with a side of fries  I felt like take out orders should have more fires although not all food places are the same . And a small sample of coleslaw I wish I had more of that now that was so good and it was fresh
author: Kentara W.

description: My husband and I were looking for somewhere nice to sit down and eat at while my father in law was in the hospital at UCSF. We found Pacific Catch on our maps and walked over. SO HAPPY we did. Our servers, Macy and Zack, were outstanding! They were both so personable and gave us great service. The food, drinks and dessert were perfect. Next time we are in the area we will be dining here again!
author: Veronica F.

description:
I'm from Hawaii and on the last day of my trip, I need my poke fix ASAP or else I will go INSANE. 

My boyfriend and I were meeting my relatives and we needed some grub before heading to the De Young museum. We got here much earlier than them and the hostess allowed us to be seated, as my Aunt made reservations.

When seated, our server (I forgot her name but she is awesome!) promptly asked us what we would like to drink. My boyfriend and I ordered our drinks and we sat there for another 30 minutes waiting for my family. Our server checked in on us regularly, but nothing to the extent of pressuring us to order food. She refilled my boyfriend's lemonade regularly even before we ordered our food. Then after 30 minutes, my family FINALLY came!! I am ready for "California" poke!

What caught my eye was the Asian bowls. My boyfriend and I both got the Japanese Wasabi. I got the Serrano along with my bowl, while my boyfriend got the Serrano and Grilled Salmon. You get a choice of getting it with all rice (White or brown) or half rice and half salad. We both chose half,half. 

At first, I was really surprised how expensive the bowls were, being that it was at $16.50, but when it came out, oh my lordy! They are HUGE. Since my boyfriend got two choices, it was $5 more, which is pricey. The bowl came out and it was a mixture of greens, ocean salad, avocado, and your fish choice and our rice on the bottom. I couldn't finish it! My boyfriend barely finished it. 

The fish quality surprised me! It was just like home. The only thing I did not particularly like were the jalapeños in the poke. I had to pick it out while eating. I like my poke spicy but I don't want jalapeños with it. That is just my personal preference.

I will be back when I come back to San Fran! I wish Hawaii had something like this... It was definitely ono (delicious in Hawaii)!! yuuum!!
author: Thuyen P.

description:
Stopped in here to get a quick bite before walking through golden gate park. Upon entering the place was beautiful. Open lighting and still has a nice view. I sat at the bar and got their ice tea which is amazing! I decided on the chicken tacos which were cooked to perfection! Nice and light but very filling. 

Robin the bartender was so friendly and knowledgeable. He walked me through the menu and was incredibly helpful. It's nice to see bartenders with such a passion for the industry. I will definitely be back because of him!
author: Shayne S.

description: Food was delicious and server Jesse was amazing, thoughtful, and made dinner even better. Will be back
author: Onyia P.

description: I really wanted to like this place. Floor dirty, lighting too bright, awful miso soup. Service good and perhaps I ordered wrong. Might try again to give a second chance as we liked our server.
author: Lauraine E.

description: We ordered the poki sampler, fresh and delicious! Just wish portions were bigger but I guess it is a "sampler", wishful thinking I guess :) we ordered some sushi rolls which were also delicious and creatively made. The ahi salad was a good size and oh I ordered another poki! Lol the service was very good! Mia was our server and she did an awesome job, my son is a picky eater and seeing that he enjoyed the soy beans so much she brought him soybeans a few times and with a big smile on her face, she was very accommodating and pleasant!
author: Linda L.

description: Worst service ever in the bar. Took 15 minutes to bring us water, another 15 before she took our order, waited 30 minutes for drinks to come. Had to request check which took 15 minutes to arrive. Complained to manager who  was a jerk. Will never return. Neighborhood is filled with great bars and food options why go somewhere that treats you like crap?
author: Amy G.

description: Best darn shrimp tacos I may have ever had and I'm old. The seasoned fries were way too salty though. But that's the only negative from our group of four.
author: Thomas B.

description: Happy Hour sucks now. Prices went up and service is even worst. Only reason we come here is for the shrimp ceviche. And lastly Zach is the worstttt server ever.
author: ChrisplusTerri L.

description:
Hi This is a review for the extremely responsive Manager at the 9th Avenue branch- Andrew (Andy).  We'd ordered a take out of our usual dine-in favorites and subsequently discovered that the order was not up to par.  I called the restaurant and spoke to Andy, about how disappointed we were with the take out service.  He was most understanding about the situation and offered to make it right by re-doing the order, and given that we were "going to take the trouble to drive there and pick it up again"- slipped in a dessert as well, which was not required but was certainly appreciated!

Mistakes happen, but what makes a restaurants' customer service stellar is their genuine effort to listen to their customer, and rectify the mistake.  Cheers and 5 stars to Andy for doing just that!
author: ann k.

description: The food was great we had a wonderful server loved the hell out of the shrimp tacos.  But I wish they would of had better mahi tuna tacos very limited selection on the fried options but I was happy over all will come back for sure
author: Dre D.

description: Disappointing. Service was crazy slow for drinks and staff were not customer focused and appeared to care less. Too many other good places to go with great service. I won't be back.
author: leslie y.

description:
We ate a luncheon here while on a very short visit to San Francisco (en route to Fiji). 
We met our Norwegian cousin (in college in SF) and had a mini-reunion lunch, after visiting the beautiful Botanic Gardens. She had suggested this restaurant.
We were so very impressed with the ambiance, the wait staff, the entire mis en scene! Lovely little place!
The menu offered some great fish dishes, and it really lived up to its reputation! I had salmon, and hubby had poke, and the coffee was some of the best I have every had. Our cousin had a noodle dish that I forget the name of, but all of us completely finished our lunches.
We were NEVER rushed. Since this was a once in a blue moon visit, we naturally lingered to talk, and we never felt that we were in the way at all.
Hightly recommend this restaurant if you are in the area.
author: Phyllis N.

description: I'm always a fan of Pacific Catch. Came in on a Friday night with my boyfriend to grab a late dinner and beat the crowd. Parking is pretty easy if you park on the golden gate park side of Lincoln and then cross the street to Pacific Catch on the corner. I had a sushi roll and a side of the sweet potato fries. They both were awesome, but I wish that my sushi roll was a bit spicier (I ordered some sort of spicy roll in the name of the item, maybe firecracker?). Overall, we like to sit on the bar side because it seems a bit more of young and hip crowd, where the other sit down side is family-oriented. Love love love, one of our favorites.
author: Micah L.

description:
Although it's not as crispy as expected, Pacific Catch is a decent place for fish and chips.

Similar to many other restaurants in the city, street parking only! However the restaurant is conveniently located near multiple Muni stops.
author: Danae L.

description: This place is just okay. The decor is contemporary and interesting, but the food is mediocre. We had the Korean Sticky Ribs and Calamari for our appetizers. The meat on the ribs were flavorful, but a bit tough and overly sweet. The calamari pieces were way too oily and small. Next came our entrees: Crispy Alaskan Cod, an ahi poke salad, an ahi poke bowl, Dungeness Crab Melt, and a 3-taco plate. I can only vouche for the Crispy Alaskan Cod, which was not crispy at all. The cod arrived soggy and the salad and coleslaw that accompanied it was overly dressed. On the plus side, the entrees were nicely presented.
author: Aimee I.

description: Was taken out on a group thing for work. Meal was good, I guess I'm grousing because the fish was "sustainably" produced. That may mean its farmed which I'm not down with. I didn't even ask if it was wild. Anyway ... I'm happy it's there but I wouldn't drop in on my own.
author: Henry K.

description:
Located near UCSF, I'd seen this place a lot in my searches while inpatient and craving sushi, as well as driven by every visit on Lincoln Avenue. We wanted a place to hang out for a while before meeting up with friends later, so we parked in Golden Gate park, which was not bad cause it was a Monday, and walked the 3 minutes over. We were early for happy hour by a 1/2 hour, but I was starving so we ordered anyways. 3 mahi mahi tacos ($16)  and a sushi roll ($13), I already forgot the name of. 

The sushi roll was good, and huge. The shrimp was a nice, actually huge tempera'd shrimp (though the crunch was lost) and not those tiny ones I normally see. Lots of avocado and julienned cucumber with a sliver of ginger, topped with a nice slice of ahi tuna. I like ginger and really liked this roll, although, just wish the shrimp had retained a bit of crunch. 

I didn't try the fish tacos, but Cory seemed happy. Big pieces of fish in here and he ate them all. The fries were, fries, a little too mushy for my preference. Cory had a few beers and I had water as we sat on the patio area with a view of the corner so prime people watching area. We were told by another frequent customer they had recently renovated everything, including enclosing the patio area. More glass would be nice, but you would lose seating I guess. The patio stayed nice and warm with the various glass gas rock fireplace and overhead heating elements. 

Barely there service, so I would have preferred to be checked in on a bit more. We never were asked about food during eating. Well enough they watched Cory's beers though. 

We will probably be back on my overnight trips as this wasn't too terrible. Happy hour looks like some good deals especially for this place. Also dogs are allowed out on the patio too.
author: Tabitha E.

description: The food is passable, but they only get your order right about half the time. Really no attention to detail.
author: Tom C.

description: Took me SO long to finally come here, and I'm glad I did. The food is fresh and delicious, and it's served quite quickly. Staff is polite, patient, and knowledgeable. Had a great night and very happy with our bill
author: Odalis M.

description:
You have GOT to be kidding me!
When my fish and chips arrived, I thought it was a joke. Each piece was LESS THAN 2x2"--both pieces combined MIGHT have been the size of a deck of cards. 
They seriously had to quarter a NORMAL piece of fish to get pieces small enough to put on my plate.
HOW CHEAP CAN YOU BE?!? 
My friend who ordered a Baja taco had more fish in her taco than I had on my F&C plate.
Though it was tasty, I was insulted at the size enough to complain, and was told *all the pieces are weighed* as if that excuses the infinitesimal size.

I have posted pics of my favorite F&C place (where I had already eaten 1 of the 2 pieces, each larger than my foot!) up against my meal at Pacific Catch where a standard lemon wedge was 1/2 the size of a piece of fish.

You guys REALLY need to up your game on portion size!!!
author: D C.

description: Pricey, but we only were here for a drink and some snacks. We had 2 orders of fries and a pitcher of margaritas. The special margaritas were cherry, but tasted mostly of tequila with a cherry aftertaste. Service was a little slow and the fries weren't too crispy, but had decent seasoning. I'd be curious to try the rest of the menu, as it seems intriguing. I'd come back next time I'm in the Sunset or golden gate park.
author: Samir K.

description: Food here is not bad. Would definately come back however the fish isnt as fresh as other places i have been to. I ordered the salmon chowder and the salmon was not as flaky and soft. The soup base is very creamy though. I also ordered fish tacos and it was alright. Nothing to special.
author: John M.

description:
Came in mid afternoon and got seated right away. Our server was nearly non existent. It took over a half an hour to get drinks and food took about 45 minutes to arrive to the table. I ordered a Mai tai and it tasted as if there was little to no alcohol in it. For the food I ordered the two piece Alaskan cod fish and chips with seasoned fries. The food was so soggy it seemed as if it sat under a heat lamp for a good 15 to 20 minutes.

Not once during our entire visit did the server ask how anything was not did he ask if we needed anything.

Terribly disappointing. 

Update:

We were contacted by the general manager, Jenny. I commend her for trying to repair the situation and providing customer service to us after the visit we had. We did end up going back to a different location in Campbell and had a much better experience. Thank you Jenny!
author: Kristina N.

description: Came here on a Saturday for brunch. They had outdoor seating with heating lamps where we cpuld sit without puppy. The qait staff was very attentive and suler friendly and we were able to sit down right away. We had the virgin agave lemonade which was decent for a virgin cocktail. I had the tacos. The fish meat was mostly fried so very yummy but heavy. My boyfriend had the salmon poke. It was an amazing variety of delicious fish with super rich and flavorful. The food and the dining experience was great. The food is a little heavy so come hungry and don't plan any other large meals that day. Great place for a large weekend lunch.
author: Anne S.

description:
I got addicted to Pacific Catch over a decade ago when there was only one location in the Marina.  

This location offers more space, a full bar (try the spicy margarita), and a bigger menu although the poki wasabi bowl is still my go-to.  (along with sweet potato fries)

I honestly don't care about the ambiance so much - the food is where it's at.   Healthy ingredients, yummy outcomes.  Never fails to to make go MMMMMmmmm...!
author: Ania B.

description: Best location and killer Happy Hour menu. Mai Tai and Ahi Tuna heaven!
author: Callie C.

description: This is my new favorite place for a nice dinner out. The dishes are excellent and the staff is awesome. It's right by Golden Gate Park so there's plenty of activities nearby to work up an appetite.
author: Rob B.

description: I wasn't sure what I wanted as I've never been to this restaurant.  My waiter explained a few different options and he hit it on the nose for me and my taste buds.  I had the Hawaiian Mahi mahi rice bowl  (half brown rice, half greens). It was amazing!  Definitely coming back!
author: Ali Q.

description:
We came here for Mother's Day. The restaurant looks nice and the service was good. Other than that, the food was pretty terrible. 

We first started off with the Poke Trio. It seemed overly sauced to hide the fact that the fish wasn't fresh. Let's just say I have an iron stomach and later that night and the next day my stomach was out of commission. 

My wife got the three tacos combo, and she said it looked sloppy and didn't taste very fresh. 

My mother got the mahi mahi bowl and hers wasn't that good either.  The fish was very bland. 

Dad got the crab cake loco moco, and he wasn't impressed either. He only ate 1/3 of it. 

Forgot what my brother got, but he didn't like his food either. 

It seems as if this place just overly sauces all their food to mask the bad taste. 

Not a fan.
author: Peter K.

description: Good food and mindful of intolerances. Ate here with a friend who cant have gluten and the kitchen made sure to give her options. Had a teriyaki rice bowl here myself, it was good and the atmosphere of the restaurant was nice. It wasn't busy early afternoon but definitely got busier later.
