author: Ang L.

description: Love the food and service even though it was pretty slow. Good specials and everyday dishes.  Needs a better wine list and please get some mugs for the mule! Moscow mule in a tall glass is not right.
author: Jonathan W.

description: Pacific Catch was a perfect decision for our seafood wants. Calamari, rolls, fish tacos, and ahi tuna rice bowl were just enough for our family of 4. Customer service was great. We had a waitress from Southern California whom was friendly and helped us narrow down some of our decisions. Cost can add up fast depending if you get apps and drinks. Our ONLY downfall was PARKING! It took us about 15 minutes to find a parking spot. Restaurant is very modern looking and clean.
author: Jackie H.

description: New Englanders in town for just three days, we were starving after a full morning of sight seeing. We came out of golden gate park, saw Pacific Catch across the street, and made a beeline!  We were so glad we did.  We both had the two taco platters - traditional Baja and grilled steak.  Perfect amount for a lunch on the go, and absolutely delicious!  Great service, and they even charged our nearly-dead cell phones. We'll definitely be back the next time we're in San Fran!
author: Amy H.

description: Great food, great atmosphere and a great time overall. Took some out of town guest here and they raved about how awesome the food was and how great our waiter Jim was. Jim was super helpful in explaining the menu and was patient and happy to answer any and all questions we had. Great place to bring visitors or for a date night.
author: John N.

description: Great happy hour Margaritas & draft beers Excellent Korean short ribs & firecracker shrimp & Alaskan cod fish & chips great although quite thin Cod! Staff friendly & efficient Nice atmosphere on a Friday evening
author: Joni D.

description:
Lovely Asian-fusion diner! Love their Ahi Tuna salad!!!

FOOD: We shared the Korean sticky ribs and the sweet potato fries for appetizer. The sweet potato fries were really good and not too greasy like I had at many other places. The sticky ribs were marinated well, but I didn't get too much meat from it. For entree I got the Ahi Tuna salad. It had a good mix of greens, avocado, sauteed cabbages, and 4 big piece of Ahi Tuna. Everything tasted great when mixed all together, with the soy-wasabi vinaigrette. My friend tried the Pacific Crab Salad (with real crab meat) and it was great too!

SERVICE: We came here on a Tuesday evening and was seated immediately. Very friendly waiter and food came by within reasonable time.

SETTING: I really like how spacious it is on the inside and also its ambient lighting. They have nice interior decors and there is also an outdoor patio where you can sit and dine (heat lamp provided during the freezing SF nights). Parking is probably impossible so just take Lyft or the muni. 

OVERALL IMPRESSION: I like it! I always run past this place but never really knew how tasty the food is. Will come back again for sure!
author: Wendy F.

description:
I am so disappointed with my experience here. First time customer. Drawn in by special limited time menu. I wanted to come in, sit down order lunch, dessert and an alcohol drunk from east coast menu. I tried to find parking in their lot or anywhere on the block for 15min. That's fine, I live in the city. I decide to make a togo order instead since no parking.They have 10m pick up only spots though, that didn't move for 45min. Because yes, it took me 45min from arriving on site to leaving with a take out order. 

I placed order by phone while sitting in car in middle of parking lot travel lane hoping someone would leave soon. I  make sure to notate I wanted the entree lobster roll from the limited time east coast menu. I am quoted 15min. I go inside to pick it up after 20min. No one at check out stand for 5min. When someone arrives, says order isn't ready(this is now 10min after quotedpick up time). The bartender managing the togo orders makes excuses to pass blame around, instead of apologizing. The order arrives, it's the wrong freaking thing. It's a lobster sushi roll. I kinda understand the mix up, but purposefully tried to avoid that confusion when I ordered it. Bartender again, does not apologize, only makes excuses. I normally am the kind of person who doesn't mind ordering a drink and patiently waiting for togo food, but this wasn't an option because no parking. And also rude customer service: How am I supposed to want to spend even more money and tip a bartender who is being rude and dismissive of patrons. I did leave him a 13% tip on this atrocious togo order experience, despite the terrible service.

 I hope a manager sees and responds to this issue. I have worked in several restaurants and my partner is an executive chef, so this is not some high and mighty post. It's coming from KNOWING much better can be done.
author: Jessica R.

description: We eat here regularly, once every 2 or 3 weeks, and the food is always good.  This was especially true last night (plus we got our favorite waiter, Jesse!).  We usually go on Fridays (the big draw for us is the largely on the down-low Aloha Friday deal--$5 mai tais if you wear a Hawaiian shirt!).  Food-wise, the best thing on the menu is the Thai Curry Bowl (my wife gets it pretty much every time), but the fish plates, fish tacos and poke all tend to be excellent.  Came with a couple of friends last night who hadn't dined here before, and they, too, loved the mai tais, the food, and the atmosphere.
author: Chuck P.

description: Great, fast service and fabulous happy hour prices!!  The calamari and the tempura sashimi are wonderful! Also had salmon poke and ceviche which were great as well! $5 well drinks and $6 wines plus half price apps, sushi rolls and poke! What a steal!
author: Caroline G.

description:
Second visit here, I usually go to the San Mateo location and think it's better

For some reason, the food seems fresher and more flavorful in San Mateo.

We started with the calamari appetizer, which was very good.

DH had the Mixed Catch, deep fried oysters, fish and coconut shrimp combo, and really liked it. I had the wasabi bowl, 1/2 brown rice and 1/2 mixed greens topped with poke.  For some reason, it lacked flavor and the texture of the poke was past its prime. There was zero wasabi flavor.  My previous visit, for lunch was ok, not great. 

After eating at the San Mateo location many times, the menu here seems very familiar but the food does not taste the same.  I know this is an older location, but I thought the food would be comparable.

Next time I am in that neighborhood I'll stick to Park Chow.
author: Joanna S.

description: 3 1/2. This is a solid place to have lunch or dinner. Nice atmosphere and appearance. The food is average but the service was good. I probably would be visiting them again if I'm in the area
author: Devaughn J.

description: I love the happy hour here. Great prices for the food and drinks. Lots of options and starts at a great time. I would pass on the coconut shrimp it tends to be over cooked and taste burnt. Great seating outside with heat lamps as well as by the bar. Friendly staff and ambiance.
author: Angel C.

description:
I love coming here for dinner when I'm too exhausted to cook. 

Recommendation: the two taco platter (one steak, one ahi) and their spicy fries or sweet potato fries or cole slaw as the side. This is my favorite, but I've never been disappointed ordering the other menu offerings.

Staff is super friendly and familiar. What sparked me finally writing a review for one of my favorite bars/restaurants was when I came in for a quick bite, a glass of water after a day of way too much coffee, and space to read. The bartender was slammed, but so calm and attentive and polite to all of the patrons and waiters requesting her attention. I really appreciated her maintaining a positive attitude despite a really stressful situation. 

I've never been disappointed with an experience here - whether it's a too-tired-to-cook dinner, a night out with friends, a date, or a family dinner.
author: Tiffany S.

description:
1. It took a while to get our appetizer and we got the calamari which was pretty good
2. Took even longer to get our actual meals 
3. I got the 3 fish taco platter mahi baja and shrimp. Mahi wasnt that good shrimp was the best. I ordered it wirh seasoned fries and they were cold 
4. Our waitress only talked to us once and it was to take our order. Always looked at our table and never followed up.
author: Sasha G.

description: Korean Ribs were great but everything else was bad. Good service can't make up for bad food. I have the udon noodles and they were tasteless and nothing special. Fish'n'chips tasted like poor quality fish. Sushi was not fresh.
author: Alex W.

description: New favorite place!! Had the Mahi tacos and they were the best I have ever had. All of the food was amazing and the sauces and seasonings were the best I have tried. Great fast and kind service. A little pricey but all of San Fran is.
author: Lindsay L.

description:
Honestly this place is so good. I've been to both the Marina and sunset location. Their poke is so fresh and good. I've tried the original and the salmon avocado. I also tried their mahi mahi tacos with sweet potato fries. Everything was solid. 

It is a little pricey because it's seafood, but I will keep coming back here for poke.
author: Jenna G.

description:
While this is such a gorgeous restaurant and we really enjoyed the service, the food was only mediocre.
The fish and chips one of the better values on the menu, but the fish was pretty flavorless and the fries overly salty.
My fish tacos just very overpriced and again lacking any kind of flavor, not worth getting again.
I have been to their other locations and had better food, it really depends on what you are ordering here.
Most dishes are around $15 which I find too expensive for the portion size and quality you are getting.
Perfect place for a date or business dinner, not ideal for families or if you are really hungry.
author: Nijole T.

description: We came to this restaurant on our Valentine's weekend. It was afternoon and pretty empty. Our cheerful  hostess seated us and explained the menu. We chatted about the specials and the museum we had just left. Then our server named Lauren came to get our orders. She rolled her eyes at me and my partner when we asked if they made custom non-alcoholic drinks (my partner is sober). After this, she recited her lines as a server robotically, and refused to make eye contact and even turned to walk away as we were talking with her. She may have been having a bad day, as many servers do (especially if you're female and get harrassed at work etc. We've both worked in the food/service industry and understand) but it totally ruined the mood. We just couldn't relax because we were waiting for her next disdainful gaze. As a side note, the food was sugary with not very much other flavor. Terrible experience, mediocre food.
author: Flynn M.

description: In the past we have enjoyed eating at Pacific Catch, but this past visit will be our last. The fried oysters were a bit gummy and not very flavorful. (They simply don't compare to the fried oysters at Brenda's Meat + Three on Divisadero.) The fries - regular and sweet potato - were OK but not as good as we remembered. Oddly, we had to ask for salt and pepper since there was none on our table or any other one around us. The staff was OK, but certainly not very attentive.
author: Bruce B.

description: Went there on Saturday night for a family dinner, and we had an enjoyable time at this Inner Sunset restaurant.  First and foremost, it is San Francisco and if you do not have a car, that is fine; MUNI is in the area. I came from the East Bay, and transferred to the N line at Embarcadero Station. The N line drops you about a block from the restaurant.  I got to the restaurant, and my party was already there.  My father and I each got Fish N Chips, which were very good. My sister got a sandwich that she took home, while my mother got a nice crab sandwich and my sister's boyfriend got three tacos that looked good as well. The service was very good, as were in and out of there in a hour and the best part was the fact that they did not rush you.
author: Jeremy K.

description: Portions are just right a bit on the pricey side but staff was very friendly and service was great. View overlooking entrance of Golden Gate Park.
author: Jacob D.

description: I Ordered the fish and chips , and it lacked flavor ! It was sooo bland. Not worth the price .
author: Alondra R.

description: I had dinner there on Sat. 2/10 with my husband and two friends. We were about to leave when my husband spotted a cockroach on the wall next to our table. Today, 2/19, I checked the Health Score of this restaurant on the Health Department website and was surprised that it received a score of 96 out of 100 on 2/13, 3 days after our visit. Needless to add that I won't eat in this restaurant again and that my confidence in the SF Food Safety Program decreased tremendously.
author: Annie A.

description: From my experience, I can't recommend this place as a seafood restaurant. This Asian fusion "seafood" restaurant caters to those looking for a mix of Japanese and Hawaiian taste. I picture this place as a chain you would find downtown in a big city. Now don't get me wrong, the food isn't terrible, and the service is great! I just haven't find any dish that would bring me back again. Other than that, the drinks menu is filled with topical drinks for your fix. With prices starting at +$15 per person, I would say you're paying more for the ambiance than for the food.
author: Ryan C.

description:
This was a nice seafood restaurant to go to during my trip to San Francisco. My friend lived by Golden Gate Park, and we were about to go to the Botanical Garden so we stopped here for a quick bite to eat.

-- VENUE --
This place has a nice pier decor to it with modern-styled brick walls, wood floors and wall accents, and comfortable rattan chairs. It was a nice, comfortable place for a seafood restaurant.

-- MENU --
I love seafood, so I'm a little biased in this department. A majority of the menu sounded tasty, and I wish I could've eaten more. I had the 'Korean Stick Ribs' while my friend had a salad. It was presented well and tasted just as good as it looked. When I come back here again I will try more things.

Another thing that caught my eye was the Hawaiian Poke ("raw fish salad") selections. Being from Hawaii, I wanted to try them out, but I've had enough poke in my life. Next time.

-- SERVICE --
The server and waitress were nice, filled our drinks, and let us have our space. What more can you ask for?

-- SUMMARY --
This place checked all the marks on my first visit: great service, nice presentation, tasty food. I'm looking forward to coming back again. Recommended.
author: Benjamin B.

description:
Pacific Catch always a good idea. This is my go-to and back-up restaurant for large groups or last minute dinners without reservations. The Asian/Mexican/American fusion menu has something for everyone. 

Prices are right. Food is yummy. Portions are huge. Drinks are on-point. Service is friendly. Space is HUGE with high ceilings.

Plus, they offer a pretty awesome happy hour menu. Loves it!
author: Ellen W.

description: What Can I Say ,Except Timing is Everything . Been Here Several Times Since Its Opening and NEVER Had a Bad Sitting.  Servers are Well Informed of Daily / Seasonal Specials and Quite Casual . Parking Here Can be Challenging During Peak Hours and Neighborhood Events - Esp Since It Borders Golden Gate Park
author: Gerry L.

description:
I have not been to Pacific Catch in awhile and was absolutely blown away with their menu selection & seriously wonderful staff.

We had the special soft shell crab roll and it was INCREDIBLE!  Super fresh, flavors were wonderful!  We also had the crab salad and the poke bowl.  Both were super fresh and delicious.  They have a poke "bar" with several choices of poke and all looked fresh and flavorful!  Fresh is very important when you are dealing with raw/semi raw fish and Pacific Catch has definitely nailed it!

While the food was fabulous the true super star was our server, Rachel.  She was, hands down, the sweetest, most professional and kind server we've ever had.  Her sweet demeanor coupled with the great food makes this place outstanding!  We truly appreciated Rachel's hard work and knowledge.  She is definitely an asset to Pacific Catch.

This was a great experience and I'm looking forward to going back soon!!
author: Samantha B.

description: Having lived in the hood for 6 years I finally tried this fun restaurant.  Wow, really good, fresh seafood and affordable prices.  We started with the tuna poki, good but next time I will get one without mayo base.  I had the seared tuna salad, excellent, my dinner partner had the three tacos, rally good.  Fun spot, good service, fresh seafood.  Their happy hour looks good, next time trying that hour, their cocktails looked really good.
author: Carole W.

description: I'm so angry right now at this restaurant .  Went there for happy hour on Sunday at 10pm and they said they were closed.  What the hell!  They need to have consistent hours.  The rest of the time they have happy hour from 10-11 on the weekend and this time when I'm starving and want to grab a bite nothing.  Also yelp says they are open till 11pm on Sunday WTF! Pacific Catch you need to get organized and have consistency.    Major fail.
author: Graham T.

description: Overall a solid meal. The drinks were probably the highlight for me. I had the spicy mango Serrano drink (forgetting the name), but it is amazing. Don't order if you don't like spicy though because this has a very nice kick! My friend had the kiwi drink which was super light and refreshing. The fish was fresh, though I thought the spicy tuna in my spicy tuna bowl was slightly under seasoned. All in all, I would be back!
author: Cassie A.

description: Our experience didn't start off the best, but Jenny the Manager was AMAZING!!! She corrected a small problem, and our experience was fantastic. The steak tacos are to die for!!!
author: Darnell H.

description: Got here around 7:45, ordered drinks and appetizers. Appetizers came super quick but the drinks took way too long. We patiently waited for the server to come take our order. 20 mins later, we had to call him over. Either the waiter was super chill or he was super high LMAO. Took our orders. It was about 8:15 now and we ordered. We waited almost an hour for our food to come out. I ordered the fish and chips. I tried the chips and the first thing that went through my mind was "SALTY AF" I swear to god, my weekly intake of salt was on those fries. So I tried my fish next. I bit into it and, I'm not joking, it tasted like paper. It was super dry and super tastless. "Fish and Chips" more like "Disappointment". So basically, service was terrible as well as the food. The only good thing that was served to me were those Goldfish pretzels.
author: Ack L.

description:
Took my mom out for lunch for their Restaurant Week but I was disappointed that they only had the salmon entree option for lunch, even though on their website they said the swordfish was also an option for lunch :( 

Anyways, for the appetizer, we had the grilled shrimp salad, which was really delicious with the rice noodles and the shrimp was grilled perfectly!
It was either salmon or veggie curry for the entree so naturally salmon all the way. The salmon came with some bok choy and some potstickers, which seemed really random since they were a little soggy and weren't listed as part of the meal. They were kind of good though so I didn't mind haha. The salmon was really good, crispy and slightly glazed on the outsider, but so tender on the inside.

Also had some coconut ice cream at the end!

I thought it was pretty good but I don't know if I'll go out of my way to come here again.
author: Jingxi Z.

description:
Had some of the best service in the city here this last weekend. I don't know if that's the usual or if our waiter Jim is just a gentleman. I work too close to this place, but ironically don't come here often. 

The poke and tacos are very yummy and were a big hit for my partner and I. Others in the party were visiting from out of town and enjoyed the rice bowls and were very very pleased with all the ingredients. 

Personally I think prices are higher than they should be, but it's SF after all.
author: Cindy V.

description: had a goodbye dinner with schoolmate last time. enjoy it again with my roomies this time. The coconut shrimp is tasty. Like it a lot. Hawai Poke is nice, and the California is my favorite. Always fancy the lemonade with seasonal fruit here.
author: Tianlu W.

description:
Quality of the food at this place has really gone down. Very disappointing meal.

My husband and I spent the afternoon at the DeYoung Museum so thought we'd grab dinner to avoid traffic heading home to Oakland. I remembered this place was close by and the food was always good so I suggested we eat here. Boy was I wrong! 

We started with the scallop poke which was the seasonal menu appetizer. This sad dish looked like it had been sitting out all day--scallops looked dried out and definitely not fresh. There were little pieces of mango in the dish but there just wasn't much natural sweetness to the scallops so it isn't something I'd order again. I ordered the Chirashi which was literally $23 of old poke served on a platter of very little sushi rice. The ahi was gristly as all hell--I ended up spitting out 1/4 of it because I simply could not chew it down enough to swallow. Both the ahi and salmon looked days old and was very low quality raw fish. For being in San Francisco, I wouldn't even give this a rating of mediocre because it was far below that. My husband got the seared ahi salad. Again, ahi was subpar and too gristly to be enjoyable. The veggies in the salad, however, were extremely fresh and delicious. But come on, this isn't Pacific Veggies or a vegetarian restaurant. If I'm paying over $20 per entree for seafood I expect some quality grub! 

Overall vibe and ambiance of the restaurant was good. They've always been family friendly. We had our 2 month old baby so they gave us a big booth so I could have him sit next to me in his car seat. They offered us a high chair and brought the kids menu which had a decent selection of yummy items for the kiddos. Too bad my little one is still too small for solid food. Outside patio had lots of heaters and a fireplace so was toasty and warm. Service as expected was impeccable as always. We had someone clearing our plates as soon as we finished and the server was pleasant and helpful. However, the food is just really lacking and not what I remember it being. 

Do yourself a favor and take your pick of any of the other awesome restaurants off of Irving rather than waste $70+ on a meal for two at Pacific Catch.
author: Betty R.

description:
I used to love Pacific Catch and their poke! They're poke is still delicious, but way overpriced! I paid $19 for the poke trio, a single poke is $12. Their poke bowls are pretty good too, but a whopping $16.

I recommend coming for happy hour where prices are slightly less.

Service was also slow. And not because they were busy. We came at 2pm and it was pretty empty inside. But service was just slow. At least they were friendly.

This location on 9th ave is a lot more spacious than the one in the marina, but it can also get real crowded. I used to go to the marina location frequently when I lived nearby.

I probably won't be back unless it's for happy hour.
author: Stephanie L.

description: Their customer service is sucks . I've been waiting for like 15-20m to get a menu plus 15m for the server to approach me . The food wasn't good I top not even fresh since I have a stomach problems now
author: Zoya M.

description:
Really enjoyed apps and drinks in the bar area on a very busy evening. My friend and I could not get a table inside the restaurant area or patio dining area. But the bar area was great! The service was super speedy and friendly, mindful of timing our apps delivery, too! We ordered fried oysters, soft shell crab salad, shrimp ceviche and beef & mahi mahi tacos. Loved the tacos! Came with sweet potato fries as a choice of side. The steak was amazing so tender and tasty, hint of sweetness. Pretzel
Fish and edamame come as bar snacks while you wait for your food, pretty creative and yummy. This was our first visit here and we were really surprised. Only one con to mention, the menu lacks entrees. The restaurant feels like a main entree type restaurant but actually has a tapas menu. I was in the mood for fish main entree, still good though. The outer patio looks cozy with gas fireplace pits! Reception area and wait staff were all very helpful and friendly. I will try the San Mateo branch next time, closer to my house.
author: Tiffany M.

description: All very good!  Food, service, atmosphere.  Maui Maui sandwich is delicious.  Chipotle tasty and spicy.  Service Jessie and manager super attentive.  Perfect lunch!
author: Alan B.

description: This is one of my top pics for food in my neighborhood. This time in particular, we had a FANTASTIC experience with manager, Andrew, & our very friendly and accommodating server, Dan. The food is always YUM! And we really enjoyed dessert this time too. #DanIsTheMan
author: Candice N.

description: The service we received at this restaurant was awful. The waitress didn't care either. Six of us dined here during the big annual medical conference. No offer to refill drinks or ask if another cocktail was needed. When I asked if Sake was served she rudely responded and said "no" and walked away. The curry bowls were not curry, I don't know what they were but the good certainly would not be used to describe. The poke was good. The sushi was mediocre and that about sums it up. I just can't get over how the waitress dropped off our food and never checked back on us the entire time. Oh! And she handed me the bill lol.
author: Lisa M.

description:
First timer - I like it! Drinks were awesome, food was great. Nice atmosphere & music, there is also a small parking lot off Lincoln. Thank you for keeping it dust free :)  Excellent drinks - Mai Tai, Pisco,Kiwi flash.
Cabo Shrimp tacos - delish! Thank you for always being attentive.
author: Natalie G.

description:
The wait to be seated felt like forever!!!! When we sat down we realized that seat had been open for the longest, but the hostess didn't seat anyone! I would recommend coming on a less busy night. We came around 7pm Friday night. 

Although the hostess we had wasnt too knowledgeable about the menu, 
our waitress was awesome and was honest about her recommendations for the poke entrees. She was pretty friendly and easy to talk with. 

This place is very nice inside with spacious seating area but the food is overpriced. I probably wouldn't eat here again but would like to come back for their bar drinks! Seemed like that side of the restaurant would be more chill.

We got two poke entrees and a three taco platter with seasoned fries. Total was about $46-53 including tax and tip. Keep in mind there's an automatic SF 4% mandate charge
author: Amy V.

description: The best part of this restaurant is they have their own small parking lot, you may find a spot if not weekends. I personally very recommend their poke bowl because the fish quality is good and the portion is huge. Remember to check out their today special, I ordered a soft shell crab rolls which the fried crab is good. Beside that I think the environment is good for drinking, especially drinking next to the fireplace in outdoor.
author: Jacques S.

description:
I drive by this place every, single day. so it eventually made it on to my "must try" list.

 I finally went in yesterday and I honestly regret waiting so long. Everything my friend and I ordered was so delicious and not to mention our waitress was so attentive and delightful!

We ordered a Blood Orange Cocktail and a Kiwi Flash. If it wasn't a Monday night, we honestly wouldn't have stopped at just one each!lol

We started off with a Fire Cracker Salmon roll, which was delicious! 

My friend ordered the Mahi Mahi Hawaiin teriyaki bowl which looked, smelled, and tasted oh so good!

I ordered the 3 taco platter. One Mahi Mahi, one Cabo Shrimp, and lastly a Pacific steak taco. Yes, yes, and YES!! 

The portions were huge so we were full almost immediately but we still had room for some Mochi Fondue!! 

Overall, great location, delicious food, heated outdoor seating, can't go wrong!
author: Katerina Y.

description: I've been here a few times and never had problems before, but that's probably because I ordered only drinks and a salad. Yesterday, I got the happy hour spicy tuna california roll. Within half an hour, pounding headache, within an hour, I felt super hot and nauseous and my heart was pounding. Within two hours everything in my stomach was coming out into the toilet. Worst food poisoning I've had in a REALLY long time. And at pac catch- I was super surprised and now very wary of eating there. Also, I should of known when the spicy tuna california roll came out and the spicy tuna looked like cat food. -________-
author: Elizabeth N.

description:
Food was ok. We got the poke trio which was the best part of our dinner. The poke was tender and seasoned ok. My friend got the mahi mahi tacos which she described as bland. It did look bland. Another friend got a ahi tuna salad and she enjoyed it. I got the shrimp coconut and it was just ok. The coconut was really overpowering. It wasn't anything exceptional. 

My suggestion is to get the dishes that have poke if you like that. You would have a better chance of having a tasty dinner.
author: Glendie D.

description: Ate here last night...Great food and a really nice atmosphere to have a cocktail and relax. There's a fireplace and cool artwork on the walls. We had calamari, fish n chips and steak tacos. Everything was fantastic! Even though it's a seafood restaurant the steak was delicious. It's affordable and you can select portion sizes --which is pretty great and sets it apart from most restaurants. Also, really nice servers and hostess. Great job!
author: Marcia T.

description: Not very good. Paid nearly 60 dollars for two lobster rolls which were cooked very weird... bread wasn't fully toasted, lettuce and sprouts on it (I've eaten a lot of seafood and not one good place has ever used fillers like this) and the lobster was rubbery. Definitely will not be going back
author: Angie T.

description:
Showed up at about 1230 on a Sunday with about 7-8 tables open and surprised the host told us we'd have to wait 10 minutes. Maybe they were understaffed at the moment but everyone that came after us had to wait as well. Then a large party sat down so maybe they were reserving space for them. 

Anyways, I came here for lunch for the mahi mahi sandwich. They serve 5-7 different types of poke which I had to take a look at but I didn't try it since the price seemed a little high. Anyways, the fish was fresh and tender on a good piece of bread. I'd come back to try more on the menu since there was so many things to choose from. The salad looked pretty large as well so it's definitely an option for next time.
author: Ryan C.

description:
I loved it, everything we had was great and on point. The green tea, the California and tuna rolls to start. the Poke 3 ways was really good as well. My mahi green curry rice bowl was really good too, I wish it would have had a bit more fish, literally one more piece and this would have been a 5 star review :)

The deserts were great as well; the macadamia but brownie and the mochi.

Totally coming back!
author: Carlos L.

description: Food was amazing! Happy hour starts at four, but Tyler took care of me at the bar. I suggest getting the poke trio and testing a few of their fresh pokè options. There was a 5 hour gap in between my classes, and I always spend my free time here, because the food is great.Thank you Pacific Catch! Tyler was very friendly, welcoming, and made me feel at home. Check him out at the bar!
author: Anthony H.

description: I recently moved to SF from So Cal and I know that SF food is supposed to be more expensive, but I really feel scammed when I got my order from caviar. First of all, I chose the trio poke, which costs $19. For this price in So Cal, I can easily make three meals out of it (with rice) for one person. When I got my order, I couldn't believe in my eyes how little poke I got for how much I paid. I had to make rice to eat with it, and yet I still feel hungry after finishing everything. I have a feeling I won't be ordering food on caviar from here in the future. It does seem like they give you more food when you dine in.
author: Catherine T.

description:
Pacific Catch has many locations around the area but this specific one is the closest to me and my boyfriends house so I'm only familiar with this location. 
This location has good service, I haven't encountered a bad experience and hopefully never will. The staff is very friendly and polite there and we are always seated right away because this location doesn't get too crowded. 
The food is good, usually we order a roll off the menu, one of the seafood rice bowls, and our most favorite: the fish tacos! 
I would recommend coming here for dinner if you're craving seafood, there isn't much of a variety at Pacific Catch on the menu, although I would say their food is pretty decent. 
I'll still be coming back repeatedly, Pacific Catch... I'm addicted to your fish tacos!! :)
author: Rachel V.

description: Pacific Catch is my go to local. The staff is attentive, friendly and down to Earth (especially my main man Charles). They always make me feel welcome (sometimes hollering Norm! when I walk in). They even chuckle at my jokes and my jokes vary greatly in quality. The food is solid. Go to bar bite faves are coconut shrimp and steak and baja tacos. If you're hungry get a roll. They are enormous. Spicy Pacific is my fav cocktail. Different spice level everytime  so it's an adventure in a glass. My only complaint is that they're not open later. Come on Pacific Catch let's stay up late and get weird!
author: Heather R.

description:
Long day of shopping and was looking for a good happy hour with something to snack between lunch and dinner. Searched nearby on Yelp and came across this place! Although I'm on vacation, and trying to hit up all the hyped Yelp spots, I was happy to hit up a regular place as if I would if I was home in San Diego. 

Their drink menu and food selection is awesome during happy hour. We got a good variety of items and it was exactly what I was looking for. Our snack kind of turned into a meal that got us full and we needed up skipping our late dinner. They do a cool Hawaiian/Asian fusion and everything was great. My poke was a bit on the salty side, but everything else we got was on point. We got a mahi mahi taco, coconut shrimp, calamari, spicy tuna roll, macadamia nut poke, and we shared a mai tai. We had a big snack, and we were satisfied.
author: Brandon F.

description: Great food, great staff. Don't miss out on this Best Coast Seafood House.
author: Bill H.

description: This restaurant has a solid salad game. I regularly (like at least once a week for lunch) order the veggie salad and rotate between adding grilled Mary's chicken, grilled salmon, or seared Ahi tuna on top. The miso dressing is so delicious and the way they "zoodle" the cucumbers is unique. It's a good portion and is very filling on its own. The chicken is always grilled and seasoned perfectly. That's probably my favorite protein add-on. The Ahi tuna and salmon (in that order) are good too for some variety.
author: Traci R.

description:
Horrible sushi. They aren't a sushi resrayrant, but oh wow, at least do something descent. Rolls were falling apart, tastless. I ordered the salmon roll and did not have salmon in it. They were awkward big, cut in different sizes and full of cheap veggies but no salmon.
The Hawaiian poke made me sick of my stomach. It is already pre-maid tuna binded with mayo. Not good.
Anyways, there room for plenty of improvement.
I went with 10 co-workers and none of them liked their food. None!
author: Eryka S.

description:
Oof. Their crab ("california roll") salad is my absolute favorite. The amount of crab is generous and the meal is incredibly filling - and I just love the combination of everything in the salad! 

Fish and chips are always great, and service is good - once they brought over the wrong kind of fries, and after we pointed it out, they brought out an extra large portion of the right type. It's the little things :)

I always love to get their calamari, too - I wish we got more with the order, but they're fried perfectly and served with thinly sliced lemons (also fried) and a chipotle sauce. Delicious!

Eating here has always been a pleasant and tasty experience... and I'll definitely keep coming back!
author: Delia Z.

description:
For whatever reason, I always "sigh" when I enter this restaurant. I love the large but somewhat intimate space (booths are intimate that is), the clean lines and light inviting space. The service is always on point without being pushy. I also find the servers to be very knowledgeable and honest about their menu. Plus it's a great destination place after a stroll in Golden Gate Park.
I had the Mixed Fish Basket (Cod, Calamari and Oysters) which was yummy and just the right portion of food. Another friend had the Wasabi Poke Bowl which she loved and the presentation was gorgeous. Last dish was the Teriyaki Salmon Bowl which was Outstanding and almost more than my friend could eat. I appreciated the fact, on the bowls they mixed the rice, white and brown which added a whole new flavor to the bowls composition.

https://www.tripadvisor.com/ShowUserReviews-g60713-d944983-r426357920-Pacific_Catch-San_Francisco_California.html#
author: Marla B.

description:
I had the Korean Barbecue Rice Bowl and my friend had the Thai Curry Rice Bowl. I thoroughly enjoyed my meal, however, was disappointed when all I saw was rice left. I think more than half the bowl was just rice. Very disappointing. 

Other than that, it was delicious!
author: Lin D.

description:
2.5 stars.

My first time here and my BFF and I decided to stop by for HH before CAS Nightlife. We both ordered the spicy pacific cocktail to start, as well as sweet potato fries, baja shrimp ceviche, and ahi serrano poke.

Our drinks were hella spicy! My friend could barely drink hers. A little too much kick for me, I think. It was do-able after the first 5 sips though. We're probably getting a lot older than we want, but we definitely felt a bit buzzed after the first few sips!

Sweet potato fries were pretty good, but man, there was a LOT. Great flavor, but we definitely ordered way too much food. 
Baja shrimp ceviche was not that great. It was like this weird avocado concoction that was trying to be a guac. Very lime-y. 
Ahi serrano poke was pretty good. The ahi part was great, every thing else was meh. There was a little too much aioli for my taste, but I'm not one to douse my proteins.

Overall, would mayyyybe be back to try a margarita, but I definitely learned my lesson when it comes to their food.
author: Leslie C.

description: Service sucks. Went here today for a quick grab a bite. And hostess ignore us for 5mins keep talking to co-workers and then ask someone to help us. Girl thats your job! And server sucks too ignore us for 15mins before taking order and FYI it's not even busy.
author: Melton M.

description:
Order the Ahi sandwich but substituted the ahi for salmon and oh my goodness it was delicious! 
The bread was so soft and complimented the grilled salmon perfectly. Service was amazing and food came out fast. Will be returning
author: Raman D.

description: Ben here many times. Only order the seafood main items but whether it is a taco platter, fish sandwich, fish and chips, Hawaiian poke or a chalkboard seafood special, the food has always been fresh and well prepared and the service nice. The crispy Brussels Sprouts w bacon and a hint of lime are great!
author: Steven B.

description:
This place is pretty good for their Asian fusion-like food. I love their poke and fish&chips that they have, as well as their chocolate chip bread pudding! Because it took them a while to bring it out, they gave it to my family and I on the house which was great service on their part. I also tried their thai iced tea (very yummy) and their ceviche. The portions here are big, especially their rice bowl dishes so be prepared to eat a lot! Since I'm the type of person to like variety, I like to eat a wide range of different appetizers as my meal.

This restaurant is great for big parties and they have a decent happy hour menu which I want to try soon, with $4 drinks and $6-$7 plates of food!
author: Kathleen S.

description: Came here on a Saturday night and sat in the outside area. The waitress was really sweet, but not that attentive. I ordered the salmon tacos which were blah. The appetizer never came out and we had to ask what happened to it. Probably won't be back.
author: Gena K.

description:
Came here a week ago because our other restaurant pick was too crowded.  Since we were in a rush, we took a seat at a bar table.  The service was a little slow at first but they were quite visy for a Sunday afternoon.  We ordered the inside out roll, the poke trio and the mixed catch (fried oysters, fish and coconut shrimp) to share.  The sushi roll was pretty good and fresh.  The poke trio was just okay...pretty pricey for what you get.  Those two dishes came out relatively fast... and then the wait...

We waited 15 minutes...

Then 15 more... before we got the mixed catch.  I literally was about to cancel my order when it came out.  And it was a huge disappointment.  The fish was good at first but it got soggy really fast and the batter quickly fell off.  The oysters were pretty good but also pretty tiny.  The coconut shrimp was my least favorite.  The best thing on the plate was the tartar sauce (yup...).

Overall, this place is okay but nothing special, especially considering the price.
author: Erin H.

description: The poke really hits home. It tastes so similar to the ones back in Hawaii. Wished I lived in the Bay. I would have come by almost every week if I could :3 I liked that I could sit out in the patio with my pup. They greeted my fur baby with smiles and were glad to serve him too.
author: Dolly J.

description:
More like 3.5.

While the food was good, it was WAY overpriced and the service was spotty. I would come back only for Happy Hour specials ($7 poke!!!) 

I tried the Ahi Tuna Salad ($14.50). The tuna was DELICIOUS- rare on the inside and nicely crusted on the outside. The salad also came with a lot of oomph- sprouts, raddish, pickled ginger, etc. However, the price point sucked. I could easily get a sashimi salad from a Japanese restaurant down the street for less!

Bf got the Ecstasy roll ($12.50). NOT WORTH IT. It's an unconventional sushi roll with no rice (you have to pay extra for rice) and a crispy, battered seaweed. Yes, it was good and dense and filled with fish and avocado.. but $12.50?! Are you kidding me!? Definitely not a "supersized" roll, as advertised.... 

I did, however, love the overall vibe. Very island-esque and nicely decorated. Wide, open windows with lots of natural light by the bar.
author: Samantha C.

description: The staff here, especially Charles and the manager have amazing customer service. I love the poke trio with the wonton chips. The location is also awesome since it's right next to the park. There's a parking lot as well.
author: Eileen W.

description: I come here all the time.  I love their salad bowls and their calamari is to die for. I recommend the Chipotle chicken or the salmon for the salad.  They have really good sweet potato fries and their coconut shrimp ate pretty good as well.
author: Arman J.

description: The food was great and really good location since the park is right across the street. The price was good for the food. The only negative thing I would have to say is parking. I had to park of the street and pay for parking every 30 minutes.
author: Oscar C.

description:
I came here based on a recommendation from a friend to try the wasabi bowl with hawaiian poke. This was an excellent choice! I don't normally like wasabi but it's flavor was mild in this dish. The combination of the sauce, poke, and the seaweed, salad and sprouts was flavorful yet light. We also had the fish and chips with sweet potato fries and that was a good choice too. The batter was slightly sweet and crispy.

The restaurant is large so it shouldn't be too difficult to get a table. And they have outdoor seating with a fireplace and heat lamps.
author: Ali F.

description: After I left my previous review, I was contacted by the GM who said he would send something out to me to give them another chance. This was 2 weeks ago, never got anything but it's probably for the best because when you search the SF Environmental Health page, it says this place has a vermin infestation. Gross. I really hope this wasn't the reason I got sick.
author: Emma M.

description:
I guess this place is a chain restaurant. Went here for lunch . The place has a nice ambiance. Food was mediocre...

I had the fish and chips with sweet potato fries. It was an Alaskan Cod...quite greasy...lacked salt but the jalapeño sauce that it came with balanced out the blandness. 

My friend had the trio poke...original Hawaiian (ahi tuna), salmon avocado Hawaiian , and the serrano Hawaiian...I preferred the Serrano Hawaiian
author: Dee R.

description:
This is a very good seafood restaurant located on a busy intersection in the Inner-Sunset area of San Francisco. It's across the street from Golden Gate park and close to many other restaurants.

We went in around 5:30 pm on a Saturday and were given one of those electronic devices that vibrates to let you know you're ready to be seated. The odd thing was that we waited almost a half-hour, but we noticed that there were about 7 or 8 tables available. We were there almost an hour and only a few people sat at those tables, so they weren't reserved. Our only guess was that maybe they were short-staffed and were "filtering" people in, but it appeared to be a time-waste for waiting customers.

We had the fish and shrimp tacos, french fries and fried cod. The tacos were very good and the fried fish was great. They serve a Jalapeno tartar sauce that had an original flavor, but I also had the vinegar. 

The service was excellent and the atmosphere was warm and inviting. They also had sushi and ahi poke, which looked good, although we didn't try it - maybe next time.
author: Charles A.

description: A bit pricey (hello, where in SF is it not $$$?), but well worth it.  Excellent food, good service, nice setting and FREE PARKING in the lot. I love the rice bowls with half salad.  Soooo good.
author: Geri C.

description:
Posted hours say they open at 11am. Now, I've been fasting for 2.5 days, (my eating disorder is a whole other story), so after 60 hours of not eating, I decided I should put some food in my belly before I pass out! 

11:03AM I arrive and the doors are locked. 
11:05AM a UPS man comes by to deliver some packages. Doors unlocked.
11:09AM somebody props the door open and brings the signs out. I ask if they're open and they say yes, is it 11AM yet?

I enter, and takes about 1 minute for somebody to tend to me, despite being the first customer there. I'm seated and provided menus.

Shortly after, a waitress came to see what I wanted to drink, but I have not looked at the menu yet, so I said water is fine and she left. She came back with water and complementary Edamame and Goldfish Pretzels. She leaves again to give me some time to decide on what I want.

My waitress comes back shortly. When I order, she decides to memorize it rather than write it down. I ordered the following:

FOOD 3.75/5*
++  Japanese Wasabi Pan-Asian Rice Bowl with Hawaiian Poke - $15 - 4/5 - wakame salad, avocado, daikon, sprouts, cucumber, ginger, sesame seeds, shredded nori and soy-wasabi sauce.
=    This bowl was fairly good. Per other yelper's reviews, I asked for the soy wasabi sauce on the side, but I guess she forgot. The avocados were flavourless and not ripe, I guess they're not in season? Everything else was very delicious, the rice was a little bit on the tougher side. The Hawaiian Poke was quite fresh and delicious. 

++    2 Piece Fish and Chips with Sweet Potato Fries - $10 - 3/5 - When ordering this, there is a choice of regular, spicy, or sweet potato fries or a salad. Yelp says get the sweet potato fries! After ordering, the waitress returned and had to ask which fries I asked for. The presentation of this dish is quite cute. It comes on a newspaper themed wax/butcher paper. The fish wasn't very crispy. They were large slabs of fish, but after sitting there for under 5 minutes, the whole bottom side was soggy. No bueno. 
= The sweet potato fries were very very good when they came out hot. If you don't order the appetizer, it doesn't come with the ginger wasabi aioli, but it does come with the Thai chile sauce. Pairs really well with the Thai Chile sauce.

++    Ballast Point Calico Amber Ale - $5.50 - 5/5 - YUM. Upon my first sip, I thought I was drinking an IPA, but then I looked down and saw it was a warm amber colour. Amber Pale Ale? The flavours were great, complex body, and hops off the end. Great beer, decently priced. 

**It's a weighted average.

PRICE 3.5/5
The pricing is fairly average, but just a little bit on the pricier side. Nothing spectacular, but also pretty affordable for SF.

SERVICE 4/5
The service was very very nice. My waitress smiled a lot, was very attentive. I saw in my peripheral that she would talk to the other waiters/waitresses but occasionally glance over to see I was still doing okay. She came over to see how everything wa around my half way point. Only thing is that she should have just written down my order so nothing was missed. (sauce on the side, sweet potato fries)

ROOM AND DECOR 5/5
There is plenty of seating, good for both intimate conversations and large groups. The decor is primarily fish paintings and sculptures. Very fitting.

TIPS / NOTES:
+ UCSF (students?) employees get 10% off
+ They are currently running a $10 off if you pay with Paypal Mobile (the receipt will generate a code, you enter the code into your phone, and it'll pay them automatically. The app will first show the full amount, then after you submit it, it will send you a confirmation email or with the amount you paid as $10 less.)
+ Happy hour: M-F 4-6 and M-Su 10pm-close.

+Rice bowl recommended
-Fish and Chips NOT recommended
+Sweet potato fries recommended
+Ballast Point Calico Amber Ale recommended

Overall, I enjoyed the food. Don't worry I didn't finish it. Boxed the leftovers. It was good, and I may stop by to try some stuff on happy hour.
author: Kaje Y.

description:
I always always always get my fix for poke from Pacific Catch. Perfectly marinated and placed on top of moist, sweet sushi rice and accompanied by Avocado, sprouts,  and ginger. You can even customize your bowls and choose which poke you want on top, as well as if you want everything on a bed of white or brown rice or salad. 

Which poke is the best? Well, I have to say either the salmon or macadamia nut poke... Per the waitress,  the macadamia nut poke isn't marinated in the sauce,  but the sauce (sweetened ponzu + onions) is poured on top prior to serving.  Therefore, you get the taste of the fish without the overwhelming saltiness of the marinade. I knocked off a star because the salad I ordered was over dressed and was salty. 

Service was great, even though the kitchen didn't tell her they were out of salmon poke until after they had already delivered our dinner plates. However, she apologized and I can tell she really did seek to find out what was going on with that whole situation even though it was the end of the night. 

Don't even ask me how the other food is...  Because I'm one of those types that can't get enough of a good thing and haven't ventured far enough to try anything else! 

Oh - and get the Coconut Porter by Hawaii Brewing Company if you haven't had it yet and are a fan of porters... Discovered it on my trip to Maui a couple of years ago and my life was never the same. Ok.. Maybe I'm being facetious, but it's really good.
author: Christina B.

description:
I came here for a company dinner, which mainly consisted of delicious appetizers.

For appetizers, we had:
A starter salad
The california roll: It was pretty generous for a basic roll and was very filling.
Baja shrimp ceviche: A very delicious shrimp dish. Recommended.
Ahi tuna poke: Those wonton chips were amazing, but the Ahi tuna poke was even better. The tuna was very fresh and tender. Highly-recommended.

For my entree, I had a Japanese wasabi rice bowl with seared Ahi tuna: The wasabi taste was light but definitely noticeable. It blended very well with the included salad. Similar to the Ahi tuna poke appetizer, the tuna was delicious. It had great texture and a very juicy taste.

The restaurant had good service and gave very generous portions for appetizers and entrees. (I was beyond stuffed)

I was quite impressed and look forward to returning to one of their many locations in the Bay Area.
author: Nathan Y.

description: Good seafood at really reasonable prices. Great for out of town guests that are looking for some local seafood. Our server Meghan was prompt and friendly! She made our night! We can't wait to come back for the out door fire pits.  I hear they have a great happy hour too!
author: Erin H.

description:
Close to the golden gate park. Good for kids. Food is realy good.

We lover their Mai Tai and Mohito.
author: Peggy M.

description:
I've been here a couple of times and I must say they have one of the best happy hour menus!  They even give you edamame and goldfish pretzels to snack on! 

We've tried the Korean sticky ribs, Kona coffee ribs, fried calamari, shrimp ceviche (my favorite), the poke trio with the California, original, and white tuna, the salmon poke, and the spicy tuna sushi roll.  The Kona coffee ribs were amazing but I think were only around for a limited time. The sushi rolls were just mediocre, this isn't a sushi joint so I would stay away from the rolls and stick to the poke.  The original poke is a little too salty but it's tolerable if you pair with rice, the white tuna poke was a little on the dry side, I would've liked more liquid/lemon on it and it had a really "fishy" taste, the California was probably the best, and the salmon poke was good but a bit on the spicy side.  The poke trio also comes with wonton chips, a small salad, and a delicious seaweed salad. 

For entrees we've had the poke salad (amazing), the Thai curry bowl with salmon (also amazing it was one of the best salmons I've ever had), and the teriyaki bowl with steak.  To be honest I would stick to what they know best which is probably fish.  The steak was just ok and they weren't very generous with the portions. It was more rice and a whole lot of other stuff on it like pineapples, edamame, carrots, shiitake mushrooms, and A LOT of fried onions.  I do have to say tho that the teriyaki sauce they use is delicious, I couldn't stop eating the rice.
author: Linz C.

description:
Went here with some buddies from out of town for the happy hour. Been here plenty of times before because it's good food at a decent price. 

We approached the hostesses and immediately were greeted with EXTREMELY rude service. They had a bunch of tables open in the dining area but refused to let us sit. They suggested that we split up our group between the bar and the outside seating. What's the point of happy hour with friends? 

The two hostesses continued to roll their eyes at us and did not offer any help. We were met with rude customer service and basically no help. It sucks when such an awesome establishment begins to forget about customer service and genuinely appreciating their customers. It was awful being met with such rude states and bad service.
author: Vincent H.

description: Outstanding in all ways - fresh food, deft service, prompt delivery to table.  The Thai Curryin particular was outstanding.  Only minor complaint is that vegetarian choices are quite limited;  delicious, but limited
author: Joel K.

description: What a great amalgamation of tastes! The asian, Hawaiian, Hispanic influences make for a great seafood experience!  We enjoyed the poke starter and calamari. the Thai rice bowl was delicious. The crab salad had a great serving of crab and avocado.
author: Sharon R M.

description:
I met some friends at Pacific Catch that were visiting from out of town for a few days. I had not heard of this restaurant but another SF friend of theirs suggested it as a good place to grab dinner.

FREQUENCY: This was my first time dining at this establishment.

FOOD: I ordered a poki bowl as my entree which was good. It took our food a little long to come out but the waitress gave us a free order of calamari to make up for that. The calamari was also tasty. My friends that ordered dishes other than poke bowls also seemed to enjoy their food. One of the girls ordered a desert which we all had a few spoonfuls of and again that was good. Overall the food was satisfactory. It's not the best poki bowl or calamari I'd ever had but it also wasn't bad. If you aren't looking to be blown away by the food you're eating then this place is just fine.

DRINK: Pacific Catch had a nice selection of alcoholic and fountain drinks. Most of us ordered beer or wine. I always appreciate a restaurant that has several beer styles and brands from different parts of the country. I think the offering was pretty standard for what you'd expect at a restaurant. I'm sure they offer happy hour specials but I'm not sure what they are since I wasn't dining at that time. They also have a bar where you can sit to order drinks.

ATMOSPHERE: I wouldn't say anything really stood out about the atmosphere. I was dining at 7 PM on a Sunday so there was a pretty good crowd. Just kind of your standard restaurant decoration and layout.

STAFF: The waitress was very friendly. As I mentioned, she offered us a free appetizer since our food was taking a while and we never complained about the wait. She came by regularly to make sure we were fine but didn't overly bother us. There was plenty of other staff but I didn't interact with many besides the waitress.

PAYMENT: Credit cards or cash were acceptable.

This was a nice spot to catch up with some friends over dinner. The food wasn't anything out of the ordinary but it was good. I don't think I would go out of my way to go here again or add it to my list of place I have to bring visitors. But I wouldn't be upset if I stopped in because I was in the area or someone else suggested it.
author: Christopher D.

description: This place is okay. I think it's overpriced for what you get. They serve you goldfish as the free appetizer which I think is cute and funny but I would prefer bread and butter. The food is not excellent but not horrible! Drinks are okay, overpriced in my opinion
author: Reyna D.

description:
I was craving for some fish and chips and this was the only spot close to my hotel that was open til midnight!! My boyfriend and I was going to dine in but decided to take it to go right when we got seated. Our waitress Megan was really sweet and had no problem making our order to go. She told us to relax and snack on the gold fishes while we wait. The atmosphere inside was really nice. 

We ordered their 5pc fish and chips and Thai tea. Their Thai tea wasnt that great. It wasn't sweet enough but maybe that's just me because I love my Thai tea really sweet.  We didn't get back to our hotel probably about 45mins to an hour(we stopped and grabbed dessert to-go as well) and our fish was still crispy!!!!! Their tartar sauce was okay. I've had better. But overall, I was really happy that my fish wasn't soggy by the time we got back to our hotel.
author: Jessica ..

description:
I tried lunch bowls, and to be honest, I didn't like it. 
Not a great quality food. 
Definitely not coming back.
author: Jenna F.

description: Party of six , all of our food was hot and very good. Very happy the manager hooked me up and parked my bike in the office! Who does that :) Waitress ( Zan ) was super friendly and super attentive.  Will be back , awesome restaurant.
author: Craig F.

description: Best place for sea food prepared with the upmost care. The food is amazing. Great staff all very friendly, quick service food was ready within 20 minutes of us getting her no wait in line
author: David E.

description:
Ambiance: 4.5 (super spacious and not a long wait) 

Service: 4 (fast and knowledgable)

Food: 3

Trio poke: we ordered the original, Serrano, and macadamia nut. The tuna was super fresh, my favorite was the Serrano which was a creamy spicy sauce. I didn't care too much for the macadamia nut, it was too salty/soy sauce. It's a good appetizer to sample their numerous poke selections.

Wasabi bowl (ahi tuna): you have the option of choosing brown rice and 1/2 rice&1/2 veggies no extra charge. An otherwise healthy balanced dish with a good variety of veggies, protein, and carbs was drenched in too much sauce. The portion is very generous and it'd be a perfect, perfect dish if they laid off on the sauce a bit. 

I will definitely come back here again and maybe ask for sauce on the side or light sauce for the bowls and try the other poke. As you can tell by the photos, pretty much all the dishes are visually stunning (esp the wasabi bowls), I feel healthier already just by looking at it.
author: Bin X.

description:
Did you know that February is National Pisco Sour Month? Neither did I until recently!

When I found myself at the Pacific Catch bar, figured it best to order this Peruvian specialty.

Pacific Catch's version leans on the classic flavor and frothy egg whites. Served in a martini glass. For $9, it's pretty good!

I know that Pacific Catch is famous for their fresh seafood, but I must give their cocktail program some extra love. Drinks like a Mai Tai and Pisco Sour aren't given nearly enough credit.
author: Abby S.

description:
A friend keeps raving about this place, so decided to try it for lunch.  With a shared calamari appetizer, the 2 piece fish & chips, 2 fish tacos and a draft beer came close to $50 for 2 of us.

All portions on the small side.  One of the fish tacos arrived cold, the other barely warm.  Fries were OK though.  Enjoyed the calamari.  

Aside from food arriving cold, service was fine.  

Ambience and decor OK; spacious and quiet.

Overall not terrible but not outstanding either.
author: Chris n.

description: Ew. This chain jumped on the poke bandwagon but it's a big disappointment. Their Japanese Wasabi Poke Bowl had gummy rice (cooked with too much water) with cubes of ahi that looked and tasted like it was marinated too long ago. I've dined here some time ago and their ceviche was good. Maybe they should just stick with that, instead of trying to do chirashi when they really don't have it down. Or stick with fish and chips. Let the sushi restaurants handle chirashi, cuz neither their rice nor their fish are up to par. The server was kind and prompt, however.
author: Kit F.

description:
I've been wanting to try this place for a little while and finally had a chance to yesterday. They are remodeling their exterior a bit, but I thought the place was still pretty cute- I like the bamboo theme they have going. It was a warm afternoon so we opted to sit at the loungey table right outside the entrance. 

Food- I would give more stars because the food was pretty delish. We got the fish and chips, ahi tuna salad, Tom yum soups, blood orange margarita pitcher, and Cajun fries. (And also ceviche, but it never came) 

Service- The staff was very friendly. BUT they didn't bring out our ceviche, twice! We ordered it the first time, and she didn't get our order. We went inside and followed up with another server, but they didn't put it down on our check. We followed up with our server, but she didn't hear about our ceviche and told us she didn't hear our order. The ceviche ended coming out AFTER we paid for our check... Which we sent back.
author: Michelle F.

description: Pacific Catch was recommended to me by someone that lives in SF. I ordered the coconut shrimp, it was crispy and hot but the serving was a little small and the side of fries were flavorful but a bit undercooked. My friends ordered the green curry and the salmon salad. They seemed very satisfied as their servings were very large. The service was a bit slow but other than that it was a great place with  lots of customers!
author: Garret W.

description:
I never thought I would write negative... very negative review. Even if I got bad experience usually I share it with my friends only. Nothing would be different with the Pacific Catch restaurant... but today morning they just removed my comment on FB. It was negative but honest... I personally think that business should talk with the customer who is by the way always right. That's why I decided to share this with people on Yelp. It was more than a year ago but still really fresh for my family.
Let me try to make stressful and ugly long story shorter but still horrible. First of all I should say we, my wife and I, are huge seafood fans. A few years ago on Hawaii we were introduced to Poke. It quickly became our food crush... Once we got back to San Francisco we immediately started to look for Poke here. Our friends brought us to the Pacific Catch restaurant on 9th Ave in San Francisco. To be honest we fallen in love... Beautiful place, great location and POKE!!!!! We were absolutely happy! Then it became a nightmare. A few weeks later we were going to celebrate something with my wife. I proposed to buy a Poke. The children went to sleep. My wife lighted the candles. I brought a Poke. What else you can dream about? I thought nothing could ruin such a beautiful evening... I was wrong... Fish parasites were on our salmon poke. Alive Worms!!! I immediately returned the meal. I tried to talk with the restaurant about the compensation but no avail. I still have the receipt, pictures and video from that horrible evening. Anyway, since that time I didn't go to Pacific Catch. It's basically closed for me forever.
author: Denis U.

description:
My wife and I went here during happy hour last night and ordered mahi, baja and steak tacos.  They were all cold and were obviously not made to order.  It was happy hour and the happy hour menu was cheaper but thats not acceptable in my book.  The serving staff was friendly.

Update: The manager, Mary started a dialogue with me about my review and wanted to know the details my dissatisfaction.  I was surprised at how persistent and inquisitive she was.  I think she was genuine and the conclusion was that she was going to kind of discuss this with her employees to improve.  Thats a solid move from management and very impressive.  Yes, I would go and give it another try.
author: Paul T.

description:
Amazing food with great drinks and awesome customer service! 
It was a little crowded so we sat at the bar and had a great time with the bartender. We definitely recommend the shrimp and steak tacos as well as the pisco sour!
author: Mackenzie L.

description:
This place gives me an immediate stomache ache.  
This restaurant should be investigated by the health department.  The salmon smells funky and it's covered in sauce to hide that it's not so fresh.  avoid the salmon ceviche

Most of the sushi rolls are covered in some kind of mayonnaise and are poorly made with soggy rice wet seaweed and sloppy fish

The fish tacos are OK
author: M S.

description:
I was trying to find a place to take my boyfriend for his birthday and I remembered I had been to pacific catch a couple of years ago. I didn't remember specifics but remembering it being good. He had never been before and half way through our meal he said "This is the best idea you have ever had! I love this place" The food is wonderful and I like the nice yet casual atmosphere. 

But the main reason our experience was so amazing was thanks for our waitress, Amanda. She is by far my favorite waitress I have ever had! She was easy to talk to and incredibly helpful when it came to what to order. I can't say enough how awesome we think she is!
author: Caroline S.

description:
Came here for their HappyHour 4-6 on a Friday. 
My friend and I were having a hard time choosing what we want so we were being indecisive and unsure on what to order, server seemed annoyed and rolled his eyes. Okayy.... I am sorry but we are girls and we are always indecisive!! Gosh!
author: Debbie D.

description: Pacific Catch accommodated a large, somewhat last minute event without even blinking an eye. The service was great, management and staff were flexible, food was delicious, and a wonderful time was had by all.
author: Anonymous L.

description:
Wow. I forgot to update this review. After posting it I heard from the company by private message and they have changed their advertising to make it clear that delivery is provided by an outside company. 
Why 4 stars? Because of the timely response and remedy. 
Even more, 4 stars for one of the best happy hours in San Francisco!
author: Faye M.

description:
I love the overall remodeling of Pacific Catch on 9th but I have to say the service is still mediocre.

Came here Tuesday night with a girlfriend around dinner time and the place was pretty packed. We weren't really greeted properly and when seated our waitress seemed like she was in a rush.

Despite this hiccup, my girlfriend and I have been here before so we have the menu a quick browse. If you're into some quick grilled fish, poke, or just fusion food.. Pacific Catch may satisfy your craving.

I opted for the two tacos combo, steak & mahi mahi tacos and they are pretty big tacos. It came with a side of spicy fries which were delicious! I mean who can refuse fries?!?! The tacos were okay but my favorite thing about that night was my choice in drink! My girlfriend and I both tried the Hawaiian Punch cocktail and it as so yummy!!! You could barely taste the alcohol too :P

Overall, an okay dinner experience but I would come back for happy hour.
author: Kary Y.

description: Really fresh seafood and for a chain restaurant this place exceeded our expectations!! Boyfriend and I shared a California roll (huge portion for the price with quality real crab) and the sticky ribs (great flavor but the meat wasn't falling off the bone amazing) for starters. He did the chipotle chicken sandwich with side of Cajun seasoned fries (wonderful flavor and the chicken breast was super tender) and I had the California bowl with poke 1/2 brown rice 1/2 salad which was ahhhhhmazing!!!  highly recommend. On top of it all our server was knowledgeable, attentive and sweet.
author: Sachi P.

description:
This review is for delivery only.

Mmm I like this place. I got the the seaweed salad with a seared ahi taco and a chicken taco. Good stuff. Delivery probably made the taco taste slightly worse than it otherwise would have, but at the end of the day, it was still pretty good. The seaweed salad was pretty flavorful--they also mixed cucumbers into it which was pretty unique and something I haven't seen done with seaweed salad before.

The seared ahi tuna taco was really good. I wish I had gotten two of these. The chicken one was definitely on the bland side and not as desirable. But the seared ahi tuna had a ton of great flavor--I also loved that they put crispy onion ring pieces to make the texture a bit more interesting. 

tldr; all in all, good asian fusion. go for a taco!
author: Jasmine X.

description: Fusion of seafood, can have a taste of cocktail shrimp and sushi roll and poke at the same time, light and healthy taste, rather relaxing space to have a casual meal.
author: Shufan G.

description: Great poke and fish tacos for a very reasonable price. Sure it's a chain of sorts, but who cares if the food is good.
author: Seth C.

description:
We are visiting from San Diego and met up with a local friend after he suggested this place. Ambiance was cool and hip while the staff was super friendly. It was late so we sat in the bar to take advantage of happy hour prices. I had coconut shrimp which was excellent. Sweet and crunchy but not greasy. I also had the fried fish which was cooked well but not much flavor. My boyfriend had a curry bowl but he said it was a lot of rice and not much curry. 

Cool place to go late at night. We didn't have the sushi or anything but I'm sure it's great!
author: Kelly W.

description: Great food, we had the spicy tuna bowl, it has amazing flavors and was super refreshing. Fish n chips, a classic executed beautifully. To top it off, great service which is a must for me to give a good review. Would def return!!
author: Aelia F.

description: Came here during their lunch hour. Tempura is good. I used to come here a lot for their noodle soup sadly they removed from the menu. Mojito is just ok.
author: Aj K.

description:
My absolute favorite.

Whenever anyone wants to grab dinner and they leave it up to me to choose where we go - it's a no brainer - Pacific Catch.

I adore this place.

Their menu is extensive, diverse, delicious, and there is a wealth of healthy options to choose from. Their staff are also some of the kindest, most personable, and lovely people around.

Truly.

You can tell that Pacific Catch knows what's up in all aspects of their restaurant. From their continually rotating specials to  their emphasis on serving up sustainable and fresh produce and meat to - their commitment to fostering a sense of community in their restaurant - with both their warm staff and their regular customers - they excel.

If you want a great happy hour spot - come to Pacific Catch.

If you want well sourced quality seafood - come to Pacific Catch.

If you want a variety of healthy food options - come to Pacific Catch.

If you want a filling meal -  come to Pacific Catch.

Pacific Catch is it.

Trust.
author: Jessica T.

description: They didn't mind that I brought in a big electric longboard and took me straight to a table with an outlet so I could charge it. Fish and shrimp tacos were fantastic! Sweet potato fries on point. Excellent service and friendly demeanor.
author: Brad Y.

description:
I tried this for the first time after being recommended by a friend.  Seating was pretty fast and it came with a small dish of complementary Chickpeas and Pretzel crackers.  After reading the reviews, we decided to try the California Style Hawaiian Poke and Mahi Mahi Tacos.  What I loved the best of this place is the Hawaiian Poke!  That is super delicious and it comes with chips that you can use to scoop and eat with the poke.  That's probably my favorite out of the two that we tried.  Trying the mahi mahi tacos was just okay.  From the reviews about the tacos, I was looking forward to it and it was a bit of a disappointment.  I was expecting something super delicious but it gets the job done.  Apparently, it came with fries too and we chose the sweet potato fries.  They were okay as well. 

Overall, food was okay.  Definitely love the poke and will return for it.  Not so much for the tacos.  I love the staff though because they were super friendly.  On two occasions, I was trying to take photos with a friend and both a waitress and a waiter offered to help us take a photo.  That was a very sweet gesture of them!  Will definitely return for the awesome staff and the yummy poke!  I might try something new next time instead of the tacos.
author: Teresa W.

description: Eh this place was okay. I don't know if I was just being super picky and it was Valentines day, but it wasn't my favorite spot. I did like their menu, though. It was different and interesting and it's something I appreciate. The blood orange margaritas were bomb. Get the pitcher! You can get 5 or 6 margs out of that thing, makes more sense money wise. My tacos were cold, my fries were messed up. And who the heck has fries with their tacos? That's random... anyway, I would go back, but it wouldn't be my first choice.
author: Amber M.

description:
I'm officially obsessed with this place.  

We decided to try the Pacific Catch in inner sunset.  They have sushi!!!  We went on the tenth anniversary for the poke bowls!  We got the Lomi Lomi poke appetizer - chopped pieces of salmon, tomatoes, sweet onions, cilantro, red chilies...deliciousness.  The fish is always so fresh.  We also got the poke bowl in a roll (yes, we love poke that much) - fresh, delicious, not too much rice, generous amounts of fish.  We each ended with a bowl.  I got the Japanese Wasabi bowl with, yes, Poke.  My fiance got the Korean BBQ Bowl with Marinated Skirt Steak.  The sauce was so good and the meat was soooo tender.  

We also had a Mai Tai and a beer.  

Once again, the staff is so friendly and welcoming.  It just makes you want to go back.
author: Lisa G.

description: I thought the fish and chips (we got four pieces) were the best we've ever had:  Very lightly battered, succulent, not greasy with great cole slaw and salad, too (we didn't do the fries).  We also really enjoyed the salmon salad (dressing on the side).  They gave us little edamame nibblets while we waited (not too long) for the entrees.  As good as the entrees were, the star of the show was the pineapple upside-down cake.  Outstanding! (and it's not always available for some bizarre reason). A diet disaster if ever.  Comfortable seating; service was a bit slow at first, then picked up.  5-star food quality.
author: David S.

description: A solid 3 stars. Not 3.5. Maybe 2.89 so perhaps not so sold. Salmon chowder special was filled with the brown salmon parts near the skin  that better places trim off. Salads were plain with a few pieces of ahi. Very boring. Don't know why I ordered salmon tacos at this place but they were as expected, bland.  Fish did not taste that fresh but was okay.
author: Jon R.

description: Pacific catch is one of my go to restaurants in San Francisco for a typical weekday meal. I love the Wasabi Bowl with either Salmon or Poke, depending on my mood. The food is reliably tasty, but in the times I've ordered something other than a Bowl, I usually find that it isn't as good (like any of the seasonal specials). The service used to be kind of bad, but in the past years they've definitely improved. The parking lot is tiny, but at least there's a parking lot. UCSF affiliated people get a discount, so make sure you ask. I also use their Thanx app to get points, which accumulate to free stuff!
author: Victoria J.

description:
The crab wonton appetizer was amazing; crispy and savoury. Korean rice bowl with skirt steak, not so amazing. $16 for literally 3 pieces of thin meat....what a rip off!! There was even small piece of hair in it...gross.

My friend ordered the Hawaiian Ono $19. He enjoyed it and said it was well cooked.

ATMOSPHERE: high ceilings, airy, big dining room, nicely designed, reminds me a little of cheesecake factory. Good for a party of 2 to 4.
