SERVICE: Excellent. Server was prompt, friendly and helpful.

CONCLUSION: I would have given this place 3 stars if it wasn't for the piece of hair I found in the rice bowl or even 4 stars if they added a fair amount of meat for the price they charge. If I come back here again, I definitely will not order a rice bowl. Maybe tacos next time!
author: Maryam Z.

description: Rancid, rancid, RANCID fish! I spit out my salmon poke and gagged immediately. My husband ate a few bites of his cooked salmon and is now violently throwing up. I am contacting the health department tomorrow. Shame on this restaurant for making people ill! You know your fish is not fresh, and you still serve it to people.
author: Clarity B.

description:
Great quality food, casual atmosphere and a fantastic happy hour makes Pacific Catch one of my favorites in the city. 

The menu covers all the bases. My favorites include fish tacos, poke, fish & chips, ahi tuna sando, calamari, & the sushi is also excellent. You leave full & not like you inhaled a pound of lard. Pacific Catch is great place for all types of picky eaters. Everyone will find something and really like it. 

Expect to see a reasonably priced menu that provides generous portions. They aren't stingy with the food. The service is also really knowledgeable & upbeat.  

When it's HH & bottles are 1/2 they will help you decide on a perfect pairing
author: Denniz S.

description:
Went here for a date!
+ Friendly, attentive waiters
+ Good atmosphere
+ We shared the food, and both dishes were great
+ Free pretzeled Goldfish and green beans

My only negative is that I wish I could visit again! I left with good feelings about the place.
author: Allyson G.

description:
To preface, I've come here a few times, but only during happy hour. 

On my multiple visits, I had the steak tacos, shrimp tacos, and fries (the chipotle mayo sauce is to die for-- make sure you ask for that if they don't provide it). 

Service was also as good as you could hope for. Not above and beyond, but more than good enough. 

I'll be back soon :)
author: Kevin W.

description: I placed a pick up order through Caviar. I arrived to pick up the food at the end of the 20 min pick up time. The food was not ready. I had to what for 30 more min for what i can only assume was a forgotten item in my order. While I was waiting I witnessed about 4 employees eating in the kitchen which was unsettling. We finally got the food and as expected half of the order was cold. The food that was hot was ok at best.
author: Chris B.

description:
Been here 2 times in the past 2 weeks and don't have any real complaints. The staff is fine, service is consistent, and the food is good. Highly recommend the tacos (even though, yes, there are other places super close by for really great tacos as well). 

Everything that friends have ordered also looks good. Prices are a little higher than I'd like and parking isn't great, but it's a place I'll return.
author: Jane D.

description:
My usual is the Japanese Wasabi bowl w/ all salad and Hawaiian Poke! It's nice, healthy, and light! 

I brought my sister and parents for their first time last week. My ma ordered the Japanese Wasabi bowl w/ crab since I already ordered one with poke! The crab was really nice but I think I still prefer the poke!

My sister ordered the 3 taco platter and all three were delicious! 

My dad ordered the steak dinner w/ kimchee fried rice, veggies, etc. Sadly, the steak wasn't so nice.. We told our waitress and she swapped out his dinner for Salmon instead. I mean I guess just stick to what they're known for here.. seafood and not steaks? She was nice enough to change his meal and ended up not charging us for the steak or the salmon dinner. Sucks though cause I don't think my dad would want come back
author: Michelle L.

description: Overdue but finally posting! I've gone to the PC in San Mateo frequently, and decided to take my family here on a Sunday early evening. None of them had been before so thought they should give it a try. Our waiter Jesse was great! Very personable, and somehow convinced the table to try about half the dessert menu (all of which are amazing btw; highly recommend the spring roll and the mochi). Also, my dad loved it. He never tries new places, and rarely gives a positive review. That's an accomplishment within itself! While he was a little disappointed about them running out of french fries, he said the fish and chips and the salad were excellent. Thanks for a great meal and great service!
author: Jessi S.

description:
Ok, It looks like Pacific Catch got Yelp to remove my first review of this place. So This is my second time here. After the first disaster at the 9th ave location let me recap my first visit with a short version. Here goes: We were seated way in the back of the main dining room where no other customers were. Everyone seemed to be in the bar area. We were forgotten. after a 25 minute wait the waitress finally came by to take our order. 30 more minutes and our ( cold ) order came and they messed it up. by this time we were over it and wanted to leave . Told the waitress we are leaving. the manager came over and half heartedly said he was sorry and gave me a fee dinner card. He said ask for him and he will personally  seat us and take our order. So we went back a few weeks later. Asked for the manager and told the greeter what he had said to us about him taking care of us. She found him and talked to him and he looked over at us and told her he was too busy. We just walked out and I vowed not to go back. 

 Fast forward to tonight 10/23/16 and a friend really wanted to eat there. so i said fine but I had already eaten. So we get seated. I wanted a appetizer and she got fish tacos. The waitress comes back and says the kitchen is out of rice for sushi. No biggie I wasn't that hungry anyway. I had told her my horror story of this place but she said she had a good experience here. Well her tacos come. the Mahi was not cooked and was raw and cold in the center.  The french fries were half cooked and cold and limp. When the waitress came back to check on us my friend let her know the tacos were not cooked nor the fries. She says : Yeah the fries did not look good when I brought them out . I was like: well why did you bring out food you knew was not cooked ? She was honest in her apology and nice. But still who serves food they know is under cooked ? She said they were slammed and the cooks were rushing. The New manager came over and was apologetic too and nice. I never had a good meal here ever. My friend says she will not come back and said now believes me about my old story. Advice. Go to the Marina location on Chestnut.
author: Jerry A.

description:
My buddy and his wife were in the city checking out apartments, so I decided to meet up with them for dinner since they were in town.  His wife can be kinda picky about food and was craving some fancy fish, so we headed to Pacific Catch.

We shared an order of their fried oyster appetizer, which I thought were quite delicious.  They were a tad oily, but crispy on the outside and creamy on the inside.  I got their poke rice bowl with brown rice, and it turned out to be a huge meal.  There was a good amount of poke and avo, as well as nori and ginger, as well as a ton of rice.  The ratio of rice to everything else was a little high, and I wish that there was a little sauce included because the dish ate kind of dry.  Otherwise, it was decent.

Service was ok, though not always that attentive.  Prices are pretty median for my expectation for a fish restaurant, and quality was pretty good.  They're supposed to have a great happy hour which we didn't get a chance to sample, but would certainly consider returning again to try.

Food: 7/10

Service: 7/10

Price: $$

Atmosphere: 7/10
author: Joe M.

description: Other than horrible service, amazing food. Our waitress was not happy to serve us and was quite rude. She was irritated when we asked about items on the menu and did not offer us a pleasant experience. However, my group of friends loved the food. We got the fish and chips, Korean barbecue rice bowl, and the Japanese wasabi poke bowl. The bowls were huge and big enough to split between two people! It came with seaweed, ginger, avocado, basically the works! I would come back for the food just not the service. Oh well I guess there's more places that offer poke that I could try in the city.
author: Tiffany M.

description:
A restaurant in SF that has a private parking lot....umm yes please! Although the lot has limited spots it is still a big plus. The ambiance was relaxing and not crowded for a family of four. I would suggest making a reservation though. 

Now the food was spectacular! I had the swordfish special and I would have eaten another plate, but I was full. My sons fish and chips was tasty and not too greasy. It also came with some veggies and a slice of orange. I'm all about a balanced meal. My husband had the poke salad which was extremely tasty, but it was a little on the salty side. When we told our waiter that it was salty he wanted to comp us for it, but we are not those kind of people. We consumed most of it so we were going to pay for it. 

Great location, great service, great food, great for families. We will be back.
author: Victoria Y.

description:
After a long hike at Land's End with my family, we were starving. It was a beautiful Sunday afternoon and the nearest place where there are notably tons of great eclectic spots to eat, was in the inner sunset district along Irving and 9th. Right on the corner of 9th and Lincoln is Pacific Catch, you cannot miss it. Parking can be a little difficult to find especially on weekends, but it was just our luck that we found a spot right in front. They say the law of attraction can make things happen & that's exactly what happened as my hubby and I were claiming a close spot beforehand. And on top of that, the meters said free parking, which is normally in service on Sundays. Made us feel like we won the lottery!!

Anyways, we were seated right away since it was mid-afternoon and not so crowded. The boys had kids meals: fish and chips and fish tacos. The mister and I shared the white tuna Poke, served with fried wontons. Then we both ordered mix & match tacos. I chose mahi mahi, shrimp, and steak. Hubby chose baja (fried cod), mahi mahi, and steak as well. We each ordered them with a side of fries--spicy and sweet potato. Everything was pretty much devoured really quickly, even my boys cleaned up their plates which is really rare. Either they were just hungry or they loved it, turns out to both.The only flip-side to it was that there was some damage done to our wallets. Total cost for a family of four came out to almost $80 including tax. We always try to eat where we can afford within our means, but today, I guess you can say it was a special treat:) Otherwise, be prepared to dish out some money for good seafood or save this place for special occasions.
author: Dahlia C.

description:
Well, not so as what I have expected. The service was fast, but servers turn away fast and not much enthusiasm serving. The whole restaurant was big and open. I ordered an original Poke and grill salmon teriyaki rice bowl. The poke was not so fresh, darker than the ones I ate at the Marina Store, and not as chewy. The Salmon was alright, but the rice was too sticky and the sauce was too sour. I ended up packing up almost the whole rice bowl and brought it home to cook it over. 

Maybe this is just individual case, but I feel like although Marina store is much smaller than here, but I'd say Marina is serving in better quality.
author: Yuyang Z.

description:
Food is good, ambiance is good, hostesses are completely horrible at customer service and also talk behind customers backs. 

Our group had 6 people and arrived at Pacific Catch for happy hour. The place was about 20% full and most of the people were there for happy hour. They mentioned that we can either sit at the bar or outside. We looked outside and found that there were empty tables scattered but did not seat 6 people together. The bar had similar seating arrangements with only tables for 2 open. 

I proceeded to ask 2 different hostesses to see if we can sit in the completely empty dining area. She said the dining area is only reserved for non-happy hour meals and told me that the only options were to sit at the bar or outside. I looked once again (keep in mind they did not try to resolve the issue telling us to seat ourselves) and there was no way for our party of 6 to sit together. 

I went back to the two female hostesses at the front and asked if we can just sit in the dining area since it was completely empty. I turned to explain to my group what was going on and we had noticed and heard the two hostess speaking about our group in a negative manner. Needless to say, we decided to leave.
author: Vincent N.

description:
A very solid place, with good food and great presentation.

It is an all-occasion spot, you can come for a casual Sunday dinner or to celebrate a birthday.  You can see  all ages and all kind of groups of people, from families with babies to ones with  older parents and everyone in between.  Groups of friends, ages from  20 something to seniors.

We really loved the sweet potato fries for an appetizer.  They came with red chili pepper sauce (yumm) and wasabi aioli.

My mahi mahi tacos were really good. They came with avocado and lettuce, a small bowl of beans on the side, and you could have an option of fries or salad with it.  There were 2 tacos on a plate.  I don't like huge portions, so this was plenty.

 My husband had a bowl of grilled mahi mahi with brown rice, roasted pineapple, caramelized onions and shaved coconut.   He really enjoyed it and could barely finish his plate, it was so much food.

We were so full that we couldn't  even  finish our side of warm edamame.

My son had fish and chips.  I tried his fries, the seasoning on them was a really good combination.

Some food, like sweet potato fries, tacos were served on a sheet of a newspaper which happened to be a Hawaiian Tribune from April 1, 1901.  Pretty cool, although I've seen it before (at an Italian Seafood place, on Irving and 9th, not far from this one.)

Cons:  The California roll that my daughter ordered was a bit dry. It also was overpriced at $9.  The wine was overpriced too, at $9 a glass, and it wasn't that much wine in the glass.  Also, they were out of one of Hawaiian Poke tonight - spiced tofu.

Nevertheless, we enjoyed our dinner and definitely will be back.
author: Michelle R.

description:
Nice seafood restaurant located right off the Golden Gate Bridge park, on 9th and lincoln.  I think it's a good spot for a quick meal especially if you don't want to travel far from the park or want a happy hour. 

The ahi tuna salad at $14.50 is reasonably priced.  Large portion for a salad with tangy sesame dressing.  Avocado and alfalfa sprouts with leafy greens were a good combo.  Ahi tuna was fresh, although the smaller portion size still left me a bit hungry after.  I came here looking for a quickly healthy bite and that's exactly what I got.  

They have sushi rolls and tacos for happy hour as well, but only at the bar.  My friends said their rice bowls and tacos were decent.  Not a bad place, it gets the job done!
author: Gino I.

description: wow, so much for yelp being legit.  I am just a regular person,I made a post about my experience with a roach on the menu here and YELP removed it....seriously?  I guess you get what you pay for with yelp, shame on you.  The food we had the first time was great, thats why we went back, the waiter was great but the next time we were served a menu with a roach crawling inside.  Shame on yelp for not giving up the truth.
author: Cooper C.

description: The poke I ordered was alright, though the marinade was salty.  Nothing really left me wanting to ensure a return trip.  I'll go if someone suggests it, but otherwise I'm glad to have experienced it at least once.
author: Jessica S.

description: I love the venue and bar area! Food portion is huge and delicious. The only reason why I couldn't give it a full 5 stars is cause most of their foods are spicy. I unfortunately do not have tolerance for spice and when I asked the server whats not spicy on the menu he only pointed out 5 options. I would recommend them have more options for dishes that aren't spicy. I had to settle for coconut battered fried shrimp. It was good, but not what I was craving at the time. I'd come back, but only if I was near the area
author: Danika P.

description:
You know you're hungry when your bill comes out to be around 90$ total with only 2 people. Or maybe we're just fatasses.

I was craving some Hawaiian Poke, so my best friend and I decided to dine here for dinner. We sat near the bar/lounge area; this is a great spot for a good picture if you're a crazy insta-food-ographer like myself #guilty

We ordered the California Style Poke, Marinated Skirt Steak Rice Bowl, Hawaiian Poke Rice Bowl, and Firecracker Salmon Roll. We finished majority of it all, yes we did (no shame, I'm tellin' you.) But anyway, I really enjoy their poke, the wonton chips that comes with it was soooo crunchy and thinly cut, it melted in my mouth (a little exaggeration there, but nevertheless, I loved it). PERFECT!

The rice bowl, however, was not as impressive especially for the price of it. I thought my rice bowl was way too overflowing with sauce, which made it so much saltier than it should taste and let me tell you, I am not a big fan of salty food. Not only that, the stuff that comes in it was nothing out of the ordinary. My friend said the same thing regarding the Hawaiian Poke Rice Bowl =/ 

We've also ordered drinks as well and I believe we got the Agave Margarita and Pacific Catch Mai Tai. Not too sure if these were the drinks but it balances out the food we ate and helped extract the saltiness in the rice bowl, which is a good thing I guess? 

Other than that, I will come back and try other poke because I am a huge fan of poke!
author: Anna L.

description:
**Review is for drinks only***

Stopped in here with friends to have a drink while waiting for a table at Nopalito.

Plenty of bar seats to be had, the bartender was friendly and nice and drink prices were pretty standard.

I had my new fave :rye manhattan with Benedictine instead of vermouth. 
It was a little strong, but still good.

It was busy , but we were still able to have a conversation without yelling.
author: Amanda G.

description:
I've been here before a couple of times for dinner but my friends wanted to go to their happy hour from 4-6pm so we sat in the bar area. I got there shortly after happy hour ended even though my friends were able to enjoy it so I had to order off the regular menu. Ordered the vietnamese steak sandwich with sweet potato fries ($12). 

Service just really sucked. I get that it's busy and there were only 2 people in that area: 1 waiter and 1 bartender but like isn't the whole point to get people in and then out of the restaurant? Not make them sit there for 10 minutes whille you do random stuff. Yeah, I could have got up to get them but I didn't feel like it after I did it 3 times before.

I love the feel of the restaurant and I get that they're busy but don't think I'd come back for awhile. The price, service, and quality are just O-K.
author: Lauren K.

description: I enjoy coming here on Tuesdays for the half off bottles of wine. Appetizers are good and service is excellent!!!
author: Amy H.

description:
The man and I went out for dinner after an exhausting working putting us both out of commission in the kitchen...even for eggs.

We meandered through the neighborhood and went into this CA chain.

Ooooo, weee! I love me some poke.

We ordered the bowls.

I ordered the salmon poke bowl with half greens and half brown rice! I love this option. The man ordered the regular Hawaiian poke with half brown rice half white rice the rest greens. Mmmm. The serving size is ginormous. (Welcome to America). And the meal is good enough to be split into two. We took the extra helpings home for lunch the next day.

We also ordered the salmon skin roll. Oh yum! While I love the crunch of salmon skin, I also loved that herby minty leaf they put in the roll. I forgot to ask what exactly it is, but I'll pop in and ask soon! 

We'll be back for more and I can see this being one of our go-to restaurants. 

Come here to sit by the fire and heater or enjoy your food indoors!
author: Bern M.

description: We enjoy the location, because the are right next to Golden Gate Park at Lincoln and 9th Ave. We are always looking for dog friendly restaurants and this is one of our favorites. The fish is fresh and the happy hour is outstanding. They also have 1/2 price bottles of wine on Tuesdays.
author: Brayton F.

description: This Pacific Catch caught my eye, and I finally got to eat here today for the first time with my uncle and his wife. They treated me to a dinner here. I picked something from the menu ahead of time and it was the shrimp tacos. I thought they were good. The others got dishes from the special menu, which were ribs and mahi mahi. Pacific Catch has big dishes with large portions. The dishes look hearty. I like the interior of the restaurant. If you check-in for the first time at this restaurant on Foursquare, you get a free dessert, so I ordered the mochi fondue, which we liked. It comes with chocolate dipping sauce. This is a fun restaurant with an interesting menu. The dishes you can get at other restaurants. Most of it isn't that new to the eye or mouth, but overall it's a nice dining experience, and you will probably and hopefully leave satisfied.
author: Denise C.

description:
I recently rediscovered this place since my friend was eager to try their happy hour. They have happy hour twice a weekday, from 4-6pm and 10-closing. Not bad! So once we checked out the happy hour one Friday night, we were hooked.

I got the Riesling for $6. It wasn't the best Riesling I ever had, or even close, but it was decent and a great way to start the weekend. Let's just say I ordered 2 rounds!  The Tempura Shrimp Roll ($7) was pretty decent. Once again, it's not the best sushi you ever had, but for $7 and happy hour it was pretty good. 

Ambiance was quiet. The inner sunset doesn't quite draw the party animals like the Marina does. But I didn't mind, this is a fun place to catch up with a friend since you can hear each other.
author: Jocelyn L.

description: THE BOWLS!! Every bowl is so good!! I definitely love coming here and I always went with my boyfriend so it's a great place for dinner dates or birthday dinners! You get a free birthday dessert also! I've gotten the Hawaiian Ahi poke bowl and I've tried the Korean BBQ bowl! Both are equally good. But if you're more into the light wasabi flavor than definitely try the Hawaiian Ahi Bowl. My favorite appetizer is the Hawaiian poke with wonton crisps! So mouth watering. If you're in the mood for dessert than definitely try the dulce de leche spring rolls! Absolute FAV!
author: Tiffany H.

description:
A lot of things about this restaurant don't make sense to me. If you are a trendy seafood restaurant named "Pacific Catch Fresh Fish Grill" in the SF Marina, wouldn't you want to show off the freshness of your fish instead of drenching your dishes in seasoning that masks all flavor?

With that being said, I think they still make enough money to stay open because they only give you ~1/4 cup of who-knows-how-high-qualify fish for like $12. The rest is all fried wonton crisps (even fried nori chips would make the meal feel slightly more worth it). And that's for the poke, one of the cheaper and more popular options the restaurant pushes. My brain hurt from trying to rationalize why I essentially paid $16 for mayo and chips. 

Nobody in my group of 5 (who each got poke) was able to finish their very meager serving of food... So I guess we were glad that we didn't drop more money here? At least the free edamame and friendly waitress lessened the blow. 

Also, who serves red wine with seafood? What?
author: Wendy W.

description: I loved the food here. Prices are just right. The inside if restaurant is really nice. Service was good. I enjoyed my visit to this restaurant along with my buddies. Will be coming again.
author: Luis B.

description: Ok, an update. I have now been here 3 more times for work lunch and the previous seating issue I had did not rear its ugly head in any way. The service has been prompt and, as always, cheerful. They've worked hard to make a good restaurant and it shows.
author: Erika D.

description:
We came for a Mother's Day Dinner with my Mom and brother. We made a reservation and waited about 15 minutes for our table. 

[ S E R V I C E ] 
- Our waitress Chelsea is super friendly. She came back to check on us multiple time. GREAT SERVICE!

[ F O O D ]
- ORIGINAL HAWAIIAN POKE - yummmy!! must get! I love the combination of avocado, tuna, seaweed salad, etc.
- Fish and Chip - I've had better but its not bad here...I liked the Jalepeno tartar.
- Calfornia Salmon Sandwich - my brother said it was one of the best sandwich he ever had.
- Sweet potato fries - yummy
- Sticky Ribs Korean BBQ - I liked it! Finger-lickin' good!

[ A M B I A N C E ]
- Bar is nice with TVs so you can watch the game.
- Restaurant seemed cleaned.
- Spacious! I love the booths!

[ P A R K I N G ]
- Parking lot located right next to the restaurant but there are limited spaces and they are usually occupied. I usually look for street parking, which could be hard around that area.

[ H A P P Y H O U R ]
- Happy hour from 4:00 to 6:00 Monday through Friday and everyday from 10pm to closing. Will definitely come back and try the HH.
author: Tammy F.

description:
We go to this place for sentimental reasons more than for the actual food. The food is ok, but for the price I'd rather go somewhere else.

I always get the spicy tuna sushi, and it fills me up. Just not a huge fan of edamame as the table snack. I'm forever a chips n salsa chica....Edamame for me is like a snack I have while working when I'm trying to cut off my charbs that week. Not what I want when I sit down to eat before dinner....

Anyways, that's just personal preference. The ambiance is cool, kinda like a suburban restaurant feel to it (chainville) and you get good service. So, if you're in the neighborhodod....check it out.
author: Carina M.

description: I don't usually write reviews but as a server (and a fellow sunset SF server) I have to give a shout out to our server Miya tonight she was fantastic, as was the food and drinks as per usual. Love this spot! Local or tourist come one come all! Thanks as always!
author: Starr C.

description: Had the three taco platter with traditional Baja, mahi-mahi, and cabo shrimp and side of sweet potato fries. Also had the mixed catch fish and chips. The fish and chips were okay but I don't really know how to describe the tacos. The tortilla was on the dry side and most of it was filled with cabbage, a lot of thick slices of cabbage. The ingredients didn't really hold together, just felt like hasty assortment of ingredients thrown together. The mahi-mahi was really dry. The crispy Alaskan cod was mildly crispy so I ended up eating just the fish. You can get much better taco at any taco truck. Service was good. Environment was clean.
author: Raymond N.

description: Great vibe! Would recommend to come for their happy hour because you're going to get delicious seafood for an affordable price!  The service was pretty good. The servers were friendly and pretty outgoing. I had an issue with my dish but they gladly took back my dish and accommodated.
author: Quyen H.

description: They are horrible, I came to pick up a order of food, the manager said someone had picked it up and he wouldn't remake the order. Terrible service!
author: Miche P.

description: The Ahi Poke is the greatest! We stopped by with my partner's parents recently and it was a hit with everyone. I usually like to hit up hole-in-the-wall type places but with the parents visiting from southern California- where chains are always preferred- we thought it would be a good choice, and it was. The visit was pleasant. Everyone enjoyed their meal, my partner and his dad both had fish and chips, mom had a seared tuna salad, and I had two orders of the Poke as an entree. We all shared with each other and all were good. Parking was a hassle but other than that I would visit again- maybe on muni.
author: Denisse R.

description:
Mediocre at best. Their crab was sad. Come on, you're in the heart of crab country, and you're promoting crab month, but your chowder is something you'd get from Safeway (no crab, just fibre), and the crab cakes nothing but crab meal... where's the lumb crab??

I don't recommend Pacific Catch for now... used to be a decent place years ago.
author: Stephen L.

description:
Thanks to Pacific Catch for staying open for HH on xmas eve... got to fit in some girlie time with the bff. 

Happy hour 4-6pm, only served at bar, is limited with drafts at $4 and bar bites from $3-7.  We ordered sweet potato fries and stuck with drafts.  Bff enjoyed her IPA and I got Sapporo, but that got boring so I ordered my fave bourbon, Basil Hayden at $10 a pour.  We also ordered calamari, a few more drafts for her, and I, a Yamazaki, also a $10 pour.

The bartender was courteous & friendly, but as it got a bit busier, our order of calamari was forgotten and one of the drafts was a wrong pour.  An apology was given and our calamari + couple drinks comp'd.  When the bill came, it was an ease on our holiday budgeted wallets.  We definitely left happy during these visited hours! 

CONVENIENCE: ***** [Located at the corner of 9th & Irving, FREE parking lot available, but usually filled.]
AMBIANCE: *** [Casual, dining room, outdoor seating, & bar area for HH or light eating.]
SERVICE: ***** [Stellar service, but not perfect.  Made a mistake and definitely made up for it!]
PRICE: $$ [$3-10 per food/drink at happy hour.]
OVERALL: **** [4-stars... altho not my first choice for HH, it's 1/2 off wine Tuesdays so I'll definitely be back for that!]

Nuff said.

[#63 of 100 YELP CHALLENGE 2013]
author: Lily Y.

description: We happened upon this place as we visited Golden Gate Park.  The restaurant is near the Botanical Garden.  The food was delicious, and probably deserves an extra star because it's a chain.  We had two salmon specials, fish / chips, and a rice bowl.  The fish entrees were delicious.  The rice bowl was a little heavy in the sauce (sort of common in restaurants).  The "sticky" ribs were tasty but a little tough in the eating.  Service was meh, our waiter was sort of mia.  There was a bit of a wait, but it was worthwhile.
author: L S.

description: The food was great, I cannot complain but the service however made me not want to go back there again. My friends and I enjoyed the food but we definitely would have loved to have been better served by the waitresses
author: Amira M.

description:
Came here for lunch to satisfy a seafood craving. Went late in the afternoon and there wasn't any wait to be seated. I ordered the shrimp ceviche and the spicy tuna roll. Even though they gave us complimentary edamame and crackers while we waited for our food, the wait was excruciatingly long. It took about 20 minutes to get our food. When the food arrived I concluded that the waitress must've heard my order wrong because she gave sweet potato fries instead of the spicy tuna roll. When I told her that they got my order wrong, she generously gave me the sweet potato fries on the house. 

The shrimp ceviche with avocado was delicious! It had a lot of flavor to it and the portion was generous as well. The spicy tuna roll was delicious too except for the fact that they put watercress in it (yuck). The sweet potatoes were my favorite! It was lightly salted and it came with a cream wasabi and sweet&sour sauce. 

Four stars because I think the service is great but prices are a little too steep. I understand that it's seafood and that's always gonna be expensive but the ceviche and sushi roll cost me 9 dollars each! 

Overall, this place is worth coming to. The quality of the food and the service is great.
author: Lisa H.

description:
They have incredible service here. The bartenders and servers are super friendly, and the service is fast. They give you a little bowl of edamame and pretzel goldfish to snack on while you wait for your food, which is cute.

I ordered the Ahi Tuna Salad ($14.50) which has seared ahi tuna, avocado, cucumber, daikon sprouts, ginger, sesame seeds, and soy-wasabi vinaigrette. YUM!! At most restaurants, they don't put enough dressing. At Pacific Catch, my salad was overly drenched in dressing... but that's okay. The salad itself was HUGE. So filling. So worth it. 

Great place to visit whether you live right around the corner or you're on your way to Golden Gate Park.
author: Stefanie C.

description: This is a great place for lunch and has become my go-to spot where I take all my friends.  The modern decor is refreshing.  Their rice bowls and salads are wonderful with the half rice and salad option in the rice bowl.  My favorite protein for these is the mahi mahi although the salmon and crab salad are a close second.  I got stuck on the tropical iced tea for a long time but recently tried the sparkling lemonade which offers free refills and is delicious!  Oh and always opt for those sweet potato fries.  I've never had a bad experience and whoever hires all the servers finds the nicest people in the City!
author: Krislyn T.

description:
This restaurant is right across the street from Golden Gate Park making its location convenient for anyone in search of seafood after a long day taking in the scenery.  The atmosphere is pleasant and not too loud even when full.

I ordered a Thai coconut shrimp soup and the fish of the day served with a baked artichoke.  Both dishes had excellent flavor with some unique notes that I hadn't expected, but everything was incredibly salty.  I normally like a lot of salt in my meals, but between the salty soup, salty fish, and salt-crusted artichoke, it was just too much.  Maybe it would have been tolerable if only one of the dishes was salty, but even still I think it would have been unpleasant.  This was unfortunate because the other flavors of the meal were great and the service was wonderful too.  I would definitely give them another shot (maybe the chef's taste buds were a bit off that day?) but I can't recommend it as a sure bet.
author: Robert F.

description:
Love the happy hour. Good deals, something like $4 Beers, $5 specialty drinks and a lot of cheap appetizers. Staff in the bar is very friendly, and the glass windows are fun to lookout and watch people coming/going from the park. 

Dinner menu is good. I had the fish and chips. Very good. 

This is a nice, easy place to have dinner. It's nor the world's greatest seafood, but it's good, not too pricey, has a good happy hour and friendly staff. 

We will be back.
author: Mike S.

description:
Compare price and quality,the price is too high.

Food are either too salty or too sour.
Crab chowder is a bit cold when served.
Service/food is slow when restaurant isn't busy.

The only recommend dish is fish and chip.
author: Eric M.

description: Tasted great! Poke was fresh and flavorful. The fish and chips were good, but the portions were a little small.  Priced a bit high.
author: Ann D.

description: Have lived in the neighborhood for years but for some reason I only recently got around to trying this place.  All in all, it's not bad.  I got the three taco plate with two baja fish tacos and one shrimp taco.  The shrimp taco was the clear winner, but the fish tacos were still decent.  Would have been better if the batter was crispier though as it felt like they took them out of the grease too soon. The spicy fries were good, and the black beans that it came with were a bit bland but still acceptable.  I think next time I'll try their poke wasabi bowl, but I was pleased wnough with what I had to have it again at some point.
author: Joshua W.

description: Another great meal, had the Hawaiian teriyaki bowl with Salmon, wow it was amazing. Tuesday is also half price bottles of wine yes!
author: Jackie S.

description:
Had a great lunch here! I know it's a little bit of a tourist spot but does it matter if the food is cooked well and the service is great?

We got the California style poke, the salmon and gyoza special, and my boyfriend got three tacos. Everything tasted good, and I requested my salmon to be cooked rare - and it was! So tasty, and the manager stopped by to make sure it was rare enough haha. The poke was awesome. The waiter/bartender was pretty nice too, and the drinks were great. I recommend the pomegranate ginger martini.

My only complaint is that the high tables were awkward to sit at because they blocked your knees from scooting in all the way.

We're usually in and out of restaurants in like 45 minutes but pacific catch was chill and we stuck around for a second drink!
author: Medina C.

description:
I've been here twice and tbh, the first time I was here was a lot worse than the 2nd. 

The first time I was here was for lunch with a HS friend and though the food was decent, the prices seemed higher than what I would normally pay. Everything was about average. Perhaps I ordered the wrong things.

The second time I was here, I came with a group of 7 and almost all of us ordered poke-bowls. The poke-bowl is AWESOME. Go for half rice and half salad if you dont want to feel like a carb monster. It's super tasty and has the right balance of sauce for the fish and when you get half rice and half salad, it makes you just full enough that you crave more, but don't need more.

Our server was super nice and was accommodating for our large group and late arrivals.
author: Courtney Q.

description:
OMG the bowls!! Too good and it totally hit the spot. 

I got the Korean bowl with salmon, half-and-half with greens and rice. The curry bowl is also pretty amazing.

Good sized portions, great waitresses, and yummy drinks! Didn't make too bad of a meeting spot for a large group. :)
author: Austin L.

description:
First time goer, so here are my initial impressions: restaurant atmosphere is nice, service is great, and food is good.

We ordered the calamari appetizer, wasabi ahi rice bowl, and the variety coconut shrimp, fish, and fried oyster basket.
By the end of the meal we were both stuffed!!

Calamari: good portion, lightly breaded, and very TENDER. I can't emphasize enough how tender it is because so many other places I've been the calamari is chewy bleh! I also love the chipotle chili aioli they serve as a dipping sauce (has a very slight kick) that compliments the calamari really well. Would order again and recommend you try it.

I'll call it the "Fried Variety Basket" because I forgot what it's called on the menu: comes with two pieces of lightly breaded and deep fried cod, 3 coconut shrimps, 3 fried oysters, and your choice of fries, seasoned fries, sweet potatoe fries, or a side salad. Sweet potatoe fries are on point! And the fried oysters were the star of this entree. I would come back and just order the basket of fried oysters!! Shrimp was also good, but the cod was bland. Also the little cole slaw side they have I could live without (too much  onion for my liking) but onto the next..

Wasabi Ahi Bowl: this dish alone would be enough to bring me back. It's honestly like a deconstructed sushirrito in a big ass bowl. I know it can seem daunting that it's $15 but it's worth it especially because it's enough for two people to share. Fish is very fresh and it was just great.

Tried to do the "pay with Paypal and get $10 off your meal deal" but it was conveniently not working for us.. Hmmm. 

But still.. Will definitely be returning once I am no longer a broke student =)
author: Danielle R.

description: Very tasty very satisfying. I left feeling the perfect amount of full. It's very clean and the decor is very pleasing to the eyes. We got the California grilled salmon sandwich and the wasabi poke bowl. Great food great service I'd come back again :)
author: Georgie O.

description:
I was so starving after we were done with the park, and stressed from chasing the kids this place has the perfect atmosphere for calming down.

Our server was busy but our drinks came quickly.  A fantastic blood orange margarita for me ( i had just had a bad one the day before so i was really craving one...) they also happened to have my favorite fume blanc, ferrari carano.

Sweet potato fries and an ecstasy roll for appetizer seriously hit the table in 7 minutes flat... i was so happy!!! The sushi was so fresh tasting i could have eaten double!!!

The kids teriyaki chicken was too dry for kids and it was left untouched but the chipotle bbq chicken breast on my salad was lightly seasoned and perfectly cooked. Super yummy!!! Also my boyfriend's salmon disappeared before i got a good look at it but i did taste the sauce that came with his artichoke... some kind of basil dill aioli? sooo nice!!! i will be trying to copy it in my kitchen right away!!!

Next time I am in town I will be back!!
author: Bethany Y.

description:
Since my first visit to Pacific Catch over three years ago, the restaurant has definitely added more options to the menu. The sandwiches now come with a small coleslaw and a choice of fries (it used to be only coleslaw). And now they have four Pan-Asian rice bowls to choose from: Japanese, Korean, Hawaiian, and Thai (it used to be only Japanese and Hawaiian). I've dined here plenty of times that I can safely say that you can't go wrong with their Japanese wasabi bowl with either poke or ahi tuna! Of the four to choose from, the Japanese one is definitely my favorite because of the seaweed salad and fresh avocado. There's hints of wasabi flavor fused in, yet it's not too strong that I find it unbearable. Also, you can substitute the white rice for brown rice and/or greens for a healthier option.

Overall, the restaurant is quite large and spacious. The chairs are very comfy as well. I find the tables are a bit taller at the bar seating area as I have to stretch my torso in order to eat my meal. Service is still hit or miss, depending whether it's peak hours or not. And they have a small, private parking lot -- a great perk to this location over the one in the Marina.
author: Priscilla W.

description: Good happy hour spot! My friends and I usually hit up the 4-6pm happy hour, and we've always had good food, friendly service, and nice seating. There's a tiny parking lot around the corner, but it fills up fast. You might find a spot if you come at the beginning of happy hour.
author: Linda L.

description:
Bleh, had a strong urge for fish and chips and thought, what better place to get it than a place called PACIFIC CATCH.  Turns out the fish n chips are not fried to hot crispy perfection, instead they are just warm and somewhat soggy.  Friend ordered 3 different tacos and they were all meh and not hot either.

MAKE FOOD HOT, how hard is that?  maybe their poke is where its at cause from what I saw it just seems like over priced food thats kinda meh. yea meh I said it again.
author: Vince L.

description:
In a hot day with the company of our dog and walking around inner sunset we chose to eat at the Pacific Catch. The first good things:
-outside tables under the shadow was great to be with the pet 
-nice cocktails 
-friendly staff 
-fast service 
-cool view to the GGP
-busy corner
:ºD
author: Coté M.

description: This place exceeded every expectation. The food was amazing, but the service was outstanding. As someone who has been in the service industry, I was blown away by how attentive the entire serving staff was to our table. Order the Lemongrass Mojito if you are into such cocktails, along with the Japanese Wasabi bowl (recommended to me), and enjoy a truly amazing experience!!!
author: Joshua M.

description:
After a long day in the park and Botanical Garden, this place was like an oasis. It's kid-friendly and the food was fresh and delicious. From the hostess to Brittany, our waitress, the service was friendly and fast. Food came out so quickly.

This was such a great find after struggling to find a place we could all enjoy.
author: Nathan S.

description: Sweet place with nice decor and attentive wait staff. Food,however is not very good.  On par with a chain restaurant. Might return for a salad or drink
author: Kathleen C.

description:
I've been here twice now. The first time I was here, I was super hungover, tried, and grumpy, so I was unable to appreciate Pacific Catch in all its glory. So I would have to discount that time I went. The second time I went, I was with my coworkers. We made reservations, and they had quickly sat us down for dinner.

We ordered a pitcher of the mojito, which was AMAZING. It just so happened to be dungeness crab season - so I had myself the dungeness crab and corn chowder (MUST HAVE... if it's in season), and the California Style poke. I can't say no to avocado and ahi tuna. I must say, the poke here is phenomenal (although, I've never had real poke from Hawaii, so don't take my word on it. I just really like fish).

Finally, we ended off with two mochi fondues. THIS IS A MUST HAVE. You can't go wrong with ice cream mochi, chocolate, and Pocky sticks.

There was a bit of a kerfuffle when it came to getting our bills. However, it worked out in the end. PROTIP: If you pay with PayPal, you get $10 off.
author: Joanne W.

description:
Where do I start? I'm from Los Angeles and love driving to San Francisco just to eat here! Start your meal off with some spicy fries, perfect seasoning and dipping sauce.

I've tried the fried shrimp, tacos and bowls here. The bowls are by far my favorite, they're huge though! You can easily share a bowl with 2-3 people, depending on how hungry everyone is. I love getting the bowl with the Poke and Korean BBQ Ribs.

This place makes my long drive to San Francisco worthwhile!
author: Karin L.

description:
Better make reservations especially if you have small kids, if you are walk-in customers with more than 4,  this place is not flexible at all to make a bigger table for you just by simply moving even two tables together, they made you wait forever until, for example, a six person table is free. 

We  live around the neighborhood and come fairly often to eat, guess what, they don't care either you are a regular customers or you have small kids who are hungry & tired.
author: Florian N.

description:
I think the text my best friend sent me yesterday morning sums up my feelings about Pacific Catch, "wtf wtfff why are you always at pacific catch crazy woman" Haha. 

I didn't even realize how much I loved this place until I kept finding myself there. It wasn't even until the third time did I realize they had a parking lot next to the restaurant! How handy! Such a rare find in San Francisco. 

Fish & Chips: Everyone loves these but I don't think its their best thing there. You should definitely get 4 pieces though since its $14 and 2 pieces is already $10. The pieces of fish aren't that big. I love the sauces it comes with but the Jalapeno Tartar sauce was never spicy to me. I think the coleslaw side is far too small as well but I love their sweet potato fries (the only reason I wanted to come in the first place haha)

California Roll Salad: I love this salad! Although I had it at every meal and I got kind of sick of it at the end. The salad is huge and you'll probably have a hard time finishing it. It comes with a ton of avocado and a even bigger mound of real crab. It really does taste like a california roll! I think its around $13. 

Hawaiian Poke Brown Rice Bowl: I never would've thought of ordering this if it wasn't for Yelp! I'm eating it right now as I type. I had a ton leftover because it wasn't the best thing to eat yesterday morning hungover! By far my favorite thing from Pacific Catch. You can also get it with white rice or 1/2 rice & 1/2 greens. 

Mochi Fondue: Nothing special. Just 3 mochi balls cut in half and a little bowl of tasty melty chocolate to dip it in. There was way too much chocolate in the bowl though and I felt bad for wasting it. I don't think its worth the money since it isn't very creative and you could just make the same thing yourself for far less. 

There is never a wait when I go. My friend and I were about to get dinner at the Presidio location until we drove by it noticed how tiny and packed it was. We just drove all the way to the 9th street location. This location is huge. Service has always been nice as well. I probably wouldn't go on a first date here though as it is a little bit commercial and there are tons of better first date restaurants in the area.
author: Tiffany V.

description:
Visited here once a few years ago and tried a number of their dishes and apps. Left feeling very unimpressed by it all and never went back until today after a trip to the de Young. I had originally planned on going to Inner Fog for some happy hour wine but my tired feet did not want to carry me all the way over there so I settled for happy hour at Pacific Catch. 

Based on my previous experience there I did not have high expectations. I was pleasantly surprised that their happy hour was pretty extensive, plenty of $3, $5, $7 bites and a good selection of beer and mixed drinks. However, I was disappointed their was only one selection for white and red wine. 

I ordered a glass of the white, Kung Fu Girl Riesling and loved it. I also ordered the $5 shrimp ceviche. It was awesome! First, it came out within 5 minutes of ordering, then I noticed it had a lot of big pieces of shrimp. I had to count, 11 pieces of shrimp for $5!!! There were also huge chunks of avocado and the citrus lime sauce it was marinated in was super delicious. What a stellar deal it was

I wouldn't come back here for their full menu yet, but definitely stopping in again for their happy hour to try other items.
author: Pauline T.

description:
Me and my friend were looking for sit-down pretty afforable and worth it place to eat. So we stopped by here and it seemed decent and there was no wait. I wouldn't say that this place was worth it. I left thinking I could totally eat more food, but I already spent more than I wanted for a quick dinner. 


White Tuna Poke- not my favorite dish. It was pretty fresh, but the sauce was very sweet and seemed kinda creamy and citrusy. The wonton strips it came with was mostly folded and I could not eat it with the tuna. I probably would try something else next time.

Fish Tacos- 
I got the 3 taco platter plate to share. First off, I got the grilled Mahi-Mahi tacos. Kind of dry, to be honest, and pretty bland. The steak taco was pretty good! very filling! Then for the third taco, I got the shrimp one. The shrimp were pretty large and fried and it was my favorite taco out of the three. Came with a side of sweet potato fries which were super delicious, so I recommend yall get that if you come here.
author: Carmen C.

description: love this place. The food is good, a fusion of Asian, Pacific Islander and American. Great bar and a great happy hour. My wife and I like to meet after work and sit at the bar and have drinks and eat bar bites--calamari, original Poke, California roll, and Korean ribs are all great! The bar features hand built drinks... I love the Mai Tai's they are best that I have ever had and the Negroni is also top notch. Good service and good prices. A neighborhood gem
author: David K.

description:
The Third Time was Definitely a Charm...

Before my Yelping hiatus which started two years ago, I had come to this Pacific Catch location two other times and was not impressed, not even remotely. The food was mediocre at the very best and forgettable.

On Friday, 5.27.11, I came to Pacific Catch for my friend's Birthday Dinner. We had reservations for a party of 14 at 7 pm. Upon arrival, it took about 5-7 minutes for them to set up our table and be seated.

F O O D:
This time I did my due diligence and made sure I looked at the other Yelper's reviews to see what to order. The Poke and Sweet Potato Fries were overwhelming mentioned in many reviews, so I decided to entrust in my fellow Yelpers and I was not disappointed. Thank you, Yelpers!

*HAWAIIAN POKE WASABI BOWL w/ Tobiko & Brown Rice ($14.95 +$2 for Tobiko):  YUMMY!
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/3bxO8T8U96uKu2numljjsw?select=GXy8_YmqbfOJ6fPhUrOi7w

The poke was hands down the BEST I've ever had! The thick chunks of tuna were uber fresh, tender and succulent. The soy wasabi sauce, albeit a bit salty, gave the tuna a nice savory sweet flavor with a hint of spice while the sesame seeds and roasted nori gave it a touch of nuttiness. The accoutrements of wakame salad, daikon sprouts, cucumber, and ginger were all very fresh and crisp. The brown rice, however, was undercooked and hard.

*SWEET POTATO FRIES ($3.50 for a Side Order): DANGEROUSLY ADDICTING!
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/3bxO8T8U96uKu2numljjsw?select=neBvXM0nJIZivB8_tiEe7g

The fresh-out-of the fryer sweet potato fries were crispy throughout with a soft, fluffy center. The light sprinkle of salt brought out the natural sweetness of the potatoes. There were two accompanying sauces: Thai Sweet Chili and Wasabi Aioli. I preferred the Wasabi Aioli as it added a layer of creaminess with a slight nose tingle from the wasabi.

S E R V I C E:
Very friendly but slow which is understandable because we were in a large party and the restaurant was packed. Nevertheless, the staff did a good job making sure everyone got their entrees at the same time although the last three took 5 minutes longer than the others. I did have to ask several times for my water glass to be refilled so perhaps leaving a water pitcher for larger parties may be a good idea.

A M B I A N C E / D É C O R:
Contemporary and fun; Pacific Catch is good for casual lunch and dinners. Since it's a large restaurant, it's also good for large parties. The noise level is very, very loud though so it's very likely you'll have to scream across the table if you want to be heard.

P A R K I N G:
Although Pacific Catch has a small lot with a 10-car capacity, getting a parking space in that lot is like hitting the jackpot. Street parking is no easy task either so make sure to allot an extra 15 minutes to find parking. Your best bet is looking for parking at Golden Gate Park which is just across the street. 

The is one of the few times that Yelpers didn't lead me astray, so if you're coming to Pacific Catch, definitely order the Poke and Sweet Potato Fries. You will NOT be disappointed!
author: Cherylynn N.

description:
My son and I stumbled into this place looking for shelter from the busy day and tons of walking we had endured.  We weren't disappointed.  Our waitress was on the ball, got us seated and took our drink order.  Our drinks arrived quickly and were thankfully refreshing.  In fact, as our waitress approached I could actually smell the open bottle of Crispin Pear Cider coming my way.  It was a great start.  We both ordered.  My son ordered a seafood chowder and I ordered the crab sandwich.  My sandwich was basically a tuna sandwich, but made with crab instead.  It was so good.  The bread was properly toasted, the cheese (which I rarely eat anymore) gave the sandwich a richness as I bit down into the crab.  I was actually sad when I finished.  Luckily the cider helped me get over it.  

Now, I know there are a lot of places doing this now, but I never seem to interact with one of them, but the waitress told me I could pay using PayPal!!!!!!!!!!!  Holy 3rd Party Batman!  I was excited.  I pulled my phone from my utility belt and paid with PayPal.  It even allows you to calculate the tip too.  I was so excited about this that I momentarily forgot that I had even had a great meal.

I'll definitely be back.
author: Nick M.

description:
My wife and I visited San Francisco, and the Academy Of Sciences. After a little over two hours that morning of looking at nature, and marching through hordes of sight seeing morons, we were in much need of a relaxing lunch. 

Nicole spotted this place on Yelp, which is within throwing distance of the inundated Academy of Foreign Masses. 

We parked on the street, and I set a timer for the meter. The hostess seated us promptly, and our waitress quickly greeted us. After ordering refreshments, we looked over the menu and were very excited by all of the seafood choices. I settled on a salmon chowder, and ahi Ecstasy rolls for appetizer. My wife ordered an Ahi salad, and I chose the wasabi bowl with Poke. 

Our waitress brought a small bowl with edamame beans, and little fish shaped pretzels to munch on before the appetizers came. The ambiance here is very casual, and is decorated in a modern/Japanese motif that is actually very relaxing. It was busy, but not at all packed. 

Both the appetizers and the food were absolutely delicious. I am not a food critique, but my taste buds were quite stimulated by the blend of flavors used in the dishes. We were both very happy to have found this gem.
author: Nick D.

description:
This place was fine.. 

A few friends from the CLS program came out here for dinner n drinks to celebrate finishing our lab internships. Our group was about 9-12 people deep. 

We shared a bunch of plates. There was a bunch of food all over the table and I don't remember how the food was. So, you can take what u want from that. Nothing really stood out. Ykno? 

Service wasn't great. They were really busy that night, so I  guess it's fine... I guess. One of the drink runners spilled a little bit of my drink on me. No biggie though... I work in a lab, so I wasn't too worried about it. Plus, she was really apologetic and got like soda water so it was fine. 

I had an Old Fashioned. It wasn't bad. Not great either. 

This place just wasn't really much. If the overall experience could be summed up in a word.... It would be "meh". 

Key take-away:
- You won't hate this place..
author: Shaun A.

description: Going to the academy of science with the family and wanted something nearby. Got an excellent beer (Lagunitas Stoopid) three tacos and a bowl to share.  Excellent food, location and atmosphere
author: John G.

description:
Despite being packed to the brim last night, Pacific Catch's service was as crisp as ever and upheld its reputation as one of the few reliable seafood options in the Sunset. Sushi-wise, their tempura and spicy tuna is quite good. Sandwich-wise, I would go for the Wasabi Ahi with a side of spicy fries. 

Pro Tip: Do your best to make a reservation--this place can get super busy Thursday through Sunday evenings.
author: Ahmed R.

description: The salads here are delicious, gigantic and loaded with healthy fats; so good they might inspire you to leave the family at home and finally take that vacation with a friend. Just thinking about the poke and the margarita is making me dream about the pool and a bikini. The staff here caters to your every need, as if you were already beached. If you ask nicely, they'll give you half of this and half of that on one plate. Eat everything you want, including the coconut shrimp. They're the bomb!
author: Anna L.

description:
This location of Pacific Catch has improved a lot over the last few years.  I used to like the Marina location much better, but now the two locations are comparable in winning my heart for a Hawaiian Poke Wasabi Bowl or Crispy Oyster Basket.  The wasabi is not very strong at all, just enough to tickle my palate.

1 star off: The tacos and sandwiches are just all right...nothing that you cannot get anywhere else.

I am usually so full after ordering the Wasabi Bowl, but still manage to stuff my face with fried oysters.
author: Ally W.

description:
I walked past this place off and on for 6 years before trying it, mainly because I assumed it was a tourist trap.

I finally noticed they had a happy hour menu and it's pretty awesome!

My boyfriend got the fish tacos and the margarita while I got the Spicy Pacific cocktail (very good, minimal spice) and the inside out roll. 

Everything was delicious, service was speedy, and if you sit near the window at the bar you get a view of the park!

A very solid happy hour spot. Would be great to bring guests out of town to or a few local friends.
author: Katie S.

description:
I've eaten at Pacific Catch a couple of times before, but this time was, by far, the worst service I have ever had. 



We waited about 15-20 minutes before we were seated, which wasn't really a problem. Then, we proceeded to sit at our table for another 15 minutes before anyone even acknowledged that we were sitting there, even though multiple servers had passed our table a few times. 
When our waitress finally realized we were sitting in her section, she basically told us that she didn't know we were there and that she didn't know that we were seated in her section, when in reality she had passed our table at least 5 times previously. So, we placed our orders, which did come out in a reasonable amount of time. Our waitress, on the other hand, hardly ever checked on us for refills, and my friend had to get up and find the pitchers to refill our drinks. She didn't even bring condiments for our food so we had to get that as well. 

At least the food is good. The poke is really tasty, and the tacos are really good. I got the Mahi Mahi and the beef tacos.
author: Meredith W.

description: Having an awesome conversation with my buddy.  So when our orders arrived, after my 1st bite I had a taste bud orgasm. The Fish & Chips were tastebud orgasims! My friend was talking I saw lips moving but only felt the fresh, soft lightly bread fish, the cilantro infused coleslaw (can u double that please?), the fries, I had regular but you could have a salad, fries either spicy or sweet potato, the tarter sauce has chopped jalapeno peppers. This will be one of my I want to eat out or time home place I will go to. Incredible. Our Server (I think Amanda) was spot on!  Thank you for being walking distance from my taste buds. And I can pick it up if I want to eat at home.
author: Karolyn H.

description:
Well, it's OK. I don't have really any complaints about this place, but truthfully, I don't have a ton of praise either. It gives you pretty decent food at an okay price, but I probably wouldn't advocate coming here if the choice was up to me. There's a lot of really great stuff out there. But the great thing about Pacific Catch is that everyone can probably find something on the menu they'll be OK with, even if they're not big on seafood. So I guess Pacific Catch is the best way to compromise when you have a group of people who can't ever agree on what to eat.

See, Pacific Catch is sort of an "Anywhere-near-water fusion" style restaurant, so you can get a little bit of Hawaiian food, a little bit of Japanese food, a little bit of Thai food, and not all of it involving seafood, either. I always get the green curry with chicken here and it's good. I could get resoundingly better green curry at an actual Thai place, but then my buddy couldn't get his poke while sitting right next to me, while my other friend gets calamari. It's an ironically good place for people to come if they like seafood but their friends don't. 

So stop by! Or don't. I don't know, I feel pretty much the same whether I do or don't.
author: Brandon B.

description: Great service and friendly. Coconut shrimp was over cooked but delicious. Poke flavor needs help. Long line in bathroom. Ono libations.
author: Leon L.

description:
We order sushi from pacific catch for delivery when we get lazy and I must say PC is the best japanese food you can get delivered to your door. 

Please try the ecstasy roll ;)
author: Margaux M.

description:
Atmosphere is great and the views are nice to sit and relax after going to the park. 

Service on the other hand is poor. When we have to get up to ask for items it means the service is real poor. Seems like no one wants to work here or understands what friendly service is. 

Food is overpriced and just ok. I know this is a nice location but you need to put better effort into the food and service. I would not return.
author: David B.

description:
Very mixed feelings about this place. The good: fish tacos, sweet potato fries and their Happy Hour.

The bad: I was served a taco containing a 1/4" chunk of hard plastic (nearly as hard as metal, not soft plastic). I discovered this on my first bite, and it hurt the hell out of my crown and upper tooth for many days.

The worse: when the "manager" came over to deal with it, she looked at the remains of what I had to spit out and said "oh, that shouldn't be in there, we'll make you a new one," and that was it. No "wow, are you hurt?" or anything even feigning empathy.

To their credit, I did get a replacement taco that DIDN'T have a dangerous foreign object inside, that was awesome. Even more awesome after being ignored for the next half hour after food delivery was they took an entire twelve dollars off the bill for nearly requiring me to do an emergency visit to the dentist (or possibly the hospital had I swallowed). 

Their response was appropriate for an instance where they served the wrong drink, not where they served contaminated and dangerous food that caused injury. We were stunned and almost amused at the level of their tone-deafness.

The "real" manager came by after we had paid and briefly discussed it then tried to take my money again. Then the kitchen chef came by and actually apologized and showed some empathy for what had happened, but at that point it was too little and far too late. But he was the one guy who seemed to give a damn about what their mistake did.

I have given it a couple weeks before writing this. Wrote a note to to their corporate headquarters while still at the table and later received back some mumbo-jumbo that didn't really indicate they gave a sh_t. They also promised to get back to me but they didn't. 

-------
UPDATE: Within a day of posting this review, I finally heard back from them (thanks, power of social media...). I'll bump it up a star just because I got the sense that management is aware of ongoing issues at this location and the guy was real with me. The food is decent, location good and prices reasonable, I would really like this place to succeed and never put anyone else through this (or worse). Not sure if I will return, but I hope for everyone's sake this is a turning point where they wake up and fix the service issues that I and others have been yelping about.
author: T J.

description:
YES - I have to give Pacific Catch 5 Stars.  Not just for the amazing food...but the service was INCREDIBLE.  Diane from Philly was awesome.

Get the POKE.  Yes, Yes, I know everyone is tellingy you to but SERIOUSlY - get the POKE.

We did apps - Ceviche Trio - WHOA.
had some sushi.

and then dessert.  Again...so great and next time we are in SF - we are going back!!!!
author: Mara F.

description:
Service was great! I was a bit concerned about the experience based off the photos on Yelp and their website, as it was very swanky, and worried for all fluff no stuff. I am glad that we gave this place a try after a wonderful day at the CA Academy of Sciences.  I had the Hawaiian punch and poke rice bowl. I strongly suggest the punch if you are a lightweight drinker like me, as it tastes great and not overpowering with alcohol, but I got a fun buzz.  We shared the spicy salmon roll for an appetizer and Chef was nice enough to serve it raw instead of frying it (so we could avoid my shrimp allergy). I originally laughed at the idea of ordering a rice bowl with only half rice and half salad, but after eating the bowl, I see why. I am a huge rice eater and still had most of the rice at the end of the meal. Tip: If you order a rice bowl, order half rice half salad, and ask for extra hot sauce if you prefer more heat.

I will definitely swing by for lunch the next time I am in the area. The botanical garden was also conveniently across the street. It was lovely to enjoy a stroll among trees and flowers after a filling meal.
author: Siu L.

description:
On a sunny (but windy) Sunday in the city, a group of friends and I stopped in to eat at Pacific Catch for dinner.

I would be giving 5 stars, if it weren't for the 40+ minute wait just to get a table when we were told it would be 15. Food was great though.

We ordered:
Edamame - fresh, healthy, green, salted deliciousness
Sunset Sushi Roll - YUM. Tempura sweet tofu, green bean, scallion, & carrot, wrapped with avocado, rice & nori, and drizzled with teriyaki sauce.
Japanese Wasabi Rice Bowl - Extremely fresh, and great colorful presentation. Good portions as well.
Korean Barbecue Rice Bowl - Pretty bomb.

Overall, the experience was a good one and a delicious one. I would definitely recommend Pacific Catch for anyone in the area who is craving some good seafood!
author: Chelsea M.

description: We went there after visiting the botanical garden and deYoung museum with high expectations. However the food was very disappointing. We ordered udon and tuna rice bowl. Neither the presentation nor the taste was any good. Oh well we would never go back there anymore.
author: Daniel C.

description:
We went there twice. Super amazing food, strong drinks, kids friendly, parking lot, great service, check check check. Will go back again and again. 
Oh and for kid-less folks, there is a super fun fire pit outside.
author: Carpe D.

description:
My husband and I came here last night (Friday) around 930pm and easily found a table in the bar area. I ordered the California poke which was good but heavier and creamier than I thought it would be. Husband got the fish and chips sampler that included fried fish, oysters, and coconut shrimp along with sweet potato fries. All were very good.
Waited for happy hour to start at 10pm to order drinks and got 2 margaritas. Very tasty and only $6 each! Overall nice place and would come back.
author: Irene R.

description:
I come here frequently with my wife and mom for lunch dates in between classes. The restaurant itself has nice decor, as well as a small parking lot on the side. It is always very well kept up and clean. We never have issues getting a booth, and service is always very good. 

They have a great selection of salads and sandwiches. My personal favorites are the BBQ chicken salad/sandwich and the California Salmon Sandwich. Both of these go very well with their sweet potato fries. In addition to salads and sandwiches they offer a somewhat decent variety of sushi, all of which is very good.
author: Chris S.

description:
I have gone to Pacific Catch since it opened and love it. The thai coconut shrimp, poke, and sweet potato fries are always in some kind of rotation when I go. I also love the salmon salad. PC always has specials as well which adds variation to my rotation! lol
The staff is always nice and the wait time usually isn't too long (20min or less) especially in the day time.
author: Kaitlin E.

description:
Had my first experience here the other day and I can say that they put great quality in their food. Ordered the Calamari Appetizer $9.95 and Hawaiian Poke Rice Bowl $15.50. So fresh! The Calamari was lightly battered and tender as can be. The Hawaiian Poke Rice bowl taste exactly like a Sushirito (in San Francisco yelp it!) but in a bowl version. 

I'm thinking of going here during happy hour cause most items are discounted. Ps if you pay with PayPal you get $10 off your meal!
author: Moses D.

description: The staff was super friendly from the beginning. I had the spicy tuna bowl which was fantastic and my wife had the mahi tacos which she loved! Great drinks . Great atmosphere .
author: Sean M.

description: This was a wonderful experience.  When we travel to San Francisco, we love to try new and different places.  We always get together with our Niece that lives in San Francisco for a meal. I had heard about this place from her, she has been to one of their restaurants with her dad.  This one is off Lincoln on 9th av.  I checked it out online and it looked good, so we made a date.  They also had a nice selection of specials not on the website.  The restaurant is very nice and roomy inside.  Not too noisy.  The staff was great.  Our waiter was very attentive.  Our water was never empty and he kept checking on us every few minutes.  The food... Knocked it out of the park.  It is a seafood place but they do offer chicken, ribs, and steak dishes.   As it is called "Pacific Catch" the food reflects different flavors of the Pacific Rim.  I like flavorful and spice in my food, but I do not like HEAT.  The waiter assured me it would not be too much heat. I love deep fried fish and chips.  I try them everywhere I go.  I went for the "mixed catch basket".  Deep fried alaskan cod, deep fried coconut shrimp and deep fried oysters. I really am not a fan of fried oysters.... but I was so surprised ... these were wonderful.  And it came with two dipping sauces,  jalapeño tartar and  thai sweet chili.  As well with fries and coleslaw.  This was one of the best deep fried fish I had ever had.  It was obviously FRESH EVERY THING.  On the daily special menu they had Tom Yam soup.  Tom yam is a coconut milk base Thai soup, and a favorite of mine.  A rich broth with shrimp, tomatoes, mushrooms, and traditional Thai seasonings.  I could have eaten 6 bowls.  Everyone at the table tasted it, everyone loved it.  We all shared a chocolate cream brûlée for dessert.  $127.00 for four people with drinks and apps and the dessert.  Very reasonable for the quality and amount of food.  I am looking forward to my next trip to San Francisco just so I can return to Pacific Catch.
author: India G.

description:
Blessed be Jessica T. for introducing me to Pacific Catch and the wonderful Wasabi bowl!!

I opted for the poke with half salad half rice with dressing on the side. By the looks of the "side" dressing that came with my order, I am glad I did. I do not like soggy greens!!

The wasabi bowl was devine...hints of ginger, sesame, and wasabi sweetness coated a large serving of fresh greens, rice, and very fresh poke. 

I took my order to go and was helped by a number of friendly staff who, regardless of it being the bustling lunch hour crowd on a beautiful Friday, greeted me with a smile and asked if I had been taken care of.

Yes, and thank you, Pacific Catch!
author: Jocelyn B.

description:
My default place to go when I need a Hawaiian poke fix. Every Time I'm around inner sunset area, I would try my best to come here and get the original poke. I also tried several of their pokes and the original is definitely my favorite. It is kinda marinated ahi tuna chunks with soy sauce and onions. The tuna is fresh and high grade. I wouldn't say it is the highest quality of ahi tuna, but I think it is very good for the price point.

I would recommend getting the appetizer of tuna poke as opposed to wasabi bowls. I feel the portion of fish is a little smaller in the bowls and wonton chips in the appetizer go well with the poke. 

Sometimes I got the take out order of the poke appetizer and they gave a soup cup size of poke. 

I also came here for dinner before and their salmon/catch of day is pretty good too. Very huge portion.

Plus, service is incredible here. They served edamame when you are seated
author: Ruxin H.

description:
Smart to capitalize on the World Series fever.  The 2 flat screens over the bar were showing the game with the sound on!  I wouldn't have known that except for the chalkboard sign outside.  Scored a table dead center to 1 of the tv's so we were set.  Oh the food...we shared...

Fish & Chips - opted for the sweet potato fries - a must do!  The cod still moist & perfectly fried with a crunchy coating.  Not greasy...totally yummy!  Gobbled it up.

Hawaiian Teriyaki rice bowl w/ marinated skirt steak, brown rice, shiitake mushrooms, grilled pineapple, glazed carrots, edamame, crispy sweet onions, sesame seeds & teriyaki sauce.  Ordered to be "healthy" & balance the fried indugence.  It was good & the brown rice not dry.

Oh, I like the pretzel goldfish & edamame samples you get when ordering entrees.
author: Kim S.

description:
Good place esp during happy hour. I still remember the good old days when this was the Canvas, SF's best coffee house. But I digress...

Food is pretty good, I've only had the apps and drinks. Come early or late to get their specials.
author: Esther F.

description:
Excellent seafood, and moderate prices.

We just returned from Oahu, and the menu was reminiscent of the Islands.  The prices, even for the City, were just a fraction of Hawaii.

Waitstaff was perky and helpful (Rachael was our server) and made our dining experience so nice.  She was cheery and chipper and anticipated our needs perfectly.  We had been to the SF Botanic Gardens, and this was one block south.  We were looking for a respite and a quick and good dinner, and they delivered.  I would go back in a minute.
author: Marshall W.

description:
This is my second time here, and I have to say that it has been good both times. We were a party of 6 people, both times, where everyone enjoyed their meal. Some folks ordered drinks, they said they were on the strong side but after a  2 hours they were able to finish it. We sat outside under the heat lamps and fireplace for which people from inside the restaurant came out saying, "this is so nice & warm." which is why I chose to sit outside; inside was too cold! Also, the heat lamps and fireplace make for a wonderful ambiance. Perfect for a night after attending events at the museum, or events at the park. If in doubt about what to order, always ask the waitress, they will tell you exactly how the food is prepared. 

I had the coconut shrimp with a side salad. They have lots of bowl dishes, which one person ordered. Another ordered the Trio Sushi, a bit spicy but good if you like hot spicy food and the rest of the group ordered fish & chips. Average price per person with 1 drink, about $32.00 not including tax or tip. Alcoholic drinks are $10.00 a shot. Prices vary for wines.
author: Petra M.

description:
I came here after a shitty day at Oysterfest... and this was PERFECT.  Seriously made my day 1000000% better.  I was nursing a hangover for the first part of the day, and then waiting in lines at Oysterfest didn't make it better. 

I HIGHLY recommend the Pan-Asian Rice Bowls!!  My go-to bowl is the Japanese Wasabi Bowl with Hawaiian Poke and Brown Rice in lieu of White Rice.  My friend got another bowl, which looked really good, too!  If you're hesitant about spending $15 on a bowl, it's because you're getting a HUGE bowl! 

The salads are pretty similar to the bowls, but without rice, so if you don't want to carry around leftovers, go for that :)  I ate at the Pacific Catch stand at Oysterfest, and I have also been to the Marina location.

I loooove this place just because it will fill you up without making you feel all greasy or weighed down!
author: Jennifer L.

description: We visit this restaurant periodically for their fresh seafood options. On this particular occasion, we noticed that our entrees were taking longer than usual. We were getting ready to complain when our meals arrived. Immediately afterwards, the manager came to our table to communicate that there was a problem in the kitchen and apologized for the delay.
