She then said that they were comping us for the entrees. Just like that, she avoided a potentially sour situation for us and enabled us to leave on a pleasant note. The food was consistently solid but what stood out was the manager's willingness to step up and do something to make things right. So often restaurants fail to take accountability for inevitable missteps. How refreshing it is to see managers who value customers so that they will continue to return. Clearly, customer service is paramount for Pacific Catch management. We will definitely be back!
author: B. C.

description: Mehh not impressed. The service was awful, and i can see why this location's ratings are lower than the one in the marina. We sat down and it took about 15 minutes before our server came by- who just dropped off some edamame beans and didnt even ask if we wanted a drink to start with. Another 15 minutes passed by...no water no server. He finally came back and asked if we were ready to order. After reading the raving reviews about the salmon poke, i decided to order that with half rice and half salad. "That doesnt come with rice or salad. You have to get the rice bowl." His whole demeanour was just unpleasant and why didnt he ask me if i had any questions about the menu? 20 minutes later he brings the food out and finally the water. Wow if i wanted this kind of service, i wouldve went to eat a chinese hole in the wall restaurant. Or maybe i should have just ordered take out. He never even came by to ask how we were doing or how the food was tasting. The last time we saw him was when he dropped off the check. Oh i guess he made the executive decision for us to not get some of that mochi fondue because he never asked if we wanted dessert or anything else.
author: Carmen A.

description:
Overall a solid 3.5 stars, but I bumped it up an extra 0.5 star for dog friendliness.

I actually didn't expect much of this place, but it was dog friendly and there were televisions (for sports), so we decided to drop in. Pacific Catch exceeded my expectation. 

The service was fairly slow, but maybe b/c we sat outside (with the heaters right above us).

Ordered:
1) Ecstasy sushi roll-2.5/5, not so great
2) Mahi Mahi tac0-3/5, great, but not memorable 
3) Hawaiian Poke rice bowl- 4/5 This was the best dish at the table!
4) Pacific steak-3.5/5-Great, but again, nothing out of the ordinary
author: Jen H.

description:
A very popular restaurant, as they are often filled to capacity during the weekends. The service is very accommodating of various requests, such as delivering appetizers while our party was waiting outside and trying their best to fit together a party of 14.

The fried oyster was pretty good. They were a bit over-battered, which masked the freshness of the oyster. However, the accompanying avocado and tomato sauce gave a nice creamy acidity; which allowed the dish to be delicious.

Once we were seated, the wait for our actual mains did take awhile. However, had a large party, so that would have been the cause of the delay.

The Serrano Ahi Poke was okay. The spicy mayo sauce overpowered the flavor of the tuna. The accompanying fried wonton wrapper provided a nice crispy texture.

The Ahi Tuna Poke salad was pretty good. The romaine lettuce and carrots provided a great crunchy texture, while the avocado provided a rich and creamy element to the salad. The salad was not overdressed, which is a definite plus. The Ahi tuna poke, although well marinated, would have benefitted from an additional splash of rice vinegar; as the soy and sesame marinade resulted in a one-dimensional tasting poke.

Overall, the food is good. The above average service definitely made up for the rather average tasting food. Definitely a great place to come with friends.
author: Joshua S.

description:
they updated their menu to have GF next to all the dishes that are GF. SUPER SUPER HELPFUL AND SO MANY OPTIONS TO CHOOSE FROM! 

I think my current favorite is the california rolls. 

:)
author: Win H.

description: Cod for the fish n chips was soggy, the coconut shrimp was good, the seasoned fries-over seasoned.  Big line to get in and empty tables inside.  I ordered lemonade and didn't know it was agave lemonade, ah well.
author: Bruce L.

description:
Really great and fresh food.  I always crave pacific catch.  They give good servings and aren't stingy on the fish.  I usually get their ahi wasabi poke bowl and recommend it to everyone. 

However, the service is disappointing.  Every time I've been here I've either had to send something back because they either miscommunicate with the back of the house or forget the order.  Almost all times I've been here, the service was slow and neglected their guests.  

Today my poke bowl came with brown rice instead of white.  They don't check up on the guests often and I had to go to the host to ask if I could speak to my server to change my meal.  

Someone came by at the end of meal to ask if we were ready for the check.  We waited 15 minutes for our original server to come by and ask for the check again.  She brought the check after another 10 minutes.  Wait time is long and it was during the lunch hours on a Sunday.. Not very busy at all. 

Great food but I wish the service was better!!
author: Cameron L.

description: TOURIST TRAP! This was probably the worst restaurant I have been to in a while. The outside and inside ambiance was quite inviting, unlike the host that did not even acknowledge us as we walked in. After she seated the party that arrived AFTER us, we were seated and greeted by our waiter with a bowl of semi frozen edamame and pretzel goldfish. We ordered the clam chowder, and side salad. The clam chowder was lukewarm, and when we requested some bread (which should be expected with chowder in San Fran) they brought us untoasted ciabatta. It took almost 10 minutes to come and by that time the soup was cold, it was just sad. The salad was underdressed and tasted unwashed to be totally honest. Also tried the poke, which was decent with a side of partially stale wontons. Seems like they don't put much effort or care into the food and service quality because most of their customers are tourists, and won't be returning anyways. 10/10 would not recommend - better restaurants a block away.
author: Natalia D.

description:
My girlfriends and I came here for happy hour M-F 4-6pm, 10pm-close only in the bar area.

Hawaiian Poke (regular menu) - SO DELICIOUS! If you come here, you need to get a poke something. The poke cubes are bigger than normal, super fresh, and is so good.

Happy hour menu was all delicious! We ordered Spicy Pacific Martinis and Agave Margaritas, both good. I would recommend the martini on the rocks!

Highlights were the peruvian ceviche, thai coconut shrimp, cabo calamari, let's get saucy, and shiso fine. We ordered double of some of these (fatties, I know), but the other hh options are definitely more normal items you can get anywhere. This is a great place for happy hour with great prices, and I would for sure recommend it!
author: Jessica L.

description:
I remember when this place was some coffee/art house.  I haven't been there since, even though I'm in the Inner Sunset constantly.  What a pleasant little surprise!  Well, not that little...the place must have 50 tables, easy.

They're dog-friendly, and we didn't want to do our usual Park Chow chow.  Extremely friendly and fast service immediately upon arrival.  We sat in the corner of the outside patio area, which was away from the wind and had ample room for the pups.

The menu is vast...tons of options and they're 90% fish and seafood.  I ordered the Mixed Catch Basket, which came with fried oysters, cod, and coconut shrimp.  I loved the oysters.  I don't care where you order cod, it's the blandest fish of all whitefish.  So, its lackluster showing was totally expected.  The coconut shrimp was tasty.  The spicy fries are bomb-diggity!  Especially when dipped in the basket's accompanying jalapeno aioli.  Mmmm

Chose the lemongrass mojito, which had very little alcohol, but it was refreshingly good.  Oh, I forgot about the amuse...shelled edamame and goldfish pretzels.  Word?  Crazy combo to eat with the supplied chopsticks.
author: Tamar D.

description:
Wanted to say Thank You! I visited the 9th Ave. location in San Francisco to celebrate the beginning of year three for #7DaysOfSmiles on Thursday, September 1, 2016.

It was far more than I expected! There is nothing bad I could say about my experience here. From the greeting at the door to the waitress and the person who brought my food! All were incredible! The drink and the food was very good too! This was one of the best overall experiences I've had in a very long time!
Customer service at its best!

Special thanks to: Amber, Akilah and Ashley

Each of you made me smile in your own unique way! This kind of outstanding customer service deserves recognition! Give them a try; then #ShareASmile to acknowledge what a great job they're doing!eview helps others learn about great local businesses.
author: Mike C.

description: We looooveeeee Happy Hour at the SF location. The staff are nice and the food is delicious. Will definitely come back...
author: Dianne Jay S.

description:
I've been waiting to try this place! I've heard mixed reviews from people I knew. but, my boyfriend said he's been here many times and said it was good. 
we came around 11, right when they open and it was getting relatively busy! so I'm taking that as a good thing. as we browsed through the menu, he mentioned that the sweet potato fries were a must. I love sweet potato fries, so.... why not! they were delicious with two choices of sauces. a sweet and tangy sauce(usually eaten with egg rolls) and a wasabi ginger kind. I wasn't a big fan of wasabi or ginger haha. but the fries were yummy! then we ordered salmon poke. the salmon was nicely seasoned with small cuts of avocado too. it was with a side of crispy wonton chips to compliment the appetizer even more. it had a nice refreshing flavor. then...... onto the main course! I ordered the Hawaiian teriyaki pan Asian bowl with grilled chicken. they had the option to change the white rice to 1/2 brown rice and 1/2 salad. so that's what I did. I didn't know the bowl was going to be so huge.... omg. it came with crispy onions, mushrooms, grilled pineapple, carrots. it wasn't too overly sauced, but the chicken tasted very chewy. I don't know, it was weird. haha. but everything else in the bowl was good. my boyfriend ordered the Korean bbq bowl with white rice and sticky ribs. let me tell you.... the ribs were PRETTY sticky, hahah. we both barely even touched our bowls because we were so filled up on the two appetizers.. but we took them to go. and for two appetizers and two main courses, the total only came out to be $50! so I thought that was a good deal. the presentation of each dish was really presentable and nicely put together. the interior of the place was huge and you could opt for outdoor seating too. I literally felt as if I was dining in Hawaii. I do plan to come back, but my eyes were definitely bigger than my stomach... haha.
author: Audrey K.

description: Kristin was our server tonight and was very informative when we asked questions about the menu. Drinks and food came out within 15 minutes after we ordered which is very rare for a very busy and popular restaurant as this one. We will definitely come back to this location and of course ask for Kristin
author: Alvin Z.

description:
We really enjoyed our time at Pacific Catch. Liked the atmosphere (I think this place is good for families, for dates, for hanging out), service was good, and food was yum yum. Oh and the cocktails were delicious. 

Started out with the ceviche trio. Most places in SF don't really serve anything with ceviche.. but here they give you fried wontons, tortilla chips, and purple yam chips (I think). Yes!! So good. I've never had a poke so I ordered the Poke trio entree and just went with what they had on the menu (you can select your own). I was so in the mood for raw fish haha so it was perfect! My partner had a trio of fish tacos.. not sure which ones but he enjoyed them all (again you get to select). We had 2 cocktails each LOL I had a kiwi splash?.. really good! And the lemongrass mojito, also yum. He had the Hawaiian punch.. he was blown away by it. And also the agave margarita which was also good. 

It can get pricey esp with cocktails but we'll be back again!
author: Vol T.

description: Good spacious and clean place for drinks, large groups but stay far away from the raw food -- completely gross, not fresh and poor quality. Cooked Mahi-mahi tacos a safe, tasty bet. And anything fried/cooked (except steak in tacos is poor quality and stringy). Private parking lot always full -- small and they never check if you are actually eating there anyway so others park there.
author: Kate A.

description:
This place is just made for the Sunday family meal after a walk in Golden Gate Park. Good food, great service, and very accommodating. One of the few places with a respectable kids' program. Great kids' menu, spill proof cups, drawing slates, and even kid chopsticks that they make themselves. 

What sets Pacific Catch apart is their willingness to graciously receive feedback on their food. We had one of the Sushi plates and the rice was a bit undercooked. They were thankful for the feedback and removed it from the bill graciously.

The crab and corn chowder was delicious, and the mahimahi sandwich was fresh.

Definitely recommended. Bring the kids.
author: Michael N.

description: Happy 1st Yelp review! Living only a couple blocks away, I always wanted to try this place out. I'm glad I finally went. Lisa, our server, was great! She recommended all the best dishes for my dad and I. The wasabi poke bowl, ceviche, and the steak were my favorites! Definitely will be back ASAP.
author: Pranav M.

description:
To be honest I don't come here for the food. I like the location and ambiance and they have a decent happy hour with reasonable bar bites, most of which are pretty average. But the service is great and it's consistently average. The spicy fries are
Good so are the tacos and the sushi is alright but could be better. Love the king fu reusing for six bucks! I wish I could get in that kitchen and churn out some stuff!!
author: Mel M.

description:
Lemme tell you a tale of superb customer service.

So, at Pacific Catch on an unexpectedly busy Sunday night, so we sat at the bar.  It was the last day of their "wild salmon summer", so I ordered the salmon tacos.  And then started in on my beer.  Dinner took a while, maybe 35 minutes, but not surpising given how full the place was.

Then the maitre'd came out, and apologized: they had run out of salmon.  Could I order something else?  Sure, why not; I ordered what I'd been planning to order before I saw the salmon specials: the mahi-mahi sandwich.  So yeah, it came out a bit late, but  whatever.

So given how apologetic they were, I was expecting that they'd comp us the sandwich or maybe a beer, and I would have been happy with that.  But they comped us the *whole meal*.  On the house.  Naturally, we left a big tip.

Oh, and mahi-mahi sandwich?  Really good, as usual.
author: Josh B.

description:
I am so torn about this review.  My wife and I went there on 10/24 for dinner.  The food was really very good, however for as good as the food was, the service was just that bad.  I'd state the server's name, but he never told us his name.  

We had the ceviche for an app (I was supposed to have the Green Goddess Shrimp Salad, but received the ceviche instead......  The wife had the crab & cheese sandwich and fries.  Raved about it.  I had the Hawaiian bowl with salmon.  Issue was I was supposed to have a lettuce bowl, but got a white rice (I'd even ordered brown rice before I was told I could get it with lettuce.  No refills on soda or water (the server never came around).  Had to ask for my check.  

Come on, the food is soooo good, this would have been a 5 star rating if the server had even half-way tried.  As it is, we left annoyed and aggravated.  Hopefully our server will read this or at minimum understand why his tip was what it was.
author: Tony S.

description: I've eaten at the other pacific catch in the marina, but ordered her multiple times before trough food delivery. I decided to dine in at this location since I was in the area. I ordered a spicy tuna roll and fish and chips. When I got the food, I could already tell I was going to hate it. First of all, the spicy tuna was a pale pink. I ate a piece and it literally tasted like glue or more like flour stirred in with water to make some sort of paste. It was difficult to swallow let alone even more difficult to digest. I'm feeling sick just thinking about it. Then the fish and chips..how the heck do you mess it up? Seriously, it's all fried! Nope, everything was cold and soggy. You could still see the puddles of oil disintegrated into the fish and fries. The slaw on the side was warm and looked like it was sitting out all day. I was truly disappointed as I was looking forward to having a nice meal. Don't come here and save your money. There are tons of eateries nearby.
author: Marie N.

description:
Pacific Catch is one of my favorite spots right now. There is usually never a line, the service is nice and quick and food is delicious!

I love the Tuna Poki Wasabi Bowl with half greens and half brown rice and my husband enjoys the Three tacos (you choose which ones) and sweet potato fries.

Recommend to all my friends all the time!
author: Karina A.

description:
My wife and I stopped spontaneously after going over the Golden Gate Bridge back into SF.  Kristin, our waitress recommended to do the half rice, half greens on the bowls.  The Thai bowl with shrimp may be the best meal I ever had.  So many flavors.  Wow.  I am want to come back tomorrow.  Highly highly recommended.

We brought four teenagers with us and they all loved it too!
author: Gerald B.

description: If you like sea food you will love this place! I would have given it 5 stars but the service was kind of slow. The decor was very beautiful and gave off a great vibe. We were in the area visiting the botanical gardens across the street while on vacation, and found this wonderful place. One of the best meals I had so far while visiting San Fransisco! I got the Mixed Catch for lunch and the Michi Fondue for dessert. If I lived in the area I would defiantly come again.
author: Nicole R.

description:
I'm still wish that Pacific Catch's Happy Hour would go past 6PM for us poor working saps.  GRRR!

-- Spicy Pacific Martini ($7 HH) - My new favorite is strong and spicy with a few pepper seeds floating inside.  Much better and more unique than the typical $4.50 HH well drinks or the $6 HH well martinis.

-- Basket of Fries ($4 HH) - Don't be boring with the regular fries, and mix-and-match the spicy fries with the sweet potato fries.

-- Peruvian Ceviche ($6 HH) - Purple potato chips and a great tasting yellow ceviche with generous helpings of avocado, tomatoes, and fish.

-- Hawaiian Poke ($9.5) - I still love the Poke even though it's not on Happy Hour anymore.  It's that good.

-- Spicy Tuna Roll ($6 HH) - The tuna had a little too much something (aioli?) mixed in, so the roll was a pinkish color rather than a deep red.  Not pretty on the eyes, but pretty in the tummy.

Extend the Happy Hour, goshdarnit!
author: Kevin W.

description: Have been here for happy hour a few times and it's always such a surprisingly great value, and quite delicious! I've tried just about everything on the happy hour menu, and it's pretty extensive. Huge coconut shrimp, big bowl of ceviche, tacos and spicy tuna rolls, ribs... It's crazy I didn't come here until recently and I only live a block away. Also nice to have late hh option.
author: Vivian H.

description: Quite worth eating at even if just for the rice bowls. For a more extensive review see: https://bakingandeating.wordpress.com/2015/02/01/trying-the-pacific-catch-of-the-day/
author: Izzi B.

description:
Great service and really tasty food. The parking lot was a nice relief from a crowded area.

We had a lot of dishes, fish and chips, deep fried Brussels sprouts, sweet potato fries, Hawaiian poke rice bowl, and the daily fish. Everything was cooked well,with lots of flavor. Fish and chips had an especially nice batter and the cod was nice and flaky.
author: John R.

description:
Five stars but only if you order right!  The one thing you have to know about this place: WASABI POKE BOWL.  To try it is to love it.  The other stuff on the menu is OK.  But here's the cool thing: you can now order a "poke special" appetizer, which includes your choice of 3 kinds of wasabi poke-style mini-dishes from a list of about 10.  We chose (over two visits):
- Ahi macadamia nut, which was most similar to the famed wasabi poke bowl.  The fav on the first visit.
- California style: creamy and really good, with avocado (winner!  And when I went back with another group, it was the unanimous winner among those who tried it on the second visit.)
- Creamy Spicy: skip it.  Wasn't that spicy and was therefore very similar to the california style one... just seemed to have less flavor and no avocado.
- "Salmon" - this was just OK despite the fact that I usually LOVE salmon poke.  

A special thank you to our server who helped us order well and within food allergy restrictions.  Note to self: get the salmon based one next time!
author: Aaron M.

description: I usually love this place. Their sushi and tacos are good. Last night I had the Thai curry bowl with salmon, 1/2 rice and 1/2 salad. The cucumbers were wilted, I didn't even eat them. The brown rice was stale, the green beans weren't cooked properly. The only thing I enjoyed was the salmon. I'm not sure if it was the chef in the kitchen, they weren't terribly busy, but I left feeling majorly disappointed and knowing that I wouldn't return. Who would want to pay 16.50 for a bowl of food like that? Really unfortunate because I used to like this place a lot, but the food I got last night was unacceptable.
author: Saskia S.

description:
Second time here, first time this location. Reserved tables via open table and had no problem walking in and getting seated. Our waitress was super nice. 

Ordered the special 3 poke combo, with sweet potato fries, and a mahi mahi fish taco duet. 

Everything tasted superb, A little pricey, but I still really enjoyed it
author: Benjamin B.

description:
Ordered three tacos. Battered Cod, Shrimp and Beef. Cod was a better fish taco than Rubios. Shrimp was sweet succulent goodness. Beef taco had yummy beefy bits with some wonton pieces sprinkled on, and turned into delicious crunchy surprise. Tacos came with a dried lime, avocado, and that veggie lettuce tomotato padding. Also salsa.

Decent tacos and ridiculous prices if you don't want a pokebowl.
author: Tony C.

description:
Came here for the first time with my roommates and we absolutely LOVED it! We had no idea there was a place in SF that served seafood like this (poke) so of course we had to try it. 

We ordered the trio, short ribs, and shrimp guacamole (everything was SO good!). Service was nice and attentive, and we also tried their mojito, which was pretty good.

We'll definitely be coming back!
author: Jennifer B.

description: How do you get better and better?  Ask these guys.  It is IMPOSSIBLE to find one thing wrong with the food, service, presentation of plates, drinks, anything (which I'm totally baffled that it only has 3 1/2 stars).  I can't speak for the other locations, but if they're even close to how good their Inner Sunset location in SF is, they are definitely 4*s.
author: Johnnie W.

description: Just had the excellent  fish & chips here, with an agave Margarita, both absolutely brilliant. The service was really excellent, given a couple of minutes to peruse the menus, the waitress and trainee Megan, we're the personification efficiency. First time here, although I live in the neighborhood, I'll certainly be back.
author: Paul M.

description:
I need to start by saying that I've been here at least 30 times in the course of the past 12-18 months. I go mostly at lunch or late afternoon, sit outside or at the bar -  you can assume that this effects my perspective.

FOOD: All in all, I'd describe their food as very good. Particularly good are the "Rice Bowls" these mixtures of seafood (your choice), brown or white rice, chock full of special greens, and sauces (again, your choice). All very customizable -  you can get half rice half salad (which I recommend). I'm also a great fan of their Oyster basket (a tinge over-priced but excellent), Salmon sandwich (don't recall exact name), and Fish fry (which optionally? come with a very special side salad). If you're feeling like a larger meal they have an ever changing roster of fresh fish dinners - (good to excellent) in my trials.

SERVICE: Have to give them an excellent rating here - following numerous visits, with numerous servers I've had CONSISTENTLY top notch service - competent, friendly and fast,.  I can only assume that management deserves much of the credit. Some servers especially warrant Kudos:Kate (who alas is leaving shortly), Alex, Rob and area come to mind..Sean, the manager (or day manager? is wonderfully attentive, constantly checking with customers to see if things are are up to snuff.

ATMOSPHERE, ETC: I find this a pleasant, bright and cheerful - but read first paragraph.The decor is simple and tasteful. The outdoor area is pleasantly cozy since recent renovation. I'm not nearly as attracted to the main dining room - but haven't eaten there in years. Noise level is pretty good by SF standards - although you need be prepared for occassional traffic noise in the outdoor porch area during rush hour. PRICING is pretty standard for the area, but varies according to dish. Some items are actually "deals" considering  that nearly everything comes with first rate sides.
author: Alan C.

description: Love their Japanese Wasabi bowls. Seared Ahi Tuna is my favorite. Their service is always great. Nice people.
author: Cindy C.

description:
I'm far overdue for a review here.  I have been to Pacific Catch a handful of times now, and have always had a great experience.

Location: Right next to Golden Gate Park - perfect for a stop in post bike ride to the beach (great location for post bay to breakers people watching ...).  The bus picks up right outside, and there is also plenty of bike parking where you can still see your bike from your seat.

Food: That Ahi Tuna salad - so good!!!  I usually end up having some sort of shared starter - calamari or a roll of some sort, and then go for the Ahi Tuna salad.  I have tried other things, but this just has my heart.  My boyfriend has tried many different items on the menu as well (most recently one of the rice bowls, I think?) and he has enjoyed everything he tried.

Service: I have only ever sat at the bar area, and received great service every time. The bartenders are always very nice, and seem to enjoy working with one another.  If the bartender Amanda is there I suggest sitting in her bar area.  Amanda has been there a few times when I was there and she always makes for a great time.  She was able to help guide me through the drink menu, and help me figure out what one (or two, or three) of their cocktails I wanted to try.  She is also very knowledgeable about the beer, and found one that my boyfriend was very happy with.  It is nice to eat at a place where the food is great, and the staff makes you feel welcome, and wanting to come back for more.

Pacific Catch, Ahi Tuna, MaiTai, Amanda - I'll be back for you!
author: Missy M.

description:
I got the 'mix & match' tacos.  The service was mix and match as well.

In the case of the food, I chose two seafood tacos. The traditional Baja cod and shrimp tacos were delightful.  The cod was nicely crisp and not greasy.  The ingredients in both tacos were well balanced.  I would add, delicious,  too.  Fries were soggy, though.

About the service, everyone was nice and friendly.  Attentive they were not.  There were very lengthy time lapses between wait service, from start to finish.   To that I say, a good place to sit and converse as long as you like.  You'll have enough time.  No rush to give up your table for someone who is waiting.
author: Debbie T.

description: We got a delivery  from the restaurant by postmares, everything tastes bad and not fresh.
author: Rose K.

description:
I love coming to Pacific Catch. It's on my way home from work and takeout is always fast, although I do prefer dining in when I get the chance. 
The Cabo Calamari is delicious -- try the fried lemon that it comes with, so good! 
Love their rice bowls and the Vietnamese Steak Sandwich is amazing (I order it almost every time). The sushi has always been great, boyfriend and I frequently order the Ecstasy Roll and the Tempura Shrimp. 
Their drinks are okay. Margaritas are alright but nothing to write home about (but enough to mention on Yelp I suppose). 
Customer service has always been friendly and prompt, and they seem to legitimately know their menu.
author: Mariah O.

description:
Good food for the price. Waitress I had was super friendly and have me tips on other places to eat in San Francisco. 

I would mos def return on my next trip to SF.
author: Karen H.

description:
First, I highly recommend to make a reservation or you will be waiting for a long time.
I am fan of their Hawaiian Poke Trio, I enjoy a dish that you can sample a variety of fusion of flavors. The poke is fresh and tasty. Also, to spicy things up try the Spicy Pacific cocktail. The cocktail has serrano chilies that are muddled, just enough heat for those who like just a hint of it. I my self always ask for it to be extra spicy and they always deliver on my requests.

Also give the Cabo Calamari a go, a dish that also has a hint of heat [fresh chilies]. You can ask for it to be extra  spicy or not so spicy,
author: D. S.

description: Usually I would give this place 4-5 stars, but the last time we were there the food was just not as good as it used to be a few months ago. We had happy hour poke that was very sparse with sauce and the tuna didn't taste fresh. The shrimp tacos had almost no flavor except for a small drizzle of sauce (so a couple bites were good where there was sauce). My drink was good, and the service was friendly, but two stars docked for food quality having gone down.
author: Christina W.

description:
I finally understand why my friends drive all the way to SF from Stanford to frequent this restaurant. Prior to visiting, I thought they were nuts! 

Pacific Catch is my favorite fusion restaurant. Why so? It's an affordable approach to Californian cuisine, which is fusion food made from and centered around fresh produce. Although it is not Alice Waters, it makes both my pescetarian self and wallet happy.

Like typical Californian cuisine, the food here is sweet, light, and fresh. My favorite items include the poke, veggie/ taro chip sampler, and fish tacos. Their ahi burger is tender and juicy as well. Besides the yummy taste, their food has an aesthetic appeal too. 

Lastly, you know this place is a winner if your carnivore of a dining partner suggested to frequent this place in lieu of a burger joint! :] Or my persuasive lure is just that potent...
author: Mabel Y.

description:
They do not appreciate Dine-In customers! 

Our Party had a reservation at 11am when they opened-- 4 adults,3 toddlers. 
We placed our orders immediately after water was given to us. We were seated right in front of the kitchen so it was hard to forget us...but they were too busy cooking and packaging their large take-out orders. We had three 1-2 year old toddlers that were starving. An hour is ridiculous to make your customers wait, especially the kids. They didn't even start making our order until after I asked for it. I am never returning to this restaurant again. Too bad b/c the food isn't bad here. Our server was nice.... It looked like the manager was there packaging the take-out order and heard us ask for our meals but he didn't care to come over and apologize to us.
author: Kim D.

description:
I was introducing the Boyfriend to a good friend & her fiancé so I thought we'd go somewhere slightly fancy & offers something that everyone would like.

I started out with a Pisco punch which was really strong & had no muddled pineapple as described.  For my main, I got an Ahi tuna poke salad bowl.  The poke was too salty for my taste but the wasabi dressing was good.  I asked for no pickled ginger but there was still a few pieces lying around.

Overall, the meal was decent & the service was good; we actually had a waitress & a waiter-in-training.  At the end of our meal, we got a free Friend dulce de leche "spring rolls" as a thank you for putting up with out trainee.  Unfortunately, it wasn't very good.
author: Karen S.

description: Consistent quality, almost always enough seating even on a sunny Saturday by Golden Gate Park, Pacific Catch is one of our goto spots whenever we're on that side city. Rice bowls, sandwiches and tacos are always yummy, and service is always friendly and accommodating. Good place for kids too.
author: Patrick D.

description:
It's just aiiiite.  Ordered the spicy tuna roll, the fish tacos, and the fried calamari.  The fried calamari was a little too greasy imo. 

However, with all that being said, I think this place will be a good place to just hang out and drink with a large party.
author: Joshua P.

description: We got in right away from a reservation but took a while for them to take our order. The food was pretty good, the lemon aioli asparagus was super good! And I really enjoyed the special blueberry julep!
author: Elise H.

description: I love Pacific Catch. I love food that  reminds me of fresh fish and seafood and Hawaii so I can pretend that I'm in Hawaii. My absolute fave is the Ecstasy roll. I am not a raw fish or food person but this is so delicious I believe it's tuna and salmon with avocado wrapped in seaweed and just a couple of tempura flakes and like a one second flash fry which crisps up the seaweed skin while keeping the fish raw. It's sitting in a yummy sauce but best of all (drum roll....) NO RICE. Delicious choice for the folks low carb in it.....the shrimp ceviche is also an excellent choice very Limey. They do not cook the shrimp but it cooks itself up in the lime juice. Must be a chemical reaction how marvelous. I never knew that, how cool. I've actually never ordered anything else besides these 2 things. The Mai tais are great!!! And strong!!! I love drinking here in the sunset and eating sushi. Nice cocktails. They have a happy hour but it doesn't include the Ecstasy roll ( sad face).
author: First L.

description: I live nearby and come here maybe once a month.  For me the food here is a hit or miss.  I enjoy the standard fish taco platter, their variety of pokes, sushi rolls, yummy desserts.  Their specials can be spotty...sometimes over cooked and not that flavorful.  Service is also a hit or miss.  I think they are going through a wait staff change. I have sat in the bar area and ordered food which has had better service.  It is not cheap here but I guess it is not extraordinarily overpriced either.
author: H. D.

description: Great service in the restaurant and for pick up (Eat24). Love Love Love the rice wasabi bowl with salmon or ahi tuna!!
author: Lindsay Y.

description: What a fabulous newly renovated restaurant with a hip, beautiful ambiance in the bar, restaurant and patio. The food is excellent. I have had the Mahi Mahi tacos, the Sushi, Chicken salad, rice bowls, Salmon dinners, sandwiches and everything tastes fabulous. A real winner. Also, all of their drinks are tasty and refreshing. I will be going back soon.
author: Donna C.

description: The fresh caught fish from a separate menu is just awesome. You should totally try that!!!
author: Julia O.

description: We ate lunch at pacific catch midweek.  The salad was good and a decent size but we were very disappointed in the portion size of the fish and chips.  Both fish and chip size was quite small. Left feeling like we wouldn't go back because of size. Would it have killed them increase the size?
author: Charlene O.

description:
Calamari, yum!

This place was a great place to have dinner at. The servings were a great size, calamari was fresh, service was great - Amanda served us... and all the food was super fresh, and FAST! We had the Pan Asian Rice bowl with Salmon, the calamari to start and the Coconut Shrimp to share. 


Definitely recommend coming here.
author: Cat G.

description:
Over the last few years, Pacific Catch has definitely improved.  They've removed a lot of the really saucy items and have made a huge effort to make quality, Hawaiian style poke - and it works.    

Appetizers:  If you're going with a group, get the ceviche trio - there's something for everyone.  Super tasty and love the won ton chips.  

Sushi:  Love the inside out - combination of california roll and spicy ahi, you just can't go wrong there.

Rice Bowl:  Highly recommend the wasabi bowl with either the poke or the salmon.  Mix it all up so the rice gets nice and flavorful.  

Tacos:  Like that you can choose from 1, 2 or 3 and you can interchange them.  I like the mahi, it's lightly seasoned and has that grilled flavor and it's not heavy so you don't feel like shit when you leave.

Always check the specials menu, they do some really great stuff (currently loving the spicy creamy ahi and cedar plank salmon).

Wine list has also improved - so thanks for that!
author: Melissa A.

description:
Came here after the hardly strictly bluegrass festival yesterday, and I was excited for what was ahead of me. I used to live in the Marina and either eat at that Pacific Catch or get take out from there a couple times a month. Hawaiian teriyaki was my sunshine on a bad day. I was loyal.

So after almost a year of PC deprivation, I was a little tipsy and extremely excited for my culinary journey. We got some spicy fries and the california poke to start, and they were delicious. Our very friendly waitress brought us out some extra aioli for our fries since we ran through the first one quickly, due to deliciousness. Love the crab in the california poke, and the wonton chips were good ones. Ordered our mains, and when they came out to us, I was freaked out. Where was my pineapple, my crispy onions, my mushrooms and edamame? Oh shit. Had I ordered the wrong thing? Had she maybe made a mistake? She came back to check on us and I said that I had meant to get the hawaiian teriyaki bowl, not the korean barbeque. She apologized for her mistake and snatched up the bowl to bring back. After she left, I became more and more sure that I had said Korean BBQ instead of Hawaiian teriyaki. Yep, yep, yep, I definitely just did that. Would I have done that again? Probably. I really wanted that freaking bowl, I had thought about it for a while, and I couldn't have possibly eaten anything else. Our waitress was SO INCREDIBLY NICE about it, and kept putting it on herself, until I finally admitted my mistake when she brought out the Hawaiian Teriyaki bowl. She laughed it off and said NBD. I didn't catch her name but she had medium length straight brown hair in a ponytail, average height, and waited on us at the table right near the hostess station... A very unhelpful description but I hope the restaurant knows how great of a meal facilitator she is!

As I sit here, writing this review and eating my leftover Hawaiian Teriyaki bowl, I am glad there are people out there like our waitress. And steaks out there as good as the one on this bowl.
author: Sarah B.

description: Great ambiance and good food and drinks. We always stop here after visiting the Cal Academy of Sciences. Nice ambiance. They have sushi and good lobster chowder! My kids love it. The service is good and fast.
author: Adrianne G.

description: A friend recommended this restaurant to me and I am so happy I took her advice and checked it out. Unfortunately, I was not aware of how busy it was going to be for a Friday night, but the hostess let me know that it wasn't going to be that long of a wait. We got a drink at the bar, and shortly after our buzzer rang. The hostess was very sweet I think her name was Nicole, on the way to our table she informed us about the crab menu. Our server was Jesse, and he was the best! He was very friendly, and made great recommendations. We will definitely be coming back! Great service, and delicious food!
author: Bianca R.

description:
I loveeeeee their Dulce de Leche Spring Rolls dessert!! I have to get it every time I go here!

I like getting the Pacific Steak Island Tacos (marinated grilled steak, crispy sweet onions, cabbage & sriracha aioli), but I think they took it off their menu, but if you ask for it they will still make it. Sweet potato fries are also really yummy.

One time I came here and my server kept on forgetting to bring me utensils and water so to make up for it she offered us Iced Teas or Thai Iced Teas on the house. I worked at a Thai restaurant, so I wanted to try something I haven't already. We decided to get the Lemongrass Infused Tea and the Tropical Iced Tea. The ice teas were unsweetened, bleh :/ I like it sweet.

I want to come back and try the Poke Wasabi Bowl!
author: Stephanie L.

description:
Finally tried this place after seeing so many friends frequent this restaurant.  I can't believe I only tried this place now. 

First of all, I love that they have a variety of "Pacific Rim" cuisine.  Everything from Hawaiian to Japanese to Korean, we actually tried a bit of all three.  We came on a Wednesday evening (just missed the Happy Hour). We started with the Korean Sticky Ribs. That was tasty but a bit messy (it's nice they have napkins and wet naps to clean off your hands).  We then ordered the Sunset Sushi Roll (which comes in 8 pieces) and Poke Fest Trio (we tried the original, California, and the Macadamia Nut).  I personally liked the Macadamia Nut and Original Poke. I think the California Poke was too citrusy (is that a word).  

I definitely want to try their happy hour (see what deals I can get). They have happy hour both from 4-6 M-F and 10-close! Great for those late night eats. Also, I have to try their rice bowl. From what I saw, they are HUGE! 

Our server (forgot her name) was real nice and pretty attentive. I don't think it was too busy but even if, good service always makes the meal (and review) even better  

They technically have a parking lot in the rear but it's usually full but at least it's an option in the busy inner sunset. 

Definitely a place to come again.
author: Phillip D.

description: We were in a rush. Fast fast service. Great rice bowls. The Hawaiian rice bowl with mahi mahi is great. My son had the ahi tuna rice bowl. He loved it. Wife had the fish and chips. She liked it. Portion size was just right. Will eat here again!
author: Robert B.

description: Went two nights in a row, that good! Tai curry bowl is amazing. Spicy tuna roll and calamari are good apps here.
author: Danielle S.

description: A great option for those looking to stick to "american" food in this neighborhood. They have lots of seafood options for dinner including some chicken, standard fish and chips, fish tacos, hawaiian poke apps (I wish they had Poke entrees like poke rice bowl or salad) and sushi rolls. I had the tom Kha special soup which was really good, but an american version super thick and creamy - almost chowder like but it was very good. The roll i tried and my poke were good as well- nothing outstanding. The fish and chips and fish tacos others in my party had were reported and good also. Seems quite popular and accommodating for families with kids.
author: B S.

description: it feels like a chain restaurant, which means that it is well-run, the way the food court at Disney World is well-run, and the food seems like it is prepared in a way that meets minimum quality control standards, the aim of which is to please without necessarily being inspiring. I had Poke, calamari, and fish&chips each of which was OK. In fairness, my dinner companions loved this place and would have given it four stars, not three.
author: Morris R.

description: Pacific Catch is my go-to American seafood restaurant, and I go pretty regularly  whenever I crave Hawaiian poke. Sometimes I get their poke trio, which as the name implies, consists of three different kinds of poke/ceviche, but the Hawaiian poke is always the best. Their entrees change depending on what's fresh that day, but the fish is always fresh, well prepared, and their servings are generously sized.  The service is always friendly and efficient, and the price is very reasonable.
author: Allen T.

description: Really good fish and chip, had at outside lands! I also came back a few days later and had the Thai shrimp rice bowl, so much yummy grilled shrimp and fresh veggies! Nice atmosphere of you can get a good section to sit, especially by gas the fire outside! Quick service and generous portions.
author: Eimear H.

description:
Really the only place for decent Poke in the Bay Area.  That, plus the various bowls - especially the wasabi bowl - are the main reasons to come here.  Some excellent cocktails too.  The rest of the menu is a bit hit or miss, with the more comforting items (fish tacos, calamari; fish n chips) faring a bit better than the more expensive main course dishes.

It's nice that they have frequent themed special menus - e.g. Crab Fest; Wild Salmon Season, etc. - where you'll often find at least one amazing new item available for only a limited time.
author: David O.

description:
3.5 stars. I have been to the Marina location  so when we were deciding on a place to eat with some friends, we went to this place since they are bigger and take reservations. It is much bigger than the marina location and food is pretty consistent too.

Service seems to be not as good here. When we got there, it took a good few minutes before we got greeted. I understand that there is a hostess but there were 3 waiters/waitresses standing right there that could have said something - not a good first impression. Things turned around though when we were seated, our waiter was great. he was attentive, gave suggestions, and checked on us plenty. However when the food arrived, things went negative again. I ordered a veggie salad plus ahi tuna, no dressing, and subbed edamame for green beans. I got a Ahi Tuna Salad with dressing. He was quick to get this taken back and fixed. I still got a Ahi Tuna Salad and not the Veggie Salad which has a lot of veggies such as mushroom, green beans, and tomatoes. I didn't want to send it back again but did ask for some mushrooms. I think then they realized that I got the completely wrong entree. They were nice enough to take it off the bill entirely so that was nic eof them.

Even though it was the wrong salad, it was consistent with marina and was delish. My hubs got the clam chowder but he wasn't impressed. There were clams but he thought it was too many veggies and not creamy enough. He also got the Japanese Wasabi bowl and thought that was good. The Ahi Poke was very flavorful.
author: Tao Tao W.

description: Japanese wasabi bowl with ahi tuna, half salad and half brown rice; Racer IPA; cutie pie edamame-and-goldfish-pretzel "amuse bouche"; high table with view of Golden Gate Park and busy smiling bartenders. What a perfect meal!
author: Valerie E.

description: One of the better places ive eaten in SF this past week ... something a little different, but not too different!  Hawaiian influenced; excellent tasting tuna poke, ahi salad and fish tacos ... very crowded on a Friday nite at the sunset district location [better make reservations] - great service n friendly ... definitely will be back when in SF again ...
author: Jerry G.

description: Seafood and cocktails are stellar. Great spot to post up, watch a game at the bar, and have a few drinks!
author: Josep R.

description:
Eeek. I got the White Tuna Poke from here during happy hour and sent it back because it smelled/tasted off. Long story short, I spent the night puking. When I mentioned this to a friend the next day, she told me the same thing happened to her a few months back.

I have been enjoying happy hour here for years but will probably just stick to the drinks. They make delicious mojitos and margaritas.
author: Jennifer B.

description: Horrible experience and was gonna complain but the red head manager chick was too busy walking around eating and picking her butt, no really. GROSS. Get it to ether guys. And zach the server: your service was slow and un attentive man. And I'm a server and bartender for 12 years man
author: Johnny C.

description:
So the sweet sweet deal is that they have a parking lot. Parking lot in the sunset? Homeboy say wahhhh?

Anyways, we wandered in on a Tuesday night after I scooped up D from Caltrain. Pretty calm night, and pretty empty; which is always greatly appreciated. Sometimes I want a quiet night with no crowds.

We got seated and order our meals. D and I shared a fried platter with spicy fries (the fries were bomb.com) and a Japanese Wasabi bowl with Hawaiian Poke.

The fried platter was eh, and definitely would not get again. Maybe its because I was still recovering from a cough, but it just wasnt that tasty, and the sauces didn't really seem to go well (they gave us tarter sauce and sweet chilli sauce).

The bowl on the other hand was delicious. I ordered one, and the waiter was nice enough to ask if they should split it for us, since it was pretty clear that we were sharing. Most of the time, when you split something its never enough, but it was the perfect amount for me and for D.

Coming back next time to try more of their fresh fish and stuff. But like I said, avoiding the fried platter.
author: Jessica H.

description:
Poke, poke, poke. It's what folks are clamoring about here, and it certainly didn't disappoint! I have tried several other poke places in the Bay Area and I can safely say this is the closest thing to Hawaiian poke. The original and macadamia flavors really complemented each other. Combined with the awesome sweet potato, and they have a recipe for success. 

We also ordered the ahi salad (not poke) and it was great. The vegetable was fresh, and the ginger complemented the overall dish well. The ahi is the star though as it was cooked perfectly. Crisp on the outside and raw on the inside. Yum. 

Was mulling for 5 stars but the fish taco was on the average side. Taco is a bit thick and it overpowers the cod fish inside. Definitely 4.5 start though. And if you like poke, definitely a great place to go.
author: Erick K.

description: Came here for happy hour on a Friday afternoon. We arrived and asked for a table for out group the suggested we sit at the bar or outside. However there was no room ouside for our group and there wasn't 6 seats together at their small bar. We asked to sit in the dining area which had over 8 empty tables. The hostess said we could not sit there because it is reserved for regular diners and not happy hour. We said that it was literally a 2 foot difference and the restaurant was mostly empty inside. She then suggested we split up our group. As we turned around to discuss what we wanted to do, she gave us some dirty looks and gave some snarky remarks to the other hostess. Really seemed like they didn't want to accomodate us and she then suggested we wait for a table to be cleared, in a mostly empty restaurant. Really forced us out the door pretty much. Terrible service, rude workers.
author: Steven N.

description: The food here was pretty good. We got 2 different types of poke and the coconut shrimp. I recommend the poke, but the shrimp was just ok, maybe even over cooked. But the alcohol was good. I liked the interior and the ambiance of the place.
author: Richard K.

description: I always try to give this place a chance because I genuinely enjoy the menu and like the food. Today I've been waiting forever and no one has ever come over to take my order. Really frustrating...
author: Dee D.

description:
Out in the avenues there isn't much to eat. One might feel the draught of the food dessert. Pacific catch fixed that quickly. 

I've been here a few times so I kinda knew what to expect. But there were still some things on the menu but I have not tried so I went out of my safety zone and explored a new things.

First off just know that when you come here it is a very busy Space and even though it is casual and comfortable it's definitely not a place to come and just relax in your pajamas like a coffee house.

The baseball game was on, on the bar tv and everyone was having a good time at the bar. We ordered some large bowls from the menu. They're so great you can always ask to have something taken. They'll be pretty open and honest if it it will taste good or not, without that vegi or fruit, but they don't try to persuade you either way they just let you know. I hate being judged for being a little picky lol.

So I asked a pineapple to be off my bowl and it came the way I asked for it. 

Be ready to eat!! The bowls alone are massive and can feed three people. 

We almost pass on dessert but let me tell you we decided to try the fried Dolce de leche spring rolls. It was mind blowing. You think you can fit something in your stomach until you try that thing and then boom, you don't regret it one bit
author: Sharon S.

description: I am vegetarian and love coming here for the bowls they have which you can do with half salad and half rice and tofu and veggies. It's a very generous portion. They have a full bar, the staff has always been very friendly, and they usually don't have too long of a wait. There is a nice outdoor patio space with heaters that is nice when the weather permits.
author: Cody H.

description:
You know, I really like this place. It's not the fanciest or most original or unique place in the world, but the food, atmosphere, and service are consistently good. So many places in this neighborhood have very heavy food (Thai, Chinese, etc.) and it's nice to go somewhere with lighter but still filling options. Obviously you have to like fish to eat here, but there is enough variety (fried dishes, sushi rolls, rice bowls, etc.) to please everyone in a group. I really like the ahi salad, and last night I got the salmon salad. 

One thing that's great about Pacific Catch is that they are very clued-in to allergies. There are a lot of gluten-free options. My dad asked for no onions on the side of his dish, and the waiter asked a lot of questions to find out if it was just a preference or if he had an onion allergy, as there were onions in some of the other parts of the dish.
author: Amy G.

description:
I went to lunch with my mom and two family friends. We got seated right away which was great but then I felt like the waitress was hanging over us rushing us to order. The restaurant was close to empty. She brought our drinks and then gave us a few moments to continue to look over the menu. I ordered the nojito which is a mojito sans alcohol. It was awesome. I even got two of them for the price of one because the bartender accidentally made two. Hey, can't complain. I ordered the Tom Kha soup and California Roll. The soup was absolutely amazing, bursting with flavors. Loved it. The California Roll was a major disappointment. I could have gone to Safeway and bought a better roll. So sad. The taco bowls were HUGE and were brought home as leftovers. Their sweet potato fries were close to perfection.

Unfortunately the service was seriously lacking. The server took my mom's food and brought it back to the kitchen and put it in a to-go box. Our friend also asked to take hers home and our waitress practically threw the to-go box at her. Our friend also asked for a second glass of wine and let me tell you what a process that was. So that was super weird. It literally took our waitress an HOUR to bring us our bill. An hour? Really? Luckily we had the day off so we had plenty of time to kill and catch-up but seriously, how can it take that long to bring us our bill? Especially when the waitress asked us if we wanted anything else and we said no. Wouldn't that be your clue to bring us our bill? It was great for people watching since we had such an opportunity to watch people come and go. 

I  will return because I really liked the soup and there were other items on the menu that looked really good. Hopefully the service improves.
author: Claudia T.

description:
This is my spot for scratching that 'ahi poke' salad craving. I LOVE it.  The pitcher of mai-tais are quite spectacular too ;)

They have a great happy hour with drink and food specials, and their menu offers wonderful selection.  

Love their bowls - korean bbq, salmon, ahi...pretty much everything...it's delicious.  

BUT, I always seem to get the ahi poke salad.  I'm a picky poke eater...they made the cut.

Great for groups and when you're looking for a more reasonable spot to eat after the museum/CA Academy.
author: Christy L.

description:
We had an excellent meal at Pacific Catch in the Inner Sunset a couple of nights ago.
The place was extremely busy on a Monday night around 8pm, which is a testament to the quality and variety on the menu, as well as the reasonable pricing.

My wife enjoyed a very generous portion of fried coconut shrimp with sweet potato fries.  My dinner was a very nice plate of crusted filet of sole (allegedly 'local' sole) with brown rice and asparagus.  Sole is my weak spot, and I eat it nearly everywhere I can- and this was truly tasty and I cleared the plate completely.  Also ordered was a spicy tuna roll- while it was ok, large and generous, and I completely devastated it- the sushi will not be what brings me back here.  The sole, overall great menu diversity, and the Drake's beer on tap (dark and delicious) will.  $60 for everything including the tip was quite reasonable from my perspective. See you again soon (but probably your Chestnut St restaurant as its closer to my home).
author: Andy S.

description:
I've been here twice now, and seafood is definitely fresh. The first time I got the Baja shrimp ceviche and the coconut shrimp. Both were really tasty, the coconut batter on the shrimp was just right and the shrimp ceviche had a lot of shrimp in it. The second time I got the ceviche sampler, which comes with the baja shrimp ceviche, the Peruvian ceviche and the Hawaiian poke. The Baja was still the best, the Poke was a little over seasoned and the Peruvian kind of skimped on the amount of fish (and was kind of...oily?).

While I liked my meals, the people that I went with (on both occasions) both got the rice bowls and complained that it was way too much rice and not nearly enough meat/fish. 

The food is pretty good, but the rice bowls ($15)  were overpriced in my opinion for the amount of protein you get. 

I would give this a 3.5 probably but the staff was nice so I rounded up!
author: Christine U.

description:
This place is great! Charles is a friendly and funny bartender that makes an incredible cocktail. The staff is helpful and sweet. The bar food is to die for and reasonably priced, especially for the amount you get. The bar is skillfully set away from the main dining area,  which makes the place surprisingly mellow in sound.

Will definitely be returning and hoping to hear some more of the great stories the friendly bar staff have to share. 5 stars!

PS: They have a late night happy hour which is a ridiculously smart idea. Perfect for those like me who work late hours and never get a happy hour special.
author: The C.

description: The staff was friendly. The food didn't take forever to come out, but it was mediocre and overpriced.
author: Jerusha C.

description: Great tortilla lime soup & nice atmosphere. The place is not too crowded and perfect for a nice lunch break or dinner. I can definitely recommend this place.
author: Eva B.

description: Very good, lots if options, solid choice for dining and nice atmosphere and friendly staff. I had three tacos, shrimp, chicken, steak. All were very good. Tried my wife's ribs and salad which was also very good. I think everything on the menu looks and tastes very good, but nothing made me say "OMG".
author: Steven B.

description:
On my only day off, do I really want to spend it with my crazy family?!

"Oh, don't worry, your dad's not coming" my mom said.

* If you know my 'rents, I'm sure you'd also say thank God! *

Since it was just my mom and I, we decided to have lunch at Pacific Catch.  She loves seafood -- fish, shrimps, crab, baked, fried or broiled.  This place was ideal since it was walking distance to GG park, which we were headed to after lunch.

We picked out a couple of items and decided to share.  

The sweet potato fries were recommended by Eileen H. Boy she was right!  crispy and simply adorned with rock salt, it comes with two dipping sauces. I didn't like the flavored mayo nor the sweet chili sauce, but the fries are good on their own. (a side order is enough for two people)

The California roll was made with real crab but surprisingly lacking in flavor.  I've never been so thankful for soy sauce to dip it in.

On to the poke dish -- huge chunks of ahi tuna perfectly marinated in a soy sesame dressing.  It'll be easier to chew on it if the cut was smaller, but I shouldn't complain because I got my money's worth on that dish. 

Save your $4.95 on the grilled yellowtail taco. (it was a special for that day) The taco was small and the fish was overwhelmed with all the other trimmings in there. 

My mom loved her grilled mahi mahi with pineapple salsa. Served with a side of bok choy, onion strings and a big scoop of rice.  She couldn't finish this dish, not because it wasn't delicious, but the portions were so huge!

Service is very good, both from our waitress and the bussers, constantly refilling water and taking away used dishes. 

I'm curious about their happy hour, so I may come back for that!
author: Janice C.

description:
Happy hour menu is generous, with a couple dozen items.  Our favorites are the poke (three kinds), ribs, and skinny fries. They have good beers and drinks.  Tables are cozy.  On nice days you can sit outside and watch people walk by. There's an awning-protected area, too.
The service varies from very good to so-so. The other day, we had to ask for water, for a utensil, and then, after waiting for a while, for a check. 
The ribs were overcooked and dry.
author: Liana T.

description:
I've been to this place several times and also their location in the marina. I absolutely adore the rice bowls here!! What other way to wind down after a marathon than a big bowl of the good stuff?

Surprisingly, my three friends who rode their bikes were able to get there ahead of time after the race and hold a table for 10!! I was expecting an epic wait but for some reason, the place wasn't all that full. I guess runners wanted deep fried goodness after their runs (who can blame them?).

My boyfriend and I shared the grilled ahi tuna rice bowl with extra fish and brown rice. They even split the bowl for us into two servings! We also shared the Peruvian ceviche. I have to say the ceviche wasn't their finest hour. The fish wasn't raw and the sauce was oily. In the past, I've also tried their sandwiches, fish tacos and sushi. Everything were fantastic, especially the sweet potato fries.

This location is much bigger than the place in the marina and great for groups. Can't wait to have another rice bowl again!
author: Alice W.

description: BAD FISH & CHIPS tried the alaskan cod fish and chips. Asked for well done on the fries. The fryer must not be working right or Hot enough because the fries were soggy and wet with grease and so was the cod. The batter also fell off the cod. There was grease all over the bottom on my Plate. The meal was comped. Had a very good bloody Mary for $10
author: Rod D.

description: My family and I went back to Pacific Catch and opted to sit in the bar area. Robin was our server and he was absolutely amazing! He's the tall, handsome, strawberry blonde man who usually hangs out behind the bar. And for good reason, he makes the most amazing cocktails! I can't say enough good things about this guy! The food was, as usual, delicious. No complaints there. Overall, tonight definitely deserves 5 stars!! Keep up the good work, Robin! We'll be back for sure!!
author: Taylor W.

description:
I can't believe I haven't reviewed Pac Catch yet.  I have been here countless times with friends and classmates celebrating the end of midterms or finals, birthdays, girls' nights out, etc.  Definitely try to come for happy hour (4-6pm or 10-close in the bar area only).  The drinks are kind of expensive normally, but they have some good hh deals.  Not super cheap, but better than normal prices and good quality.

We also love their appetizers.  The sweet potato fries are delicious, especially with the white dipping sauce (I asked what it was one time, but I've since forgotten).  The sushi rolls are all a pretty good hh deal too, and although definitely not authentic in any way, they are flavorful and fresh.  I like the coconut shrimp except for the fact that they are hard to take off the skewer and I almost always end up making a mess or dropping one on the floor (sacrilege!).

This has been one of my favorite hangouts over the past 4 years, and I will miss it when I've graduated!
author: Caroline K.

description:
My mom wanted to take me out on a celebratory dinner after passing my Exit exam. She said anywhere, and I chose Pacific Catch because it has been a very long time without their ceviche.

We ordered the ceviche, the tortilla lime soup, fried oysters and the ahi tuna salad (which they split for us). This mean was perfect for two people. My mom felt ambitious and was about to get the oyster basket, but our server asked if we wanted the appetizer size and I thought that was the better choice.

If you have never had their ceviche, you are missing out.
author: Jenna R.

description: Nice place ... Atmosphere is hip and modern. I like that they serve fresh seafood and wonderful salads. I'll definitely make repeat visits.
author: Diane V.

description:
California Roll Salad - 14.5 
crab, avocado, cucumber, pickled ginger, carrots, shredded nori & soy-wasabi vinaigrette

Hawaiian Bowl - 15
asparagus, shiitake mushrooms, pineapple salsa, grilled bok choy, sesame seeds & house-made sake-teriyaki sauce served over seasoned sushi rice*

Taco Platter - 13
Baja, steak, and mahi mahi

Combination Captains Plate - 15 or so
3 thai coconut shrimps, 2 pieces of fried fish (forgot which kind), and 3 battered oysters with a choice of a side.  We choose the sweet potatoes.

We came on a Friday night and there was a good crowd.  I'll start by saying that the people there, the waiters and waitresses were alright.  They were cordial and polite, but I think that having worked in food myself, I definitely could've done a better job in the friendliness department.  The restaurant wasn't so busy as to have the servers running around, but after saying the food was coming out really quickly, he disappeared for a lonnng time and on top of that the food did not come out quickly at all.  Which is understandable for a Friday night, but it would've been cool not to have been ditched at our table.  Or maybe I'm just expecting too much.

Anyways, I'd give this place a 3 stars.  The ambiance is nice, the food is mostly good.   Except for me thinking that I'd try the California Roll Salad.  For $15, I wish I ordered the Hawaiian bowl cause I wasn't sure if I was supposed to be tasting anything.  With a decent amount of crab that they give you, and an overdose of avocado, surprisingly, and the soy-wasabi sauce, it had HARDLY any taste.  I was confused.  Is this crab ...or invisible taste? o.0 Pass.

All in all, I guess some things are hit or miss, but the Hawaiian was good and the coconut shrimps were tasty.
author: Lindsay L.

description:
Get the Tacos!!

The fresh shrimp, 
the crispy fried cod, 
the grilled mahi with cajun cayenne rub, 
the crunchy fresh cabbage, 
the spicy tomatillo salsa, 
the wedge of lime on the side.

The best fish tacos around.
author: R J.

description:
It's a small restaurant that serves amazing seafood. I had seared ahi salad and a side of sweet potato fries. Everything was delicious, and ginger-lemongrass iced tea was very refreshing.
Service was fast and friendly.
A lady at the next table was asking about the seasoning on the fries, and the chef came out to talk to us and was very friendly. 
It's a great place, if you are in that area check it out!
author: Marina I.

description:
I'm a dedicated advocate of Pacific Catch, as they seem to serve some of the freshest seafood in San Francisco. 

Their Asian fusion food is pretty well executed; the poke wasabi bowl is one of my favorites! Try the mahi mahi tacos - so good. The sake sake roll is better with brown rice, and comes in eight large pieces. End a date or outing with mochi fondue and you're good to go. 

Service has been quick and courteous every time I've been there but it is true that the tables could use a little more cleaning. I don't care though, I'm definitely coming back!
author: Colleen M.

description:
Pacific catch has pricey mediocre food of large proportions. The service was friendly although our entrees came out before our appetizers which was not ideal.

We started with the crab dumplings from the specials menu.  They were mushy and came with a bad-Chinese-restaurant-style dipping sauce.  We then had the Japanese rice bowl with poke and seared ahi as well as the miso salmon (also from the specials menu). The rice bowl had great flavors- daikon, cucumber, sesame seeds and wasabi. The poke was definitely the better protein. (I've previously had the thai-flavored rice bowl and have to say the Japanese one has a much better flavor profile). The miso salmon was just average, not that interesting, cooked fine, but overall not much to write about.

The agave lemonade and the mint and lime "nojito" were also just forgettable drinks. They tasted like average watery lemonade and flavored soda water, respectively.

Overall, the meal was fairly bleh to average (which we count as two stars) but pricey for just average mains ($18-$20). I doubt we will be coming back for dinner. However, their happy hour is pretty good and the poke is on it as well.
author: Amy D.

description: Delish! How does this only have 3.5 stars?! This place is da' bomb. The food is super tasty. I highly recommend the wasabi bowl with salmon and brown rice. It was so so good. I like their sushi too but it is a bit pricey ($9 for a California roll). That being said, 5 stars for taste!
author: Hello G.

description: Here's my unusual review. The food was simple and good. I ordered an entree salad w a protein... thumbs up! I'd order this healthy option again in a heartbeat. However, what set this place apart, was perfect service. Our server was friendly, happy to be there, and appropriately attentive. I'm looking forward to going back.
author: Michael S.

description:
First of all, food can be great , but the experience would be better with good service!
I honestly was looking forward to this place for weeks. I was going to San Fran for the weekend and looked up good restaurants and saw the pictures,read some reviews. And reviews never bothered me since I've never experienced a bad spot. But this one in particular, I was so excited to go that would eat the whole freakin menu. I even fought my boyfriend to come to this one. I really had high expectations! I wouldn't even give a star if I had an option to do so. Anyways, to make this clear.
As soon as I walked in I wasn't even greeted. I had to ask a table for two and a young girl (host)looked at me with disgust. I guess I was a little "beach dirty" but anyways. So my first though was like whatever this might not be the hosts day. She then walked me to this awkward part of the restaurant and sat me on the smallest table every. It's not even busy to begin with! Anyways I politely asked if we can have a booth. She looked at me with annoyance as if I'm asking to much. Then she turned her head to look at the booths and she then turn to me and said sorry that for bigger parties for later in a way where she didn't not wanna deal with us at all.  
I didn't think about till now... But I should've asked when they will be coming. 
So now I got the menu. I went to the bathroom. Got back I see two glasses of water with out ice. It's a hot day and I looked around and every table has ICE water. I been server and I never served water without ice unless it's requested. 
From there I was just confused of what and why this is happening that I didn't even wanna look at the menu. The sever seemed like she didn't even wanna deal with use either. I've never had service like in my life.
To add on. I was making a review while I was in there.... And I guess I was so disappointed that I wrote the review all weird and someone reported saying I'm mentally challenged. I hope this explain a little.
author: Jennifer M.

description: It's more like 3.5 stars, but since the waitress was so nice, I bumped it up, instead of down.  Come before 6 pm for their Happy Hour.  Everybody looked really happy on a Friday night!  The drinks just kept on coming out.  We actually had dinner.  Mine was the fried combination seafood with 3 oysters, 3 coconut shrimps, and 3 fried fishes, a turtle dove, and partridge in a pair tree.  The fried sweet potato was yummy.  My friend had the 3 tacos and she loved the steak one.  My other friend's chicken bowl was the most disappointing.  Who serves "dried" chicken?  I had the non-alcohol nojito (lime & mint), yummy!  Lots of children having dinner with their parents.  I love the family feeling of this place.
author: Helen L.

description:
Andddd GO!  Seafood fusion at its best.

Great atmosphere to just sit back and have late night happy hour.  It's location is definitely a win.  I love sitting at the bar side and just relaxing with friends over sushi and beer.  If I am really hungry I go for the rice bowls which are decent and filling - I always get the Korean BBQ.  The hawaiian tends to be a little sweet, but what do ya' expect - there's teriyaki sauce in it.  The calamari is a great dish to have, or share.  I usually go for the "shiso-fine" roll if I need my sushi fix.  

Sometimes if you are lucky, you might even get a parking spot in their lot.  The service is great too.
author: John Michael R.

description:
If you like fusion seafood, then I would highly recommend this restaurant.  I personally like my fresh seafood to be prepared as simple as possible (fresh seafood shouldn't require much preparation, in my humble opinion.) 

We had the grilled shrimps and mixed seafood ceviche as appetizers.   The shrimps are highly recommended.  The ceviche is prepared in a mango salsa, which I thought overpowered the flavors of the seafood.  The ceviche was also served with purple yam chips, which was not crispy or sturdy enough to hold the heavy salsa (heavy due to the mango puree.) 

I had the mahi mahi, and my boyfriend had the shrimps and squid special.  My mahi mahi was prepared with a green curry and paired with sweet coconut cakes.  I thought my mahi mahi was so fresh that the green curry, once again, overpowered the freshness of the fish.  Coconut cakes were different, but nothing to write home (or yelp, in this case) about... 

Overall, I would not visit this restaurant again unless I am in the neighborhood and was starving and was craving some fusion seafood.
author: Sharon C.

description:
As I've said in other reviews, if you have poke then I'm there. 

But I've been here a few times and the service is consistently awful. There are often times when there are plenty of empty tables but the wait is extra long (we are understaffed) or somehow they're all booked.

But in a large enough occupancy like this it doesn't make sense. Even if you have people coming no oner reserves specific tables, so there's definitely an operational shortcoming here.

Or something more insidious.

Sad, because I actually did enjoy the poke.
author: Christophe C.

description:
Service was not that great. If you like sushi don't get it here, they are trying to hard and putting a lot of extra stuff in their rolls, which doesn't improve them. The poke was good, as well as the lost coast tangerine wheat beer. 
 Overall, over priced corporate place with nothing that makes me want to come back... I think they get a lot of business only bc of it's location by the GG park.
author: Valerie E.

description: Came here last night for my mom's birthday, the place was not as full or busy as it could be but nevertheless once we were seated and our drink order was taken the drinks a beer and a Mai Tai took forever!!!! And only after expressing our frustration did the waitress say anything "the bar is backed up", it wasn't even busy!!! Food was pretty good, the crab melt was a little dry. The "spicy" fries are more overly seasoned then spicy. The bowls and poke is delicious!! I decided I'll just do take out from now on.
author: Rebecca A.

description: Everything we order'd was amazing! Calamari, Tuna Poke, Taco's and 2 Sushi Rolls!! I highly recommend trying this restaurant. We look forward to go back.. and hopefully soon!
author: Nicole B.

description:
I enjoy the atmosphere at this place.

I used to come here all the time when they had their ahi poke for happy hour! That stuff was bomb! But they got rid of it.. And it's 10$ as opposed to the previous 5.95$...

Aside from that their happy hours are from 4-6 and after 10pm. My friends come here for the Original Cosmo drink half off During happy hour. 

Today I had the wasabi salmon bowl and it was pretty delicious and healthy! I've never been too big of a fan on wasabi but this bowl taste amazing! It's almost like a light honey mustard taste to the salmon and rice. The bowl came with white rice, salmon, wasabi sauce, ginger, and a seaweed salad.

I really like their original idea of edamame beans with pretzel goldfish, it's actually a great combo when you try them together.

The only problem I have with this place is that the waiters are never really there when you need them.. They take forever and never notice you esp at the bar area.. It gets annoying!

Minus two stars for the service and taking out ahi poke from the happy hour menu!
author: Jonathan L.

description: The poke trio was absolutely delicious. It comes with crispy wonton chips, seaweed and salad. Super healthy and tasty. The warrior's five-one-ohh cocktail was also a great value at $5.10. If you love seafood, this place is a must try.
author: Jon T.

description:
This place is incredibly awesome. Me and my boyfriend decided to come here one Friday because it always looks super packed and we did not regret it. The service was just amazing, we were seated within the first 5 minutes and everyone was so sweet and friendly.

We got a waitress that was awesome as well! She told us all about the best dishes and the the food was to die for. All the fish was so fresh and yummy! 

I would most definitely recommend this place to anyone who loves Hawaiian Poke!!! No words to describe how delicious it was :) I will for sure be back here!!! mmmm....
author: Julia K.

description:
