So delicious! After a long day of being a tourist, this place has everything you could want. We happened in here at happy hour. I got a inside out roll, which was perfect and my boyfriend got the sticky bbq bowl. Both were full of flavor and we couldn't stop eating. 
I didn't LOVE the agave margarita and that is literally my only complaint. Altogether with tip and us getting one than one drink, the total was under $50!
author: Kaitlin P.

description: Fish and chips was excellent! The Korean sparerib appetizer was disgusting, definitely not Korean style at all super America and it lacked total flavor. The tacos were gross as well. Calamari was pretty good.  Service was OK I honestly wasn't happy with them, I had asked for a booth but unfortunately the hostess said it was all reserved. We ate our entire meal as we watched every both sit empty. By the time we left only one both had been taken. Also it took five minutes to get a server to even bring us water and acknowledge us. But I will probably go back for fish and chips, I can't lie.
author: Natasha P.

description:
As a newbie to the City, I heard about this place through SF Chefs 2013.

The salmon poke served at SF Chefs was delicious. My experience encouraged me to visit the restaurant.

This location has a small parking area, but it's better than nothing! 

The boyfriend and I ordered the poke appetizer and we each had our own bowls. We both felt it wasn't as amazing as what we had previewed at SF Chefs. The fish didn't taste as fresh. 

I do appreciate that the bowls have vegetables and rice to balance out the diet. 

3 stars from me!
author: Belyn L.

description: Had lunch there after a visit to the DeYoung and it was a lovely 5 minute walk from the museum.  This means a huge savings in time by not having to find parking after leaving the museum.   We both had the steak tacos which were excellent.  Service was good, restaurant was not terribly crowded even at noon, and the whole experience was enjoyable.
author: Karne N.

description: The food was fresh, and the drinks were strong. I was with a group of friends, and the waitress was great at answering their many questions. It was a nice environment, close to home. Would visit again!
author: M. C.

description:
Another year, another luncheon. After last year's luncheon that my organization held at Pacific Catch went so well, I was looking forward to recreating the same event.

Once again, the staff at Pacific Catch put together a lovely luncheon. The staff was fast and flexible, the communication setting up the event was prompt and productive, and the willingness to serve around the flow of the event was all greatly appreciated.

With such a diverse group of volunteers, there are often lots of opinions. All of them spoke to how delicious the food was and how much they enjoyed the event. 

There was an all-around positive and easy going atmosphere, which fits our organization perfectly. Plus, the portions are hearty and each course was delicious. 

Thanks to Shawn, Nicole, and the whole staff for helping us thank our volunteers yet again for their wonderful service to local students. 

Looking forward to next year!
author: Lauren A.

description: This restaurant is very spacious compared to most SF restaurants and there is also a bar area. I would have given this place 3.5 stars the first time I ate here because I didn't really like what I ordered (tacos), but after coming here again, I bumped it up to 4 stars. My favorite thing to get here is their Japanese Wasabi Bowl with Hawaiian poke and half brown rice, half greens. So good and it's also pretty big, so it's filling; I can never finish one. I ask for the dressing on the side though, because sometimes they put too much and it can be overpowering in the bowl. I love how it comes with seaweed salad, and avocado too! My bf ordered the poke trio once and I definitely recommend that as well. They also serve you pretzel goldfish and edamame while deciding what to order. Their cocktails are strong too; I remember being really buzzed after 1 drink.
author: Stephanie G.

description:
5 stars for the drinks, 3 stars for the food.

Much props to the awesome people behind the bar. Every cocktail on their menu that I've tried has been very good. I'm a sucker for Mai Tais, and I think the one they make here is one of the best around.

As far as their food goes, I enjoy that you can go here for a different experience on any given day or night. You can come for a Japanese experience one night and stick to ordering their sushi rolls. Or you can come in for some pub fare and get their fish and chips. Or if you're feeling nostalgic about your time in Hawaii (I do all the time), you can choose from a variety of poke bowls they offer. Overall, while their food is decent, I wouldn't go out of my way to come here. The fish they serve is certainly fresh, but I don't think anything is quite a home run here.

But like I said, I would go out of my way to come for drinks. I recommend coming here and hanging out at the bar and coming in for some apps while you enjoy their delicious cocktails.  As a neighborhood spot, I don't think there's any place in the Sunset that does this type of cuisine any better, especially with the quality of seafood product they have. But if you're looking for food really beaming with bold and unique flavors, this might not be the best spot to try.
author: Jeffrey J.

description: If it wasn't because of the service I would give this place 4 stars. We walked in and waited for a bit before we got seated even though there were empty tables around. When we finally got seated, we ordered calamari, tacos, and fish n' chips combo. Everything was delicious and the flavors were amazing. Calamari was kinda soft. I wish there was a bit more crunch. The service was bad. Our waitress barely checked up on us. She then took a good 10 mins to get us change. How long does it take to count money and get change????.....With a place like this I thought the service was supposed to be better. Guess I was wrong
author: Jenny L.

description:
Our server, Zan, was just fantastic! Best server ever!
People are right about the Poke - excellent. We had they original & the Ahi Mac nut, both great, as are the accompanying wonton frit.
We also shared a special, Figian Mahi-mahi w green curry. Exc. Recommend.
author: R K.

description:
Don't let the chain-decor fool you (though, it really is a chain), Pacific Catch serves up incredibly fresh & tasty seafood in a variety of ways. You'd be remiss to pass up the Poke (my favorite is the traditional Hawaiian) that's served in a big bowl with warm, freshly made wontons. The calamari is also FANTASTIC. So just order both & thank me later. For your main, my favorite the Hawaiian Bowl with Poke or the Korean Bowl with Salmon. Good Lord those are good & incredibly filling! My boyfriend also loves the fish & chips or the tacos -- both really big portions. 

We prefer this location because it's bigger than the one in the Marina and... has PARKING! Yes, there are about 5 spots in the lot, but you can generally get a spot and a table. Tuesday Nights are also 1/2 priced bottles of wine to boot.

One of our regular faves!
author: Chantelle D.

description:
So glad that I finally got to try this place! We came on a Sunday around 6:30PM and sat at the bar because we wanted to watch NBA finals. It was pretty busy but we got lucky because there was one table open. I can't speak for the normal seating area but the bar area is really nice! They had seasonal and fresh drinks that looked really good too.  I had the Japanese Wasabi rice bowl with Hawaiian poke. SO GOOD. Everything about it was perfect, I highly recommend it. It had the perfect amount of wasabi, soy sauce and the poke was really fresh. Service was bit slow but it was really busy and we were pretty distracted by the game so it didn't ruin our experience at all!

P.S. They had a gluten free menu - you just gotta ask for it!
author: Alli Q.

description:
I came with group of friends on a thursday night after the nightlife at the academy of sciences because; 1. It was close in proximity 2. Seemed like a more health conscious choice. 3. We wanted sushi

Even though we came 30 mins before closing, the place still seemed busy. 

So here's the breakdown, The server says "Oh, sorry our sushimaker just walked out on us today." 

We're all thinking, wow, he just up'd and 
left huh...

So then she tells us that we are only allowed to order just appetizers and drinks.

Ok fine. That limits us to ordering like fries, fish ceviche and calamari.


Next thing you know, there was another party that came in 3 mins before closing that was seated right next to us. They promptly got their orders started and got their food served shortly. What comes pouring into their table? SUSHI. 

The general manager tries to save his ass by saying they had a shortage of rice and had found some more but told his servers to actually make up lies. Hah Smooth alright. 

SERIOUSLY, IS THIS THE TYPE OF SERVICE YOU RUN?!!!


I will HAPPILY take my complimentary entree cards to your other locations,
Thank you very much.
author: Samantha D.

description:
A local girl mentioned that she loved this place.  Was in the area with good friends to try it out.

Food:

-Cabo Calamari:  this was some tasty calimari! could have been crispier though.  the chipotle aioli was quite unique and had just the right amount of heat in it.  

-Mixed Catch Basket: a variety of fried fish, coconut shrimp, and fried oyster with fries.  some people wanted sweet potato fries and others wanted regular fries, the waitress was very nice in letting us get 1/2 portion of each so that everyone could be happy =]  the coconut shrimps were especially tasty and crispy on the outside, with the right balance of sweet and saltyness.  the other fried items were average.

-Japanese Wasabi Rice Bowl [Hawaiian Ahi Poke]: there was a good amount of food on this dish, with a great mix of seaweed salad, shreded nori, sprouts, etc.  the ahi was fresh tasting and flavorful, however they could have done with less salt/soy sauce.  it made me very thristy, and the waitress did not come by to refill water.   although i did not taste the wasabi, the dish tasted savory/meaty.   I dont know if this was intentional, but the rice was cold, and a little hard..

- Special of the Day: Escolar with mashed potatoes and spinach:  this was the best dish of the bunch.   The fish was cooked to perfection, did not taste "fishy" and was nicely complemented by a mango-salsa type topping.  The mashed potatoes tasted buttery and fresh.  The spinach was garlicy, which is nice, and not grainy.  The amount of food you get for the price however is not worth it.


Service:

- the waitress was very friendly and made good suggestions on the type of food, splitting the fries, etc.  however we did not recieve any service after we got our food.  the water was not refilled until half an hour after it was empty, we were waiting a good 10 minutes before we could even get the bill.  


3 Stars:
Overall, I would maaaybe come back here if someone invited me (because of the above average food), but otherwise the price for the amount of food is not worth it, and the service is sub-par given that it was a pretty empty restaurant when we got there.
author: Tina A.

description:
We came again before CAS NightLife for happy hour drinks and food. The food was really good. I ordered the coconut shrimp again, calamari, and crab soup.

The calamari wasn't that great. There wasn't a whole lot of flavor to them, but the soup was delicious. I wasn't sure what to expect with a crab soup. It's not a cream soup, and only had 2 nice chunks of crab, but the overall taste was very good.

I'd get it again, and I'd probably come back again. However that won't be awhile since I have promised my body it won't be eating seafood for a few weeks.

By the time we got home my boyfriend and I got pretty darn sick, and here we are the next day still holed up in bed clutching our stomachs.

I don't blame the place, stuff like that happens sometimes. The food really is good, and this was not our first time there. We're thinking it was maybe the calamari, so maybe just becareful with that.
author: Vanessa F.

description:
Ew. I came here again and we got HORRIBLE service. Our server didn't come to take our orders until almost 20 minutes after we were seated. The waiter also didn't collect our check way after we were ready to pay. The restaurant wasn't even that busy at the time! 

The food was not that good either. I had the Grilled Salmon Salad and the salmon was the driest shit of my life. The dressing was also bland and nothing special. The only thing good that we ordered was the basket of sweet potato fries.

Parking is a bitch because it's 9th and Irving. I really wouldn't have came here again if it wasn't for the fact that it's one of the bigger restaurants on the street, so it didn't have a wait. Now I know why...
author: Christine A.

description:
Friendly staff and decent prices. The lounge outside is nice for a medium sized group on a nice day--- we had a blast.

The Hawaiian poke is by far the best of the four we tried (macadamia, yuzu, and California were the other three) but the yuzu was good, too. I suggest getting the trio anyway just because it is fun, but definitely get the Hawaiian on its own if you can.

Also do not miss the spicy mango martini (perhaps I am forgetting the name, but they'll know what I mean) or the coconut prawns. Just, don't.

Great beer selection, too, and the bathrooms were clean. 10/10 would bang.
author: Grace A.

description:
Uhm this place totally rocks. No idea why it's got low stars. I think it was GREAT.

My friend and I ordered the trio of poke: original, a creamy one with serreno chiles, and a white tuna one. I LOVED the original. I thought it was really good. It tastes like poke is supposed to taste. The serreno was my least favorite - it was really creamy, and I'm not super into creamy foods. I did like the spice, though. The white tuna was really refreshing. I would definitely order again.

They were previewing their special SF menu, so I gave their salmon BLT a shot. And OMG it was so great! I loved the salmon, the bacon was cooked to perfection... wow it was good. I only ate half, but that half was more than enough.

The waitresses were also super on top of it and really nice. I would recommend this place to anyone!
author: Jade R.

description:
Used to be hand down my go to favorite place in the city! The Ahi is usually TO DIE FOR. Tonight it was like the bought it frozen at Costco and didn't feel like cooking it. It was beyond bland. And had the fishnets after taste. 3 of us were so disappointed. The friendly waitress didn't even say anything when we were finished and my friend had an entire bowl left. He literally had about 3 bites. Plus side- rice was great! :( 
Side note: DRINKS ARE HEAVENLY! And the servers are sweet. Hence the two stars.
author: Kristen S.

description:
I wish I could give the service 10 stars!!! I came here Monday night with some friends from out of town who have a baby and one on the way. We needed to adjust the seating at the table to make everyone comfortable and the server was more then kind in making sure we all had everything we needed. She was sweet, gave great advice on what to choose on the menu and was accommodating throughout the entire meal. 

This is a warm, fun and relaxing place without all the SF food snobs. If you want a place to go after a long day, Pacific Catch is great.
author: Jenny D.

description:
I hate to be a hater, but I had the worst service I have had yet in a restaurant here in San Francisco. This 3 star I am giving is generous only because I have only been here once, and don't want to be harsh.

It took our server 25 MINUTES NO JOKE, just to come over and take our drink order, then after that another 15 minutes to bring the drinks and take our dinner order. And once we got our food, we didn't see our server for a good 45 minutes. And the restaurant was nowhere near busy. Hopefully she read the note I left her on the receipt. It wasn't mean or anything, but I just let her know she gave us a horrible experience and should work on her serving/ multitasking skills a little bit.
I am a server myself, and this was just ridiculous.

The food was alright, nothing to brag about though.
I won't go back.
author: Kayla C.

description:
FYI,
Pacific Catch will feature a few Peruvian menu items on 2/16/09 thru 3/1/09.

Below is the proposed schedule of regional cuisines to be featured at the 9th Avenue and Corte Madera locations only.

Peru  2/16/09 - 3/1/09
Alaska  4/20/09 - 5/3/09
Australia  6/22/09 - 7/5/09
Thailand  8/24/09 - 9/6/09
Singapore  10/26/09 - 11/8/09
Costa Rica  12/28/09 - 1/10/10
author: Luis C.

description:
I would've liked to give them at least 3 stars for the food, but I was really, really upset by the service that I had to dock them!  

My first experience here was a pleasant one until we were about to order and the first thing the waitress told us was that sushi was not available for order because the "sushi chef walked out on them."  WHAT???  But okay, we settled for the Peruvian Ceviche (which was super nomsy), Thai Coconut Shrimp (it's okay, not bad though), Cabo Calamari (meh, nothing special), and Fries (sweet potato & normal fries, both were decent, good enough for late night munchies).  We were enjoying our beers and some of their starters from the happy hour UNTIL we saw the table next to us (mind you - that came and sat AFTER us) getting served with sushi.  WHAT???  How are you going to tell us that we can't order sushi and then only to see it get served to another table?  You're not only miscommunicating to us, but we also felt like you were treating us unfairly.  We asked to speak to the waitress, and all she could say was, "Oh, I meant we ran out of white rice, and can only serve sushi with brown rice."  WHAT???  If you told us that from the beginning, we would've even been okay with that.  But the fact that you didn't?  Lied to us and then got caught?  WHAT???

Ugh, we made a complaint to the manager of the night about our experience there, and he tried to save himself by saying they had a shortage of rice and had found some more rice later but told his servers to make up lies meanwhile.  WHAT????  To make it up, he compensated each of us with a complimentary starter ticket and I gave you one star back for doing that, but honestly after my first experience there even with the complimentary starter ticket, I don't plan on coming back.
author: Carena N.

description: Exceptional. Walked across the street from Golden Gate Park to get a quick bite, surveyed the options on 9th and settled happily on this spot after checking out the menu. It was a busy Saturday afternoon and we were able to be seated right away. Service was swift. The food was out of control delicious. Every single item, every bite. Cannot wait to eat here again!
author: Jessica L.

description: I debated whether or not I wanted post a review because, well, the place is already busy enough. We came here after a day at Golden Gate Park and truly stumbled into a gem. I had the BBQ Salmon Sandwich. The fillet was perfectly cooked and rested in bread that was neither too hard to too soft and topped with the best sauce I ever tasted. I'm definitely coming back.
author: Randy S.

description:
OUTSIDE LANDS FOOD REVIEW, First was restaurant

-fish and chips $10, do it.. line is shorter than others by far 
-hawaiian poke - i dont usually like raw fish, but WOW. very good. love the flavorrrrrr
author: Melody T.

description:
We were a little wary about trying this place out after reading several sub-par reviews, but I'm glad to say our experience was fantastic all around. Shared the carrot ginger soup to start, which had a very robust -- but not too overwhelming -- flavor that complemented the coconut shrimp really nicely. I was also impressed with our waitress's wine recommendation, as the sauvignon blanc she suggested went perfectly with the food I ordered. 

I went with the mahi mahi (on special) and was pleasantly surprised at how delicate it tasted: not at all chewy or meaty like I'd had at other places. Really generous portion size, too! My better half went with the ahi tuna sandwich; given that he inhaled it in under 2 minutes, I'd venture to say he really enjoyed it. 

So overall, excellent service and food for the price -- looking forward to our next visit!
author: Justine M.

description: Had a great poke and the apps were really good. They had some daily specials that everyone loved. Get the grilled corn, it was outstanding.
author: Jason H.

description:
I can't believe how picky San Francisco Yelp restaurant reviewers are!   I'm giving Pacific Catch 5 stars for food for the price.  Find me a better tuna sashimi rice bowl or salad bowl (or combination of both) and I'll eat my socks.  I've never seen this dish anywhere.  Its delicious and healthy. 
     Fish and chips are great.  Sweet potato fries-Yum!  I'll be back tomorrow for lunch with friends.
author: Nancy S.

description:
Nothing will ever compare to the poke you get in Hawaii, but this will do! The poke trio appetizer was good--I liked the lomi lomi and original the best.  The poke bowl was good too! 

The tres leches dessert with ice cream was sooo good. I don't know exactly what it was called because we said yes as soon as the server recommended it.

Portions are generous.  Service was great.  Nice atmosphere. Parking is a little difficult since it located right along Lincoln, but its SF, get over it.
author: Abby M.

description: We've been to Pacific Catch many times... mostly at lunch but a few times at dinner.  We often stop in after a visit to the nearby Golden Gate Park Botanical Gardens which, by the way, gets 5 stars!  EVERY time I eat here I order the very delicious fried oysters (my choice of fish) and chips.  I keep saying I'm going to order something else but I really do love these yummy fried oysters.  I give the chips (French fries) to my husband.  He always orders the equally delicious ahi salad which is a meal in itself, even if I didn't give him my French fries!
author: Nancy C.

description:
Got 4 different tacos. Only 1 was worth it. The beef! Skip the fish and chicken tacos, get the beef! The waitress also told us, "yeah the beef and shrimp are the best." 
Why didn't she tell us sooner!

The poke was pretty great. And good choices. Sweet onions!

And real crab cali rolls!

Go during happy hour!

Parking lot in the back is really tight,
author: Augusto M.

description: My friends all love this place. I think it's ok. Food is solid but nothing spectacular, waitstaff competent, and it has a small parking lot in back which is a bonus.
author: El B.

description: Pretty good place! There is quite the selection to choose from, especially since it's a seafood based restaurant. Though I am not the biggest fan of seafood, I decided to get the chipotle chicken salad. It was very refreshing and I enjoyed every bit of it! The chicken could've had more bbq sauce on it to top the entire dish off but overall it was great!
author: Ricardo R.

description:
YUMMM!!! Just came back from an awesome lunch at Pacific Catch!! Their grilled salmon japanese wasabi bowl with brown rice was outstanding!! Everything came out fresh and the flavors were on point. Portions were generous to offset the price. 

Don't forget dessert --- you gotta try their dulce de leche fried rolls with vanilla ice cream! Completely delicious....

Service during lunch was not too shabby.....
author: La C.

description: Great food. Try the crispy oysters and the Steak island tacos. They were delicious. This place has a little bit of everything. I would definitely go back again.
author: Chris H.

description:
We went on a week night for dinner and I was pleasantly surprised by the level of traffic here. From my previous experiences (MANY MANY YEARS AGO), PC was never a huge hit. Perhaps things have changed since. 

Service was good. We were seated right away. 

They have a pretty good variety of food available, mainly all seafood based, so beware those of you who are allergic!

Pricing here is a bit on the steeper side, which is to be expected since it is seafood..

Overall, I think this place is still a  overrated and overpriced for being a chain location. It is not one of my top picks of restaurants I must go to.
author: Sharon G.

description:
If I were to switch teams and marry someone of the same sex. Mr Chef, meet me at the alter and lets make history.

Pacific Catch is one of my most favorite recent finds of the last 40 years. Ok, I'm not 40 yet but I'm getting there. Fresh ingredients combined with seafood that was literally on a boat just a few hours ago equate to one of the best food experiences in my adopted hometown.

Save room for dessert. I mean it.
author: V B.

description: This place is located in a pretty crowded area right next to the golden gate park and academy of sciences. I got the Japanese Wasabi poke bowl and it was pretty good. The only exception is how much Wasabi is in the middle of the bowl. It was burning me and my friends if we ate too much at a time. Other than that, service was great and got seated right away as well. Good place that is decent priced to take parents, friends, dates. 3 stars for now until I go back to try more !
author: Hae Rim H.

description: This place is amazing! Sat outside by the fire pit and had happy hour, which is outstanding. 4 $ tacos, 8$ pokes and 6$ bar bites cheap beers and cocktails. Our server Miya was attentive and friendly. I would recommend this place to anyone looking for a great happy hour, ambiance and sevice.
author: Alice S.

description:
Decided to stop by this place for dinner after walking around the Lincoln/ 9th Ave/ Irving area. What really caught my eye on the menu was the variety of Poke options, and I love me some poke.

The restaurant itself is pretty cute; it has a casual, beachy feel while still seeming nice enough for dinner after work. I chose the Original Hawaiian Poke, the special of Pulled Pork sliders with pineapple slaw, and a blood orange margarita.

Overall, the food was decent. I wasn't too thrilled about it though. I've had some pretty good poke, so my expectations are pretty high. While it was nice, both the poke itself and the wonton chips served with it had way too much salt for me. I finished most of it, but couldn't get through the last little bit just because the taste of salt became so overwhelming. 

The pulled pork sliders were really delicious, with the pork being so nicely seasoned and cooked, and the sweetness of the pineapple slaw plus the Hawaiian rolls were a nice blend. My only gripe about these little sliders is that I wanted there to be more of the pork to balance out the thick fluffiness of the roll. 

The margarita was pretty good; Blood orange flavoring seems to be getting popular right now, and I'm all for that.

My mom seemed to be a little annoyed at how little our server was attending to us. She was very nice and polite when she was, but we had to keep scanning for her and didn't see her very often. 

It was a nice dinner. I may come back here again if I'm in the area, but I'm not salivating or yearning to come back in the near future.
author: Jenessa R.

description:
They have a gluten-free menu, tasty ceviche and friendly service. (Sometimes too friendly, like they came out of TGIFriday's training)

Rice bowl was a ton of food. Fish was fresh.  Me likey.
author: Paul W.

description:
So... I know I'm not alone in being suspicious of monstrous restaurant buildings on the corner of busy intersections in the Sunset.  In this case, possibly the busiest.

Pacific Catch.  Hm.  Tropical themed fusion-ish pan-Asian-ish fish place decorated with wicker and rattan as far as the eye can see.  How in the world can the food at such a place be any good?  Surprise.  It actually is better than decent.

(Disclaimer:  I don't have a sophisticated palate.  But you already knew that from skimming the places I've already reviewed.  Hello, Carl's Junior?)

I do like my seafood that has unfortunately been fished to the brink of extinction.  Codfish and tuna are some of my favourites, and they were fresh here.  That's half the battle.

Fish and chips used authentic cod (yes!).  I also like that Pacific Catch offers brown rice.  Three-way tuna-- yup, ahi tuna prepared three different ways.  Can't recall exactly how, other than seared and sashimi-style, but it was tasty.  And you get plenty of wasabi, pickled ginger and soy sauce; what more could a hungry customer/sushi lover want?

Drinks are good.  Girly beachy Hawaiian type concoctions.  Those are nice.  Order a Guava Cooler or Kona Lager and just hang out as you wait for a table to open up.  Drinks are always good.

Some tables are a bit small though.  Crowded with plates, cups and dishes, and we didn't even order that much.  Either down-size your serving platters-- but NOT your food-- or give me a bigger eating surface.  Yes, I am a petite slob. (Aw, that reminds me of my beloved pet kitty...)

Kudos, Pacific Catch, for a nice seafood meal and fun drinks.

Sorry about the mess. :P
author: Jade T.

description:
It was surprisingly good! It looked like a chain restaurant so I wasn't sure about it but me and my sister were really hungry so we thought we'd give it a try. Our server was friendly and prompt and we never had to try and flag him down. 
The food was pretty good and reasonably priced. We started off with the ahi Serrano poke; the fish tasted fresh, didn't smell funny and it the flavors blended well together. I had the spicy tuna roll and that was pretty good and really filling and my sister had the mahi mahi sandwich and that was really good too. The best part was the bread pudding with the vanilla ice cream and coffee sauce....my god that was delicious!
author: Kate T.

description: I've been going to Pacific Catch for a while and am consistently impressed by the menu. Always exceptionally yummy sandwiches, fresh fish, friendly staff and good prices! I love how they offer daily special and add new variety to the menu. Spicy mahi mahi and wasabi ahi tuna always remain favorites.
author: Priya C.

description:
This is a great casual place to stop and eat if you are at Golden Gate Park.  

I ordered the salmon salad and sweet potato fries.  The veggies in the salad were fresh, the dressing was good and the salmon was fresh and very tasty.  The sweet potato fries were light and tasty.  Nothing had too much salt, which was very nice.

I also drank lemon-grass infused iced tea.  Very different and good.

The service was good and friendly.
author: Sharon L.

description: Ahi Tuna Poke is my favorite here!! Great food for the price.
author: Shiva A.

description: Great ambience and food. The price was reasonable as well. Will definitely go back
author: Amin E.

description: About the third time here and it gets better each time. Some of the best calamari I've had in a long time, light crispy perfectly cooked with a chipotle aioli that rocks. Pick your meat, pick your taste of either Korean, Japanese, Thai, and go. Lots of food that's fresh and full of flavor
author: Matt A.

description: My sweetie and I came here for happy hour last Friday, some earlier reviews notwithstanding, and we are glad we did. The hostess was prompt and courteous, we were seated immediately, the server was friendly and attentive. We had the calamari and the coconut shrimp, both excellent with the happy hour maergaritas. We had no trouble redeeming the free dessert promo, either. Tip: the macadamia nut sundae on the brownie is ample for two
author: Stephen S.

description:
I received an email from the General Manager regarding my experience at Pacific Catch, and below is the correspondence between him and I:

**Hello Matthew,

My name is Rob and I'm the General Manager at Pacific Catch in the Sunset.  I read your Yelp posting and wanted to express my concern.  Do you recall when you dined here?  Was it for lunch or dinner, or midday?  Do you recall what manager you spoke with when you called and may I also ask what you were expecting the manager to do upon receiving your call?

We do pride ourselves on serving fresh, well-prepared food at Pacific Catch.  We also take a great amount of pride in the cleanliness of our establishment.  In fact, last year we took part in a study performed by USF and UCSF about hygiene standards and practices in the food business.  Our restaurant finished their study in first place with respect to our standards and practices.

Best regards,.
Rob

Here is the message I replied to him...

**Dear Rob,

Thank you for your response.  I appreciate your time to write to me here on Yelp, despite your busy schedule at Pac Catch.  I came here for dinner a few months ago and I had called the next day and I had spoken with you.  Please don't get me wrong, but I called to pinpoint/figure out the source of my friend's and my diarrhea.  It's true that it is hard to pinpoint where it could have come from, but when I had addressed my concerns to you, I was a little disappointed because you had completely dismissed them, and flat out had told me, around the lines of, "it's not us, sorry!"  It was upsetting to have had completely disregarded like that, especially when it's about the health of your patrons.

Thank you again for communicating and engaging me through Yelp.  Your response does make me feel a little better and much more willing to come back again.  Because management was responsive, I will consider rating Pac Catch 2 stars, but will withhold it until my next visit.

Yours faithfully,
Matthew

======
It was nice to hear back from management, and it is good that they were responsive despite the initial attitude and lack of good customer service I experienced on the telephone back a few months. Yelp truly is an excellent medium to communicate with restaurants--especially to get issues like this addressed.  However, I still rate Pac Catch a *1 star* as I await a response from the manager.  I'm STILL a bit wary and hesitant.
author: Matthew L.

description: There aren't many places in the city to get fresh seafood for a decent price and a healthy portion. I had the Mahi Mahi rice bowl with 1/2 greens and a yummy Coconut brew from Maui.  Mind you it's tiny and gets super busy, so don't go at high tide (excuse the pun).
author: G W.

description: Pan Asian fusion. Says it all. Food is fresh and very good. Service is with a smile. I love sitting by the open window on a warm sunny day with a breeze coming through. And open kitchen so you can watch your food get cooked. I will be back
author: Čøręÿ Ś.

description:
Complimentary edamame and goldfish pretzels - Yay?! Pacific Catch on Lincoln & 9th is a large restaurant. Both the bar area and the tables for larger parties are accommodating. As long as you are willing to battle for parking spots in lower irving then your'e good to go. It's a popular restaurant and has been on my list to try for a while.

All salads are $13.50.  I had the grilled salmon salad with long beans, shiitake mushrooms, cherry tomatoes, and a miso salad dressing. It also came with fried salmon skin pieces, very similar to fried pork skins. The salmon was juicy and not dry at all! It was a large salad and i only wish there were more long beans and cherry tomatoes in the mix! 

If i'm ever in the mood for an asian/hawaiian/seafood inspired menu i will be sure to come back to try more off the menu.
author: Samantha L.

description:
beautiful location with parking....I don't know how they stay in business.
Service is lact luster....food is one step above painful.  seafood resturant that taste like using frozen fish. waste of prime realistate. Many great resturants in the area...I'd pass on this one.
author: Sharine d.

description: Went for happy hour. Had a good mai Thai. Food was ok, but just shared appetizers with friends. Fun place if you are looking for a quick happy hr
author: Lauren A.

description:
We were searching for a good seafood restaurant and saw this place. Overall, I'm disappointed. The service was slow and awkward, they gave one of us an incomplete menu and didn't bring us back a second one. The restaurant wasnt that busy but I think it was the way the server's stations are spread out so not everyone gets equal attention. 

The food was hit and miss. We had the calamari as the appetizer. These were the smallest calamari I've had and they also mixed it with red bell pepper and lemon. It was satisfying, nice breading but not usual. 

For dinnner, my friend got two tacos... Shrimp and halibut. They came with black beans and a salad which was so so. The fish itself was good but the combination was lacking flavor overall. He wound up eating just the fish. 

I had the California sandwich with salmon. It was an odd combination that didn't fit together. I again took the fish out and at that. The Cole slaw was really bland. It just needed some mayo. 

Overall, I wouldn't go again.
author: Lalena S.

description:
Food here is pretty good, I would say about 4 starts. Minus one star for the ridiculous service, which is really a hit or miss. Never accept a table in the bar side of the restaurant, unless you are okay with being completely and utterly ignored. 

We came here for just a simple lunch, and they seated us in the room with the bar. They handed us menus and disappeared for the next half hour. When we finally flagged someone down and got our order taken and received our food, they never returned. We asked several waiters nearby for some attention, and they all said "Oh I'll check to see on that" and that was that. It seemed no one really knew who was helping us, so we got no service at all. We waited for the check for the longest time, after again asking several workers, and nothing. Finally we asked the bartender, and he came out from behind the bar to help us. I'm pretty sure that wasn't his responsibility. 

A simple quick meal ended up taking up an hour and 45 minutes of our afternoon. The only reason I'm keeping the review at 3 stars, is that service was fine in the actual dining area of the restaurant.

Also, its great that there is a parking lot behind the restaurant, but just be aware that by the time you leave, there will likely be a car parked illegally behind you, requiring you to wait till they return, or try and attempt a 20 point turn. 

There went another 10 minutes of our time.
author: Elyse N.

description: Eh, I live in the Bay Area and I've definitely had better seafood in San Francisco. Service was slow, food was mediocre, prices were a bit high. A pro for this place is that they have a small little parking lot on the side of the restaurant, which is rare in the city! Outdoor seating was nice too, as they also had a fireplace on the side. But other than that, it was overall very mediocre and not a meal to remember.
author: Elsie W.

description:
First timer here with the parents and I must say, not bad. We came in for a late lunch around 1:30 pm on a Tuesday and there wasn't a lot of people. The ambiance was quite nice. I just wished we were sitting in a booth instead of a table close to the kitchen, but that's just me being picky. 

We ordered the wasabi ahi poke bowl, the California salmon sandwich and the mixed fish and chips. My ahi poke bowl was delicious! So fresh and the ahi poke was very flavorful. The wasabi sauce they use was soo good too! My only thing was the proportion to rice to the amount of poke. I had a ton of rice leftover. My mom's sandwich was equally delicious and the sweet potato fries were super crispy. My dad enjoyed his fish and chips too but he mentioned that the regular fries were kinda soggy. The fish, shrimp and oysters were battered just enough and crispy all around.  Prices are on the higher end, but it's seafood. 

Overall, we'll definitely come here again! :)
author: Juvi Anne B.

description: Great place very close to Golden Gate Park.  Fun place to eat with a great menu and casual atmosphere.  A great stop after a visit at the park. I was there with a large group and everything we tried was just awesome!  The service was great, very attentive and knowledgeable.  The place was very busy, but our we felt that we were the only table in the place.  Yeah, service was that good.
author: Majid J.

description:
After driving by and walking by this place so many times, I finally decided to give it a try on a thursday night

Stepped in about 630ish and there was no wait, which was perfect but yet not so much a good thing too? I guess that means the place isn't as popular as i thought?

Ordered:
Poke Trio.
1. traditional - the only perfect one. nice kick to the tuna
2. lomi lomi - i love salmon but it was ruined by the saltiness of the citrus/salt
3. caifornia style - i didnt really taste the crab but it wasn't bad

Taco trio.
1. traditional - tasted ok, the serrano salsa makes it better
2. mahi mahi - the best taco of the three! just tasted perfect
3. cabo shrimp - least favorite one. it just fell apart

grilled corn w/ lime butter - this was probably the best part of the meal. that corn was some of the best corn i've ever had


OVERALL: i'd be back only for the traditional tuna poke and the mahi mahi taco and that corn. but with all the "OK" food i had, all that dragged this review down to a 3 star.
author: Kenny L.

description: Don't dine here unless you enjoy being discriminated against and treated with hostility by families with loud screeching kids and management staff because you ask to move to a quieter table in another dining area and not next to the toilets and storage area. Worst dining experience ever. And the food is totally over rated. The poke with rice bowl is heaps of rice with raw fish that is probably injected with chemicals to keep the color. Sad.. as I took a friend for her first time and it was a disaster. I did my review on Open Table account but Open table didn't post it. This was back in Nov. 2015. They food has declined alot and is overpriced too. not quality fresh ingredients...same at the Marina location which I got takeout a few weeks ago.
author: Barbara I.

description: Rachel was a wonderful server! She made great reccomendations on the Mahi Mahi taco and the Ahi Macadamia nut poke bowl.  All was delicious! :)
author: Emi K.

description:
If this is hard to read, sorry...but this is how I shorten it.

Drinks = Great.  I'm a lemon drop girl...so I like the Yuzu drop.   They make the fufu drinks, a nice bright color of pastels but they're strong.  I'm not a fan of their alcoholic punches though.  They have an awesome drink list though...wines, hard liquors, etc.  

Food = good.  I love their wasabi bowls, their appetizers, and their oysters.  Hey, I hate oysters, but this place gets me to eat 'em!  My bf loves their sandwiches...nice piece of seafood and delicious crispy sweet potato fries.

Service = good.  Refills on water.  Re-order on drinks.  Providing the appropriate plates, silverware.  

Seating = strange during their dinner hour.  Walk-in and reservations available.

Atmosphere = quiet with some music when not packed.  Really noisy when packed, but you can still carry some conversation through it.

Parking = pain, but that's typical in this area.  They do have a very small parking lot, which is generally full, unless you go at 'odd' hours...i.e. around 2 p.m.  


Caveat: Sometimes, they have a bad night, and they forget the drinks, mess up on the menus (i.e. wrong specials menu for every other person), or just a horridly executed entree...

I've been to the location on Chestnut, and it's a really small place, but this one is much bigger, and it's totally new...so I guess some things need time and adjustment.
author: Fannie S.

description:
After many years of refusing sashimi, I've recently acquired the taste for raw fish, so my roommates decided to introduce me to the Hawaiian Poke at Pacific Catch. Wow, and I do mean WOW that is goooooood. Beautifully flavored and pairs well with the chips served in the appetizer dish. We also shared the sweet potato fries, ahi tuna salad, and mahi mahi tacos. Every single dish was so delicious, and even though we were full after our meal, we didn't feel like we were about to explode like we sometimes do after a carb binge.

Service was great and the interior was very well decorated. Made me feel like I was dining at a classy seaside resto (until I looked out the window and saw the traffic instead of the ocean, but whatever).
author: Melinda W.

description: Had a very lovely meal. Waitress was very pleasant. Food was great. Ordered a chicken salad; it was huge and delicious. I shall return.
author: Tianna H.

description:
Pro: It's huge. Pretty clean. Better than average spirit selection. Nice servers. 

Con: Flavors and food quality bland and mediocre. My salmon sandwich was so flavorless. Can't fault a food business of this size/price range but, bummer calories consumed and dollars spent.
author: Catherine C.

description:
I love the food and the service is exceptional. Happy Hour twice a day and they don't skimp on the portions. I've come here over 20 times and I have never been disappointed. Specials are always changing and are always good. Great list of Beers, knowledgable staff, managers remember you, ask how you are, really care. 
Spicy Pacific Martini: 5 stars
Calamari: 5 stars
Ceviche: 5 stars
Spicy Tuna Roll: added avocado. 5 stars
Steak tacos : 5 stars
author: Sabrina M.

description: Have visited numerous times and though I want to love it it's always just ok. The location in the Marina is a world better.
author: Alicia M.

description: Pacific Catch has been consistently OK the dozen or so times that I have dined there. My only wish is that they would offer more options for diners who cannot consume gluten. I always end up having to order the same thing, but at least I have that one safe option.
author: Patricia D.

description: I wish I'd insisted on looking this place up on Yelp first. It's like Mel's: overpriced and not very good and a waste of an eat-out.
author: Michelle G.

description:
After a long flight from the east coast, we were hungry and tired of driving around so we decided to take a chance with Pacific Catch.  What a great choice!

Coming from Hawaii, I was a bit wary of restaurant's "Hawaii" theme and of the poke and other fish items but I was pleasantly surprised by the quality of the food relative to the price.  Entrees range from $10-$20 and everything is fresh and delicious.  Lots of fresh, creative salads, plenty of seafood options, and the food bursts with flavor and color.  

I really enjoyed the salads and the soup of the day which consisted of seafood in a tomato base. The edamame and pretzel Goldfish crackers were very cute, and I also enjoyed the wakame salad and the broccolini. The salmon salad had tons of crispy fried salmon skin and the California Roll salad had plenty of crab salad but without heavy mayo. The fish tacos were very fresh and filling. And the cocktails are phenomenal. 

Service was very good-- the waitstaff were very friendly and welcoming. Also, I'm super glad there is a parking area!
author: Melissa K.

description:
It's been awhile since we've come. We came for dinner, and there was a good size crowd.  Maybe because of their happy hour 4p-6m.  Hubby & I both had a rice bowl with brown rice.  I had the Thai green curry bowl of grilled shrimp, and he had the Korean marinated skirt steak bowl.  Daughter had the crispy shrimp taco plate.  

The Korean bowl was somewhat too sweet for hubby.

We started with the Peruvian ceviche consisting of ono and served with  purple chips which were a bit soggy.

There's a small parking lot; however, we always park inside the GG Park and walk over.
author: Shirley N.

description:
My wife and I knew we made a mistake the minute we sat down but decided to stick it out. 

This is to seafood like Chilis is to Mexican food... except Chilis is ok. We had a really weak rendition of poke and two different but equally forgettable Asian inspired bowls. The rationale for our selections was 'what is the least likely to not be screwed up' if that gives any idea. 

Two stars for the staff and clean facility which should be a given.
author: Easwud C.

description: To the female hostess on shift on Saturday, February 27th at approximately 3:30 pm, you should really consider working in another profession that doesn't involve customer service or dealing with the public. Perhaps you should be a dishwasher or custodian or the person who peels the potatoes in the kitchen, because you have a shitty attitude and really should not be 'greeting' customers. I've NEVER encountered a host/hostess who didn't even bother to say hello or make eye contact upon seeing a large party standing in front of her. Your lackadaisical attitude really spoiled what was supposed to be a pleasant birthday celebration for a family member. This was one of the most UNFRIENDLY experiences I've ever had while dining out.
author: C G.

description: If I could give this 0 stars I would. I just ordered from postmates and I went to eat the poke and it smelled horrible. I started eating it, and there is definitely something wrong with the fish, it tastes terrible, I have to throw it away in fear of getting sick. Not to mention the portion size is sooo tiny, what a rip off for 12.50, I feel like I should get a refund. I will never come here again/hope I don't get sick from the bad fish!
author: Sarah S.

description:
Been here a few times, and I really love the ambiance! I think it's really great that they are open past 10pm. Oh, AND there's a parking lot! Definite plus since it's an absolute pain to find parking in that area during dinner time, and meters in SF are too expensive!

I've gotten the wasabi ahi sandwich a few times, and I really do like it! The wasabi mayo is very good, and it's interesting that they put pickled ginger inside the sandwich. I love sushi ginger, so definite plus for me. The sweet potato fries with sweet chili sauce were very yummy. I had their spicy fries, which were too salty and soggy for me.

Service seems like a hit or miss.. When I went last night, our waiter was very unpleasant. He didn't check on us once during our meal, he walked up to us and just kind of stared at us for a few seconds before asking us to order. After we finished ordering our food, I had to shout after him to ask for a lemonade because he didn't bother asking if we wanted drinks.

By the end of the meal, when we were just kind of sitting there and talking, he walked up to us and just stared at me blankly for about 10 seconds before I just flat out asked "may I please have a box?"

Having worked in a food establishment before, I understand that shifts are long and by the end of the day people are usually just WORN out, but come on.. USE YOUR WORDS!
author: Erica A.

description: One of my favorite places.  And enough booths to get a table since the smaller Pacific Catch in the Marina is sooo crowded at night.  The Rice Bowls are divine and they oblige making mine with Ponzu sauce instead of Wasabi.  This food is satisfying yet will help you drop a few pounds.  Maji maji Tacos with Yam Fries and Seaweed Salad are great for lunch. The Poke is a good starter for dinner and any of the specials or a Rice Bowl makes for a perfectly healthy dinner.
author: Diana M.

description:
Ate here on 3/6/13

Arrived around earlier dinner time (probably 6pm). It was busy but not crowded. We were taken to a table right away and our waiter was over to order our drinks promptly.  

Drinks: I had the Long Coast Tangerine Wheat on Tap while my cousin had a mojito. She said sadly the mojito was not up to par with other places and opted not to have a second.  

We both had the Pan-Asian Rice Bowls.  

I tried the Thai Curry (sauteed eggplant, red bell peppers, green beans, cucumber, onions, toasted coconut, crispy shallots & green curry sauce) with Tofu and Shrimp.  Was a HUGE portion and could easily have been split between the two of us.  It was delicious.  Just enough heat and kick to know it was Thai inspired but not overpowering.  Also had a ton of veggies and the rice underneath seemed to regenerate with every bite. 

Cousin had the Hawaiian Teriyaki (shiitake mushrooms, grilled pineapple, glazed carrots, edamame, crispy sweet onions, sesame seeds & teriyaki sauce) with Mahi Mahi. Said great things about it.  But again HUGE portions. 

Noise level was average, as well as the crowd. The one down would be that our waiter wasnt particularly helpful with the menu when we had questions and seemed a bit tuned out in wanting to answer our questions regarding certain dished. But all in all a pretty good choice for my first night in the city.
author: Alisha H.

description: We sat at the bar on a Thursday for lunch.  If you like Poke, this is a great place to go.  Location is great and the patio with fireplace is perfect any time of the year.
author: Marjorie G.

description:
I couldn't decided between 3 and 4 stars, so I'll just go in between... 3.5 but round down to 3.  Now for me, a 3 star place is somewhere where I wasn't disappointed with, it just wouldn't be my VERY first choice in the area.  However, I did enjoy my visit to Pacific Catch for the most part.

I've heard so much about the sweet potato fries that I just had to try them.  And they didn't disappoint!  Great flavor and good texture (crispy outside, soft inside) with two dipping sauces.  Mmmm.  Definitely one of the better sweet potato fries I've eaten.  We also had the poke appetizer, that was a winner too!

For the main course, I ate the "Rising Sun" roll and my gf ate the "Let's Get Saucy Roll".  Not bad at all.  Our friends ordered the seared ahi bowl to share since they weren't very hungry.  It was a nice touch that they served it in two separate bowls for them.

The atmosphere and environment were really nice...  very clean and a pleasant place to eat.  But the issues that irked me was that it is a little bit pricey and the happy hour specials are only at the bar!  They wouldn't give us the specials at our table even though the place was around half full only.  Booooooo....
author: Jeff C.

description:
At some point in one's life, they will feel the need to eat out a place that's a bit fancier than the little place down the street, but not so fancy that you feel intimidated if you don't dress up in fancy attire.

Pacific catch is a wonderful blend of both worlds.

I had heard some great things about this place, so when some friends were visiting from out of town and wanted to eat out, this cat decided to suggest Pacific Catch as a place to go and check out.

The atmosphere of the place is modern with a rustic, almost tropical feel to it. Relaxing, despite the fact that the day we went was quite crowded and noisy, but being a place with a decent reputation, and a sunday night, this is to be expected.

We were seated by a very nice waitress who served us superbly the entire visit.

We ended up ordering a sushi dish as an appetizer which was very professionally presented, and tasted absolutely amazing. While this place does not seem to be known for sushi, it definitely is some of the best I have had.

I ordered a salmon club sandwich which was wonderful, except there was one problem. One way I judge a place and their sandwiches, is how well the sandwich can stay together. This one was sadly all over the place. The salmon was constantly falling out, ingredients were getting everywhere, I ended up just using a fork to eat it as there was no way I could truly hold the sandwich to eat it. I may be a predator, but I am by no means a drastic messy eater , so this put me off a bit, but the salmon within was cooked perfectly, and the flavor was very pleasant.

Would I come here again? Yes, its a bit on the pricy side, and yes the sandwich was a bit of an issue, but that's just one dish of many that are not "hand held", so I may try something else next time.

And again, the people who work here are incredibly professional and nice. I very much felt welcomed here, as did my friends ^ ^

Good stuff!

*chirp*
author: Jei C.

description: Disappointed that the dining room was pretty empty but it still took 5 minutes for somebody to notice we were standing by the door waiting to be seated. The food more than made up for it though. The boyfriend ordered the seared ahi salad and I had the taco platter (shrimp, mahi and steak for him). Everything was delicious as always. Super fresh fish. The plating of their menu items is always aesthetically pleasing as well. It's no wonder this is one of our favorite neighborhood restaurants.
author: Sarah L.

description:
Pro:
1.Fresh fish always
2. Great customer service
3. Organic
4. Parking
5. The salads are delish and filling. I can never finish it! Leftovers! Yes :D

Con
1. No fresh fruit drinks. It's all concentrated for alcohol
2. The dressing can have too much vinegar, there's no adjusting it.

Tip
The tuna poke salad with brown rice... awesome. 
Check out their PayPal and punch apps. You don't have to wait for the waitress to come take your card, just scan it. You could to her there too. Punch gives you 10% off your 7th purchase.
author: Monica M.

description: Overrated!! I went to this place because people gave them a good reviewed. Honestly, food was so blended and I couldn't taste the freshness of the seafood.  One particular dish: tuna poke I would suggest you NOT to order. You will only able to taste and feel the chilly powder texture ... Service on the other hand was alright and their drink meet the restaurant standard.
author: Chiru C.

description:
Good variety of Pacific Rim seafood dishes.  Their staple dishes are consistently good.  They run seasonal specials. Last summer it was poke, which is now on the main menu.  Now it's crab fest time.  Crab mashed potatoes?  Yum!

We eat here often and haven't been disappointed yet.  

Parking? No problem.  Golden Gate Park is right across the street.  You'll find a spot within walking distance.
author: Florlina A.

description:
Eh - so much hype for this place and it really wasn't allll that. 

It's cute they give you goldfish and edamame to munch on but kinda weird they give a small amount. But then again, you don't want to eat too much!

You MUST MUST MUST order the Hawaiian poke as an appetizer. It was my favorite dish of the night. The wonton chips were perfectly crispy and well cooked (also had a bit of a sweet flavor), and the ahi-tuna was melt in your mouth DELISH! I loved it. 

After the poke though, everything else fell kinda short.

The cabo calamari was good but not unique or better than other calamari dishes I have tried. Calamari is always the standard appetizer, but I say get the Hawaiian poke instead.

I ordered the mixed catch basket, which comes with coconut shrimp, fried oysters, fish, and sweet potato fries. I thought the coconut shrimp was kinda forgettable - something about it didn't wow me. The fish was definitely fresh but like the coconut shrimp, I was "whatever" about it. I did, oddly enough, really like the fried oyster. Maybe it's because it was the only thing in my basket that had tons of flavor? And the sweet potato fries were kinda cold? Or at least, they were not warm. I love sweet potato fries and mine were just bland in a way.

They also don't give you enough sauce for your food.

I'm hoping that maybe I ordered the wrong thing? Or maybe at the wrong time? I would just come back for the Hawaiian poke!
author: Stephanie B.

description:
If it wasnt for the ambience of the place, then it wouldve been a 2star
i just understand what they're trying to do here. 
trying to be a "healthy" choice to eating type of place?
modern seafood?
is it sushi? not really
but i had the poke salad bowl. fish wasnt even fresh.
the yam fries was decent.
left feeling not full and paid too much for dinner

if i wanted raw fish, i would rather go to a sushi place
author: Andi I.

description: Great service and food. The recommendations made by our bartender/server Robin were on point. SF has a lot of options but this is a destination. A1!
author: Todd G.

description:
This place was A-OK. I went with a friend during my visit in San Francisco. He recommended the Pan-Asian Rice Bowls so I gave it a try! I have NO idea why I got the Korean BBQ bowl........wtf? LOL worst place to get a KBBQ bowl....why wasn't I thinking clearly with the poke.. or something seafood.. Anyway I had that and it was very mediocre plus the pricing was XXXXXXPENSIVE! My friend got the Hawaiian Terriyaki and that was alright too...

Next time, maybe sure to order the Japanese Wasabi bowl, the Seared Ahi (MMM) or the Hawaiian Poke!
author: Joyce M.

description:
I usually patronize the Pacific Catch in Campbell, but I was in San Francisco one night and was in the mood for some Asian-seafood fusion, so I thought the Pacific Catch here would be a safe fall-back.

My friend and I were quickly seated, and I ordered the California Salmon sandwich - one of my usual entrees at the Campbell branch. The salmon was slightly dry, the bread was a bit chewier than I'd like, and the spicy fries that arrived with the sandwich were soggy. Meh. Meanwhile on the other side of the table, my friend had the mixed seafood platter and had no complaints, and I also got to sample some of the sweet potato fries for the first time - those are BOMB. We also ordered the Let's Get Saucy sushi roll, which was just dandy (although its pretty hard to screw up sushi).

The service here was decent. Our server was very friendly and had a good sense of humor, but didn't stop by the table very often. Whenever we needed something, we'd spend several minutes trying to flag him down cause he was consistently MIA for long periods of time.

Overall I had higher hopes for this Pacific Catch, especially considering this is San Francisco. I won't be returning and I definitely cannot recommend this location.
author: Felix C.

description:
Review for late night happy hour.

Mediocre food. The best was the wasabi and chipotle sauces for the fried calamari. The sweet potato fries were okay; they were on the soggy side. The 2nd order of sweet potato fries ended up being on the House since we complained about how slow the service was.

Horrible service. The restaurant wasn't even full. We arrived and sat at table hoping that they would clean it once we sat down. Nope. The waiter ignored us for about 10 minutes. Once he came, he just gave us menus and didn't bother to clean the table. If it weren't for his co-worker, our table would have never been cleaned. Anytime we asked him for something he didn't look happy. However, when he was helping another table, he was more amiable. How about treating all customers the same?

Overall nothing notable. Won't be coming back.
author: Kathy W.

description:
After sitting for a few hours in the sun of Speedway Meadows at GGP for a free concert, came here with my good friend, her husband, my boyfriend and daughter. 

I was told that this was the bigger location of the original one down on Chestnut Street. The location is definitely in a very busy area off GGP. Luckily, our friends were already sitting. Service is quick-quick-quick. I love that, especially at a busy eatery. 

My boyfriend and I shared their Baja style fish tacos with sweet potato fries (ick). To eat we shared the Vietnamese Steak sandwich. Their fish tacos are incredible! The batter looked crunchy, but oh no, it was delicate and the fish was not at all fishy. Even with mountain of guacamole on it, you could still catch all of the flavors off the dish. I was completely blown away that I actually tasted an amazing fish taco.

Since my boyfriend and I shared the sandwich, the staff was nice enough to split it in half, as well as split up the regular french fries. Again, I was completely enthralled by their great combination of flavor of siracha aioli (!) and thee most tender steak I have ever bit into. Moreover, their cole slaw, which I normally don't care for, was crispy and not at all drenched in mayo. 

Their prices are a little higher than what I would pay for, but it was so worth it. I would definitely come back if I am in the area.
author: Jamie L.

description:
Pricey but it is seafood and it is fresh!

Get the tuna salad, and ask for poke. It's a huge salad and you will definitely get full despite the lack of carbs.  The salad gets spicier and spicier as you eat it. I think the wasabi dressing creeps in slowly.

The fried oysters are AMAZING too.  It's not overdone and lightly battered. I may return just for the fried oysters.
author: Vanessa K.

description: My favorite joint in San Francisco! Hawaiian poke and a mojito are my goto. This will be my deathrow last meal request some day, and I can't wait!!!!!
author: Jason B.

description: We absolutely love this place!  Dark and stormy's made with kraken rum are the best!  Usually I enjoy the ahi wasabi bowl/salad but tonight chose the dinner specials which included swordfish.  Firm and delicious with perfect flavors!  Just wish I could have ordered the cioppino but it was a special last month.  I also strongly suggest eating at the bar!  They are always the best and friendliest staff.  Lots of fun times to be had!
author: Melina P.

description:
first time came here and I love it.......

We had reservation at 7:30pm but we were15 minutes early.  Good that we got seated right the way.   Parking was a nightmare there.  Make sure you come early to allow yourself to look for parking.

All the staffs were friendly there.  Our server was very nice and friendly but was lacking service toward the end of the meal,  I guess he was too busy with the other big party (15 people).  He was pretty slow and did not refill our water.

The menu was extensive.  There were a lot of varieties that you could choose from.  You can choose from Salad, Rice Bowls, Tacos, Sandwiches, etc...

What we ordered:

Pacific Ceviche Trio ($17) - a sampling of shrimp ceviche, Hawaiian poke & Peruvian ceviche with chips.  It was great.  The portion was good for share.  I really like the purple potato chips.  It was perfect to eat with the poke.  Poke was so fresh and flavorful.  

Sweet Potato Fries ($6) - Portion was big.  The fries was so good.  Thick, crispy outside and soft inside.  It came with ginger wasabi aioli and sweet Thai chili sauces.  I think the wasabi aioli was better with the fries.  

Spicy Tuna Sushi Roll ($8.50) - The sushi roll was huge.  very filling......everything was so fresh.

California Roll ($9.00) - Again, the roll was big.  The crab meat was real crab salad.  Tasty.......

I got the Hawaiian Poke Rice Bowl ($15).  It had tuna, wakame salad, avocado, daikon sprouts, cucumber, ginger, sesame seeds, shredded nori and soy-wasabi sauce.  I agree with other Yelpers.  The portion was huge and had a lot of rice but not much fish.  $15 was a little bit over price.  But the taste was pretty good.   The fish was fresh and flavorful.  I got half brown rice and half salad.  All ingredients were very fresh and tasty.  The only thing is the soy-wasabi sauce was little bit too much.  Kinda of salty to me.

My sister got the Ahi Rice Bowl ($15).  The ingredients were the same as the other rice bowls except the fish.  Ahi was very fresh.  I did not read the menu carefully.  If I knew the Ceviche Trio had poke, I would order Ahi rice bowl instead.

I really wanted to try their mochi for the dessert but I was too full.....Ok, next time!
author: Liza T.

description:
It's taken my partner and I awhile to find a restaurant that we could both get excited about as a favorite. I'm a Lacto-Vegetarian, and he includes fish and eggs. We have many perfect places for either, but not both. This particular day we were parked near 9th in the Sunset, and looking for a place close by because I was on crutches. We headed towards Lincoln, both starving and passing long wait lines outside of every restaurant. We hit the end of the block in front of Pacific Catch and there didn't appear to be a wait so we said why not. Because it wasn't packed we were a bit skeptical. 

When I looked at the menu, my stomach growled! When our meals arrived, mine with grilled tofu and his with fish, both were beautifully presented and tasted great too. I think the biggest surprise was the side salad. It is not at all the norm that you would ususally be served, but large and prepared with sprouts, shitake mushrroms, edaname, cukes, and a delicious miso dressing. 

It's casual, and although some areas are louder than others, you can still carry a conversation. Having returned several more times now, we have our favorite spot that if necessary, is worth waiting for. The service is prompt, helpful and friendly. Substitutions are no problem and the chef really knows how to prepare vegetables.  Everything is reasonably priced.  We also got introduced to the Nojito! The non-alcoholic fresh and minty Mojito that is offered with FREE refills. In JOY!
author: Bobbi Jo F.

description: I think this is the best restaurant in the neighborhood.  Really like how the fish is prepared here and like to order from the specials.  I also say that they have the best sweet potato fries in the city.  This place is child friendly with a good selection on the children's menu.  When one sits down they give a small plate of pretzels and edamame to snack on while waiting for the food.  Kids love this finger food.  Also, there are chopsticks at the table as well as Western cutlery.   We have never had any complaints about the service nor prices.  I would recommend this restaurant to anyone who wants to know where to eat in the Inner Sunset.
author: Kay P.

description:
Yummy poke!

Great customer service. Made reservations earlier & got seated promptly.
My best friend and I sat down while we waited of two others in our party.  The waitress served us appetizer finger foods- edamame and pretzel goldfishes - while we waited & even gave us another serving per request!

Ordered the poke trio:
1. Ahi Serrano - my fave, I love spicy food, & very light & fresh
2. California Style - a little too creamy for my taste but refreshing with a hint of lemon
3. Ahi Macadamia - something about the onions and the macadamia nuts that just pairs so well together! 

Overall, variety of fresh poke!
author: Alyssaaa S.

description:
This is a solid fish place, and perhaps has a special place in my heart since my boyfriend took me here on our first date. We've been back many times since.

I like the fish sandwiches. Ahi tuna one is great. I am alway sure to get it with the sweet potato fries.

I also really like the fish and chips and ceviche. I find the sushi rools to be delicious!
author: Rebecca D.

description:
Shrimp or Chicken Tacos with a side of sweet potato fries and Racer 5 IPA...what more do you need when sitting at the bar watching a Giants game or Warriors basketball.  This is one of my go to spots for a not so sports bar with good food.  

The bar staff are always fun and attentive.  I've spent time in the dinning area, but to be honest I prefer to bar area.  It's a little more upbeat and relaxed. This is also a great spot to dine outdoors and bring your pet.  [

I do recommend sticking with the tacos and the appetizers are great, however, the sushi not so much.
author: ERICA G.

description:
Bad service and rude waiters 


I'm a big fan of Pacific catch but this location is the worst experience I had! About 2 weeks ago after the academy of science visit I decided to go there with 3 of my friends and we all were disappointed. 

First the server was rude, and looked like he hated working there. 2nd the food took forever Even though there was only 3 tables with customers, so it wasn't busy. We asked the waiter whats going on with our food, then he started mugging us plus all the food didn't come out at the same time, took another 10 for my plate to come out while my friends are eating already..3rd and last the food wasn't as good as I expected, the soup of the day was awful and too much spices! Overall I'm never going back there...

2 stars for the clean environment and their good salamon I stole from my friend because my plate wasn't good that's all
author: Zohan E.

description: Food was fair. Service was good. Though my girlfriend and I got sick after our meal.  The manager was nice enough to follow up for us.  Very good customer service.
author: May F.

description: Our service was terrible. My poke bowl was sitting forever on a pound of hot rice so it was weirdly warm and boyfriends was super cold. Our sodas were even watered down. Super cute outside and inside but not worth it.
author: Macy M.

description:
4 1/2 years later...and I return!
Came here today to celebrate my mom's bday for lunch. Had no problem making a reservation on Opentable. 
This location is larger than some of the other PC's I've seen and has a nice, modern and casual atmosphere. Our waitress was very friendly and attentive and our dining experience was very nice overall.
We started with the Korean sticky ribs (yummy and finger licking good)! I had the chicken and steak island tacos after for my meal. The tacos were good (better flavor than I remember from last time) and were filling. Also had a Foursquare newbie check in special for a free dessert. We had the chocolate macadamia nut brownie sundae (my least favorite part of the meal...pretty dry and not very moist-but it was free).
Overall the food and service was good. I'd recommend this place for asian fusion or seafood if in the area. Nice place for small groups or a date.
author: Miss H K.

description: Nice place, good food , 1/2 price bottle of wine on Tuesday !
author: Kiko W.

description: Sit at the bar. The bartenders are wonderful. Best service in the house!  Happy hour is amazing for food!  Love this place!   :-))
author: Daniel A.

description:
I have an unhealthy obsession with salmon. Well, I guess not that unhealthy if you take into account the omega-3s but seriously, I always crave it. And thus, I LOVE Pacific Catch's Japanese rice bowl with grilled salmon. Everything (avocado, seaweed, veggies) is fresh, and the salmon is cooked perfectly. Plus, it's big enough that I usually eat it over two meals.

I've also had the Hawaiian poke, and it's delicious - fresh and light.

I saw some complaints w/service here - whenever I've been it's definitely bustling, but I've never experienced any delays. Last time, the kitchen made an extra order of sweet potato fries, so the server gave it to my friend and I gratis! Heart.
author: Laurel K.

description: Fresh food and reasonable prices. I am a big fish fan and this satisfied my appetite.
author: Kyle P.

description: Always a good standby - the fish tacos are excellent, and they have great cocktails.
author: Jackie O.

description:
Date & Time: Thursday, 9 pm
Reason For Going: 9th Annual Dine Out For Life (25% of your bill goes to STOP AIDS Project)
Company: The BFF
Rating: 2.5 stars (I don't think I will ever eat at PC again. especially at this location.) 

Hostess was wonderful (enthusiastic, friendly) but our waitress clearly hated her job. Service was horrid--it took forever to order, we were basically neglected (checked on once right before we were done eating), water glasses filled once (again, pretty much at the end of the meal.) I don't expect any server to be Little Miss Sunshine (especially at the end of their shift) but please save the curt, one word answers & annoyed look for when you're fighting with your bf, not when you're dealing with a customer. 

Food was boring, uninspired, unseasoned--the artichokes were begging for flavor & the sweet potato fries were nothing without the dipping sauces (which were brought out only when I asked for them...u mean if I didn't ask for sauce, I would have been stuck w/ boring fries?! Boring fries are a no-no!) 

We ordered chicken wings which were brought out way after our entrees, so they graciously took it off the bill. Our entrees were lukewarm (pretty much the same way I felt about the entire dining experience with the exception of my best friend's company which is always 10 stars.) BBQ salmon for me, hawaiian themed escolar for him. Both very blah. The only thing that kept me from giving 1 star is the fact that the entire bill was about $41. 

The only positive thing that came out of dinner was being able to catch up with my friend & doing a small good deed at the same time.
author: Fancypants X.

description:
Quite honestly, I don't know what this restaurant is trying to serve...on the table, there was soy sauce, Vietnamese hot sauce, Tabasco, ketchup, and 1 more sauce that I now have forgotten (I think it might have been A-1).  It was all over the place and so was the menu... they have a WIDE selection ranging from Fish & Chips, to Sushi, to Tacos, to Hawaiian styles Mahi-Mahi and much much more.  They serve Thai Iced Tea, and have Margaritas if you want.  

I just think they are trying too hard.  Be a Fusion.  Be a Fish & Chip. Be something unique.  All I can say is that it's all over the place... and when you have your too many eggs in a basket, it breaks.  You sacrifice quality.  You sacrifice taste. I was disappointed.  

Dishes for lunch range from $8 for a sandwich (yeah, they serve that too) to $15 for grilled fish.  Not cheap.
author: Jannie Q.

description:
i am seriously trying to go on a diet, so I have been trying to pick restaurants that serve fish or delicious salads! Looking at the pictures for Pacific Catch literally made me DROOL. The pictures of their food looked oh so good, I couldn't wait to try it ! 

Came here on a Friday with my boyfriend and were seated fairly quickly. It's so cute! Right when you sit down, they bring out a little tray with Goldfish Pretzels and Edamame. Weird combo, but I was dying of hunger so I ate it and it tasted fine. I looked at the menu for days before deciding what I really wanted. Be aware, the cost of the food is pretty pricy, but in all honesty, it is worth the money! I would definitely pay this amount to eat the food from here again! 

I got the "California Salmon Sandwich" with a side of salad and the bf got the "Traditional Baja Tacos" (I think?)...but Anyway I was debating between that and a rice bowl. I went with the sandwich and boy was I delighted once it came out. The salmon looked so PINK and FRESH! It was cut in a certain way so that every bite I took, I was able to gather the taste of everything in the sandwich. Also it was easy to bite into! It was such a big surprise to me how fresh the fish was. Usually, most restaurants serve a stingy amount of salmon and it is dry and not fresh at all. GAWD. It was so good! The cole slaw was even good with it and I hate cole slaw. The salad was such a plus too! I couldn't help but notice the couple sitting next to me with their "Hawaiian Poke" bowls!!! That looked awesome too! I super duper want that next time! 

Everything was GOOD GOOD GOOD! LOVE it! Coming back to try more freshness! 

oh yea this place definitely reminds me of Yard House. I don't know why, I couldn't tell if this place served American, Asian Fusion, Americanized Asian errr what. Whatever just as long as they satisfy my hunger I'm all about that!
author: Katrina T.

description:
Don't let the negative service reviews get you down from coming here. The food is deliciousssss and the location is very convient for anyone spending a day around the Golden Gate Park area.
