I ordered the Poke Three Ways, which was a lunch special during the month of March. The chef had created a whole lot of new poke flavors so there was lots to choose from. I opted for the Californian, Shrimp and the traditional Hawaiian. The special came with a snow pea + enoki sautee, a daikon salad and a bed of sticky rice. I also got a thai iced tea which was delish!

My favorite poke was actually the traditional. Had the right amount of spice from the chillies and the ahi was incredibly fresh. The californian was my second, which was essentially a deconstructed californian roll with ahi, crab, mayo, tobiko and avocado. The shrimp was also very good and had a great sesame and garlic sauce. I also really enjoyed the daikon salad which was had a great bitter and tangy balance that contrasted the fish nicely. My only complaint was the portion might be a bit large for a lunch and the rice was a tad on the dry side (might have not been as fresh as I liked). 

Service was great and everyone from the greeter to the waitress was very friendly. Solo diners fear not cause I never felt odd eating alone ! This location is very spacious so I think getting a table wouldn't be an issue if you beat the rush. Sure $21 is a little pricey for a lunch, but for the amount of fresh fish you get its a steal!

Update: According to the manager, the poke three ways is available till May 5th! Get it while you can yelpers!
author: Shiori M.

description:
My friend and I decided to come here for dinner on a Friday night. We decided to sit near the bar area because we would have to wait 15 mins for the next dining table. No biggie for us, I don't mind where I sit.

What I ordered:

Fruit punch (alcoholic cocktail) $9.50: Vodka with various types of fruit juices. This drink was STRONG! My face was red and I was pretty buzzed. I guess if I can feel the alcohol from one drink, it is worth the $9.50 you pay for it because you actually get alcohol in it, none of that watered down drinks at other places.

Thai Coconut Shrimp $13:  7 pieces of jumbo shrimp with coconut shaving batter, deep fried and with the sweet chili sauce.... mMMmm nom nom nom. My friend ordered this appetizer and I was a little hesitant. A lot of restaurants end up giving you small shrimp with crappy battered textured. This was pretty good, you can taste the actual coconut shavings, the batter was light and crispy and the shrimp was bigger than I thought it would be. I was happy with this dish.

California Salmon $12:  This is where I wasn't too happy. This dish came with a side of coleslaw (that wasn't really good) and a side of fries ( I picked the sweet potato fries). The sweet potato fries was good until it got cold and soggy, I recommend you eating it as soon as you get them! As for the sandwich, I was disappointed with it. You get a slice of salmon that you can't even see at all, but can taste it. I swear the slice of the salmon was the thickness of 10 sheets of paper... not the filet that you would expect from a salmon sandwich. The bread was not toasted and so it was cold and not warm and crispy. I think texture is key when making a sandwich, you get the lettuce, tomato, avocado and salmon (all of which have a moist texture -- except the lettuce) and you want the bread to add a different texture... this is just me, I like my bread warm and crispy. As for flavor, it had enough flavor and it was actually tasty, just sad that the main attraction in this sandwich was nowhere to be seen.

Service was great! The lady came by quite often to make sure our water will filled and to make sure we were ok. Overall, the food was ok and the service was great.  I would give 3.5 stars if Yelp let me....
author: Erica T.

description: I am a super big fan of the California Roll Salad, which had TONS of real crab on it - made my meal special.
author: Andrew K.

description:
Yayyyy the only kitchen that is open in the Sunset on Fridays and Saturdays! 12pm woohooo!!!

After Izakaya Sozai completely SCREWED our reservation, we were frustrated AND hungry. Not a good combo. 

So for walkin in around 11:30pm on a friday, they have some pretty good deals on their "Bar Bites" happy hour until midnight...not too shabby.

+Agave Margarita $6
+Warm Edamame $4
++++Peruvian Ceviche
-Thai Coconut Shrimp (they were just okay)
- - Cabo Calamari (soggy, stringy, not impressive)

+Hawaiian Poke - $9.5 Worth it!

Conclusion: If I ever get screwed like that again, and really hungry late at night after a ravenous night of drinkin' it's alright to make an exception.
author: Julia D.

description:
Price & Quality - The prices here are a bit high, not for the amount they give you but for the quality of the food. I've simply experienced better. Pretty basic cooking. The only thing that stands out to me is their coffee which is delicious. 
Service- The waiters are always very nice. No complaints.
Atmosphere- Place can be lively, not a bad atmosphere.

Will I come back? At the end of the day, the food is what matters and the food here is simply lacking for my taste, so no (been here about 4 times).
author: Moises L.

description:
It took 30 minutes to get a glass of wine and longer to order. Food came to our table we didn't order then after we touched it, the server came by and took it to another table. That's nasty, baby. 

They need to look around the neighborhood. The bar is raised a lot and they need to step it up or move out. They also don't get it when we keep asking them to bring the kids food out with the adult food. They keep bringing it early and the kids are done and climbing the walls when we get our food. 

If a place does this, I honestly think they should comp the meal since we want the families to "share a meal" together. Even better, we should have the server sit at our table and see what is going on - they obviously do not have kids.
author: James T.

description:
I brought my husband and 3 sons here who are all (well maybe minus the 1 and 2 year old) complete snobs about their fried fish.  I convinced them it was going to be good based on one experience I had at the Marina Pacific Catch location.  The Asian fusion aspect was throwing them a bit but in the end my recommendation was whole heartedly appreciated.  We each got the 4 piece fish (hubby and teen had regular fries, I had the sweet potato ones).  The only reason this review is not for 5 stars is because the sweet potato fries, though tasty, could have been so much better!  And they were the first time I had them at the Marina location so, who knows, maybe I just got the bottom of the barrel on 9th.  

Highlights:  the fish is perfectly seasoned, battered and fried, not overly greasy at all
Loved the complimentary edamame and goldfish pretzels as did my 1 and 2 year old (thank you very much!!!). The jalapeño tartar kicks butt and it isn't overly spicy at all as the server assured us.  I LOVE spicy food, I eat raw jalapeños but my husband and teenager aren't into spicy but they liked the sauce too.

Last but not least great service, location and ambiance and we came on a busy Saturday afternoon to boot!
author: A H.

description: Only been here during happy hour, but from what I've experienced at the bar, the food, drinks, and service are great. I came with just one other person and we ordered four snack items from the happy hour menu. We were surprised at how generous the servings were. My favorite item that we had was the sweet potato fries. My friend had the ahi poke salad, and while I'm poke is not my fave, I thought it was delicious. I'll definitely be back for dinner soon!
author: Zherr-Anne A.

description: Great large place, great for large parties.  Very friendly staff.  This is our go to place at least once a month.  Their fish is just so fresh, they usually have specials so try those too.  I mostly get their spice rubbed fish tacos - hit the spot every time.  We also get their bowls - curry is good but spicy.  Their salmon rolls are very good.  You have the option for sweet potato fries which is a nice change.  Good beer and wine selection - mixed drinks are a hit or miss.  Park in the park nearby if you don't get street parking.
author: Ketan D.

description: Awesome food and good service especially with it being my first time here! They're currently under construction but still open for business. I had the Hawaiian Teriyaki with Grilled Chicken and I loved it! Everything was fresh and cooked just right! Prices are fairly decent but you do get what you pay for and the portions are good as well. The location is in a fairly busy area so parking is a hassle but the space itself is great and very well maintained. Overall, an enjoyable experience!
author: Shaniah M.

description:
I had high expectations for this place after perusing the menu online.  Since I am on a strict clean eating diet to determine some food allergies, I thought this would be a good place to go.

I ordered the Grilled Salmon salad which said it had these ingredients - salmon, green beans, shiitake mushrooms, tomatoes, crispy salmon skin "croutons", citrus-miso dressing. I had the dressing on the side and removed the fried salmon skins (there was way too much...) so it would just be veggies and salmon.  However, after I started eating it, something felt off.  The mushrooms and green beans tasted as if they have been coated in some slick oil.  Somehow there was salad dressing in my salad even though I asked for it to be on the side. The salmon was grilled with the same slick oil that made my digestive system act up for the remainder of the night.  

My husband also had the grilled salmon special. And guess what. He also had his tummy act up for the night as well.

Anyway, it was not a pleasant experience and wished we had gone to the other tons of restaurants in the Inner Sunset. I guess the lesson learned here is to explicitly ask if the ingredients in a salad are raw or coated in something... (Usually when I get a salad the ingredients are raw veggies unless they specifically say its not!)

Pros - 
- Service was great with a very attentive server 
- The restaurant is spacious and good for groups
- There was no wait to be seated even though the place was getting crowded

Cons -
- Parking is tough on the weekends around this area.  We parked a few blocks away
- Food is not super high quality for seafood
author: Lucy C.

description:
The first time I came here I ordered one of their wasabi bowls.  It was nothing special and I left unfulfilled.  I came here recently since I thought that maybe I just ordered the wrong thing.  I had the mahi mahi island taco, and while it was way better than their bowl, the combination of sauces was just kind of weird.
I don't think I'll come back for a third try.  Plus, their cutting fee for cakes is ridiculous!
edit: so my cutting fee was charged the first time I came here, which was a while back.  I received a message from the marketing manager, and apparently they don't charge a cutting fee anymore.
author: Karen L.

description: The good thing about this location is the parking-- it's still not good but it beats trying to find parking on Chestnut! The food here is exactly like the location on Chestnut, always consistent and fresh. I love how this location never has a wait! Be sure to check out their Cabo shrimp tacos, ahi tuna bowl, sweet potato fries, coconut shrimp, calamari and fried oysters! But skip the dungeons crab chowder-- totally not worth it!
author: Tiffany U.

description:
So we've passed by this place probably more times than we should have and NOT tried it. We pass by it to go to the Park, or eat a different places on 9th, but one night, when deciding where to go for dinner instead of cooking, we decided to come here. 

Coconut shrimp was delicious beginning of our meal. The shrimp seemed to have been coated in breadcrumbs and coconut shreds and the boy doesn't like coconut, but ate these shrimp up. They were really good. 

I ordered the salmon sandwich, it's quite a big portion, but damn it was good. the sauce they have on it, OMG. so good. I go the sweet potato fries - great choice.  He ordered the japanese wasbi bowl with poke - which i learned is so popular in hawaii and is just soy sauce marinated tuna...or something like that. Definitely delicious. 

Really wished we got dessert, but we were so full afterwards, we could barely walk. Great meal, great service, pretty good prices.
author: Nina Y.

description: Amazing Hawaiian poke. Get the trio to taste a few different kinds! Service is wonderful too.
author: Chris S.

description:
Great seafood!  We came with the kids in tow and we all found something great on the menu.  The salmon chowder is a must have! 

I will definitely come again!
author: Marianne A.

description:
The continuity of the restaurant's menu leaves me a bit baffled.  Is the inspiration for Pacific Catch American, UK, Japanese, Thai, or Mexican?  Even the appetizer they serve to each table, pretzel goldfish juxtaposed with edamame, is confusing.  The menu ranges from Thai coconut soup to fish and chips to tacos to sushi.  

The fish has always tasted fresh, and the portions are big, with prices being reasonable.  I have always ordered the wasabi bowls, which are obviously chirashi inspired.  

Regardless of inspiration, the unifying theme at Pacific Catch is clearly fresh fish and seafood.
author: Sandy K.

description: The place and the dishes looks good, all fresh and nice, taste wise I would give them 2 stars
author: Nadav H.

description:
We had a rice dish and I had th "choose 3" variety poke plate that allowed for 3 choices from I think a dozen, and it was love at first bite.

Smart, clean, classy, hip, this is wonderful. Excellent service, informed staff, we were just impressed beyond anything. WOW! Among the best fish places across the USA!
author: Mark B.

description:
My friends and I decide that every time we decide to eat out, we need to try a new place. My friend suggested this place, we gave it a shot.

For starters, we tried one of their chalkboard specials. It's a Poke, forgot exactly what's called, but it's calamari poke. It was so good! Then I ordered their Island Tacos, for some reason, I went with their 3-taco platter just like what my friend got. It's pretty awesome that you can mix and match so we tried the Traditional Baja, Mahi Mahi and Cabo Shrimp. My friend finished the entire plate plus his side salad. I didn't =( but I ate all the shrimp and fish just not the tortilla. It was good though, next time I will remind myself that I don't have a huge appetite like my friends do and order 2 tacos maybe :P
My other friend who happens to be my boyfriend got the Pan-Asian Rice Bowl. He got the Japanese Wasabi bowl with Grilled Salmon. I personally didn't taste it, but he said it was too rich, although the salmon was still pretty good. 

Server was friendly and attends very well to our needs. Great experience! Can't complain and I will definitely go back. =)
author: Czarina Y.

description: Gluten Free, awesome.  They had a beautiful menu.  I had curry salmon with rice and bell peppers.  It was excellent.  Very customer friendly.  I am definitely coming back every time I visit San Francisco.
author: Dawn P.

description: Happy Hour at Pacific Catch is the bomb!   Our bartender Adam not only knew his stuff mixing marvelous mai tais, but he was super fun with his "cork toss" game.  I got a large plate of sweet potato fries and a steak taco for only 3 bucks each.  My group got ahi tuna, ceviche, sushi, and everything was super fresh and delicious.  The happy hour is only from 4-6p Monday through Friday, so I suggest making a bee-line to hit this spot!   You won't regret it!
author: Marie B.

description:
This review is of the food only. Service was sub par. 

Visiting from Houston for the first time and wanted to get some seafood. Unfortunately when we went they were not serving ahi tuna but we improvised. Ordered the pitcher of blueberry mojitos which tasted like heaven. Freshest mojito I have ever had. Then we got the calamari to start, and ended up ordering some fish tacos and Thai shrimp curry and added chicken. Let me just say, those mahi mahi tacos are life altering. Seriously the best fish taco I've had in my entire life. The Thai curry had an amazing flavor as well and they did not skimp on the meats. I would highly recommend this place to anyone visiting from out of town who wants to try something delicious.
author: Amanda H.

description:
4 stars for food, 5 stars for cocktails. 

I've tried several different entrees by now and I still think the island tacos are the best thing on the menu. As for dessert, the fried dulce de leche "spring rolls" are definitely worth trying! They are served with vanilla ice cream and caramel sauce. 

Service is usually good. Sometimes the place will get crowded (and loud), but if you plan ahead, you can make a reservation. 

The restaurant is within easy walking distance from the museums in Golden Gate Park.
author: Gloria B.

description: Came here from out of town for my Birthday yesterday. We came not knowing anything about the place, we just knew it was a convenient location (right by the park/gardens) The service was great and the food was too!!! They went out of their way to make me feel special on my Birthday, I really appreciate that cause they didnt have to.
author: Jasmine A.

description:
The food is great here! I must say though, the quality of the rice bowls are better at the Marina location. This location has some inconsistent service. Two weeks ago we had the most amazing service by Chelsea, tonight......below average. Most notably, when a customer asks a suggestion of wine and the server brings you one, what do you think happens if you don't like it?  Yes!  They should take it off the bill, or offer another drink. This did not happen.  "oh! I should have given you a taste first"....does not work. I'm not the type to bring it to the manager's attention.  The server should KNOW this basic rule of customer service. All of us skipped dessert, it definitely was a memorable birthday dinner.
The ahi wasabi rice bowls and the Peruvian ceviche is why I come back!
author: Jodie S.

description: Great Food and great service. Daniel, Charles, an Robin provided us great service at the bar during Happy Hour. Their reviews of the food was spot on and as a result we had a great time.
author: Paul D.

description:
In terms of a family-kiddo-friendly restaurant where you can chow down on fresh fare, wash down with a cocktail, stretch out with elbow room, receive attentive service,  IN SF,  I'd say 5-Stars :)

This time, I had the Salmon sandwich and it was very good. Coffee was nice and dark, in a large, modern-style mug and saucer, re-filled nicely. Hubbie had 3 tacos and they hit the spot.

I like this Pacific Catch, specifically. The one in Marin is lousy ... food-wise, ambience-wise, service-wise.
author: Kimbalee W.

description: Love love loved this place! I was really craving a great salmon dish and they had the perfect one here. I was beyond satisfied and highly recommend this place!
author: Ashley Z.

description:
Many years ago, there was a small seafood restaurant on Chestnut called Pacific Catch. Ate there and was hooked. I now know of two others-one in Corte Madera, and one on 9th and Lincoln in SF. I frequent the 9th Ave. place the most. 

It is consistently good. How many places can rate this remark? I often order the Ahi Tuna Rice Bowl over Brown Rice and greens. Delish! Never a bad piece of Ahi. My wife enjoys Wild Salmon Teriyaki Bowl. I sometimes splurge on their Sweet Potato Fries. Outstanding! This was the first restaurant where I had this dish. Now most places have it on their menu.

Service is professional and prices are reasonable. Decor is cool, yet friendly. My only complaint is this place does get a bit noisy at times. There is a bar off to one side and it can get rowdy. 

I still give it 5 stars, mostly for the consistent food quality.
author: Howard S.

description:
Great space to go with guests for a delicious and easy-going dinner!

Our party of 4 had 3 dinner entrees, one calamari appetizer and four drinks for under $100.00. Not too shabby for a nice night out with great food!
author: Em L.

description: Our food was really good!  The crab wonton appetizer was so good and liked by all that we placed a second order.  Great seafood, close to Golden Gate Park.
author: Evi G.

description:
2 Stars (for parking in the back)

Big place (nice inside) which offers small tiny portions, overpriced, bad waitress...need I say more?

The menu offers little variety.

$10 for ceviche, which had 5 pieces of shrimp, half a handful of half broken chips.

$10 on a small plate of itty bitty calamari (calamari was about the size of a dime) and there was a whole bunch of peppers and onions mixed in to the plate to make it seem like it's a bigger portion. 

The waitress didnt bother to ask if we needed any thing else, didnt bother to re-fill our drinks, NOTHING. 

Pacific Catch, please re-train your staff and offer a legitimate amount of food for the price and while you're at it, add more to your menu. 

Thanks!
author: Annette F.

description:
Always drove by and wanted to try this place out. The chance came when my friend decided to have his birthday dinner here. If I remember correctly, it was a Saturday night around 7pm. I live on the other side of the park and drove straight through 8th Avenue (Richmond side)...Surprisingly; I found parking in the front immediately!  
My friend made reservations couple days prior to the dinner. We were seated right away. It wasn't practically busy..They had a special going on- Dungeness Crab sandwich (Dungeness season just opened) I decided to go with that..It was pretty damn fresh and good.
author: Christopher L.

description:
Came here for Restaurant Week on a Thursday night.  Three courses - $40 each, which included appetizer, entree, and dessert.  They offered two choices for each course.  

Crab chowder was flavorful and rich and the poke was excellent.  Quality of the poke was above average; a bit sinewy but otherwise excellent with the crunchy strips.

Crab was excellent, not a lot of meat but the flavors were very good. The sole was probably the best; cooked perfectly, seasoned well and sauce was perfect.  Paired with mashed potatoes and broccolini which was cooked well.  Their food is cooked really well - not over or under.  Something a lot of restaurants don't do well.  

Had both the brownie with ice cream which was super rich and I needed a glass-of-milk type of richness.  The dulce de leche "spring roll" was excellent; not overly sweet and went well with the ice cream.  It probably just needed a little crunch but otherwise, an excellent dessert.

Two people - $40 each, couple of beers, about $110.  Not too bad for a VERY filling meal.  Would definitely come back to try their sushi and other menu items.  Highly recommended!
author: Lester C.

description:
It looks like the type of place that cares more about décor and location than food ...  I was happy to be proven wrong.

The drink menu is delicious ... I had the Dark & Stormy ... and the part that I got to drink before spilling it all over the entire dining room was quite tasty.  Fred and Gail both got some guava cocktail that they were both raving over as well.

We shared some fries, got the poke (which was well prepared, well seasoned and was top quality ahi ... but in giant 1 inch cubes ... I would have enjoyed it much more if the tuna was cut smaller).

I got the Ahi house salad- which was pretty average - but I think priced appropriately.  My friends also seemed to have enjoyed their mahi mahi and sandwich.  I'd be back ... for appetizers and drinks and to people watch the folks heading in or out of the park.
author: Kathleen W.

description: I've been eating here for about 4 years now and sad to say the quality is really gone down and the service was horrible. I recommend some college should I go to lunch there yesterday and was severely disappointed had the Pokey fishy old service was horrible she barely even said hello to us sad to say probably will not be going back
author: Pug O.

description:
Good tofu salad, except some of my lettuce was brown.. =(

Their dressings were great, and they had decent sweet potato fries. They also had some of the best seaweed salad I've eaten in a long time. Kudos.
author: Emily D.

description:
I went  for Saturday afternoon late lunch. This place changed a lot since Art Cafe. It now has a warm modern, comfortable, and casual decor. You are surrounded by hints of fish artwork and cute blue bottle lights hang from the ceiling. 

Menu is quite interesting. Menu has seaweed and hints of wasabi here and there. Reminds me of Hawaii.

I had the:
JAPANESE WASABI Pan-Asian Rice Bowl (my choice of brown rice  1/2 &  1/2 greens)
(wakame salad, avocado, daikon sprouts, cucumber, ginger, sesame seeds, shredded nori & soy-wasabi sauce-Hawaiian Poke) 

I was so surprised, how delightful and well balanced this bowl was. Brown rice was super moist. I think there was miso dressing for the salad and it actually blended very nicely with everything else. The Hawaiian Poke was fresh and a good amount was provided.

Also had the:
Crispy Oyster Basket (Pacific Coast oysters with jalapeño tartar)

Hooray!!! Fat Oyster and good batter. Fresh and delicious. Another pleasant surprise. I was expecting peanut sized oysters, but they were size of buffalo wings. It was goooooooood. 

I definitely want to go back and try other dishes. Or just eat the rice bowl and oysters.
author: Janice T.

description: I have lived in the neighborhood for many years, but had never eaten at Pacific Catch.  Firstly, the service was amazing.  We were seated almost immediately upon our arrival (granted it was 4pm on a Saturday).  Amanda was great, her service was fast and on point.  My partner and I shared the spicy tuna rolls which were amazing.  We also shared the Wasabi Ahi Sandwich along with the the Spicy Mahi Mahi Sandwich.  To drink I had the blood orange margarita (I highly recommend it).
author: Giovanni G.

description:
LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE THIS PLACE!

1. Tasty food (I'll get into that below)
2. Great atmosphere
3. Friendly servers, bartenders, & owners
4. Great happy hour specials! Even late night!!

All ingredients to win a spot as one of my favorite restaurants!!

FOOD FAVs: 
Hawaiian Poke - sushi-grade ahi tuna in a sesame-soy marinade with wonton crisps
House Cured Sake Salmon - nori rice cakes, wasabi creme fraiche & black tobiko caviar
Sweet Potato Fries Basket - "signature" fries
Fried Dulce de Leche "Spring Rolls" - with vanilla ice cream & caramel sauce 

Happy Hour
4:00pm - 6:00pm, Monday through Friday
10:00pm - close, nightly

I've seen Pacific Catch participate at a ton of local events like the SF Weekly DISH and the Yelp Unwrapped Holiday Party and it's always been a big hit!  They really love their local customers and it shows when you talk to the staff either at these events or in their restaurant.

Now, I'm just patiently waiting till they open one up in the East Bay =)
author: Elaine L.

description:
I was drawn here by the Hawaiian Poke at the Yelp Holiday Party and decided to come with a couple of friends. We got, as expected, the Hawaiian poke as an appetizer and somehow we all ended up ordering more tuna for our main course: the Ahi 3-Way for me, an Ahi Wasabi Bowl, an Ahi Salad... etc. (Which really took the waiter aback. I don't blame him.)

Why did we do this? We were basically looking for more raw fish, more innovations in the same ballpark as the Poke. Not finding it we all settled on seared Ahi or the Poke, which was as raw as it gets. And it turns out, it's kind of a one trick pony. I found my Ahi 3-Way to be pretty disappointing. It was a wad of rice, a wad of poke, a wad of seaweed salad, a wad of seared ahi in one style and another wad in another style. I found it pretty uninspired and pretty uncohesive.

It was also pretty expensive: $17.95 for what did not amount to $17.95 worth of fish (and as you know, rice is basically free for restaurants.)

So, maybe next time I should just leave it at Hawaiian Poke for the appetizer and try their catch of the day or seasonal special. I will see about returning and updating my review.
author: Josh K.

description: A finer version of Aqui. Nothing spectacular about Pacific Catch. It's a chain with dependable quality, though the service was slow when we went, and the food is good.
author: David M.

description:
Not bad. Pretty commercial - a safe place to bring out of towners or your grandparents. The seasonal crab melt was excellent and the sweet potato fries were very good. The ahi salad was quite tasty too, just a little slim on the tuna. Very cute that they serve pretzel fish crackers and shelled edamame (kind of unsanitary!) while you wait for your food. 

Note: there is a lot specifically for the restaurant off of Lincoln going east right after 9th st. We missed this and paid at a lot off of 9th. Boo. Another note - this location is right on the fringe of Golden Gate park, so easy to take a walk over there after you eat!
author: Lisa H.

description:
I come here a few times a month. Awesome place... as long as you order the right items (I'm gonna tell you which, don't worry). 

For appetizers, I recommend the Hawaiian Poke (4 stars) or the Fried Oysters (3.5 stars). You can get the oysters with fries (I recommend the yam fries - ask for a side of Chili-Pepper sauce, you'll love it). 

For main, I'd go with a Wasabi Bowl; my favorite: Hawaiian Poke (5 stars) with brown or sushi rice (both good). If you've never tried it, get it; it's unique to Pacific Catch and it's awesome. For a lighter alternative, try their salads: House Special Salad with salmon (4.5 stars) OR the Salmon Salad (4.5 stars) OR the Thai Steak salad (4 stars). 

For dessert, get the caramel Spring Roll (4.5 stars)- it's on the sweeter side, but it's delicious.
author: Eugene M.

description:
the food here is OK Average...

this place is here for tourists i think. me and my friend came here thinking it would be a nice Asian fusion restaurant .we were sure wrong it its a mixture of seafood and i think you call it Asian.

the free snake they give out are already open Meade and pretzel fish snacks.
i order ice tea and the waitress for got to give me extra sugar when i asked wasn't that many people their.;
we got the Ahi Poke which was quite good but the extra topping sauce was over kill.
my friend she order the fish and chips and she though it was OK but way to salt.
I got the Ahi Sand which that i thought i was OK small portions, the sweet potatoes French fries were good extra crispy.
author: Seaera T.

description: I love this restaurant ! Friendly wait staff and the place has a great feel to it. Fresh Prawn Ceviche is a MUST!! Their summer specials are on point too!!
author: theresa T.

description:
California roll salad. Ceviche.

Thats my lunch after a day at Golden Gate park.

Lots of Asian rice bowls with tons of choices in case I want something warm.

You can reserve a table which makes the stress of finding a place on a Sunday in the sunset disappear. Of course you have to park-- but we usually find something relatively close if we pray to the parking goddesses.

Excellent service. Fair prices.
author: Dani K.

description:
I had a 50% scoutmob coupon to use so might as well give it a try. 

The wait isn't too bad, we waited about 10 minutes to be seated.

I ordered a Taco wrap and bf ordered the popular rice bowl that every table seemed to have. It was quite a LONG wait for our food to be served, even people who ordered after us started to eat and our table is still empty. When our serve saw my wondering eyes and hungry look on my face, he went right away to check on our food. Soon, our food came. Unfortunately our food are COLD, like really cold. Bf was okay with the rice bowl being cold since it was sushi rice (you know, we eat sushi with cold rice anyways). I tried to eat one bite of my cold taco, and sadly, I couldn't take it. Our server came over to ask if everything was okay and I addressed my concern to him. He offered to remake one for me. And then in 10 minutes, my food came and it is warm! yay! 

Maybe next time, I should come before I become too hungry. LOL
author: Rebegi G.

description:
This place is in my neighborhood and I've become a regular.
I love the fish tacos and the shrimp tempura rolls.
Sweet potato fries are good, but I wish they would take it easy with the salt.

Great place for happy hour and do some great deals.
Good food and friendly service.
author: Julie P.

description: Dine and order take out at this location a lot over the years today. I used order ahead and placed my order. Arrived at 8:27 3 minutes early than the quoted time and was told my order is not quite ready by the lady at the bar. I have a seat at the booth and notices this bag by the kitchen that seems to fit the size of my order. I have a feeling it was my order but I'm not one to tell someone how to do their job. The lady that "assisted" me walked by it at least 4 times. Another employee asks the first lady I talked to what's my deal and she explains I used order ahead and everything it's paid in advance- but no one bothered to check on the status despite my wait. Another customers order was bagged and the customer gets hers, then the waiter grabs "THE BAG"  I've been waiting for the past 20 minutes and hands it to me. So mad! Got to the car and checked the food, fries' cold and the fish and chips barely warm. Luckily we had some salads in the order. This why I can't support $15 an hour minimum wage.
author: Katrina C.

description: Thanks Kate for the great service! Sat in the bar at a table and had a super meal after a long ride in the park.
author: Brett M.

description:
GREAT service. Our waitress was super nice and has a very friendly smile!  We came here with a large group and they accommodate us pretty quick on a semi-busy Sunday. 

FOOD: 

There are SOO many options on the menu and they all sounds good! Very hard to decide on what to get but since I wasn't as hungry, I settled for an appetizer, the Cabo Calamari....but I guess having a whole appetizer plate to myself is pretty much equivalent to a meal...

CABO CALAMARI Appetizer 

Dislike: SUPER OILY and fried.
LIKE: Fried red peppers and lemon slices! The fried lemon slices are very interesting and being a fan of lemons, I LOVE IT. (yes, the skin is also edible!) 

BIRTHDAYS:

One of our friend had a birthday recently and guess what, you get a FREE mochi ice-cream from the dessert menu on your BDAY! 

SETTING:

Very comfortable and somewhat artsy with amazing paintings on the wall and ceiling lights made from blue glass bottles! I LIKE. ( makes me wanna make something like that one day)

SPLITTING a meal with a friend?

Done. They even split the meal FOR you so you and your friend get your own portion in a separate bowl/plate!! HOW NICE.

I really enjoyed this place alot.
author: Eileen Z.

description:
Poke was tasty but the cut of fish was stringy. The sauce overwhelmed the flavor of the fish. Coconut shrimp were crispy and well done. The maki rolls were average. The sweet potato fries were little overdone and the dipping sauces were kind of weird (tarter, really?)
Large open space, good for big noisy groups. If you want good seafood head to the wharf.
author: Naomi K.

description: This is me and the ladies go to spot when we want seafood and stay close to the house.  More than anything, the bartender makes amazing drinks. Always perfect to my taste.  The food and location itself is more than good considering its a chain but we like the place very much.
author: Sa V.

description:
FAST Review 

Food 3/5 
Mahi tacos overpowered by sauce. Cabo shrimp tacos had two measly pieces of shrimp. Tasty though. Good sweet potato fries.

Ambiance 3/5 
Hmm, to describe briefly: Bland, minimalist, clean, modern

Service 4/5
Good, prompt service

Total Impression 3/5 
Standard Pacific Asian American fusion fare
author: Raul S.

description: I had heard good things about this place and everything lived up to the expectation.  We got the Cajun ceviche, the miso salmon, and some sushi roll ( I don't remember). Everything tasted amazing. The ceviche came with fresh potato chips and it was spicy and cold and perfectly balanced. The miso salmon was sweet and the texture was very tender, melt your mouth type. The sushi roll was very good also, all sushi kind of blends together for me but there was definitely nothing bad about it. The service was great and the restaurant is large for San Francisco. My only complaint is that it is a little pricey, but what do you expect was good seafood?
author: Melanie M.

description: After my date with the Golden Gate Bridge, I went to lunch at Pacific Catch.  This food was GOOD! it was a cold, misty day. I wanted soup.  They had a shrimp vegetable soup. OMG. It was so good. I wanted another bowl of it. I swear I did. But I didn't get it. I had already had the calamari fritti (which by the way was comped because of the yelp checkin offer or foursquare checkin offer or something like that). Lesly had the shrimp tacos and they looked delicious, too. I love Pacific Catch. I'll be back. Hopefully.
author: Kelly G.

description: Great atmosphere! Would go back. Tried the poke and ceviche. It was very good, but not as fresh as some other places.
author: X P.

description: I had their entree salad with salmon and I liked it. For $15, I was pretty stuffed. Service was friendly. Filled up our cups right away. I've had their tacos and ahi tuna entree salad. They were also good. I like their original location bec it is a lot smaller but intimate. However, this location has plenty of space with a lot more seating and a parking lot for maybe 6-7 cars.
author: J C.

description:
We came for a quick bite to eat and overall, gotta say that I'm quite happy with this place.

The Cabo calamari was delicious. Although they do mention that there was lemon slices, we didn't realize that some of them would be breaded and deep fried. Anyhow, they add a great deal of flavour and the bit of spiciness (thanks to the chilies) was really good. The spicy chipotle aioli was also very tasty (and tastes great with the fried fish if you manage to save some for when your entree arrives).

I had the California salmon sandwich and my BF had the fish and chips. After having the sesame slaw and side salad, I was quite full. I had a bit of my BF's fish and chips (he got the cod and spicy fries) and everything tasted great. I ended up getting the sandwich to go and later on for dinner I had half and it was delicious. Light, not too heavy with the sauce and the salmon tasted great.
author: Shauna S.

description: I came here for the first time with a friend after hearing so much about this place! Definitely not disappointed! We shared the calamari, ceviche, original Hawaiian poki, and split the spicy tuna salad. Everything was fresh, delicious, and brought in a timely manner. The staff is very friendly and accommodating. They also have a great selection of wine. (The Riesling was great with the fish!) I will definitely be returning!
author: Gayane B.

description: The shrimp tacos and calamari didn't taste fresh. The coleslaw was lacking acid. It was average food. Server was friendly but forgetful.  I would not go back.
author: Livia K.

description:
Mahi Mahi Taco with onion strings atop--delish! Day dream worthy! 

Did a mix N match of the Steak taco and the Mahi mahi taco (both with onion strings atop) with sweet potato fries and black beans. The steak taco was yummy but boy was the Mahi mahi totally something different. I absolutely recommend this combo! 
Sweet potato fries were just right--not too sweet and not too salty. 

Our appetizer = Seviche with sun baked chips on the side. Little too salty for my taste but I'm guessing that's the whole point with seviche? 

Service was good; we arrived around noon time and was sat instantly by the bar along the window--beautiful view of the outskirts of Golden Gate Park on a sunny day! Really loved the atmosphere of the place and I think it's mainly because of the huge, open bay windows.

I can see this as a nice dinner place in the evening with amber lighting. Great place for family, friends or dates.
author: Kat L.

description:
This is the only restaurant in 20+ years of dining I've walked out of.

And I don't mean in a huff because of crappy service, but because the food was awful. We didn't even make it past the appetizers. We ordered some raw ahi thing and some other things, and they were so bad that when the waiter came back to take our main dish order we smiled politely and said we were full. Then we hit up Park Chow for our mains.

The fish was on the level of Safeway, nowhere close to a quality sushi place, and it was from this experience I learned my lesson with raw fish: its got to be top quality or it'll disappoint.

If you don't know fish and you want an underwater upscale Dennys, this is the place. If you know what quality fish is, avoid PC.
author: Rob C.

description:
I like the decor of this place.

Food was alright. I ordered their bbq skirt steak bowl. There was very little steak.
Bf got the fish n chips, that was really good. fish was very juicy and crispy. He got the spicy fries which was pretty good too. 

Heard about their happy hour. and i would definitely come back for it.
author: Erica L.

description: The food was good, but their service was sub-par. My server, I think her name was Amanda, had quite a bit of attitude. If you hate your job that much, then maybe it's time to find a new one! She didn't refill our waters, and when I asked her for a to-go box she went to the bar to chat it up with her coworkers for awhile. It wasn't until she caught my stare that she had the "Oh, sh*t" look and got my box. I had the original poke, and the BF had the hawaiian terriyaki rice bowl with salmon. The poke was just OKAY, but we enjoyed the rice bowl. It wasn't the best experience, and I don't know if the food is worth coming back for if I have to deal with service like that. Perhaps I'll try another location. My experience here was just .... mehhhh.
author: Christine L.

description: This place is simply amazing. This was our first visit to this location and we loved it just as much as there other restaurants. Our server Ally was fabulous and because of the Monday holiday the place was hopping but we never felt rushed. The food is amazing and the prices are good too. The portion size is what always surprises me, you truly get what you pay for, I usually have leftovers. I ordered the shrimp tacos, they were the best I have ever had, looking forward to going back soon.
author: Ki H.

description:
A low cost healthy fish yummy fish joint.
Salad are not weighed down with tons of dressing, light flavorful.

The Ahi tuna salad is good tasting, even though the thin slices are a bit skimpish.  

Reading all the reviews here, I agree the best value is the healthy fare, as the fried portions are just ok / nothing to write home about.
author: David H.

description: Came in here for happy hour. Prices are decent and the place was roomy.  I particularly liked the crowd, was a mix of old and the young, dress shirts and t-shirts, the hip and the wish they were hip.   Relaxing for sure.
author: David S.

description: Three words: Japanese Wasabi Bowl!  Amazing balls, especially with ahi tuna. Wish they were in the east bay, I'd go all the time.
author: Laura W.

description:
This place is awesome! The freshness and quality of the food and drinks is superb.

I drank the pomegranate ginger martini and it was one of the best martinis I have ever had! 

We tried several menu items, but the Japanese wasabi bowl with poke was amazing! It was so flavorful and well constructed. The dressing was delicious but not overpowering. The chef has such a wonderful grasp on flavor and texture combinations. 

Oh, and you must try the dulce de leche spring rolls for dessert. They are heavenly!
author: Kristin S.

description:
I have been to Pacific Catch a number of times (mainly due to the fact that it's pretty close to UCSF) and it's consistently pretty good/"a-ok."  I've never actually come for dinner, because I think there are plenty of better (and more student-budget-friendly restaurants) in the area, but it is a great option for happy hour or just place to catch up with friends over a drink and appetizers.

The restaurant is pretty nice looking inside, yet casual.  If you dine-in, they give you a tray of pretzel goldfish and edamame.  Some of the many appetizers I've tried include:

Cabo Calamari ($9): fried calamari (both rings and tentacles, lemon slices and chilies); taste is pretty standard and it's served with a "spicy" chipotle aioli.  During my last visit, this was free via a Foursquare check-in offer.

Sweet Potato Fries ($6):  always delicious and served with interesting dipping sauces: ginger wasabi aioli and sweet Thai chili.  I prefer ketchup.  

Baja Shrimp Ceviche ($8.50):  a fair amount of shrimp, lime, cilantro and chilies, served in a martini glass and surrounded by tortilla chips.  This was pretty tasty, but not that stand-out is.  

Hawaiian Poke ($9.50): this is probably the only appetizer that actually shines.  The tuna is marinated in a sesame-soy marinade and served with crispy wonton chips.  It can be a bit salty, but just make sure you have a nice cocktail also.

Happy hour is 4-6 p.m. Monday through Friday and also 10 p.m. to close each night.  They have a fair selection of beer for $3-4, wells for $4.50 and a selection of appetizers as well.  The service is generally pretty helpful and I think overall, it's a pretty fun place to get snacks/drinks.
author: Samantha L.

description: My husband and I came here on a Friday for a late dinner, around 9:30; and though things were winding down, it was still quite noisy. The ambience isn't too special, but it's nice enough, especially the tables with street views. We shared the California roll first, which was a good portion and came out quickly. My husband ordered the swordfish; his favorite part was actually the side of grilled and seasoned brussel sprouts with finely chopped bacon. I don't like seafood so I tried the Hawaiian teriyaki with chicken. The grilled pineapple and soft mushrooms with the crispy onion strings mixed nicely with the rice and chicken, but I was less excited about the edamame addition. Service was good, but we had to wait a bit for the check. Still, since it's nearby and the hubby loves seafood, we'll try it again.
author: Kacy C.

description: pretty good place to grab a bit on a daily bases, not bad but nothing out of the ordinary. resturant is clean and servers were polite.
author: Helen Z.

description:
update on an update....

If you ever see "ALASKAN KING CRAB SOUP" listed in the menu under Soup Of the Day section, GET IT!!!!

The best soup i have ever had. My friend liked it so much she said she could make love to the soup. yup, its that good it'll make you say some crazy things. She had seconds. All i have to say is... who sprinkled crack in my soup because i'm addicted.
author: Jane A.

description:
The entire time I was sitting here, I wanted to run across the street and go to Marnee Thai instead.
The service was terrible. The waitress barely ever came over to our table. The whole entire experience was forgettable. The only thing I remembered is how horrible of a time I was having. Good thing I loved my company, otherwise I really would have dashed across the street.

By the way, I wasn't the only one who wanted to leave and go to Marnee Thai. My other friend/coworker wanted to as well. 

The food is like.. Imagine if IHOP/Dennys were to try to take on sushi.
author: Susy C.

description: Big enough to easily seat a party of 6 on a Saturday night. Everything was fresh and tasty. Shrimp and crab dumplings delicious, but could have been a little more moist. Fun friendly service. Great poke.
author: Maria A.

description:
If no one told me, I would never thought this is an actually chain restaurant. 

I really liked what they did to the restaurant, the layout, and the environment. A really good place some asian fusion food.

I am in love their sweet potato fries. =)
author: Evan L.

description:
Pacific Catch sounds like a corny show from the 90s but in reality, it's a mighty fine restaurant. I enjoyed my Pacific Catch experience. We came here on a Saturday night and had a reservation, so they seated us immediately. We got lucky and found a spot in their free parking lot, but parking is incredibly difficult in this area, so give yourself enough time to find a spot.

We started off with the fried calamari. It was a healthy portion, and had a small kick to it. We were tempted to also start off with some sweet potato fries, but since many of the dinner meals come with a side of fries, we decided not to. I ordered the 3 taco plate (mahi mahi, shrimp, and traditional baja) and enjoyed the shrimp taco the best. One of the tacos, I think the traditional baja, lacked flavor and was disappointing. For $15, I was stuffed at the end of the meal and had no room for dessert. The service was excellent and the staff was attentive. I'd come here again.

My tummy gives Pacific Catch...4 Stars!
author: Allan L.

description: the only thing positive about this place is that it's convenient for a group of tourists as it sits directly across from Golden Gate Park. it's marked up and mediocre. locals wouldn't come here for poke since there are a few other sushi restaurants in the area. on the other hand, it's not a sushi restaurant, but a fusion california style fish and chips restaurant? i mean, i don't really understand. good for groups of people visiting who don't know where else to eat i suppose.
author: Thao T.

description: Great and fresh seafood. I ordered the fish tacos with sweet potato fries and the Kiwi Flash.  Big pieces of fish for each taco was enough to fill me for the day. The kiwi flash drink was good as well. Its a mix of gin, with fresh kiwi, cucumer and lemon juice. Just perfect for a hot day .Their salad and rice bowls looks uhmazing, I would have to try them when I come back.
author: Claudine V.

description: So I am rewriting the review because they have definitely improved! Food is fresh atmosphere is nice staff is friendly. Fish tacos are great !  Keep up the good job!
author: stanislav m.

description:
They have a nice space, it's mostly spacious on the inside, and it looks mostly clean inside. 

Eh, what was the point? It took them more than 35 minutes to deliver the food and the waitress made us feel like we were disrupting her evening. Someone at the booth next to ours placed a menu on top of the back rest and it was about to fall on our heads and yet the waitress did nothing. Her pal the hostess that seated us was in full high school clique mode. The snickering and scowling was annoying after we were seated. This place seems to be on the prepubescent management course.

The food was, eh, small portions of protein and loads of rice. I ordered the fish and chips and was met with three soggy fish sticks over a handful of fries on a large plate, covered in some type of news printed on white paper. The plate was too large for the meager portions that was served. The coleslaw was in a small condiment container. Everything would've fit on a side plate.

It's was quite expensive for 3, the bill was almost $100 for underwhelming service and food. I'll pass on this place in the future. Parking can be a nightmare, there are so many other places to eat why waste my time here?
author: Jane A.

description:
PC is very roomy, theres a bar, booth seats, and tables. Families can definitely have a nice dinner here. I love their high ceilings!

My dad loves their sandwiches, specifically the Wasabi Ahi. It was grilled rare ahi with ginger, avocado, daikon sprouts and ginger-wasabi aioli. The sandwich was really filling. The sandwich was served with coleslaw and sweet potato fries. 

My mom loves the Pacific Ceviche Trio. Three different types of ceviche served with purple potato chips. Yummmmmmm. The fish was grilled seared with ginger! Very flavorful! 

We also had the Pan Asian Bowl, the thai curry with grilled chicken. They were very nice and gladly adhered to our half brown rice and half vegetable request (thank you!). The crispy shallots also added a nice touch.

Customer service? Very nice and speedy. 

My younger sister had Korean BBQ, the Marinated Skirt Steak. She thought it was too salty. She only ate the meat (left the vegetables and rice alone) because she said it was way too salty. (This says a lot because she normally loves rice.)

This place was definitely worth it, but my recommendation? Stay clear of the Korean BBQ!
author: Tiffany H.

description: I came here last weekend to celebrate my friend's birthday.  The service was great as my server was very attentive and nice.  She had a lot of knowledge about the dishes that were being served.  However, the food came out pretty slow, even though the restaurant did not seem that busy (maybe I missed something? perhaps a lot of to gos).  The food was fresh and it tasted great.  The place is known for Poki, but I actually liked the tacos more (I did not try the poki though, I saw my friends trying).  I thought the place was supposed to serve Asian style of dishes, but it was very Americanized.  Overall, it was a great experience for me.
author: Jamie K.

description:
I read so many reviews saying how people really liked Pacific Catch.  I live so close to this place, I had to try it for myself.  I went on a Thursday night at 7:30, and expected a wait, but there were actually a lot of open tables.

Of course we had to start out dinner with drinks, so we got the Pacific Punch and Kamikaze Bloody Mary( http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/xrXCgiAiwQKfIcWmIUZDpQ/l ).  The Pacific Punch really tasted like punch...very easy to get drunk off of them!

It took a while to pick what we wanted for dinner.  Nothing really stood out on the menu.  We ended up getting the sweet potato fries( http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/F7Jasi9YOKm_xukGraPLqw/l ), Hawaiian surf & turf( http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/b-odRG7EHLA9pF6Tad_32Q/l ), and the ahi tuna wasabi bowl( http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/yQEL8q5t9x7sXXys5QP-mA/l ).  

The fries were good, but the rest of the food was just ok.  Nothing was super spectacular.  They have happy hour from 4:00-6:00, so I'll just be back for some drinks.
author: Patra I.

description:
Why have I not reviewed this place earlier? I love it here. I am a regular here; the servers recognize me, stay and chat. It's great. Sure, like with every place one can have a bad experience, but the great experiences and delicious food (well priced too)  outweigh any hiccup that might occur. 

My favorite entree is the veggie special salad with grilled salmon. I have even been known to add the korean steak to it. It's just perfect. 

Recently, I tried their salmon club special. WTF? That was just awesome! 

I also love me some thai iced tea! They make it super tasty and are generous with the refills. The lemongrass iced is great too, but please don't forget about the full bar! 

Lastly, a very special treat are the Fried Dulce de Leche Spring Rolls. Yea. Wow. Seriously, WOW!

I haven't mentioned their appetizers yet, but I feel like I should. The ceviche and fried oyster appetizers, and their hawaiian poke are really tasty. The spicy fries make a good side or just a yummy starter. 

Ok. I have to control myself. But this place is really good to come to just when you want a quick dinner, to catch up with a friend, or with a group. 

p.s. they have opentable to you get points for making reservations, and just recently started using the punchh app. Double perks for eating here!!!! Yes please.
author: Irina S.

description:
I love Pacific Catch. Been coming here since it opened, and it has not failed me yet. Even though I only love getting one thing - it just tastes so good every time. 

Hawaiian Poke Wasabi Bowls are my weakness and I love how Pacific Catch puts everything together. One time, I came here with a friend for lunch but I knew the bowl would be overkill at the time. So our server suggested splitting the bowl between the two of us. perfection. I wasn't even sure they do that because I know how much of a hassle it can be. 

Had my birthday dinner here last October and everyone was so accommodating. In a big group, I get nervous that other people will start getting annoyed or the orders get mixed up. But dinner went without a hitch. 

Next: gotta make it here for happy hour and drinks
author: Maria B.

description:
This is such an odd sight in the middle of a street full of eclectic restaurants and shops. It's like it would be found in the suburbs based on its size and interior decor. And waiters who are mostly older men.

The mixed bowls are quite delicious, though on the pricey side ($14.50). The portions are generous so don't feel like you can finish it on your own.

The pretzel goldfish an edamame for snacks gives the place a cheap feel, but we cleaned those little plates quickly.

The waiter was definitely not friendly and embarrassed us quite a bit by making a huge scene when we asked for a picture. He did fill our waters quickly and checked up on us regularly; I guess he just did his job fine, and we were satisfied.

I'm glad I came once to try; I hear they frequently give out coupons on certain sites, so do your coupon hunting before!
author: Hana J.

description:
Let me preface this by saying that I am not a fish person. At least, not cooked fish. Far too often, fish at restaurants is not fresh and further ruined by being cooked until it's completely dried out. For this reason, I've never paid much attention to Pacific Catch despite passing by its admittedly attractive looking building thousands of times. As far as I was concerned, it would just be another disappointing seafood restaurant. I probably would've continue to ignore this place had my fellow food enthusiast, Andrew W., not urged me to try their fish tacos, which he swore were some of the best he's ever had. We have similar taste in food, so finally, I decided to give it a shot. 

Our table of 3 shared a meal-sized salad with hawaiian poke, a three taco platter prepared Traditional Baja style, a Japanese wasabi rice bowl with seared ahi tuna, a grilled yellowtail platter, and fried dolce de leche "spring rolls". Unfortunately, the yellowtail special was not that special. The sauce didn't really make sense with the fish. The hawaiian poke, on the other hand, was wonderfully seasoned and a delight with the mixed greens. The Japanese wasabi rice bowl came with a perfectly spicy wasabi sauce. The seared tuna, unfortunately, fell a bit short. The ahi tuna did not come with a sharp, crisp sear, instead appearing as a small gradient from the cooked exterior and the raw interior. The tuna was also not as fresh as Mikuni's in Sacramento, which remains to be my top choice for seared tuna. Now that I've talked about the other dishes, I can finally talk about the fish tacos. Let me tell you, the fish tacos are heavenly! If you choose to have your tacos prepared Traditional Baja style, the fis will vary with the catch of the day. The two times I went, the FOTD was True Cod. The cod was as fresh as if it had been caught that morning. The batter came out crisp but not overly thick as to drown out the subtle flavors of the fish. The guacamole was creamy deliciousness. Squeeze a bit of lemon on it and you've got the perfect fish taco. After a very satisfying meal, we decided to order the fried dolce de leche "spring rolls." Definitely unique and tasty. One person at my table found the dolce de leche to be a bit too sweet, but I liked it just fine. 

Just writing about Pacific Catch makes me crave it. I can't wait to come back again for the fish tacos and dessert.
author: Jenny C.

description:
I love this place! This is probably one of my favorite restaurants in the Bay Area. 

After much convincing, we came here on a Saturday night with a party of six, and the host greeted us warmly and told us our wait would be around 15 minutes. He then took us to a lounge area where he let us sit and order drinks while we waited.

Service here is always top-notch. Our waitress was very friendly and prompt without being overbearing, The hawaiian poke wasabi bowl is TO DIE FOR. The best part? It's totally reasonably priced! I'll definitely be back.
author: Kim C.

description:
Graciously accepted.

Bit of a hiccup during my last Pacific Catch visit. Received a very nice note from the owner inviting me back for another try. It was a very nice gesture.

Return trip was the perfect excuse to sample a signature rice bowl. Chose the Hawaiian Teriyaki with grilled chicken, pineapple, carrots, edamame and teriyaki sauce.

It was four star love from the first bite.

Felt the same way later that night when the to big for lunch became dinner as well. So in fact I was invited back twice.

Generosity started with complementary edamame. Standard for everyone. Get the feeling great food and exceptional customer service is standard for everyone too.
author: Jason B.

description: Solid food.  Service is mixed but improving.  Great seafood options.  They are kind to our kiddos.
author: Genevieve B.

description:
4.5, rounded up to the nearest whole number. Whoop, 4th grade!

I really, really like Pacific Catch.  I love how this location serves sushi, and has a larger menu than the one on Chestnut.  It's so big, and has a great bar as well.  You're not stuffed in like sardines, and I can actually have a conversation without someone next to me eavesdropping, pretty nice.  I also really like how they bring out house appetizers, it's just a little odd that it consists of goldfish pretzels and edemame. 

The California roll has ACTUAL crab, so that's a plus.  And their Island chicken tacos are soooo good.

You should definitely give it a try.
author: Michelle R.

description:
Kinda torn on this since this place is like a bowl of kid cereal... wonderful candy marshmallows mixed with things we don't like as much.

Heard all the great reviews so wanted to eat here but found out the meter we paid for was only for 30 mins max. So we decided to get take out and just eat at the beach. We met a very friendly worker named Andrea? Audrea? working in the bar area who took our order, gave us tips, even felt bad for us having to do take out and gave us free sodas for our wait. We got the korean bbq ribs, serrano poke, and the original, mahi mahi and steak tacos with spicy fries. The best thing for both of us by far was the poke. I'm not a big or experienced poke fan (insert joke here) but it was very tasty with enough heat but not too much. The thing I liked second, my friend not so much, was the ribs. I loved the sauce they used and enough meat to not think you got cheated. 

On the other side we found the spicy fries cold and soggy but we drove 5 minutes away so HOPEFULLY that was just our fault and I will put that on us BUT kind of skimpy on them (i think my friend counted 10 thin fries) and it didn't have any "kick" to be called spicy in my opinion. The original and mahi mahi tacos lacked really any flavor and were disappointments with the steak taco being the one taco we both agreed we wish we got instead. This is also the first time I got black beans with no flavor. I thought my friend was joking but it actually had no flavor. Just a suggestion I think they should put more cheese in with the beans since it added more flavor than without the cheese bites. Also parking here is TOUGH! Best parking is either at the park across the street or a couple blocks down on one of the streets. The meters were 30 min max and the parking enforcement marked tires I think so knew if you put in more money and still ticket you.

Overall, I give this place 2 stars for the food we liked and had to give 1 star to Andrea or Audrea (sorry I butchered your name) since she rocks! She gave EXCELLENT customer service, was helpful, very friendly and considerate to give free sodas once she realized the customers had to go with Plan B. THAT is what customer service is all about! Other than that while there are a couple of good things to eat and we may be back we both felt it's not a MUST GO place for us.
author: Mike D.

description: The spring roll dessert is the best thing I've ever eaten in my whole life.
author: Stephanie D.

description:
I love this place! My boyfriend and I went here for our first time last week and it is definitely our new favorite spot. The food was great and I love the fact that I do not feel guilty eating their food since their portions are pretty big! Our server (I believe her name was Adriana) was really nice! She asked if we ate there before and of course we said no so she suggested to us what we should try. She was definitely helpful and made our experience there for our first time even better. It is always a love/hate feeling when we get a good server LOL we know we have a good server when we're thinking "dammnit now we really have to tip" lmao. Thanks Adriana!! We ordered the California Style Hawaiian Poke, which she recommended... and it was hella good, lawwd have mercy. For our entree, I ordered the Hawaiian Teriyaki rice bowl with grilled salmon and it was amazeballs. I will definitely be coming back for the rice bowl, the poke, and the service! 

Only downside is that we got pulled over before we got to the restaurant lol apparently we can't drive through a intersection until a pedestrian has gotten onto the sidewalk completely  -___- the pedestrian had barely started walking, but luckily we got off with a warning. They do have a small little lot so parking might be a bit of a hassle, but it is worth it!
author: Kate E.

description: Nice lay out, good food, but the fountain drinks taste like tonic soda or they use tap water to make the ice. Fish and chips under cook. Kitchen gets overwhelmed when the restaurant is not as busy.
author: Ricardo F.

description:
I can't believe we haven't been here sooner! We live in the Inner Sunset and have passed this place by a hundred times and didn't think much of it. I am so, so glad we came here for dinner finally! The Ceviche Trio was amazing, the sushi was great, and the steak tacos were awesome. Service by our waitress Alyssa was also super friendly and efficient. She even ran after us a block up 9th to return my husband's sunglasses that he had left on the table. We will definitely be back! (I also hear they have great happy hour specials!)

One last thing - don't be turned off by the place because it's corporate. The food is really delicious!
author: Celeste R.

description:
The boyfriend and I ambled in here on a gorgeous Saturday afternoon, and had no trouble grabbing a table near the bar. Things started out well: We got menus quickly, and were brought a great little snack tray with pretzel goldfish and edamame. Their menu has a lot to offer, and both of the cocktails we ordered were fantastic (a Dark & Stormy for him, a Guava Mint Cooler for me). I really liked sitting in the bar area. We got a table right next to the window with a beautiful view of the park in all it's green, sunshine-y glory. 

For starters, he got the Crab & Corn chowder, which I think was a seasonal special but was SO tasty and crab-a-licious. I ordered the Peruvian Ceviche. Ceviche appetizers are usually so small (even though they're expensive), but Pacific Catch does NOT mess around. The ceviche dish was HUGE! I was begging my boyfriend to have some so I'd have room for our main dish. They really packed in the fish and all of it was so fresh and delicious, I thought about licking the bowl (boyfriend vetoed, but only because I told him he couldn't lick his soup bowl clean, either).

We split the Sushi Grade Ahi salad, and they were nice enough to bring it to us in separate bowls. I really loved the wasabi dressing (a nice kick at the bottom of the bowl), but I thought the actual Ahi itself was only alright. We also got the sweet potato fries and they tasted a bit unseasoned. 

While the service at the beginning had been fantastic, it took a really long time to get anyone's attention and after we got the check, nobody came by to pick it up again. The bar isn't that large, wasn't full, they had more people working than when we'd walked in, and it still seemed impossible to get anyone's attention for the bill. It wasn't until a bus boy stopped by to clear our salad bowls that the bill got paid. 

Overall, I really really liked the food here. Not a cheap lunch but well worth it. They would have gotten 5 stars if the service had been more consistent!
author: Rachel A.

description:
4 stars even though the service is kind of BAM.

As in BAM here's your dinner. And BAM here's your beer and a glass, and no, I'm not gonna pour it in the glass for you and BAM I'm gonna reach across another diner to put your plate in front of you. 

Don't take your fiancee here to propose to her, and not recommended for a first date, but the seafood is good and relatively reasonably priced, with the best "value meals" being the teriyaki and wasabi rice bowls available with a variety of fish (i love the poke best of all). I highly recommend getting them with brown rice because for some reason Pacific Catch makes DELICIOUS brown rice. 

The bowls hold up well as a take-out option too if you don't want BAM.
author: Gwynnie P.

description:
Fun place to go with your friends, lots of great appetizers to share.


Prices were decent and salads were huge, just don't expect GOOD fish here....the oysters in the fried oysters appetizer did not seem all that fresh and the calamari was average.

Service is mediocre.. 

Overall, fun place to check out, casual feel, good place to go with friends, but food is just not bad.
author: Veronica S.

description: Tried the California Roll salad- a great new innovation. Our children loved the fish and chips. This is a great place for large groups- there are so many choices and the prices are reasonable and portions generous!
author: Helen M.

description: The poke is the best ever. I would eat every kind if I could. Also their special mojitos are boss. Would highly recommend this place
author: Katie L.

description:
So I'm kind of ashamed.  I avoided going to Pacific Catch for ages because it seemed like the sort of corporate, kitschy place that I got to ignore now that I had a neighborhood full of wonderful local cuisine.  Something about it made me say to myself, "They can't possibly have fresh fish, and if they do I bet it's covered in weird, thick, salty sauces.  What kind of real SF restaurant has a parking lot, anyway?"

I am an idiot.

If you get beyond the plastery exterior and enter the restaurant, it's pretty posh.  It's open, and with wooden booths in the main area and nice wicker tables and chairs in the bar area and patio, it has a bit more personality than your average chain restaurant.  While it gets crowded early, it's a pretty swell place to kick back and enjoy a Dusty Road (rye whiskey and ginger beer - like a Dark and Stormy, only better!).

What impressed me most, however, was the menu.  While it mostly consists of variations on a few themes, they're good themes.  And the variations include ways for making things healthier!  I think few people are as picky as I am about that sort of thing, so I can say with confidence: If you're looking to go out to eat somewhere but want fresh ingredients and the option to eat right, Pacific Catch has got you covered.  Want a rice bowl?  Get it with brown rice!  Worried about how caloric rice is?  Get it with half brown rice, half greens!  Going gluten free?  No problem!  They have a section in your menu just for you.  Want to substitute one type of protein for another?  That's fine, too.

I have a friend who's a big fan of poke bowls, she knows good poke.  And when I asked her where I could get a good one in the city, she recommended Pacific Catch.  This was at the time when I was still being an idiot, so I thought "Hmm...really?"  I had to try it.  The moral of the story here is that I should trust my friends' palates over my ignorant pre-conceived notions (imagine that!).  The wasabi rice bowl with poke is so very good.  Soverygood.  And fresh!  The fish is fresh, the veggies are fresh, the rice is cooked to my favorite chewy consistency - even the brown rice!  And yes, very healthy.  The fish and veggies are dressed very lightly, which not only keeps things healthier, but also preserves all of their individual textures.  The fish is soft and smooth, the veggies are crunchy to the last bite!  Good, clean fun.  

Will I ever judge a book by its cover again?  Truthfully speaking, more than likely.  Will I eat at Pacific Catch a lot more often, though?  Why, yes.  Yes I will.
author: Becca S.

description:
Pacific Catch is a nice stop for a drink or dinner if you're near the golden gate park area. Don't let the name fool you though, there's plenty of turf to go along with the surf. I came here for dinner and was very pleased. 

First the food, there is an asian section on the menu that caught our eyes. We ordered the sticky ribs and the marinated skirt steak asian bowls. Both were excellently prepared and delicious. For dessert we got the fondu mochi balls which were fun and great tasting. 

The Service was good. No complaints here. 

The Restaurant is pretty large. This place would be perfect for large parties and is in high traffic area of the city so I could definitely see myself holding a party here. I'd definitley say this place has a casual, chainy type vibe to it. It's very nice inside but something about it gives off a cookie cutter feel where you can tell they followed a blue print on how to build restaurants so I don't think you're going to find any SF charm here. 

Overall, great dinner experience. I'd definitely come back here again and would recommend it. Enjoy!
author: Ken C.

description:
The Poke Wasabi Bowl is to die for. Ever since the first time I had this I have been dreaming about it. It contains all my favorite things - fresh chunks of poke, seaweed salad(wakami), avocado, wasabi, and much more yummyness! It is BIG so the key is to get half rice/half salad. You can opt for brown rice free of charge.

This location is soo much better than the Marina one which is small, hot, and stuffy. It does seem a bit pricey to throw down $20 for a rice bowl after tax and tip, but it's worth it. The fish is quality and the servings are large. And it's just so damn good!
author: Rachel G.

description:
I just ate here tonight!  From the outside I actually thought it to be more casual because it used to be a sort of cafe/art place several years ago.

Chic, contemporary decor.  Got seated at one of those half booths/half chairs thing.

Our server was nice and gave out great suggestions to what types of fish were offered as well as how the fish tasted/was served.

I played it safe and got the fish & "spicy" chips and while taste-wise it was good, it wasn't mind blowing.  I was also disappointed with the servings.  Three, rather small, pieces of fried fish, which ran about $12.  It came with "spicy" fries, which though delicious and well-seasoned, had absolutely no spice or kick to speak of.  I liked their special tartar sauce.. that coming from a person who never touches tartar sauce.  

My friend ordered the Escobar (sp?) special of the night and I found it to be oily but quite delectable.  It came with fried bananas, beans & rice, and sliced avocado.  Definitely a type of fish I would order the next time I was invited out to dinner.

Overall the food was A-Okay but nothing to really write home about.  I wish their fish & chips had more of a fresh veggie variety instead of a tiny coleslaw, so as to offset the greasy flavour.

Props to our waitress who definitely knew her fish!  I'll be back because I like all the options they have for seafood.  

P.S.  Sushi is uber expensive
author: Kimiko Q.

description:
Ok, so I've heard about this place when the name was thrown around within circles of people that are from the city. So I thought to myself, I have got to try this place. So I gathered up one of my friends and we drove to this location where we had a reservation at 6:30 pm. So I am someone who absolutely hates driving in the city due to the fact that it is so crowded and there are all these one way streets and the worst of all: there is NEVER any parking! This time was no different. We found the restaurant within ten minutes, but the next twenty minutes consisted of us circling the neighboring streets to no avail. The restaurant has its own private parking lot but there is only room for about ten cars, and for a restaurant that busy, it's like "are you serious?" We kept calling the restaurant to push our reservation back, and Elena, one of the hostesses, was very nice to us and told us that she would take care of the reservation and even gave us her own tips on where to find parking. My friend and I are starving at this point and getting cranky and I was on the verge of giving up and going somewhere else when a spot in a public parking lot opens up! So I pay $8 to park, but at this point I am desperate. The lot we found was one block away from the restaurant so we made the walk there and arrive about 45 minutes late for our reservation, but they had saved a table for us and were super fast and efficient at taking our order. 

Let's just say that we were so hungry that we dug in a little too eagerly into our menu and ordered a bunch of food. I would definitely recommend the poke bowl as a starter and the dulche de lech "spring rolls" as a dessert. The fries have the best seasoning and all their food is so fresh. When we left, we both felt like we were drunk, we were so full. The food is a little on the pricier side but definitely worth it.  

The restaurant was big and busy with almost all the tables being used, but we never felt neglected. Great restaurant, great service,  would definitely go back there again but the parking is a killer.
author: Anita L.

description: Started with the coconut soup with shrimp. Wish the portion  was larger but more to come:) sticky ribs oh baby. Entrees were superb  my friend Christy got the poke salad and since she's Miss Hawaii  everything must be on par from there. She gave it thumbs up. I had the yellowtail dinner. Very fresh tasty. Pictured is the yummy saucy desert
author: Mark C.

description:
I'd give this place 3.5stars. 

A friend recommended Pacific Catch and it was very good in terms of making the food and drinks well. I had the fish and chips which can be touch and go in re: preparation, but it was very light and tasty. The seafood was delicious but for the price, I think it was a little expensive.

My friend had one of the bowls (the curry one w/chicken, I think) and he didn't like it too much as he thought it would be more curry and less rice. 

The ceviche was great - but the chips they served with it weren't as sturdy and as plentiful as needed. They tasted and looked great (purple potato chips? awesome) but they just couldn't hold up in the end and we weren't offered any more when we ran out. 

I think in terms of decor, it looked a bit like the Olive Garden - kind of that non-descript interior decorating that doesn't strike you as particularly fancy. But maybe b/c I'm from Chicago where seafood places (if they're not fast food joints) look pretty fancy. (We're a landlocked state.
