I'm sure it's just to distract us from thinking about how fresh the fish is.) I wondered why they even took reservations. But it was a pleasant experience and our waitress (who was new) was very sweet. I would recommended someone to go there in the future.
author: Kim S.

description: Fresh, tasty,decent service, comfy tables and seats. I would eat there again.
author: Kris F.

description:
The three taco order: baja, shrimp and chicken were good. I never had sweet potato fries prior eating here. They started a trend of me ordering that side dish whenever I see it on the menu in other food establishments. Good stuff

Bit pricey just for asian food IMO, thus, the tacos.
author: Alisa M.

description:
I've found my new favorite salad.  The Grilled Salmon salad.  Loaded with greens, mushrooms, a generous filet of salmon, and the best part - salmon skin croutons.  YUM!!!  

As a special, they have a Dungoness crab and corn chowder.  OMG.  Slightly spice, but sooooooo good.  Chunks of crab to enjoy.

Hubby had 3 tacos.  Two types of fish, and the third was shrimp.  Very generously filled and very tasty.

Will definitely go back.  Only problem is, I'll just want that salad again... so many other things to try on the menu.
author: Denise M.

description: This place is super yummy!  I've been here twice now, both times with my family and friends and I've been satisfied every time. The drinks are delicious and unique, the food is incredible, and I leave feeling insanely full. The fish is cooked to perfection, my mom's favorite is the tacos, and I'll admit that I love their little "bread basket" of edamame and pretzel Goldfish. Definitely a great place to check out!
author: Laura T.

description: Love their sushi, tacos, and rice bowels. Big portions so get ready to share. Very nice and clean inside. Staff super nice.
author: Y R.

description: Came in thinking it was a 5 star restaurant. The appearance was really nice and clean. The food was okay, I ate. But I was displeased and pissed with the service, I don't remember the waitress name but she received no tip. It was about a 4 star restaurant until she came along and knocked it down to a 0.
author: Veronica B.

description: Made a reservation and was given a booth for my party of 6, which was pleasant.  Service was good, but did have to wait for awhile.  Had a bottle of wine that took atleast 10 minutes to have opened and served.  Ordered and surprising came pretty fast than expected.  The ahi appetizer sampler was the best thing on the table.  Order 2 fish tacos and it was a definite "mehhh". I can make a better taco at home!!  Better to go to Underdog's around the corner for the Nic's tacos!  My fiance's fish and chips were terrible!!!  No crunch at all, which makes me think it was sitting out for awhile.  I wouldn't come back unless I had too.  Better options in the area.  Wouldn't recommend this place.  This would of been 1 star, but our waitress was nice.
author: Paul John G.

description:
Menu highlights:

-Hawaiian Poke Bowl: try the half brown rice and half salad option if you're watching carbs ;) HUGE portions
-Calamari: they give you a lot and the dipping sauce is delicious
-Seaweed (wakami) salad: comes with the Hawaiian Poke bowl or you can order it as a side. My favorite.

They have a weekday happy hour that I think ends at 7pm. 

Bar and regular seating areas with outside patio seating too. It can get crowded so make reservations on Friday or Saturday nights.

Oh and this is NOT a sushi restauarant. I warned you...they do have sushi rolls but they are mostly drowned in sauce. Go with what they're known for - bowls and the hot food. You won't be disappointed...
author: Yee-Shing W.

description: This is one if my favorite restaurants! There food is soooo good. Fresh seafood and great drinks. There bowls are the best. They did half rice and half salad in my bowl and even split the dish in two bowls for me and my mom to share. The manager came aver and talked to us and took such great care of us. He was really awsome and helpful to us!
author: Haley M.

description:
Not bad, not bad at all. 

Pro's: 
-"Inexpensive" for a seafood restaurant 
-Exceptional waiter service 
-Great location--LITERALLY across the street from Golden Gate Park, just walking distance from all the museums, and a few blocks away from Haight & Ashbury 
-Yummy appetizers :) 

Con's: 
-Parking is a pain; I drove around for 25 minutes before settling for a parking spot on a busy, busy street 
-Their spicy tuna and anything that is supposed to be mildly spicy is out of this world HOT. I love spicy tuna and anything with a kick, but geez louise, this was just ridiculous. I only ate half of my roll. 
-Their fish tacos are dredged in sauce and fried so much that I forgot I was eating fish for a second. 

Other than those few cons, I plan on coming back...just not for the spicy tuna or fish tacos.
author: Jasmin W.

description: I haven't been able to drop by a Pacific Catch in a long time, and needless to say I was excited. I usually go to the location in Marina, but this one was closer and generally easier to find parking. Unfortunately, it's also the less tasty one. I ordered a fried calamari, which was drenched in oil, making it less appetizing. I ordered a poke wasabi bowl, but the wasabi sauce was nowhere to be found, and the cook had a heavy hand with the soy sauce. The ahi used to make the poke also left a lot to be desired. The sweet potato fries were solid, but not as well seasoned and yummy as I remembered it. I think next time I'll just go to the Marina location even if it's smaller and harder to find parking. Service was exceptional, but it wasn't good enough to take the bad taste out of my mouth.
author: Thy L.

description:
I've been here a good amount of times and I pretty much always get the Thai Coconut Shrimp. With sweet chili sauce, so NOM-tastic!

I've had a guava alcoholic drink of theirs and another tropical one I can't remember but they were delicious, just slightly pricey.

They usually give you a tiny tray of pretzel goldfish and edamame to snack on before your food arrives. Always great service every time I've been here so really can't complain :)

Hubby and I had the Fried Dulce de Leche "Spring Rolls once that comes with vanilla ice cream & caramel sauce. DELICIOUS!
author: Lauren L.

description: There were 7 adults 2 children and 1 baby in the party of mine that ate here.  There was no problem accommodating us which was great.  I wish the service had been a little faster but all in all it was a good experience.  The food was fresh and tasty and I absolutely love eating meals out of bowls (not sure why but it is always comforting to me)  Everyone enjoyed their meals and the two children seemed to have a really good time.  The bathroom does have an infant changing table that was clean and bolted on to the wall at a reasonable level (yes sometimes this is an issue).  My husband loves this place and I have always been reticent to join him for a meal here.  After my last experience, I will be happy to head here for a meal!
author: Kylie L.

description:
Went here for my mom's birthday on New Years Day. The ease of getting a reservation was great... thank you OpenTable!

Upon arriving, the hostess was really nice and said that she could seat us even though it was about ten minutes before our actual reservation. That was also great because our group was pretty hungry. Another point for wonderful!

For the food, to me it was a hit and a miss. It was crab week at the time, so of course I decided to take advantage of that. I really liked the crab chowder (it had really good flavor and lots of bacon in it), and the birthday girl had the crab with garlic noodles which she thoroughly enjoyed. We also loved the ceviche trio, which had Hawaiian Poke, Peruvian ceviche, and shrimp ceviche... that was delicious! 

What I did regret was getting the tacos, three of them also. I think I didn't expect them to fry the shrimp in the batter (then I realized I should have actually read the menu more carefully haha). Also there seemed to be some kind of kitchen malfunction, so our food was coming out late. Our waitress was really apologetic about it, which we really appreciated. She also gave my dad a free beer, and that was cool too.

I don't know if I would come back here any time soon, but I do know what I am NOT getting the next time I go. I think I'll stick to the more fresher options, like the rice bowls.
author: Caroline L.

description:
I got the wasabi bowl with hawaiian poke. It was a very large bowl with many pieces of poke, japanese seaweed, avocado, ginger, sprouts, sesame seeds and other random ingredients that are sometimes found in sushi over your choice of white or brown rice. The pieces of poke were fresh and well marinated...you definitely get a good amount of poke so much that I felt that I was all "fished" out towards to end of my meal.

I also tried the sweet potato fries which I thoroughly enjoyed because they didn't taste overly fried or oily. They came with a special wasabi dip which complemented the fries well.

The overall atmosphere was pretty chill and definitely relaxing when it's a nice sunny day as you can sit against the window or outside. Service was friendly and fast.
author: Margaret R.

description: This place is awesome. We always come here. Great food, great times. We really love the happy hour here. Pacific Catch is a winner!
author: Jenny B.

description:
I would give zero... we've gotten food poisoning now 2 times. The first time we didn't call them but the 2nd time we spoke to the manager Patrick. Not only was he defensive and unsympathetic,  (and I was being really nice about it although I was furious) but he told me he would call me back about it the next day to follow up. Of course NO call. He also claimed that food poisoning takes 6 hours at least to set in, but if you look it up, if you are eating shellfish, like oysters, it can take 1-6 hours to set in.  

I would stay clear from this place or they should get rid of Patrick. My 1.5 year old threw up from the salmon and my husband got sick from the mixed catch (fried seafood and french fries).
author: Momo F.

description: Almost always delicious.  The ahi tuna sandwich is tasty.  The ceviche is good, but nothing insane. This place looks and feels like a Chevy's type restaurant.  But whatever....
author: Click C.

description:
Went back again for its delicious poke bowl-- but it wasn't as delicious as before. My friend and I attributed it to the rice's lack of vinegar. I took it back home and added some rice vinegar and viola! The dish was saved! But thanks to the staff for splitting the bowl in half for us!

Their other dishes were amazing though. I encourage you to go during their happy hour to maximize bang for your buck!

It was crab week when I went and we got a fried crab wonton with a spicy chili sauce (YUM!!!), fries (which look ordinary but were fried to perfection!), and this dungeness crab soup which was very soothing for the cold SF night.

I hope the next time I go that the poke bowl is up to par! It was def the best I've ever had.
author: Lisa T.

description:
Came here with mixed feelings because of what I read on Yelp but I try to never let it hender my experience. 

It's a nice, large, dimly lighted restaurant with a nice cozy feel to it. 

On the up side, our waiter was really friendly... the downside, he was really frantic and running around during our entire meal. We tried to get his attention a few times throughout and he either never saw us, or didn't have time to stop. The hostesses walking around were quite helpful though.

I got the California Roll salad which seemed to be a pretty popular item on the menu from all the reviews. It DID taste like a california roll, so that was pretty cool. I forgot to ask for dressing on the side, because I normally like my salad naked so that was my own screw up. The avocado was SO creamy like everyone says. I'd come back and order this. Plus, it IS rather large! 

The bf ordered the thai curry rice bowl devouring it quickly and my friend ordered the salmon sandwich. Both seemed pleased with their choices. 

Biggest issue was just the service... true to the reviews, it was lagging. Thankfully, my extra dirty martini helped me be more forgiving than usual. Next time, maybe not so much...
author: Jeannie L.

description: Came here with my gf and her mom on a Saturday afternoon and were easily seated. The food was really great, especially the soup if the day, which had muscles. I was the only one who ordered soup and that came out first before their orders did. They told me that I had to finish the soup before it got hot so it was a little awkward for me to start without them. I would have preferred to  have the soup when their first dishes came out. Service was slow and it took a while to get our food and dessert out. We really enjoyed the dishes here but I wish service was more attentive.
author: James M.

description: Originally I rated this takeout order a 1 star.  The mgmt did reach out and apologize for the poor experience.  I'll give them another chance.  Ordered a takeout order for 5 for lunch.  Arrived at restaurant on time and waited 25 minutes for my order.  Wasn't that busy. Just not very organized and didn't seem to care.
author: Craig S.

description:
Two words: HAPPY HOUR. For $40, yes forty dollars (including a $10 tip b/c Grayson was a rockstar server!):

Tuna Poke
Spicy Tuna Roll
CA Roll (REAL Crab!)
Crab Rangoons (SUCCULENT morsels)
Sweet Potato Fries uh-mazing (dip them in the crab rangoon sauce!)

All regular servings  = $30 (including a soda and tax? UNREAL) 

Bottles of Sriracha on every table...be still my beating heart. 

Happy Hour. 4-6 and after 10. 'Nuff said.
author: Maggie C.

description: Pacific Catch just isn't what it used to be. With every visit, the food and service gets worse. Tonight was no exception. First they seated us with no menus. Then we waited for our food as a table that placed their orders after us finished their meals. My biggest disappointment, however, was with their Hawaiian Poke. Looked like someone hacked away at some tuna and threw it in a bowl. The quality of fish wasn't nearly as great, and the portion keeps getting smaller. My shrimp tacos were still good, but the sweet potato fries were cold and soggy. Thirty minutes after finishing our meal, we weren't offered a dessert menu. I think we might've been stuck their all night if I didn't flag our waiter down for the check.
author: Sophia B.

description:
Today for lunch, there wasn't a wait to get a table.

Coleslaw was way better today, compared to last time. Last time it was soooo onion-y. I like KFC cloeslaw a lot more than Pacific Catch's coleslaw.

Spicy fries were good, but I prefer sweet potato fries.
author: Kylie L.

description: I expected this place to be like a seafood version of the Cheesecake Factory but I was very pleasantly surprised.  All three of us had delicious food, the service was just fine and the presentation was nice. We went for lunch on a weekday and it was a little loud so I can imagine what it might be like on a weekend dinner, but that is the upbeat ambiance of the place. I got the tuna poke bowl and thought it was very fresh. I wish I lived closer as this is a very good kid friendly restaurant.
author: Erin B.

description: The food was fun, tasty and fresh but the service could definitely step it up a notch, don't know of many restaurants that I would get up and go grab my own ketchup bottle for the fries since all the waiters were way too busy talking to each other.
author: Vlad M.

description: This place is great! It is one of our favorite date spots; really nice restaurant but with a casual feel. The food is different but delicious. I always end up getting the same thing; the salmon korean bbq bowl. The salmon is always cooked perfectly and when paired with the yummy sticky rice and tasty veggies, perfection. We get the sweet potato fries as an appetizer and they serve it with sweet pepper sauce, such a weird mix, but really awesome.
author: Kristin F.

description:
If I remember correctly, Pacific Catch had a booth at Outside Lands in August. I tried a sample of something (ceviche perhaps?) and the taste stuck with me. Good thing too- I put two and two together when exiting Botanical Gardens and Pacific Catch was towering in front of me like a beacon of light for my hungry bits. 

We went in there on New Years Day and what better way to celebrate the new decade but with a basket of fish and chips? There is no better way, that's what. I also had a wakame (seaweed) salad which was absolutely peachy- especially considering the fact that they didnt scrimp on the green goodness, and there was a dressing soaked bed of cucumber waiting for me at the end once I finished. 

I stepped up the standard fish and chips to a sampler which included fried oysters, shrimp and fish, I chose standard fries since other people at the table got spicy cajun fries and sweet potato fries. Pacific catch has the fries down- absolutely. I loved the combo basket and was simultaneously salivating over everyone elses meal at the table. The Ahi sandwhich looks ridiculously good. Had I not been so full after the combo I had, I would have stolen the bits that left unfinished on my friend's plate. I also had a taste of the soup of the day-a chayote chowder, which had one of the best tastes I've had in a chowder. I didn't know what chayote was when I walked in, but when I walked out I was a fanatic.

A bit on the expensive side of affordable, but for good food (fresh fish) and a good experience, I say it is worth it. 

Also, the place is full of amazing things to daydream at. The chandeliers made out of blue bottles are great taste, event the bathroom has tiny strands of bamboo hidden behind the stall walls. The whole place is open, bright, and tastefull.
author: Tawnee K.

description:
There's a ton of reviews for this place already, so I'll keep it short.

Reservation was really easy with Open Table, even on a Saturday night. Atmosphere is great, nicely decorated place. Prices are reasonable. Food was delicious. Service was outstanding during our visit. Can't really ask for more than that.
author: Alex L.

description: I went here for lunch. The shrimp ceviche and fish of the day (with a side salad) were absolutely fantastic!
author: Nick S.

description:
I thought the food was pretty good here and not too pricey but the service was poor.

I had the traditional fish tacos, 2 for $12.  They came with a choice of sweet potato fries, spicy fries, regular fries or a salad, and a little bit of black beans.  The avocado-tomatillo sauce was good and they didn't skimp on the portion of it.  The fish had a light and crunchy batter.

The things we found annoying were every time we ordered something, the waitress said "Oh, that's the best choice!"  Since one of us ordered sweet potato fries and one ordered spicy fries and they were both declared to be the best, I wondered which really was the best.

Then my friend's order of spicy fries didn't come with the rest of the food.  When we asked about it she apologized and said it was coming, which it did when my friend had already finished his entree.   We wanted salt and there was none on the table and it took a while to get a waiter's attention and bring the salt.  Also, after my friend paid the bill he noticed we had been charged extra for the spicy fries even though they were supposed to be included with his entree.  They corrected it but it was all slightly annoying.

I'd try it again but hope I don't get a waitperson that gives opinions on everything ordered and I'll check the bill before paying.
author: Madeline M.

description: Relaxed, casual pan-Asian dining. My BBQ salmon sandwich with spicy fries was excellent. Plenty of interesting menu choices, kid-friendly and free parking. It's an  easy to get to location (especially if you're just driving through SF on I-280/GG bridge).
author: Anna J.

description:
I just like this place. That's all.

The seafood isn't to die for, but their bowls are good. The ceviche is a little bit too sour, but the fried oysters hit the spot.

The beer and whiskey selection are decent, and it's pretty easy to get parking and seating inside Pacific Catch when you go during the evening time on a weekday.

This is a great weekday spot for dinner or a date and close by to a Irving street's UCSF bar scene (all 3 of them) in case you want to continue the night. To sum it up, it's a great  local hangout for locals.
author: Jason C.

description:
Always impressed. Came back here after an 8 mile run and boy was it satisfying. 

I ordered the usual Wasbi Rice Bowl Poke split into 2. I devoured this bowl of goodness so fast. My heart was so content, my stomach was so happy. I was smiling all over :)

1 order of Combo Fish & Chips. Came with 4 coconut shrimp- battered, deep fried. The shrimp was huge!.. juicy.. tender. crunchy. 
The fried oyster was okay, the fish was sooooooooo good. Just flaky meat, tender. Hot, fresh, sizzles in your mouth, makes you wanna drive 30 mins just to eat it  goodness!

I looked around the restaurant. On a saturday evening, the tables were filled, families were happy, enjoying their meal, laughing, talking. i love it, just an overall positive good vibe. 

overall i was so happy. they gave me free refills on the lemonade. Service was fast fast fast, excellent. Pacific Catch on 9th, you guys are fantastic.
author: Juan C.

description:
Always a delight! This time we got the soup, poke appetizer dish, and the fish tacos with sweet potato fries.

This was my first time getting the poke appetizer, but I definitely  recommend getting the poke bowl instead. I usually get the bowl with half brown rice and half salad and the brown rice soaks up the excess poke sauce beautifully and compliments the fish. The appetizer poke comes with fried Wonton wrappers which were also good, but a little overwhelming.

The tacos were good, but not super impressive. There was a lot of fish and even more Wasabi [mayo] sauce . 

It was a cold day and I was getting over a flu, so I ordered the soup. It came with two clams, two-three shrimp, and a nice tomato broth. I'm not really sure what I was expecting, but I found the broth a touch watered down. It came with a toast that was slathered (albeit very prettily) in mayo sauce. Whoever was at the kitchen today really liked their mayo. I chucked the bread, found the soup satisfying, but the poke [bowl] is my favorite dish.
author: Sue Y.

description:
Me and my sister took our mom here for Mothers Day lunch time.  I would prob give this place a 5 if we didn't get seated 5 min. after our reservation time... but understandable, it was mothers day and busy is busy.

any how, hands down... The food is Bomb. If your into seafood... hit this place up!

Ordered the Baja Shrimp Ceviche... Fish & Chips mixed catch basket...  Escolar..and ummm ok, i guess i forgot what my mom ordered.. but it was good from what i stole a bite from, and she finished it without really sharing =P

My 2x mojitos was  surprisingly  heavy handedly poured :)  which was cool but i got somewhat of a headache by 5pm
author: Kenneth V.

description: Great happy hour! $4 tacos (The Mahi and Baja were AMAZING!-- Pass on the sirloin steak!). The Shrimp Ceviche was limey, delicious, with generous portions of avocado! Beers were $4 and overall, this was a good call for a stroll into a neighborhood happy hour spot!
author: Lissette L.

description:
Finally, a place where I can enjoy my poke wasabi bowl, munch on some baja fish tacos and nibble on some sweet potato fries without having to cram side-by-side each other like at their Chestnut location. Great service - they kept refilling my water - and great food. Parking sucks, but what else is new?

JONASAPPROVED!
author: Jonas T.

description:
My 2nd visit:

I was so impressed with my meal at P Catch the other night I had to try a couple things on the menu I wasn't able to the 1st time around.  So I ordered a bunch of rolls for pick up last night. 

Once again service rocks and the rolls were great. There are 8 large rolls per order, you have the option to substitute for brown rice which was a nice thing to see. Hopefully more sushi places will follow in P Catchs' footsteps and be offering this healthy option more.   

OG Review:

Pacific Catch really saved the day on Saturday night. I called in for a 15 head party the morning of and Rob, the general manger, really came through for me. He had a large party already booked but recommended I book 2 reservations and he would try to seat the parties close to each other. 

We all adjourned in the bar area for drinks. The bartender was awesome, great customer service! We were then seated and Rob reserved  2 booths next to each other. It worked out perfect because we used 1 booth as the kids table and the other for the 8 adults. 

There are peeled soy beans and pretzel gold fish on the tables to start munching. The menu rocks!  You can order sushi rolls, and sashimi for the sushi lover but for the not so seasoned raw fish eater there are teriyaki bowls and great specials available as well. I started with the seaweed salad and clam miso, so good. The table ordered the fried calamari which was liked by everybody. Watch out!  It comes with a spicy creamy dipping sauce which was received well, but it is hot! 

The tacos were a favorite of the group. Each taco has a different fish, mahi mahi, cod and salmon. They come with sweet potato fries, yum! I had the Surf and Turf, for 19.95, amazing!  The surf was shrimp with 2 skewers loaded, about 6 shrimp to a skewer. The meat was seasoned and juicy, very good. The entree also came with fried shoestring onions and pineapple fried rice, you have the option to substitute for plain brown rice. Large portion and great price! 

The staff brought out a complimentary dessert for the birthday girl. I didn't try any but I have a pic I'll attach. It looked fantastic and finished the night off perfectly. 

We had a great time and the staff was just great to us. Very accommodating. I will definitely be back and I love that it is so close to home!
author: Frankie F.

description:
We ate here on Thursday for dinner and had a deal from Scoutmob.  I believe our server's name was Neal.  5 stars to him.  He went out of his way to ensure that we were enjoying our time, filled our glasses, split our salad into two bowls for my sister and & I to share, brought extra dessert forks and spoons.  I haven't had this great of service in months.  Our order:

-3 Taco Platter $14.50
-Vietnamese Steak Sandwich: marinated grilled steak, seasoned cucumber-daikon-carrot salad, sliced chilies, cilantro & sriracha aioli $12
-(*)Sushi Grade: Hawaiian poke, avocado, cucumber, daikon sprouts, ginger & sesame seeds with soy-wasabi vinaigrette $13.50
-Side of sweet potato fries $3
-Spicy Tuna: hi tuna with sriracha aioli, chili oil, cucumber, daikon sprouts & green onion $8
-(*)Fried Dulce de Leche "Spring Rolls": with vanilla ice cream & caramel sauce  $6

(*) = Favorites
author: Stacey L.

description:
While I desperately miss the Canvas Gallery, this place is a lovely new addition to one of my favorite neighborhoods, the Inner Sunset.  The food is good while offering many healthy options, the prices mostly reasonable, the feel is spacious, clean and stylish, and there's even a small parking lot by the side of the building with free parking for patrons...it's hard not to love this place!

This place doesn't add anything special to the neighborhood from a culinary standpoint, since it's another Asian Fusion place on the same block with three (yes, THREE!!!) other Japanese restaurants and within a block or two of several more sushi bars and fish restaurants...and arguably there's something formulaic and trite about the intentional hipness of the decor...

But there's also something to be said for dining in comfort, which is exactly what whoever designed and decorated this restaurant seemed to have in mind:  the lighting is mild and pleasant, the ceiling vaulted, giving the overall feeling of weightlessness, and the chairs and booths are mostly comfortable...although the booths will feel slightly cramped if you are very tall or have a big butt or tummy, since the tables are low and there's a non-removeable 1/2-height cushion behind your back that takes up about 5-6" of your rump room.  If you are under 6' tall and on the slender side, you'll be just fine.

The servers are very friendly and attentive, which is a pleasant departure from many restaurants in San Francisco, where courteous service sometimes seems to have been otherwise forgotten in the shuffle.  Pacific Catch seems to operate the way many serious, highly rated professional restaurant environments do, with a highly trained staff, attention to detail overall, and a menu that reflects modern trends.  For example, this menu offers not only foodie versions of Miso soup, but also a brown rice substitution option for those of us watching our waistlines or simply attempting to eat a more healthy diet.  

I recommend the coconut skewered shrimp and ordering anything that will get you some of their delicious sweet potato fries (healthier than regular fries, at least!)!  Be warned that you won't be able to eat just one...

I also thoroughly enjoyed their salmon teriyaki bowl which came with shitake mushrooms, asparagus cut into the perfect size bites, and bok choy which was cooked to perfection, served over brown rice that's been dosed with some more of their flavorful teriyaki sauce (normally it's served with pineapple fried rice, but I opted for their complimentary brown rice substitution instead).

Their traditional miso soup is average at best, and at twice the price that other Japanese restaurants in the neighborhood will charge for the same size bowl, it's nothing special and you get the feeling it's pricier because everything on the menu is priced a little higher, not because of an increase in quality.  Still, the presentation of the bowl, which arrived covered and was quickly de-topped by the server at the table, gives at least some clue as to what your money buys here:  a higher end experience, even if it's at a chain restaurant, even if the menu looks like a mash-up of Sushi-Bar-Meets-Fish'n'Chips-Joint, even if it's a Monday night in the Inner Sunset.  

There's something to be said for a restaurant that does what it does well.
author: Amy L.

description:
Sunday Lunch Review.

Came here with my coworkers after the AIDS Walk. (On the company), everybody ordered way more than they could handle (except for me).

I got one of the daily catches... and like always, I forgot the name. It was a halibut-like fish from a random country in S.America. It had a bbq dry rub, over (or under?) a green something+cilantro sauce. I give up any further description of my entree.

Appetizers ordered to share included: poke, calimari, and a rock n roll, and maybe something else not worth remembering?

All the appetizers were good, the rock n roll probably wasn't as flavorful and eel-tastic as I would've liked, but still tasty. My entree was fantastic. I had a lemongrass-infused ice tea... that tasted like... lemon ice tea. But it was refreshing after my 6+mile stroll through GG Park.

The prices were definisly SF/Sunset-tastic. (their terriyaki bowls -- which a few of the ladies ordered but none finished, were ~$15).

But, it was good food though. 4-star worthy.
author: Victor C.

description:
This review is for both the Marina district and 9th Ave locations.

9TH AVE -- accommodating for a huge party (takes reservations)
MARINA -- the whole restaurant seats maybe 20 at a time. VERY SMALL (does NOT take reservations)
Btw, parking at both locations suck but the 9th Ave location has a small parking lot in back which maybe parks about 8 cars at most.

Thai Iced Tea - YUM
Hawaiian Poke - YUM (chunks are a bit too big though...)
Hawaiian Poke Roll - Was okay
Ceivche - Too limey, not enough chips
Sweet Potato Fries - YUMMM
Catch of the Day - YUM
Teriyaki bowls - TOO SWEET, sickkk
Any Tacos - Mediocre (go to Nick's Crispy Tacos instead)
Mochi Fondue - A must get!!

And that is about all the food I've tried between the two locations. The place is cute, service is good and you just have to come and try this restaurant at least once in your life.

(Photos uploaded)
author: Heidi C.

description:
Great food, poki is awesome.  The rice bowl is probably the best bang for your buck.  Also good margs. 

Slightly expensive, hence the 4 stars.
author: Joe A.

description:
Went here with a group for lunch on a Sunday. We had a reservation and the table was ready when we arrived. We were quickly given menus and water. Plus they give little dishes of edamame and pretzel goldfish (random!). 

This was where the efficient serviced ended. We had a few late comers so it took awhile for us to order. But I distinctly remember the waiter saying "the food comes out pretty quickly, so take your time" when we were going over the menus.

After we finally put our orders in it was SUCH A LONG WAIT. The restaurant wasn't busy when we arrived so that wasn't the reason. Our table ordered mostly tacos and sandwiches so it should have been relatively easy. Thank goodness we had those goldfish to tide us over.

Finally we got our food. I do admit that it was really tasty and fresh, but the wait was annoying. Prices are decent for a seafood restaurant, but maybe a little high for a regular spot.

My salmon sandwich was yummy and I want to try the rest of the menu, but maybe I'll try a different location.
author: Annaliese D.

description:
Having a child is a huge pain in the ass. People tell you this before you have a baby, and you understand in theory, but not in practice. Luckily, Baby H. and his face and his blonde locks are the cutest thing ever, so I don't mind lugging him, sans stroller (I forgot), along with all his accoutrements, for eight blocks to get to Pacific Catch. I just die when I get there, and hand over baby care to Grandparents while I drink my adult beverage.

So, parking is difficult, but if you don't have a gigantic baby with lots of luggage, it's not a terrible place to be walking blocks and blocks to and from your car.

I ordered the Kamikazi Margarita, which was a godsend. It made me feel super. For my lunch I had three tacos, each with a different kind of fish. My favorite, hands down, was the BBQ Salmon taco. Next time, I would get only Salmon for all three. 

I shared the fish part of the taco and the black beans that came with it with Baby H. He also enjoyed eating the complimentary Pretzel Fish Crackers and edamame. He was a totally happy guy, and flirted/screamed with/at the waitress a lot. He likes brunettes.

This is a good place to get a nice semi-healthy lunch and bring your baby, but DO NOT forget the stroller. I have since purchased an umbrella stroller that lives in my trunk all the time.
author: Rachel H.

description: I have been here a few times and it is really good! The bowls are delicious. I wish I had saved room for dessert because they looked so good and I always tell myself I am going to but never do - because the food is so good. It was healthy and filling. Would definitely recommend it. (The drinks are slightly expensive...) Overall, great!
author: Carly C.

description:
Had a great experience eating at this restaurant I must first say, especially the waiter and the food had made this experience to a five star.  

Before we begin looking at the Menu, the server saw us walk to the table and simply gave us some starters in a rectangle dish that's divided with edamame and pretzel goldfishes.  We were extremely hungry and read to chow down. So we finished it and after we ordered our food the server refilled it again.  Normally I guess they don't do it, or maybe they are lazy but he did the extra mile and refilled us not twice but three times total.  I was really happy and the waiter knew how to treat his customer's right!

- food -

I ordered the Pan-Asian Rice Bowls: wakame salad, avocado, daikon sprouts, cucumber, ginger, sesame seeds, shredded nori & soy-wasabi sauce with seared Ahi with brown rice.

The presentation of the bowl was very balanced, I enjoy most was the seared Ahi; it was perfectly grilled and raw in the middle.  It was so good you can even taste that it was seared on a grill and the Ahi just melts in your mouth with the soy-wasabi sauce on top.  The salad was a bit interesting with mixed greens and Romanians top off with some Japanese style shredded green seaweed with the soy-wasabi sauce too.  I am a fan of brown rice and there brown rice is made perfect, not to soft or hard.  If you are not a fan of wasabi, I would not recommended because it is a little bit mild spicy.  You can have the choice of either 1/2 salad or 1/2 rice I eat a lot so I thought I would have too much rice but I would get full rice next time!


I also tried some of the Fish & chips my girlfriend order: 2 pieces of fish, 3 coconut shrimp & 3 crispy oysters with jalapeño tartar 

The fish and chips were amazing, the batter they used was very light and not overwhelming, yet enough to have a crunch, the fish was tender and juicy.  The fried oysters were smooth and creamy.  The sweet potato fries kicked an up a notch and balanced the meal with the sweetness and crunchiness to the fries.  It is some good stuff, I usually don't like sweet potato fries and I sure do like these!

Overall the food is great, the se
author: Kenneth Y.

description:
I had a great time dining at Pacific Catch tonight. My friend and i walked into Pacific Catch without reservations and were seated promptly. I LOVE the decor, you wouldn't even think the place was previously the Canvas Gallery. I love the red walls, there are plenty of seating, full bar & most importantly an open kitchen. I love restaurants with an open kitchen which means the place is clean.

It was my first time dining at Pacific Catch and i thought the menu was overwhelming but at the end i finally ordered the 3 tacos platter (Grilled Salmon taco -- which was very good!, Spicy Chicken Taco -- very disappointing because it wasn't spicy at all!, & Shrimp Taco -- my favorite because it comes with a mango salsa). The taco platter also includs sweet potato fries (YUM!!) & black beans. The platter cost about $14.95. My friend ordered the Eel Wasabi Bowl but she requested no wasabi but instead terayaki sauce which was really good! i wished i ordered the Eel bowl instead ($14.95). In addition to the menu, each meal includes  fish shaped pretzels & endame beans.  Our whole meal cost about $30 with drinks. 

Overall, i really enjoyed my meal and i cant wait to come back and try the other items in the menu. I thought the service was really good, our waitress was very sweet and attentive. I am not sure why there are some bad reviews about the service. The waitress even came back to refill my diet coke without me requesting for one! 

thanks Pacific Catch for a memorable dinner! :) 

PS. parking can be alittle tough!
author: Carol Y.

description: To begin. Robin is the reason I come here. This place is a awesome ... to the amazing cuisine... People and regulars ... I would love to say that I would happily drink and eat with you until the day I die.... Love....P.C. May you all live forever
author: Anna K.

description:
This is a great choice for seafood in the Inner Sunset. They do a few things that basically nobody else manages to pull off, and it always impresses me. It's a solid four-star dining experience, but the fact that they can go the extra mile earns them the 5th star.

First, don't get put off by the look. The decor is sort of corporate/franchise-y, but it's definitely not a dressed up TGI Friday's or BJ's or anything of that nature. The ingredients are fresh and high quality, and the food is prepared by people who care and know what they're doing.

Almost everything on the menu is seafood, but they manage to do fusion food better than anywhere else I can think of. Usually most places have a few good dishes in a particular style and if they stray too far, it comes out mediocre.

Here, they do American, Mexican, Japanese, and Korean fusion dishes at about an equally high level. None of the dishes is "like mom used to make", they've all got a unique twist that makes them Pacific Catch dishes. But these twists are all good choices, it's not like a lot of restaurants where they put their version on a classic and end up butchering it in the process.

So basically, the careful attention to the quality of ingredients, the obvious skill in developing the menu, and the ability to do so many diverse things well keeps me coming back.
author: Aaron G.

description:
My husband and I have eaten at Pacific Catch on our last two trips to San Francisco after getting lost, being crabby hungry, and stumbling across this gem last summer.  We loved it so much the first time that we made sure to make it a part of our vacation itinerary.

The food here is amazing!  Both times, I have tried things off of their seasonal menu.  The first time we went there, I tried items on their chalkboard menu that was Peruvian themed, and my husband ordered Korean barbeque.  On this last trip, we shared the shrimp coctel that was served with a mini shot of tequila.  For my entree, I had the mahi mahi, which was served with amazing sweet potato fries, a delicious tomatillo sauce, and fresh grilled vegetables. So delicious!  My husband got the salmon that came with rice and vegetables.  

The real star of the meal is the dessert!  Both times, we have had the fried dulce de leche.  It is literally the most incredible dessert ever.  It's rich, creamy, cheesecakey, gooey, and it's served with caramel sauce and vanilla ice cream.

I will definitely go back to this restaurant again!
author: Noelle T.

description:
My first time here, definitely not my last!

We were in quandry about where to go for my birthday dinner last night; after a bit of research and wanting to not venture too far out into the city since we had family in town, we decided on Pacific Catch.

Treading through GGP with a 4-year old nephew can make anyone very hungry so it was great that we were so close. We kept our car parked at the park (lol) and walked less than a block to the restaurant. 

First impressions work always- the place was clean, nice decor and the wait staff was friendly.

Early dinner equals Happy Hour... unfortunately they only serve the happy hour menu at the bar and it just didn't seem right to sit there with younger ones in tow. Womp womp :(
That didn't stop me from trying their lemongrass mojito though- delicious! Tart and sweet and minty with the right amount of rum... yum!

The trio ceviche was enjoyed by all- even the ones that weren't fans of fish (really?). The baja shrimp ceviche was tasty and tangy, the Hawaiian poke tuna was perfectly marinated, and the Peruvian ceviche was close to being great! I come from an area where Peruvian restaurants sort of rule, so I'm used to the ceviche being more authentic- with the white cornuts and the yucca- but this was still tasty and satisfying. 

Our dinner was an assortment of their rice bowls, fish tacos, fish and chips (made with the catch of the day... cod) and chicken tenders for the little one. All the dishes were very good. The taco and fish plates came with fries. Regular and sweet potato thumbs up- nothing spectacular about the "spicy" fries though. And nothing really "spicy" about them. dipping sauces were a plus, epecially the jalapeno tartar for the fish and chips and the wasabi (guessing) ranch for the sweet potato fries.

Our server was friendly and attentive and when asked a few questions about the menu she was knowledgeable and in one instance when she didn't know, she returned later with information and actually followed up. That was nice!

Lastly, my surprise birthday dessert (surprise!) was a near perfect brownie topped with vanilla ice cream and chocolate sauce. The brownie was dense but moist with walnuts and the vanilla bean ice cream... the icing on the cake!

Price was very reasonable for a party of 5.5.... $120 or so. Gratuity not included.

Overall, an enjoyable experience and a memorable birthday! 

Thanks Pacific Catch!
author: Yahra V.

description: Hawaiian Tuna Poke rice bowl.. yes please! This is the only main course meal i ever order, It is too die for!! love going to Pacific Catch, the ambiance is nice, servers are nice and attentive when they are not swamped and the food is decently priced. It is also walking distance from my place which makes it even more awesome! I've also had their calamari, and other poke and ceviche which are all great as well. Check them out, they also have a lot of seasonal items as well. Oh also the bf and I really enjoy the edamame and pretzel goldfish that they give you to snack on when you first arrive lol.
author: Lily S.

description:
While I don't usually love chains, I have always been pleased when eating here.  Although the space is very large, the tables feel intimate and the staff are always very helpful.  While the food can be over-salted, especially the poke ceviche and some of the glazes on the sushi, in general everything is great.  My in-laws are in love with the mahi mahi tacos!  
Even better, the restaurant is exceptionally able to accommodate folks with specific dietary needs.  The "Nojito" (non-alcoholic mojito) is excellent, and they have a gluten-free menu for those who need it!  Enjoy!!!
author: Sandra H.

description:
I've walked by this place for years and finally decided to try it last night. 
Applebee's meets Pacific/Asian fusion. "Fresh" fish on a  rice bowl, on pasta, on a salad or in a sandwich along side any option of tropical corn syrup cocktail.

The waitress was very nice but when taking our order asked, "What kind of protein would you like on that?" Granted there are three options, but if I'm paying $20 for a rice bowl I don't want to feel like I'm at Jamba Juice. 

The ambiance- just like eating in a Holiday Inn lobby. Short carpet on the floor, plastic wicker chairs and TERRIBLE, generic prints of fish all over. 

My boyfriends seared Ahi tuna bowl was fatty and tough, and my Teriyaki bowl arrived looking like a TV dinner- rice with little areas of vegetable that were sliced too large to even fit in your mouth. 

I should have know things could only go down hill when the first thing they brought to the table was complimentary Edamame and PRETZEL GOLDFISH. This would have been neat...if I was 5. 

Lesson learned: I will never, ever eat here again.
author: Brooke C.

description:
Green tea : tasted like thai tea without milk  -.-"
BBQ salmon sandwich : flavorful, must try!
Hot/spicy fries : tasted like bbq fries to me, fine with that!
author: Annie Y.

description:
I took a friend from out of town here for lunch yesterday. It was a great experience. We had the shrimp ceviche and poke for appetisers and they were outstanding.

Our waitress was Amber and she made a great visit into an amzing one.
author: Matthew F.

description: Came here once for happy hour and once for dinner. Had great experiences both times. Their poke is so good. Got the hawaiian poke wasabi rice bowl - it was delicious and came in a huge portion. I could have shared this or save half for the next meal. Service was quick and free parking lot in the back!
author: Linda L.

description: Great food and portions are just the right size!!! Our waitress very pleasant. The menus has a lot of healthy options where you can avoid carbs completely or substitute.
author: Tanya Z.

description: Don't let the name fool you. None of the seafood tasted like it was caught in the pacific. Caught in the freezer, definitely. Great location and dining area, trendy and spacious. I have to say our experience was nothing less than mediocre, from the service to the food. I suppose that's what we get for dining at a chain.
author: Lindsay O.

description:
A and I come here a lot now.  It's in a great location, spacious, almost always has room for us, and easy to walk to.

We used to always share the California Roll Salad.  They're awesome here because when you tell them you're sharing, they split everything up in two separate bowls for you.  

Lately, we've moved on to the Hawaiian Teriyaki Rice Bowl with Grilled Salmon and brown rice.  I like to get half brown rice and half greens.  That's greens, like salad, not green rice.  That would be weird.

I love the rice bowl.  It's tasty.  It's healthy.  But it's a bit too big for just me to finish.  I'd share with A, but he loves it so much that he always gets his own.
author: Kris L.

description:
Standard large restaurant fusion fare.

Parking in the back; 10 car lot. Drinks are $; decent selection of mixed and cocktails.

Portions are decent for the price; the sushi is your best bet; 2 rolls are plenty if you're not overly hungry. Expect the dressing to be heavy and complicated unless otherwise requested. 

If you're into fusion then great; if you want simple and good quality (fresh, texture) fish, this is not for you. 

For groups of friends, this place is plenty comfortable, spacious, and loud. Enjoy at the table or bar.
author: A T.

description:
Park Chow is sort of out of hand, at times, around lunch time.  Wait is a bit longer, it's a biz too cozy.  Maybe afternoon deck beer/wine, but if you need a proper business lunch place, I really think this is your spot.

In fact, I would venture to say it is the best business lunch spot on the West Side other than Park Chalet?  That's off the top of my head, but the restaurant is large, unpretentious, efficient, really quite good with both small bites and large entrees, and they have enough space in various ways for congenial conversation, a business presentation with laptop or ipad, etc.

The menu is solid, the barkeeps are friendly, and it's likely the right spot if you are looking for a warm, inviting, business lunch stop. Cheers.
author: Uncle Fishbits Aeneas X.

description:
First of all, the waitress at our particular table never once smiled. Thats kinda weird, especially since all the other waitstaff were smiling up a storm. It looked like they might have been a little understaffed, but even still she just wasnt that great of a waitress.

Except for the black beans and sweet potatoe fries, this place was amazingly mediocre. I tried all 3 of the seafood tacos (fried fish, shrimp, and mahi mahi) and have to say they were waaaaay too bland. All I could taste was sauce, I almost forgot there was fish in there. 

But,  the sweet potatoe fries and black beans were FANTASTIC! Or maybe I only thought they were good because they were the only thing on my plate that had any flavor...

The drinks were pretty awesome though, if I do come back it will solely be to get drunk. 

 In the end the hostess was the most attractive thing they had to offer.
author: Nelson S.

description: This place has seriously excellent Mai Tais and high grade poki.  The menu is quite diverse, I look forward to exploring more of what they have to offer, but I know it'll include a poki appetizer and mai tais.
author: Kenny J.

description: We were excited to see this place open a couple of years ago in our neighborhood. Since then we have been there multiple times. Recently we found the food to have lost its luster. The ahi tuna wasabi sandwich that I used to die for is now lost its great taste and the tuna isnt just as fresh anymore. The firecracker sushi is still alright. And their sweet potato fries cannot be done wrong. Too bad this place lost its footing and I am hoping maybe the next time I give this place a chance it will be different!
author: Michelle I.

description: Great food.  Lots of variety on menu.  Affordable, great service.  And, they will do kid items!
author: Peter E.

description:
The salmon salad was burnt. I did not like it.

Loved the place that was here instead a few years back.
author: Kristina S.

description:
Thank you Yelp for the free appetizer. After having the tuna poke at the holiday party we just had to have it again. The poke is fantastic, love it, finger lick'n good.
The mahi mahi had that gas fired grill taste I don't know if they have a gas grill but whatever seasoning they use maybe they need to change to hardwood seasoning instead of gas seasoning.
The taco platter was yummie but the single shells fall apart as soon as you think about picking them up. There is something to be said for doubling the shells.
Ben our bartender was great attentive even though he was pretty busy behind the bar.
Overall great experience would go again for the free tuna poke but may not stay for an entree.
author: Lawrence T.

description:
I came here with two galpals to explore the city and it was a definitely MUST to come here, according to one galpal. I had a 50% off discount for the bill courtesy of Scoutmob, and I still was not impressed. 

I got the Wasabi bowl and was impressed with the portion I got. My wasabi sticky rib bowl came with 5-6 ribs, tons of rice, cucumber strips, and seaweed! It cost $13.99 and you can even choose from other themes like Korean themed, Japanese themed, and two others. The ribs were falling off the bone and good! However, I wish the rest of the bowl could have helped enhance the flavor or somehow tie it all together. I couldn't finish my bowl and gladly took it home. 

The sweet potato fries had no WOW to it and I'm wondering why everyone is raving about them so much, they taste the same!
author: Connie C.

description:
Came here for lunch around 12pm.  There was no wait at all for small groups; in fact, there were quite a few tables open.  The thing is this Pacific Catch is on the corner of 9th and Lincoln, so it's really hard to find parking.  PC does have a parking lot, but it's fairly small so it's hard to find a space in there.  

Decor: The place is really nice looking for a restaurant that's not super fancy.  Nice hardwood floors.  There are booths and tables; indoor and outdoor seating.  Wine bottle light fixtures here are a cool touch.  There's an open kitchen and a bar you can hang out at if you don't want to sit down and eat.

Food:  I ordered the California Salmon sandwich with a side of sweet potato fries.  The sandwich was really good.  The salmon was cooked perfectly, cooked all the way through, but it was still tender.  The bread was surprisingly good.  It was a Ciabatta, but the outside was crisp and the inside was soft and warm.  It also came with avocado, and a citrus aoli.  I have to talk about the avocado because the avocado here is extremely good.  Usually, the avocado I get at restaurants are not ripe and bland, but at PC it was soft and very flavorful.  The aoli was good too.  Not sure how it's supposed to taste like, but I liked it.  The sweet potato fries were decent, this last time I had them.  When I had them this time, they were a little soggy and cold.  
I was disappointed because I had them once before and they were on point.

Service: Here's where PC loses some stars. Minus one star for being slow.  The waitress actually took our orders and brought our food out very quickly, but after that the service fell off.  Took awhile to get a refill on my drink, and to get the check after the meal was over.

This might be mean, but minus one star for the hostess.  Don't get me wrong, the hostess was nice and all, but she was wearing this black mini-skirt, showing off way too much skin (she wasn't the attractive).  The whole time I was thinking, you're a hostess at a restaurant, not a vegas night club.  Other than that, the foods great.
author: Anthony N.

description: Many times I have driven by this place but never had a chance to go and try it. I ordered the 3 taco platter with a shrimp taco, a fish taco, and the mahi mahi taco. The shrimp and fish tacos were well cooked and perfectly seasoned but I was disappointed that the Mahi mahi taco was cooked too long. The meat was definitely overcooked to the point that it was a little on the rubbery side. Aside from that blemish, everything else was good.
author: Joe K.

description:
I've been wanting to check this place out ever since I passed by it one time on my way to Golden Gate Park via 9th Ave. 

It was pretty packed on a Saturday around 6 p.m., which was no surprise, so I ordered for take-out and decided to wait at the bar, grab a beer and watch the game while my wasabi ahi tuna bowl was being prepared. Although the place was packed my order was ready before I could finish my beer and I don't nurse my beers. Since it was a beautiful and warm evening in SF I decided to journey across the street into Golden Gate Park to enjoy a quiet, relaxing meal in the summer sun. I would definitely like to come back some time to try what else this place has to offer, but so far I thought the food was pretty good and filling. I also give this establishment a plus for serving Kona Longboard lager on tap.
author: Erich D.

description: This is one of our 'go to' places when we're in SF - always great!  The menu choices are interesting and varied - have not been disappointed yet! My daughter and I usually just getting our favorite grilled salmon or ahi salads.  The wait staff is friendly, the ambience is low-key and just upscale enough to make it a good place to have business meals. Just plan ahead if you need to park - lots of tourists around there on weekends.
author: Julianne W.

description:
see food review from Marina Location...

i have to say, this location is much more spacious and actually a place that you can have a meal conversation... but for some reason, the atmosphere is missing something... cant really pin point...

but this place has full bar and free pretzel gold fishes to start! haha
author: Kelly H.

description:
Love it, usually just go for the bar foodies and drinks during happy hour.

Poki 
Sweet Potato Fries
Tangerine Beer
Rising sun sushi!
author: Marissa E.

description:
If you love fresh food and delicious drinks at a good price then go here.  

Get:
Spicy ceviche appetizer
Any grilled fish
Steak tacos

Be careful:
Mai tai ...stronger than they look
author: Michael C.

description:
Came for dinner sunday night after roaming through Golden Gate park and the Academy of science.  Parking is a bore.

Table for four without reservations at 6:00, scored and got at table.  The place is nice.  

On the table is fish pretzel crackers and soybeans, nice touch.

I had the wakame salad and seared Ahi,over rice done just right.  My friends had the grilled shirmp on mashed potatoes.  Had bear republic ipa on draft was a nice touch.   Finished the night off with warm peach  with a side of vanilla ice cream and cobbler and macadamia nut brownie.

food ****
service*****
decor****
nice solid ****
I left happy.  great place after a day in the park
author: Richard G.

description: I had a really nice experience here today. The general manager was friendly and attentive, greeted us the moment we walked in the door. We were seated promptly at the table of our choice in the bar area by the window (note: we arrived just after they opened, just before a Saturday lunch rush) and our server offered water immediately. I asked for recommendations and our server happily obliged. I was very happy with my California roll salad, which was huge and worth the $15. I will definitely be back when I'm in the area.
author: Nicole C.

description: I really like Pacific Catch. Their food is good, service is always great and they are very kid friendly.
author: Kasia G.

description:
Before I tried this spot, I use to drive by it every time I shopped around Haight street. Back in the days, I went to this spot when it was Canvas. 

Anyways, I ran into a long lost friend, Leslie R. (she's on my Yelp).  Long story short, I bumped into Les at a nail salon.  I freaked out and got a lil embarrassed bc unfortunately, Les knows me from my ex's softball team.  (FYI, its not really fun to run into people who know that you got played). We chatted for a bit, and exchanged numbers.  Now I love hanging out with her.  She invited me to lunch at Pacific Catch.

Les suggested the items I should get, ahi tuna bowl thing and oysters.  With all the noise and crowd, we still talked for hours.. talk about work, guys, drama, gossip, and the best part, she understood my embarrasment from the past and reassured me that its better to be alone than with a 2timer.  But its in the past, and the tuna ahi bowl was sitting in front of me.. So freaking good. We also had sweet potatoe fries (yuumy sauce) and oysters.  I loved it.  I wish I had a bigger stomach to eat more!  The waitress was awesome.. gave us plenty of suggestions.  oh and the drinks! yummy! I think I had a lemongrass mojito?? I had some mojito and it made me a lil tipsy. 

I think the best part about it, the sauces.  The sauces really make the dish.  And it wasnt the same sauce in every dish (like some lazy restaurants do)  There was a sauce for each specific dish.  I love it here, only bc I love seafood! I can't wait to come here again!
author: Cel A.

description: Love tuna poke here! Original poke is wayyy too salty for me though. I ordered it once long time ago but thought I was just unlucky on that day so today I tried one more time and again, way too salty. Will stick with Cali style, Serrano poke and Salmon next time.
author: W M.

description:
I worked in the inner sunset area today and was excited to try some new lunch spots.  I ended up yelping a few  places but Pacific Catch caught my attention with the reviews and pictures of their Poke and Dulce de Leche Spring Rolls.

I sat at the bar and ordered my food to go to enjoy it directly across the street from Golden Gate Park.  I ordered:

Poke Appetizer - It really was ono (dee-lish). I mean it wasn't like the real stuff in Hawaii but it was pretty good.  The sushi grade Ahi was cut perfectly and the color was bright (meaning fresh) with just the right amount of marinade.  It did lack the seaweed flavor but the crispy wontons they serve with it was the perfect combination of textures.

Vietnamese Steak Sandwich - Yummy!  It's not your average Bun Mi.  First of all, it's square shaped.  And the bread is soft!!! It still has the same marinated steak, seasoned veggies and heat flavor.  Sandwich came with Sweet Potato fries and a wasabi aioli which was also really good.

Dulce de Leche Spring Rolls - I was so full from the poke and half a sandwich that I didn't really get to enjoy this as fresh as I wanted to, therefore this was just OK to me.  I probably need to try it again to enjoy it more.  It kind of reminded me a skinny chimi cheesecake with vanilla ice cream.  

Regardless, I really enjoyed my food and I'd def be back if in the near vicinity.
author: Resa N.

description: I thought their pisco sour, crab & corn chowder and crab melt were amazing! Give it a try for sure :)
author: Irina K.

description:
Not a good restaurant for groups of four or more people. I came here last night with a dozen friends to celebrate my birthday and it was impossible to get in and out of the long "booth" they stuck us in. I was trapped most of the night and couldn't get up to pee without forcing four people to get up and scoot out first. 

The food was sub par. I had the salmon teriyaki bowl and my pineapple fried rice was drenched in teriyaki sauce; there was probably 1,000 mg of sodium in every bite (okay, I'm exaggerating just a tad, but it was salty!). I also tried the calamari...it was okay. 

Overall, it's just an average restaurant, but I want to give them the benefit of the doubt, since my girlfriend's love it so much. Next time I come here, I'll order something different and if it's good, I'll change the rating.
author: Jennifer L.

description: Mediocre food. Not sure why it is so popular . Korean ribs tasted as if they were prepared week ago, ahi tuna slices were not chewable, crab salads have been much better in other places. Please add a very slow service.
author: Boris S.

description:
FOOD:
1.) Korean Bbq rice bowl = Yum! Worth it. Falls off the bone, good taste
2.) Poke = It was good. Tastes a lil different than other poke? Not sure if the fish is the freshest..
3.) Sweet potato fries = Extra crispy, kind of a spicy touch. hrm, not sure if it suits my palate. I think I was expecting it to be sweet 

SERVICE:
Good. Ummm and pretty good Happy Hour prices

ATMOSPHERE:
It's pretty nice, contemporary, good for a casual date. Has a nice bar area. Some outdoor seating, plus booth seating.
author: Angela L.

description: We have been to Catch several times for lunch and for dinner with small and large parties. Invariably, service was very friendly and efficient. Food is focused on seafood and always was very good. I would rate them as a reliable neighborhood place for a casual meal. Will come back when in the vicinity. Some zones are more noisy, some quieter so you can select your level if you have a choice and the place is not crowded (it often is).
author: stan h.

description:
This place is somewhere in between 3 and 4.. so about 3 1/2 stars..
We all know that this area is really tough with parking.. even on weekdays. Pacific Catch has their own lot but it was full.. thankfully tonight we found parking a few blocks away. The space still reminded me of the Canvas, but it was nicely decorated and I liked the fact that they had a small space for outdoor seating. It was cute but too cold tonight to sit out there. Any who me and my two girls took a while to decide on what we wanted to eat since there were so many good sounding entrees. We finally decided on the Hawaiian surf and turf, 3 tacos and the fried basket. We were all very satisfied and pretty full. The portions could of been a little bigger though.. For dessert we had the dulce de leche spring rolls which were absolutely delicious! I'd definitely come back here again soon.
author: Tiff C.

description:
I have the tendency to order the same thing over and over again despite seeing great plates at the neighboring table. But like clockwork, I always order my unlimited Thai Iced tea and my Hawaiian Ahi Poke Rice Bowl. 

This place also has great salads, great fish and chips, and great sushi rolls.

Anyway, I've only ever been to the Marina location of this restaurant (which is EXTREMELY tiny) and I've been a fan. However, upon entering this huge restaurant at the Inner Sunset location, I don't think I'll ever be going to the Marina location anytime soon. Though the real reason for that is because I now live in the Inner Sunset. Anyway, this location has the same great food but with a lot of breathing space. One thing to warn people about is that parking here is just about as hard to find as in the Marina.

I highly recommend this place. Especially if you like seafood.
author: Rylan C.

description:
This place used to be better, but I think it's gone downhill a little bit. Your best bet is still the wasabi bowl with one of the fresh fish choices.
Atmosphere is a little chain-ish, but service is fairly dependable. You can park in metered or in the park.
author: Kyla L.

description:
Pretty solid.

Generous servings on the fish tacos. Big chunks of fish, lots of tomatillo sauce and aoili (I had to scrape some off). I opted for the shrimp, mahi mahi and the catch of the day which was rock cod, and the rock cod was probably my favorite. The tacos held their form pretty well, but I still had to eat a little with my fork. No complaints, it was equally delicious. Awesome sweet potato fries with kosher salt, a nice mildly sweet twist from the fish tacos with salsa and plenty of lime. The lemongrass mojito was sharp, and they have some pretty good beer on tap. Bomb.

Annnnnd if you snagged a goody bag at the Yelp Holiday Party this year there's a coupon for a free Hawaiian poke or shirmp ceviche appetizer with a  purchase of entree priced at $12.95 or above. The poke they had at the party had bit too much soy, but my guess is because it was made and then brought to the party (poke chunks probably dripped along the way and gathered a pool), not made to order like at the restaurant. The poke we ordered was plump and by no means soggy. Served with plenty of fried won tons. MMMM.

I wouldn't come here for sushi, but they do seafood well and the staff (including the chefs they had at PLEY!) were very friendly. Not the decor, but the menu seemed a little touristy and like a chain (a la Elephant Bar and such), but the food was good. They offer a late night happy hour on the weekend (after 10pm, but before they close at 11pm) with cheap appetizers and drinks, definitely a great deal. There's even a parking lot for customers. How awesome is that?!
author: Chelsea P.

description: I agree with some of the reviewers that service is hit and miss. I have some friends who refuse to go here because of an experience or two, but I always stayed true. Today was a miss and I'm now with the friends who are thumbs down.
author: JanM B.

description: Props to the person who hires employees because service here is wonnnderrful. Makes up for their 'meh' food. Still a good restaurant to visit though - always a nice respite from a busy day.
author: Mico G.

description:
Pretty nice place for reasonably priced fusion japanese seafood. Ordered california rolls, sweet potato fries, and some other things involving seafood which I do not remember. But I assure you it was pretty delicious. 

Oh and just noticed they have a parking lot!!! That's pretty rare in this city.
author: Jenn L.

description: The service was lovely, the food was pretty good but not outstanding. A nice gathering place, but not a food destination.
author: Mari N.

description:
First off let me warn you that this review is completely biased.  I won a contest for their Crabfest.  It included a fixed menu for dinner for 6 and two free beers.  So free crab...hells yeah.  Free DELICIOUS crab....f*ck yeah.

The first course was their Crab Corn Chowder.  This is the recipe that the exec chef won a contest with.  So we all had pretty high expectations...and they were met and exceeded.  It was perfectly spicy and had a nice pesto sauce drizzled over the top.  Tied with the crab as the best part of the meal.

Second we had a crab-ragoon like dumpling for an appetizer.  It definitely was good no complaints, but if it wasn't included it wouldn't have been missed.

Third was the main meal.  We had a choice between crab or their special which was two different types of fish.  I didn't really pay attention because I won a contest for free crab during their Crabfest Festival...so of course I choose the crab.  I normally don't like eating crab due to all the hard work and dedication needed to enjoy it, but this time I made an exception.  And I am glad I did.  The crab was seasoned and cook nicely that I didn't even need the extra butter to dip it on, though of course I still used it.  It was served on a bed of arugula and garlic noodles that was also delish.

Finally we had dessert.  There were three different dishes.  Mochi ice cream (chocolate, vanilla, and coffee), Brownies, and this apple turnover pastry served with Dulce De Leche ice cream on it.  The pastry with the ice cream was the stand out winner.  The mochi ice cream was the same you buy in stores but still so good.  The brownie was the low point....it was dry, but with all this other free goodness it didnt stop us.

The value of the meal was $300 and all we had to pay was tax and tip.  4 course dinner, 2 free beers all for under $30.  score!

The servers and hostess were extremely helpful and nice.  I don't know if it was because I was the contest winner and they were treating me like royalty, but good for them.  The GM, COO, AND the Executive Chef came out during our meal to introduce themselves, congratulate me, and talk a little.  Our party felt like rock stars.
author: Kelson P.

description: * TEARS * They took the ahi poke off the happy hour menu. =(
author: Sue Y.

description: We've been to Pacific Catch(sunset location) four-maybe five-times. While the first two-occasions were fun, the service and food was fair, there was also no issues with our OpenTable reservations as we were seated with drinks to come within minutes. If I were writing this review after our first visit I might've given them 3-stars, but since our first coupla times, the service as well as food have taken a notable decline. On our visit there last night: We had again made reservations, though pentacle, for 6:15. We arrived there just a few minutes early, and when i told the hostess we had a table for two under my name she apparently didn't hear me-i guess-'cause she said there'd be a 45min. wait. That's when my gf asked, "are you sure, even if we made reservations..?" the hostess then hurriedly seated us, gave us menus, water. about a half hour pasted and we still hadn't even gotten our dink orders in. So, we finally split and to our delight found a awesome brewery right up the street. no problem there-and they were packed! Needless to say Pacific Catch is off our list. cheers!
author: Brian C.

description:
I honestly don't remember what I ate but I remember it wasn't bad. I took my girlfriend here the day before Valentines Day. I looked it up on Yelp! and made reservations online and it was painless. 

I was surprised how much bigger and nicer it was inside. It's a great place to take a date. I definitely want to come back for the happy hour.
author: Nate C.

description: If L&L BBQ and Rubios had a baby it would grow up to be Pacific Catch. However, the service may make you wish you went to the fast food joint instead.
author: urban r.

description:
First of all, note that they have a private parking lot on the Lincoln side of the restaurant. Because we drove down 9th, we went straight into the park and worked up an appetite walking to the restaurant. No biggie because who doesn't love a stroll through the park? But for the anxious-parker, rejoice at the private parking lot!

I love the dining area. The high ceilings are almost unheard of in affordable city dining and it creates a really spacious atmosphere. It is also bright and tables have a good amount of space in between them. 

Pacific Catch has the most adorable nibble-food I've ever seen. Maybe I'm just a sucker for goldfish. Every table gets a tray of edamame and pretzel-flavored goldfish crackers! So cute. The two don't really go that well together but it makes for a very aesthetically pleasing start to the meal.

The menu is a little big and overwhelming. I just picked stuff off of the June specials menu because they were promoting some succulent shrimp specials that sounded enticing. I was tempted to go for the ahi wasabi bowls that I had read about but decided I didn't want to pay $14 for a rice bowl. Maybe next time.

Instead I went with the $13 shrimp banh mi. I expected it to be delicious because this is 26 times more expensive than a banh mi from Saigon and 3 times more expensive than a typical banh mi from Vietnamese sandwich shops. Of course it didn't need to be "authentic", just tasty. It sounded very good in theory but I think the presentation fell short. The bread was much too heavy to enjoy completely; it was more like a cross between a baguette and a roll. Ergh..overall the sandwich tasted like an Asian fusion po'boy. 

I liked that it came with a cool Asian looking salad, but did not like the coleslaw. Too many salads, make up your mind! 

As others have noted, the sweet potato fries are bomb and come with many of the dishes, so before you order yourself a whole side of sweet potato fries, check if your meal already comes with it!

The tacos looked good but overpriced. The fish looked tasty and reasonable for what you pay. The shrimp papaya salad was not good and the little shrimp was just weird to eat with the crunchy papaya! 

They charge you for brewed green tea. Our server was not particularly friendly to us and seemed completely uninterested in anything, but didn't really do much to affect our dining experience here. 

A solid semi-chain restaurant.
author: Lydia W.

description:
Went there on Saturday for dinner, and we got seated right before the dinner crowded came in.  Finding parking is always challenge in Irving area at night, but we were lucky to find a parking in the parking lot. The dinner was great and the services was fast. For two of us, we ordered the Hawaiian Poke, Cabo Calamari, King crab leg soup, and traditional tacos with sweet potato fries. 
My favorite was Hawaiian poke, sushi-grade ahi tuna in a sesame-soy marinade & spicy seasonings with wonton crisps, and Calamari. To me, the ahi tuna got slightly too salty near the bottom of the bowl, I think it might be the soy sauces that marinade the fish. For dinner we ordered, the Fried Dulce de Leche "Spring Rolls", which spring roll that wrap with cluster or cheese cake filling.  And served with vanilla ice cream & caramel sauce....Yummy
author: Stacy L.

description:
The bar area was already packed at 4:15pm on a Friday but my bf and I were quickly seated to begin our happy hour experience.  We sat at one of the tables with the tall bar stools, which was quite uncomfortable as the bottom of the table was not hollow for our legs to fit into.  My knees kept hitting the sides of the table. 

Now for the food.  I was tempted to order everything on their Bar Bites menu but opted to have just the first 5 items (minus the edamame beans and sweet potato fries) and 2 refreshing cosmos - YUM YUM.  I have been here before but for some reason the food was not as good as I remembered.  I had the following in the order of favorite to least favorite:

Asparagus & Shiitake Roll: It was an interesting vegetarian take on a sushi roll and I found the asparagus tempura and the tiny strings of mushroom and carrot to be quite lovely.

Thai Coconut Shrimp: It's funny because when I had my first bite, I was like "OMG...it feels like a Thai restaurant in my mouth."  Now looking at the menu as I write this entry, the dish's name is quite befitting. The coconut flavors are so quintessentially Thai.  I loved the crunch of the crispy coconut flakes and the juicy shrimp.  Frankly, I ended up just eating the coconut flake outer layer instead of the shrimp because it was so good.  The sweet and sour dipping sauce (that you can buy at any Asian market) was a nice complement. 

Spicy Tuna Roll: This roll was actually spicy, which I appreciated.  It was yummy with the bitterness of the daikon sprouts.  

Hawaiian Poke:  This was a disappointment as everyone had been raving about it.  Mainly because the poke tasted so gummy.  It did not simply melt in my mouth and the chopped green onions were a bit too overpowering.  I do like my poke to be marinated for a few hours so that the fish really soaks up the flavors but I just felt it had been marinated too long.  And the crispy chips started to give me a headache...which I get when I eat too much fried food.  Disappointing.

Spicy Cabo Calamari:  Pretty good but nothing too spectacular.  It was interesting that they also deep-fried slices of lemon and peppers.  The peppers were really yummy and SPICY...hehe...I attempted to eat the lemons too, but I suggest you not do that.      

The food is pretty good and very well priced. They also played good music...love Bob Marley. :) I think I hyped myself up for this dining experience as I hadn't been here in a long time.  I probably won't go for a few months.  I'm sure I will start missing the Coconut Shrimp by then.
author: Rose J.

description:
3.5 stars
