description: I LOVE OYSTERS.  I mean I really really REALLY love them.  I love them raw, I love them fried, I love them barbecued.  Pacific Catch had some amazing breaded deep fried oysters with a to-die-for jalapeno tartar sauce.  I swear I could've eaten 2 of the appetizer plates by myself.  This was the great part about my dining experience here.  The not so great was my Ahi Poke Wasabi Bowl.  3 words: sour, salty, gross.  There was too much vinegar in the rice, the poke marinade was way too salty, and the cubes of tuna were hard.  Bad choice on my part this time, but I think I'd go back to try something else on the menu.  Something safer maybe, like fish and chips.  OR I could get the fried oysters meal.  YES, now that's a good idea.
author: Kalista W.

description: Fun! Super big, had a "Chevy's" feel ( is that a bad thing??)...portions are big for SF.Liked the location...Poke,sushi and fish tacos all on the same menu....this girl is happy.Better half loved it  too...he liked the oversized sushi rolls.
author: Nan H.

description: I have been there 3 times now, and have had good experiences. The food is very good and the prices are fair. The only gripe i have is that the service can sometimes be slow, but usually thats not the case. Last time i was there, i had to get up & track down the server to get my check...very annoying. Overall, i'll go again. The sushi rolls are the best value for the $$ and are suprisingly good. The sweet potato fries are also wonderful.
author: Dave S.

description: Had dinner here with two of my friends and my friend's two children under 4. Service was good and the menu had a great selection.  Why only 4 stars? Because the food was decent, not outstanding.  Some were good tho, the sweet potato fries and the sticky ribs were great but the bowls didn't wow us. We also had California rolls for the kids but that tasted like a pre packed sushi box  from a supermarket. other than that we would definitely go there again
author: Kevin C.

description: Lots of fresh fish dishes, most with some heat; but very delicious.  Service was quick and friendly (it was mid-afternoon and not too busy).  Only reason not for 5 stars is that the side salad was just so-so and the prices are a little on the high side for a lunch.
author: John W.

description: After a long day at Golden Gate park Pacific Catch is the first place that comes to mind when my stomach starts growling. The sweet potatoe fries are the first thing I order with a salad and seared ahi tuna. Customer service is excellent.
author: Marie G.

description:
I'm not going to lie-I had low expectations for this place. After months of walking by Pacific Catch on the way to other restaurants on Irving, my friend had a hankering for fish and chips so off we went. I ordered the crab salad wasabi bowl with brown rice and miso soup with mushrooms and asparagus. The miso soup was okay, way too much asparagus which distorted the flavor of the soup a little bit (and also too pricey for what it was). However, I  was pleasantly surprised to be graced with a decent portion of crab in the wasabi bowl. The crab salad wasn't too heavy, which I preferred. Unless one is starving, the wasabi bowl is a good choice if you're trying to get two meals out of it (and keeps pretty well in the fridge for a day).
I'd definitely go back again, although the pretzel fishes kind of weirded me out...in a cute way I guess.
My friend and I were seated in a booth, so the ambiance was pretty good. However, they have some 2 person tables in awkward places that didn't look too comfortable.
I'm only knocking the place down a star because the soup was too over priced and they charged for tea (even though it's a fushion restaurant).
author: T L.

description:
HUGE fan of Pacific Catch. I probably eat here once a week...usually the tacos/fries, grilled special of the day (so long as it has the pineapple salsa and maui onions) or  poke salad is what I order. All are delish. The lemongrass mojito (made with Flor de Cana!) is amazing and refreshing. 

I would give this 5 stars, but the service is sucking big time lately. And it's not because they are jammed. It's usually because the servers are on their breaks, talking to the hostess or hanging out by the bathroom. The last few times I've had to flag down our server several times over the course of a quick meal. The Corte Madera and Marina locations are much better with the service (Jeffery in the marina is a scream) and attention.
author: julie b.

description: I'm not typically a fan of chains, but I do make the exception for local ones. I've been to the 9th Ave and Chestnut locations numerous times. Big fan of the sweet potato fries, dark & stormy cocktail, and wasabi bowls. I've tried a number of other dishes and have yet to be disappointed. Seems like a good value too as the portions are on the bigger side. I love that they are pet friendly in their outdoor seating areas. Definitely a decided factors for me when I'm hungry and have the pups with me. Oh and there's a parking lot attached the 9th Ave location. Score!
author: S A.

description: I really want to give this place 5 stars but alas no.... Food was average bordering on the good side. Service was terrible. We had five different servers help us and each time ask if someone already helped us...15 minutes later we got our first round of drinks. Food came and we ordered a second round. We didn't get the drinks until we were completely finished with our meal and all plates had been cleared. We sent the drinks back and they removed them from the bill so that was a plus. I will try this place again, but will not wait
author: John D.

description: Did I leave my house and somehow teleport to Suburb, Anywhereville in the course of the 5 block walk.  Whole family outings, young parents with kids, college students on dates. Average food with average preparation. At least the martini glasses were large and the specialty drinks tasty.
author: Nikke G.

description: I fail to see the appeal. The food never tastes BAD, it just doesn't really taste like anything. And why would anyone come here for sushi with many many sushi places with a variety of price points and qualitites within a few blocks. Finally, am I the only one who tends to feel like my place comes out half-full? It's not that I leave hungry, I just wish they would bring my food  on a surface that gave the illusion of a good value.
author: Julia G.

description: I really like this place.  Not super cheap, but great food and atmosphere!  I am actually not a big seafood fan, but my boyfriend highly recommends the ahi tuna salad and the fried seafood basket.  The chipotle chicken sandwich and sweet potato fries are also yummy.  Extra points for the unique edamame and pretzel gold fish to snack on while you wait!
author: Patti L.

description: Solid choice.  Went here with a couple of couples and a recently birthed child.  Very sroller friendly for our friends which was nice.  The food was tasty although the portions were a bit small - prices were reasonable though.
author: Robert U.

description: Was in the area tonight so I stopped off and ate at the bar. At first I was thinking about a Wasabi Bowl but they had a special of Idaho Trout, served Baja style with sweet potato fries for $12.95 (the bowl is $15.95). So, I went for it and ordered a beer since I felt like I just saved $3!! The fish was great, the rub they put on it kicked up the flavor. Of course the fries were good and it came out in about 12 minutes, not bad. So, the reason I am giving four stars is that the bill came and it had the trout at $15.95! I told the waiter that my menu said $12.95 and he said "oh you must have been given a lunch menu... sorry." Not, "sorry, i'll fix the bill" but just "sorry". Oh well, at least they don't charge the 3% health care thing. Pacific Catch is good at what they do. I'll be back!
author: Jim M.

description:
I haven't been to this one in awhile so I dont know if their menu is different from the one in the Marina district.. BUUUT

I love their wasabi bowls! I'm a huge fan of their ahi poke.

I remember them having a poke sampler.. THAT is an awesome deal with a variety of fish. The one in the Marina didn't have it... boo

AND I love their sweet potato fries.. I'd probably get them to go if I walked past the restaurant... but I live on the East Bay.

I don't think I can ever get tired of this place. Their cocktails are so delish too! I can usually handle my alcohol.. but these dang things creep up on me cause they're so good. 

I'm usually pretty quiet when I eat here because there's a constant flow of food into my mouth.
author: Colleen L.

description: I'm not a sushi expert...hell, I don't even LIKE sushi all that much. So when my husband craves it, as he did this weekend, I either have to give in or fndd a place like Pacific Catch that offers a varied menu of sushi and other seafood treats. When we sat down to dinner, I got sucked in to the sushi bandwagon and decided to split a few rolls with my dining companions. I was pleasantly surprised by how delicious it was. We  shared a rock n roll (eel - yummy!), a spicy tuna roll and a tempura salmon roll. Everything tasted really fresh and, for a non-raw-sushi-eater such as me, it was a great assortment of user-friendly rolls. I'm sure sushi experts might prefer to go elsewhere, but for sushi novices/lightweights this is a perfect middle ground.
author: Beth T.

description: I like coming here to sit in the bar area, have a beer, have a bit of food and watch the ballgame. Food is good but the service can be slow at times. Sitting at the bar is your best bet because then its hard for the bartender/waiter to ignore you. But if you sit at the side tables near the window, the bartender can take his/her time to come over even when there's hardly anyone else there. But, I do keep coming back. Once they come to the table they're always friendly. Guess I end up overlooking the occasional episodes of disinterest cuz I enjoy everything else about the place.
author: Jan F.

description: I have walked past this place many times on my way into Golden Gate Park.  Finally decided to try it because of a special promotion.  Well, gotta say it was very good.  Had the salmon sandwich which many reviewers have said was great, and it did not disappoint.  The fish was moist and cooked just right.  Had the sweet potato fries as the side.  I still think the Elephant Bar sweet potato fries are better, but not bad.  Prices are not bad to boot.
author: Stephen W.

description: Five kids, Five adults on a Saturday afternoon.  The food was great and the service was great and everyone really enjoyed themselves.  I had the big green salad with Hawaiian poke.  The other had tacos and the kids had sushi. Plates were cleaned.
author: Erin M.

description:
My husband and I went to Pacific Catch on a Wednesday night and the place was pretty full.  So we sat at the bar instead so that we didn't have to wait, which turned out great cuz the bartender was very nice and both our cocktails tasted delicious!  We ordered the Firecracker Salmon roll which was very good.  We also ordered the sturgeon fish of the day which came with an avocado sauce, grilled vegetable, and sweet potato fries.  The fries were really good.  The overall portion size for the entree was just right because it still allows room for appetizer if you want.  We are small eaters so it was just right.  Our total bill was about $60 which is not too bad given we had drinks too.  We're definitely going back and will try some of the other menus.  We recommended this place to our friend who liked it too.  The only complain they had was that everything on the menu is fish but that was fine with us.

1/1/2008: This is the 2nd time I've been here and I would still give it a 4 star.  We had reservations at 7pm for 7 people and they seated us late for about 10 mins and they comped all our appetizers, without us complaining or mentioning it at all.  Now that's a restaurant that cares about their customers.  It was a pleasant surprise and treat.  The service was great throughout the meal as well.  

With 7 people, we tried alot more different dishes.  

Appetizers:
1) Shrimp ceviche - They were whole shrimp and there were lots of them.  I think they should dice up the shrimp because it was served with tortilla chips and there's no way you can get a whole shrimp on the chip.  But the taste was decent overall, nothing spectacular so I probably won't order it again
2) Grilled artichokes - Fresh, good, seasoned properly.  Would order it again.
3) Calamari - very good, came with fried lemon slices too which is an interesting touch.  the sauce was a little spicy.  Would recommend trying this and I would order it again.

Rolls
1) CA roll - good that it was real crab meat, not some doughy fake ones.  There was too much rice which will fill you up quickly.  I prefer less rice.  Probably would not order it again just because I don't think this is not a signature dish.

2) Rock 'n roll - Too much rice, couldn't find/taste the unagi (bbq eel).  Again, it tastes ok, but wouldn't order it again.

3) Firecracker roll - We had this last time, loved it.  This time it was still good.  For some reason, this roll doesn't not have as much rice as the other too, which is good.  Would order it again

Entrees
1) Mahi mahi fish of the day - came with grilled veggie, sweet potato fries, mahi mahi served with tomatillo avocado sauce.  The fish had a cajun spice rub that was a bit pungent.  The sweet potato fries as always was great.  Grilled veggie - can't go wrong with this.  Don't like the spice rub so won't order it again

2) Grilled shrimp teriyaki bowl - Very tasty, great teriyaki sauce.  Liked that it came with veggie and mushroom, chopped and mixed into the rice.   Would order it again

3) Ono fish of the day - very good.  came with fried onion rings that were delicious.  came with pineapple fried rice which everyone loved.  the fish was grilled on banana leaf so it had a great aroma and taste.  would order it gain.

4) Organic chinook fish of the day - it came with grilled artichoke and brown rice and the fish was served with a tomato sauce.  it was fresh and decently good.  i'm not a big grilled salmon fan so that's why i won't order it again. 

5) Grilled Korean beef (another daily special) - I don't eat beef so I can't comment, but my husband thought it was decent.  This place is called "Pacific Catch" so I'd stick with the fish but if you have a friend that doesn't like seafood, at least there is an option to have meat.

Overall, I'd recommend this place and would go again.  Good atmosphere for couples or groups.  Great service.  Nice decor and clean.  Lots of cocktails, decent size wine list.

2/14/08: This is visit #3.

Cocktail Review:
Sun Burn - average; menu says there's a tropical syrup in it which I think is what gave it a little after taste of some sort.
Some cocktail with Gin 209, kiwi and cucumber juice - DELICIOUS!  We had to order a 2nd one.  

House salad - Good size, very fresh greens, salad dressing was yummy, if you like a Japanese type kinda dressing w/miso; The mushrooms that were in the salad was delicious.  They're cooked in some sauce, not some uncooked mushroom.

Catch of the Day Fish and Chips - The ling cod fish and chips is the freshest fish and chips we ever had.  It's lightly fried, lightly crispy and covered in a thick batter where you eat a lot of batter and not fish.  The fish was cooked to perfection and fresh and was juicy.  The sweet potato fries as usual, are always yummy!!!

Salmon and mahi mahi taco: Both were good and fresh.  The salsa on each one are good.  The salmon one has a spicy kick to it so if you like spicy, try that.
author: Irene C.

description:
so, i grew up in orlando.  for anyone who's never been, it looks, feels, and tastes exactly like this place.  all it's missing is the rest of the shopping plaza and the fifty acre parking lot.

the thing is, the food isn't TERRIBLE.  but it's not great either.  and while it might seem all right in a place like orlando, i just don't get why you'd ever eat here in SF.  yet, it was packed.  

food-wise, we shared a few appetizers, coconut shrimp, calamari, etc., which were all deep fried and okay, and then we ordered our entrees, and they were out, seriously, in thirty seconds.  call me crazy - i mean, i'm all for efficiency and all, but that kind of stuff makes me suspicious.  i had the king salmon special, and it was a little overcooked and basically drowning in this really sweet, thick sauce.  (it could've been any fish under there.)  i didn't taste any of my friends' entrees, but we all seemed to be feeling about the same.  i kept thinking, are we sure this place isn't owned by darden?

all that said, the mai tais were pretty damn good (yes, i said mai tai, thankyouverymuch), and the bartender was great.
author: brian g.

description: Someone must have thought of my dream combo.. Fish and Chips plus japanese/hawaian style cusine!! So we went here by chance, just to check it out. I was across the street getting "Blue Brothers" at Le Video, and was super hunger and didnt want to go to far... I ordered the plat of the day; girlled Mahi Mahi, and grilled articoke and brown rice.. yum yum while my boyfriend got the Fried sampler; fried mahi, oysters and coconut shrimp. We began with some cocktails and the Poke, which I highly recommend! Next time Im getting a "Sashimi" bowl with tuna.... we skipped on the sushi rolls b/c we are so die hard for our sushi guy (see my other yelp review, chin bistro) but next time Im giving it a go... Service was friendly and appologetic, though I think she had smoked a joint in the park before work because she was super forgetful.!! SO GLAD DUMB CANVAS has been replaced!!
author: Liz C.

description:
Uhm...where do I start....oh....they have a parking lot.  Ok I think that's the highlight of the place oh...and the place looks nice.  Now on to the food.  Hmm...bleh.  That's what I thought about it.  So I ordered the 2 fish taco platter and ordered one grilled mahi mahi and the other one a baja style.  Both of them were pretty bland.  The sweet potato fries were ok.  Lorraine L. ordered the mixed the mixed basket which had skewered coconut shrimp, fish fillets, and deep fried oysters.  The coconut shrimp was hard to eat.  She tried to slip one of the shrimps off the skewer and was having a hard time cuz the breading would come right off.  The actual taste of it wasn't too impressive.  Her oysters were somewhat chewy and her fish was just ok.  Another friend ordered the special for the night which was sea bass...which they didnt have so they said they had trout instead.  Hmm...trout is way different than sea bass last time I checked.  Anyway she got the trout but was pretty flustered about it.  The rest of the friends ordered fish & chips.  Oh...if you wanna ask about how big the fish is...don't ask.  

I think the only reason why I might come back is to try out there late night happy hour.  Other than that I wouldn't come back. =/
author: Adrian D.

description: Great cheap eats! I always order the salmon wasabi bowl because of the delicious salmon and sour tangy wasabi flavored rice. It's definitely great for lunch or dinner. I especially enjoy this new location as it has tons of space and you can make reservations on opentable.com. I have also enjoyed many of their sandwiches. It's great for take-out as well. It's nice to have a comfortable atmosphere and a healthy meal option for a great price.
author: Josephine L.

description: I HIGHLY DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS RESTAURANT. Worst service I've ever had. I was with my toddler and  I can not believe the HOSTESS told me that she was unable to give me a booth that was open because in 45 min. a party would come in... WAIT as i recall, she said i could seat you, but you have to leave in 45 min. What kind of BS is that.  I live right by this place, but I would rather drive all the way to Pacific Catch on Chestnut, friendliest service ever.  Plus i was never told i would have to leave at a set time. AGAIN I HIGHLY DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS RESTAURANT!
author: Food C.

description: Pacific Catch always delivers.  I've been to both locations and find this one to be better in the sense that there is parking, places to sit, and more parking.  Food wise they seem similar to me.  The Wasabi bowls are always a favorite and are huge in size.  The last time I was here, they even gave us a $20 oyster app even though we ordered the small portioned one.  After realizing their mistake the waiter was quick to point it out, but did NOT ask us to pay for the higher priced one.  Nice call.  Wasn't a huge fan of the shrimp ceviche, but other than that, everything else is great.
author: Thomas C.

description: Went with a large group for dinner on a Saturday night-the sweet potato fries were the hit of the evening, so be sure to order these as an appetizer.  They do bring pretzel goldfish and an edamame appetizer on the house but we found the edamame difficult to eat.  They were already shelled and no servicing spoon was available to scoop these out of the dish.  I had the escolar special which was meaty, flavorful and cooked just right.  Just a bit on the pricey side but if you work for UCSF, show your ID and you'll get a 10% discount which certainly helps!
author: Al L.

description: loved complimentary edamame and goldfish pretzels, fish tacos, and sweet potato fries :)
author: Andrea B.

description:
The rare intersection of great food AND reasonable prices.  Edamame, wasabi rice bowls, seaweed salad, grilled fish (mahi mahi and tuna are always good), fish tacos, sweet potato fries -- all tasty.   Sometimes the fried fish tacos are a little fishy tasting because they don't always get all of that gray stuff off whatever fish they use for that... but that's kind of a nit.  Interior's nice too (though if you require super fancy-schmancy, this might not be you spot).  

Plus -- they actually have (limited) free, dedicated parking.
author: Steve R.

description: I've been trying this place over and over again throughout the years (mostly because my husband likes it and talks me into it every time) - the majority of the time I have not enjoyed what I ordered.  And then tonight we went again for dinner (we live in the neighborhood) and I had the special - escolar!  OMG...it's by far the most delicious fish I've ever eaten - EVER!  I'm relatively speechless and ...even though I'm still full...am dreaming about when I can eat this dish again.  The fish was grilled and served with a grilled artichoke and a delicious aioli dip, and rice, and a tomato and summer squash medley.  It was supposed to come with brown rice (my favorite...and from what I hear, they make it just right), but they ran out and told me ahead of time (which was nice) and then said it would come out late but they'd substitute something else in the meantime so my family and I could eat when all the other food was ready (I chose sushi rice).  They never brought the brown rice - so I asked for it as we were leaving to take with me.  That and other slow service issues meant our service was not great.  The manager is not exactly on top of things and there's a bit of an ultra-hip attitude going on that's a bit over the top...but this fish is worth dealing with all of that just to eat it.  I'm only giving 4 stars because of the so-so service, pretentiousness, and the hit and miss menu (I've probably had 4-5 dishes now and only this last one was worth the trouble - this fish was THE BOMB!).  The iced tea is also very good and it's very easy to bring your kids here and not disturb anyone (the tables are nicely spaced apart).
author: Nancy K.

description: I think this place is overrated. The service was good and the servers were friendly, but the food was just mediocre. I had the California salmon sandwich which was suppose to come with avocado but there was none to be found in my sandwich or anywhere on the plate. The organic string beans that come with every sandwich was also missing. Either the cook doesn't know his/her own menu or they need to update it. Overall, it was okay but not worth the price. I probably won't be going back.
author: Austin C.

description: Came to Pacific Catch with a friend from out of town and we were treated to this great awesome one of a kind drink called the "Ryan Rhumba" (ask the bartender Ryan to make it). Its soooooo refreshing and sweet and okay, so I'm going back tonight just to get another one of those. The appetizers were awesome too!
author: S M.

description: This is a nice and easy take to place a group or go out for dinner on a weekend. There is parking, it's a big space, and there tends to be availability if you call. The cuisine style is a nice combo - sort of mexican meets seafood, and the quality of the food is good. I wouldn't go here for a special occasion, and the ceviche is nothing to write home about, but it's a good staple restaurant.
author: a m.

description:
solid meal

coconut shrimp are delicious
poke was OK but the quality of the tuna seemed a little off
tasty beers were had.

ambiance in the main dining room seems a little off, like a mcdonalds in a food court or something, with that ugly slate tile. Seems much nicer in the front room where the bar is, but we didn't sit there.

If you make a reservation through open table make sure they check you in. They didn't check us in and open table had us down as a no-show. which then required a bunch of bs to get rectified.

Hey don't mess with my open table points!
author: Alex K. W.

description: FINALLY!  there is seating for more than 10 people!  this place has the BEST poke in town.  My friend and i loved it so much, we ordered two!  the marina location had excellent bowls... but at this location... it was so-so (i had the salmon teriyaki).  maybe it was just the fact that i was so stuffed from shoving poke down.  the corn on the cob still does wonders.  YUM!!!  We didnt have reservations, so ended up waiting about 1 hour for our table.  but that's ok.  my friend and i were in good company of poke and sake :o)
author: Nutmeg Y.

description: Minus one star for the annoying waiter who obviously wanted us to get up so that the people on the non-existant wait could possibly show up and grab our table. Loser. Anyway, food was great, atmosphere is way better than the marina location, and the pomegrantite martini was yum yum in the tum tum....we did a few sushi pieces and the fish and chips - all were excellent. Not so excellent - the Friday Happy Hour scene :-(
author: Jess W.

description: This restaurant would be more at home in a Westfield mall than on 9th Ave. in the Sunset.  It's totally corporate, the food is boring, and the fish is not fresh.  Also, I think there was something wrong with their deep fryer, because the fish and chips were soggy.  Next time I want seafood, I'm going to Ebisu.
author: Ezra Y.

description:
so what are you? sushi joint or fish & chips? you really cannot be great at both can ya?

i had the fish & sweet potato frie basket.... deep fried deliciousness!
my bf had the poke bowl.....really now, the most basic item which just needs to be fresh and marinated and plopped over rice was subpar.
 
why bother. 14 dollars down the drain when you can go to bristol farms for much better value/ tasting poke.

redeeming factor:  the deep fried oysters, yum!

service: everyone looked discombobulated, too busy to help clear your plates really. all in all...i have gotten better service from a chevy's

stick to the deep fried...
just cause they serve sushi & sake, does not mean they do it sushi right.
author: Tiger Lily ..

description:
Located on a fairly busy corner of 9th and Lincoln, this new restaurant replaced the art gallery, bar, restaurant thing that was here before. The décor was marine themed, and the place appeared clean. Being my first visit here, and sitting in one of the booths I had an impression that they may have some kind of identity confusion. I don't know if it was because the name gave me the assumption they were a California Cusine restaurant with a slant of seafood offering, or the extensive menu that included American entrees, alongside Japanese items like sushi, teriyaki, and Mexican with the tacos. The edamame they served as soon as we were seated tells me they are Japanese. Maybe it was the Hawaiin entrees, or the fact that the visible cook staff was completely Hispanic, except for the one white guy calling out orders at the pass. Mexliforniapanese Dining. Nah, doesn't have the right ring to it. 

We were disappointed in the ahi tuna poke appetizer. The ahi was fresh enough, but the seasoning was monotone, and overdone. There is no evidence of poke seasoning. Just soy sauce with bits of red and green onions. I love salty foods, but even I thought this dish was too salty, and finishes flat.

Our entrees were Wasabi Ahi Tuna sandwich, and the Mixed Catch Basket. The Ahi Sandwich was over-seared (see Medium Well), and missing any kind of a wasabi bite. It tasted good, with the avocado slices providing a nice buttery texture for the sandwich and a somewhat experimental addition of pink ginger slices (yes, the same ones served alongside sushi) that didn't do much. It was an okay sandwich, for what its worth. I couldn't help but think this was some deli's version of a sushi on a french roll - take a roll, replace rice and seaweed with bread. The Mixed Catch Basket was served with sweet potato fries. It was the probably the best component of the dish. You couldn't go to far off track with fried foods, and this basket was no exception. Good, but nothing worth writing about. I should stop here.

The coleslaw that accompanied our entrees were suprisingly good. It was a light cream dressing with a distinct Korean-type pickling tang I detected. It was light and palette refreshing.

Overall, it was an okay experience. The place is nice to be in, be seen in, but not particularly nice to eat. I'll probably be back only when we are doing something in the park, and want to hit a bar... Nah, I'll walk the extra block and head to Yancy's instead.
author: Bor C.

description: Wooo!!! I love the sweet potato fries and the dipping sauces they come with. The calamari is excellent too. My salmon teriyaki rice bowl was a bit too sweet, but the fish was cooked perfectly. The wait was a bit long, but the prices were decent, and I look forward to coming back for dessert. Dulce de leche spring rolls and mango cheesecake sounds interesting. If you're craving fish or Asian fusion, Pacific Catch is a pretty safe bet.
author: James P.

description:
ahi poke wasabi bowl, with brown rice.  so it's a little heavy on the rice side (as in they prob give you 2 cups at least).  so i kindly scooped about half of it aside, and heartily ate the remains, which was more than enough considering i was pretty darn hungry.

i could see this as a casual date spot perhaps, or a good place for reasonably priced seafood with a group of friends.  this isn't a fancy date place, nor somewhere that you go for a night out on the town.  it is, what it is.  its very similar to the atmosphere next door at park chow or the like.

our waiter was very friendly and all of the service was very good (ie water glasses filled once they were half full).  the food was pretty good, and you can substitute brown rice.  all in all, a good reliable place to come back to.
author: Jason J.

description: I've eaten here twice and walked away satisfied each time. I haven't been to other locations so I can't really compare them, but I like the interior of the place. Nothing over the top but not plain and boring either. Nice casual place to come and grab some grub.  Each time I've eaten one of the wasabi bowls, 1st time I had the ahi tuna the 2nd time I had the eel. I liked both but if I had to pick I'd choose the bbq eel first.
author: Cee D.

description:
I can safely say I will never go back to Pacific Catch ever again. 

I'd been there once or twice before for drinks and snacks and things were fine.  Unfortunately I can not say the same for my most recent experience.  

This past Saturday night, 5/1/10, a group of friends and I headed here for a few late night snacks and drinks since we were in the area and knew about the late night happy hour specials.  We sat at the bar in a few small groups and although we had already had a few drinks were not really loud or rowdy (I acknowledge that we can get like this sometimes but we were pretty tame that night).  From the minute we sat down it was clear that the manager and some of the wait staff were none too thrilled that we had decided to spend money at their establishment.  For the rest of the night the manager stood at the end of the bar and was clearly talking s%*$ about us (about what I am still trying to figure out...) while pointing and casting unhappy stares our way. Our waitress didn't smile once and barely acknowledged that we were trying to order.  I guess the manager thought we were so drunk already that we wouldn't notice her standing there even though we were literally sitting 5 yards away...  At one point my BF asked if everything was ok but our waitress played the I have no idea what you are talking about look and walked away.  The worst part of the whole thing, when our waitress finally did bring us our bill, that would be the bill for just me and my BF since we were not sitting with the rest of my friends, there was already an 18% gratuity added!!! I was completely dumbfounded.  At that point I had no more energy to deal so we left without bringing it up but I woke up the next morning totally regretting that I hadn't.  

Oh and the food really wasn't that great.

One of the worst dining experiences I have had in SF ever.

Couple tips for the staff:
1-If you are going to talk s%&* about your clients, at least go in to the back
2-Don't have a late night happy hour if you don't want people coming in who might have already had a few drinks
author: Alex S.

description:
Nicer atmosphere inside than it appears from outside; even when bar is crowded during happy hour, high ceilings (I assume) make it not too loud to carry on your own conversation.  Plus, if you eat in bar (several tables, hi & low) on one of those days when restaurant is packed with people with children just coming from park, the music is pleasantly loud enough that it doesn't sound like your'e in a chuck e cheese.  Booths, because they're tall, offer decent privacy even when crowded.

Great weekday happy hour (4-6).  Serve several fruity drinks; even watching bartender make my vodka collins was like standing at the counter watching workers at jamba juice.  Dos Equis on tap!  Solid mojitos & cosmos.  Good deal on tasty appetizers.  Only questionable app. are sweet potatospicy fries pretty much taste like A&W curly fries, so I'm sticking with poke, calamari, tuna rolls. 
Good variety on menu, relatively healthy food available.  Poke appetizer bowl is a great deal & tasty.  I'm an oyster fan & fried oysters (Washington state) were good.  Salads looked good & seemed big enough for meals for most people.   Shrimp Ceviche (regular menu) not a bad deal.  When they have them, steak tacos are totally worth it!
 Service was good, appropriately attentive.
author: Ernie S.

description: Food was fabulous. I love the sweet potato fries. And my friend ordered the Poke and that was fantastic. I would definitely go there again. And they have their own PARKING in the back.
author: Julie K.

description: The Sweet Potato Fries are bangin.  And if you ever order one of the teriyaki bowls, get the teriyaki sauce on the side, cuz i had waaay too much sauce in my salmon bowl.  I haven't been here in a while.. I need to go back.
author: JD D.

description: super yummyyyyy , and good service , go here yummy
author: matt p.

description: The Sweet Potato Fries are pretty awesome and the Japanese Rice Bowls are pretty good, but overall it's a little bit pricey for the quality.
author: Nicole C.

description: I love this place and I am so excited that they opened one up in my neighborhood.  I love the food at the Chestnut location, but the place is so small and there never an available table so I get the food to go.   The 9th Ave location is huge so I don't think there will ever be a problem getting a table here.  The love that there is a variety of healthy dishes at really good prices. As long as you like seafood, there is something for everyone (salads, fish tacos, rice bowels, sandwiches, suchi, etc).  I'm a big fan of the shrimp tacos and the sweet potato fries.   A great casual spot for a weekend lunch or a quick week night dinner.
author: Sara A.

description:
cleanliness: 4/5
food quality:  2/5
service: 3/5
cost: $15-$20
other:

2nd Visit: I came here with a friend after another restaurant we wanted
to go to was closed. 

My friend ordered the poke and the traditional baja taco. I had the bbq salmon taco and the spicy chicken. The spicy chicken was not spicy and lacked flavor. The salmon was okay, but also lacked flavor. 

the service was pretty good but nothing outstanding compared to my last visit.

1st Visit:

cleanliness: 4/5
food quality:  3.5/5
service: 5/5
cost: $15-$20
other:

Found parking in the lot, probably because it was early. I came here with Helen and we sat at the bar per my request so we could grab a drink and watch the basketball game. 

She ordered the coconut shrimp and I ordered the catch of the day. She ordered a martini and I got a dark and stormy (which was great!)

The bartender was really friendly and chatted with us from time to time. The nuggets ended up winning and Helen was a great date as always. Unforunately the bartender thought Helen wanted the coconut shrimp appetizer, but she wanted the full entree. Although the coconut shrimp wasn't great, we enjoyed the sweet potato fries and my fish.

The bartender was super and comped us on the appetizer and by the end of the meal we left happy.
author: edie t.

description: A very mixed experience. Good trout when I was there,  , good sushi, good oysters, & what looked like good sturdgeon.  They failed, though, at some of the "easier " items, like french fries.  French fries should never be limp & soggy, especially at these prices. Maybe  with such a large operation and so much frenzied kitchen activity, nobody's paying attention to the no-brainers.
author: David H.

description:
After spending some relaxing time in the Tea Gardens in the park, my Love and I went to this very pleasing restaurant. We sat near the bar and we pleasantly surprised to get a quick (free) serving of pre-pealed edamame and fish pretzels. We ordered some soup, an artichoke appetizer, and shrimp taco and the miso glazed trout. The soup and artichoke were good, and the taco was ok (not recommended though), but the trout was absolutely amazing. Great fish, great sauce, great seaweed and what-not salad to compliment. Good to the last drop!

When you go, get the trout or one of their chalk specials (I would guess they are all great).

BEST DISH: Miso Glazed Troute
author: Ian S.

description: My husband I tried this place for the first time last night. I have heard about it so  many times and we were in the area and hungry so we figured it was good time. We walked in at 8:30 on a Friday night and no wait! That was great. The food was very good. I ordered the Ahi Tuni wasbai bowl and he had the mixed catch with sweet potato fries. Both of us were really happy with our meals. Really good food and good prices. The only reason I gave it 4 stars was that the service wasn't so great. I think she was pretty busy though. We will definitley be back!
author: Sarah C.

description:
I like this place even though its a chain.. I like the location of this one better than the marina one.  The fish in the Hawaiian Poke bowl I ordered was fresh and well marinated and it seems healthy with all of the vegies they give you.  This place is great for kids too.  Good service as well.  I would come back again.

 A bit pricey though!
author: Ethan C.

description: Went here after a fun time at the Academy of Science's Thursday evening Nightlife.  The place was packed (for a weeknight) so we sat at the bar and didn't regret it.  The Bartender was a nice guy with a great demeanor and sense of humor.  I ordered the Shrimp Teriaki and my girlfriend ordered the Ahi.  We both loved it.  Good place for seafood and has a nice vibe.  Would like to come back with reservations for a table.  Tip: Only a scant non-seafood selection so if you are not into fish skip it.  It is a fishlover's dream.
author: Kayne Y.

description: Ok, so we've been here about 10 times and I am finally writing a review as I keep craving their food. While I miss the Canvas coffee bar that used to be here, I do really like Pacific Catch. The size of the restaurant is large by SF standards, and feels a bit surburban with the huge booths and all, but the food and drink really delivers. We usually get a poke appetizer which is fresh and reminds us of our trip to Hawaii. My hubby tends to order a fish special which is always unique, fresh, and delicious. I usually get a teriyaki bowl or the coconut shrimp and they are both ALWAYS exactly what I want. I'm a creature of habit, what can I say. Sitting in the bar with a mojito can be fun, or a mai-tai, which is what my husband gets. The service has been good overall, though there is one waiter that is the slowest guy in town. I get a work discount here, so the price is right!!! Mmmmmm I'm craving Pacific Catch right now!
author: Anne Y.

description:
the food was in the middle of ok and great. if that makes any sense. haha. i ordered the shrimp tacos and my dad ordered the combo plate thing--- had fish, coconut shrimp, and deep fried oysters. he really liked his, i, on the other hand, that mine was okay. for dessert we got dulce de leche spring rolls....which were AWESOME. the dessert definitely added an extra star to the rating. 

id say its comparable to the elephant bar, but a star better.
author: alana v.

description: Came here on a Saturday night and it wasn't super packed which was nice. Service is friendly and nice. The atmosphere is great. The place is clean which is always a plus.Their food is awesomeeeeeeee! And they even had chopsticks which was nice :) haha They have a lot of variety on their menu which is great. The prices are a little high but worth it. We ordered the calimari ( awesome ), fish and chips (okay), and let's get saucy roll (AWESOME!). The sweet potato fries weren't that great... they're better at elephant bar. But overall this place is awesome. bill came to about $35 for those 3 dishes which isn't too bad. Will definitely come back!
author: Lauren L.

description: So I will start off by saying that on a different day I'm sure my experience would have been a lot better than it was. I went on a Saturday evening, about 5pm with a reservation of 10 people. The place is nice enough for a casual dinner or lunch with a friend or coworker but not for a quick bite. It is definitely a sit down type of restaurant. The place is pretty spacious, the booths are made to fit about 5 people per booth, unless sitting in the chair seating area. There is a full bar on the outside looking out onto Irving street. The lighting is dim and warm (very complementing to your skin :) ). As well as their paintings on the walls, very welcoming. So, after we all walked in they took about 10 minutes just to acknowledge that our group was waiting to be seated. After we were seated, we had a waiter named Neal, tall, middle-aged, white male with glasses and long-ish white hair, He was really impatient and rude. He did not give us that much time to review the menu before he kept bugging about ordering. By the second or third time of him asking, we were actually ready and he left in the middle of us telling him we were ready to order in irritation. He also made four mistakes on the bill (we had split checks) and was very sarcastic when we had to add more money (because he did not divide the cards right), and I quote, " Wow how generous of you all, now I am blushing because you added more money", it might not sound as bad as he said it, but it came off very rude and sarcastic. After the fourth mistake we asked for the manager to set the cards right because clearly he didn't know what he was doing. And even the manager cut my friend off in the middle of expressing our frustration with the cards and also Neal's service to us. Then, once the manager spoke to Neal he came back to us saying " SO whats the problem now!?!" then walking away AGAIN in the middle of our sentence shaking his head. I have NO IDEA why they were so out of it with their service but it was EXTREMELY disappointing because the FOOD WAS REALLY GOOD. I ordered the 2 taco Entree with the choice to mix and match with the other styled tacos. I ordered the Traditional Baja taco which is basically a Baja fish taco with Jalepeno sauce over it, and the Shrimp Cabo which is with crispy shrimp, a special chef sauce, pico de gallo and avocado (YUMM). The Shrimp Cabo taco was my friends favorite as well. The Entree's are about  $10-15 depending on what you get. SO all in all, the experience wasn't the best, but the food was very tasteful. I DO, want to go again, but maybe this time to a different location. If any of you do decide to try this location out for yourself STAY CLEAR of NEAL. He is a douche. And a horrible waiter. If it weren't for the service, I would give this place 5 stars or food and location. Hope this helps?
author: Allanah S.

description:
3 stars for mediocre food and service.

We made a reservation for lunch and we were 15 minutes early. When we walked in, half of the place was empty, but the waitress said the table isn't going to be ready until the time of our reservation. We waited and when it finally became the time, I asked if we can just sit down and they said it's not ready yet. I didn't understand-- there are so many empty tables, why can't we just sit at one of those tables? We ended up waiting for another 10 minutes to get a table.

Service was good once we were at the table.

I had fish and chips ($13). The fish was very soggy, not crispy at all, as if they were dipped in the water after frying. Not tasty at all. Not easy to eat either, because it easily breaks down when you try to pick it with the fork to dip it in the sauce. The fish was so soggy that the parchment paper underneath the fish got soggy too. The paper got so easily torn, so the food dropped through the holes in the paper. It was ugly.

It came with a small coleslaw, but it tasted old. I make coleslaws at home all the time so I know when it's about to go bad. It was definitely old, mishandled, or both. 

My wife had a wasabi bawl. She and I thought it was pretty good. I ended up eating half of her food.

Next time I might try different things on the menu, but would stay away from the soggy, overpriced fish and chips.
author: Taekjin S.

description:
i would give this place 4.5 stars. The service was a liiiiiittle slow, not too bad but the food was excellent. the wasabi bowls, yuuuuuum and the dulce de leche spring roll for dessert...no words for it !!!!!! So good!!!!!! 
It's a good place if you go with others who don't necessarily want sushi, they can get tacos or a salad, and vice versa but this was my first time there and I def. recommend it. It's not a typical sf "hip" scene necessarily but the food is great oh yeah, and so are the lemon grass mojitos! 
enjoy!
author: Monique P.

description: I really like this place.  Very chill and always a good choice for happy hour or a leisurly drink.  The food is really great too (sweet potato fries with yummy dips!)  We usually sit in the bar and the service can be a tad on the slow side.  But, if you're just chillin anyway, it doesn't really matter.
author: a e.

description:
Update: The restaurant sent us a nice e-mail via Yelp apologizing and indicating that the situation could have been handled differently. Other than the one incident we really enjoyed our meal, the service was very friendly and attentive. We particularly enjoyed the Rock n. Roll BBQ eel, the Idaho trout special, and the corn on the cob on the side was cooked perfectly (I think the best corn on the cob I have ever had). We have changed our opinion and would certainly go again. 

Old Review: 
Not kid friendly. 

Don't let the large selection on the children's menu fool you, the manager has no patience for little ones. Obviously managers have to be cognizant of their other customers and step in when parents let their children cause unreasonable disruption, but his threshold of tolerance is very low. 

Excellent service and good food, but why pay for public humiliation.
author: Scott N.

description: This could be one of my favorite places to eat in with kids. Food is good in general, but unfortunately that can't be said about service. We went in on Sat morning just right after they opened and waited for an hour for our food to arrive. There were 4-5 tables filled and our waiter was running all over the place. Hope it was just a fluke. Hate to hate this place cause truly it's not a bad place to eat.
author: Lynn W.

description:
Don't do it.  I was really excited to see a new restaurant open in the area and decided to give it a try.  

Pros:  Service was excellent, we had the nicest waitress ever.  She was knowledgeable and didn't push drinks/apps/desserts on us.  Sweet potato fries and calamari were decent.  Dipping sauces were excellent.  Poke flavor was great.

Cons:  Worst ahi tuna (sesame and seared) ever!  You can tell it just came out of the freezer.  Big let down.  Cost is high for quality of food.

I say skip it, and go to a neighboring restaurant for better food.
author: Aimee L.

description: Solid dinner time meal... I had a shrimp taco and salmon taco with a side salad. I love that they bring out Pepperidge Farm pretzel goldfish with edamame for you to snack on. The shrimp taco with mango salsa was good but the mango was a little bland so I was disappointed. Maybe I had my hopes set too high for that one? The BBQ salmon taco was outstanding. Good fish, great taste with the BBQ sauce, worked well in a taco. Sweet potato fries? Meh. But then sweet potatoes aren't my favorite to begin with.
author: Bryan Z.

description: I love pac catch in the Marina & was psyched to hear they had a new location. Unfortunately it is nothing like the quaint locale in the marina.  I always wished they would open a bigger place but I didn't mean Las Vegas style.   The decor is weird, they were WAY cheap on the wine - didn't even fill the glass half way up and the food was good as usual.   I guess I might go back,  but I would never go out of my way to eat here. :-(
author: gem s.

description:
I've been searching for a restaurant with great fish (especially grilled fish/salmon) in San Francisco for a few years now, but I have to say the search is not over yet. I had high hopes for Pacific Catch that I saw open on the 9th Ave a while back. Yesterday evening was the time to check it out.

As an appetizer we had the Coconut Shrimp. It came with a thai sweet chili sauce, but even with that it felt a little tasteless. For entrees we had the day's special Ono Hawaiian style which was very dry. I've had Ono dishes in Hawaii and feel that they were totally superior. My date had the Tokyo Salmon fish & chips but said that they were average, nothing to get excited for.

I have not been to the other locations of Pacific Catch, but based on the other reviews I might check them out later, but for me there is no need to go back to the 9th Ave location. And where have I had excellent grilled fish? Oregon coast, Hawaii, northern Europe...
author: Adore P.

description: Ok, so it's not the beloved Canvas Gallery, it's not Gary Danko....but still good neighborhood spot with tasty Mai Tais, good sweet potato fries, fish tacos and and friendly bartenders.  If you want to kick back, just enjoy a low-key bite to eat or happy hour by GG Park...well, not a bad choice whatsoever...
author: Alissa V.

description: I really enjoy eating here. I alternate between my two favorites whenever I eat here: a wasabi bowl (usually poke) or the wasabi ahi sandwich. You can't go wrong with either! For an extra $1.95, you can get the delicious sweet potato fries with your sandwich. If you sign up for the e-newsletter, you get a free appetizer (alternates between baja shrimp ceviche with tortilla chips and poke) with any $12.95 order. There is a small parking lot behind the restaurant. I think it fits about eight cars. Looking for parking around here is not fun, especially on a Friday or Saturday night. Making a reservation doesn't hurt to help you get seated quicker! So far service has been good.
author: Jenn O.

description: Menu consists of flavorful japanese food. I am a fan of the sushi selection AND that they  offer brown rice for sushi. Their wasabi bowls are also awesome. They didn't offer hot sake which was a big bummer and the service was a bit slow, but I think it was probably just the server we had and all 3 of us who were dining really enjoyed our meal. It's also great option for those who want to do asian food but prefer not to eat raw fish as Pacific Catch has a wide selection of raw fish free cuisines as well.
author: Snora E.

description: I like Pacific Catch because it is lively and has a parking lot.  However, I think that the sushi is very sloppy and the rolls are falling apart.  Also, I'm not usually a fan of mystery pink sauce on my sushi but little did I know that it is that pink sauce that provides the "spicy" in the spicy tuna rolls.  Without it, the rolls taste like a mouthful of sprouts.
author: melissa o.

description:
The hostess could not mask her lack of enthusiasm, her "enjoy your meal" came out like a curse, 

The fried oysters were good.  The fries were average and lacked salt, there was no salt on the table and the waiter was largely absent.  

The cole slaw portion was about two tablespoons, really.  C'mon guys this is cabbage, kick down a little roughage with the deep fried meal.  

The mahi tacos tasted like lime juice.

The black beans were okay, small portion like the cole slaw, but that was all I needed.

The sweet potato fries were average.

I could go back, but I won't have high hopes.  It is a good idea but the execution is lacking.
author: Swaz E.

description: Delicious food and good service! Another great neighborhood restaurant, they just keep popping up all over the 9th and Irving area.
author: Randa T.

description: the  food is great. I especially recommend the sweet potato fires, the fish tacos. the service is very fast with friendly staff. great selection of organic teas.
author: morgan t.

description: Most chain restaurants have frumpy decor and the food they serve usually adheres to "McDonalds" quality standards. This particular restaurant chain served (surprisingly) decent food at reasonable prices.  However, there are drawbacks:  parking is almost never available, wait time is usually long and the wait-staff can be abrupt with customers.  Also, I would not recommend ordering anything off their dessert menu - it's not worth the money they're charging.  Eat your dinner here and then walk over the Crepevine for really great dessert!
author: Daria i.

description: Sunday afternoon my boyfriend and I took a long walk around inner sunset and stopped by Pacific catch to have drinks. A waiter was nice and quick but the drink, my boyfriend ordered, came out with 2 black long hair in it!!!!!! It was so gross!!!!! And the waiter took it back and brought a new drink but he didn't even offer to take the gross-hair-in drink out of our bill. We just paid and didn't leave tips. We'll never go back there again.. even just thinking of the drink, still makes me throw up :( :(
author: Q S.

description: I went for lunch today after a morning at the de Young b/c Park Chow was packed with a giant waiting list.  I've been hesitant to come here b/c it's a chain, but I was pleasantly surprised. The place was pretty empty at just after noon on a Sunday, but started to fill up while I was there.  Nice wine by the glass list and friendly service. I had the seared ahi salad, which wasn't earth-shattering, but was solidly executed and fresh.
author: A W.

description: i can't believe i haven't reviewed this place yet! i've been here a few times and have not been dissappointed yet. i always get cravings for the hawaiian poke appetizer which is awesome. came here for dinner on a saturday night with my family without a reservation and we were still able to get a table pretty quickly. i would advise making reservations though. i had the surf and turf entree which was super yummy, a bit too much rice but otherwise no complaints. service was great and the restaurant itself has a very calm and pleasant atmosphere. i like!
author: Linda N.

description: The food was great.  I had the tacos.  It was just the right amount of food.  Also the filtered cold sake was smooth and delicious.  The best part of the meal was our waiter, Neil.  He was not to intrusive, he brought us an extra plate of goldfish pretzels and edamane when he saw that we ran out, and we didn't even have to ask for it. He has a great personality.  He is the type of waiter every waiter should strive to become.  I know, I am  a former waitress.
author: Susan B.

description: I believed that there was a high probability that this place was going to suck big time when I walked in.  The space was HUGE *by SF standards* and had that sort of Texas Big Chain restaurant feel to it. But I was wrong. I thoroughly enjoyed my meal here.  I had the barbecue shrimp tacos and the fried mahi mahi tacos.  Both tacos were yummy, but i liked the shrimp ones best..  My tacos came with lots of sweet and salty sweet potato fries.  They were the best I've had to date (although I've only tried them 2 other times in my life).  My boyfriend at the time ordered the ahi sandwich and thoroughly enjoyed it.  I also ordered a Mai Tai in the middle of the day and it was not only sufficiently strong, but tasty as well.  Thank you helpful waitress, for assisting me in finalizing that selection.  All in all, I had a good experience, but after reading the rest of the Yelp reviews, I get the feeling that the food here can be a little hit and miss.
author: LaSha G.

description: I love the new location that opened up. I can actually swing my arms without hitting at least 5 people like the Pacific Catch on Chestnut. Food is always steller here and I actually like their cocktails and bar food that they have set up. They have their own parking lot, which is odd from the other places around that neighborhood. Good, high traffic area, great parking and great food.
author: mark h.

description: My boyfriend and I tried this place on Monday and I thought the food was just average.  The place is really nice and modern looking. I made reservations through Opentable and got a seat right away.  We got there around 7 and there were still plenty of tables open. I also liked how this place has a parking lot - small, but we were able to get a space.  We ordered the calamari appetizer which was very good! - probably some of the best I've ever had.  For entrees, we got the 3 piece fish n chips and the 3 taco platter.  The fish n chips were average - seasoning was good but not as crispy as I usually like.  The tacos were tasty - we had one of each: cod, tropical shrimp, and i think mahi mahi.  Overall, all of the seafood tasted fresh.  Oh, and had the sweet potato fries - hella good!  They were nice and crispy.  Another cool thing was that they gave us pretzel Goldfish crackers and edamame as snacks before we ordered!!  The service here was also great!!  I only gave this place 3 stars since the food was pretty average but kind of pricey for what it was.  And the place could use better ventilation (the kitchen is open though, which was kind of nice).  Even though I miss Canvas, I'm glad this place is here.
author: Michelle H.

description: I have eaten here twice, the food is good,  I didn't expect anything special but it was tasty.  The service is horrible!
author: Tom T.

description: While I would not recommend this place for a romantic dinner, it is a great place to take the family.  If you go on the earlier side there are loads of children to take away from the noise your child might be making.  Overall, the food is fresh and offers a pretty good variety of seafood options, Hawaiian, Mexican,  and Japanese style.
author: Leo S.

description: Were on a vacation and decided to go here for dinner with our 3 kids. We absolutely loved it. Fish and chips were outstanding. Wasabi Poke Bowl was superb. Had a Korean BBQ spare rib appetizer that was a special for the night which made us want to come back again the next night. So, we did. 2 nights in a row.  Our kids loved it as well, especially the spicy french fries. Our servers on both nights were outstanding. The GM came by several times to make sure we were doing well. The Chef even walked around to make sure his patrons were enjoying there food. I will make this a priority every time we come back to SF.
author: Tony S.

description: Absolutely love it. Great prices, excellent service....pleasant experience.
author: Anastassia G.

description: A whole lotta signs around the restaurant point out supposed fetching yet overpriced food, but that doesn't matter if the service is sub par, nearly negligent. These guys don't seem like they want a tip. How about a little refill on the water, buddy? Or even ask how we're doing? Once? Maybe next time (highly fucking doubtful i'll be back for a 'next time'), they'll manage to even crack a goddamn smile. Maybe it was just that my fish 'n chips (sweet potato shoe-string-like frites) wasn't as good as everyone else's food and the much-anticipated Coconut beer (for me anyway) tasted more like an oversweetened Guiness. Or it could be the fact that something that looks like it was spawned from the Marina supplanted what was once a great little hangout called the Canvas Cafe. I can see how the neighborhood would want to support a place like this, but if they continue to staff clueless and practically robotic servers, it looks like it'll be more sink than swim. or even 'Catch'.
author: Chris C.

description: Yummmmy!  Healthy!  (I think)  Last night I had my usual, which was a side Wakame salad, and the Tokyo Salmon fish and chips.  Unbelievable, as usual!  I just had to write something today, although I've already been there several times.  First of all, you just can't beat their salmon for the price.  It absolutely melts in your mouth like a stick of butter.  Thats how I like my salmon.  And the fries, both sweet potato and regular are delish!  Everything I  have eaten in this restaurant has been fabulous.  I even love their Miso soup.  Oh yeah, don't miss the grilled artichoke appetizer (if you are an artichoke fan like me).   Mmmmmm.  The restaurant itself is very hip looking as well.  It easily accomodates large or small groups.  A lot more  comfy than the Chestnut location!  Loved our server last night.  My mother in law thought she had left her cell phone there, and the server literally pulled up cushions looking for it!  Not a lot of people would do something like that.  Only one critique:  I'm not really into the desserts, but I know some people adore the mochi.
author: Allison A.

description: Food is not bad. The waiter we had needed a refresher course or a new one at least on etiquette. Didn't come around once after he brought our food to check in on us and when we paid the bill, he mindlessly threw the change on our table as he was talking to the table next to us. He was a tall Asian guy with a pony tail. The host was very nice though. Tipping is a privilege. Remember that!
author: S. F.

description: This place is awesome. I went there with some friends for my birthday last night. The place has a great vibe. I had a tuna dish that was excellent. It had 3 different types of tuna that were all prepared in a great way. Their sweat potato fries are also really good with their two dipping   sauces. Even their sushi was good, but I would never go there if you were just looking to eat sushi. Great food and a great time will bring me back here sooner than later.
author: David S.

description:
i had been boycotting this place forever because i was so sad when the canvas gallery closed (remember the canvas gallery? that place rocked!) not to mention that i drive by pacific catch almost every day and the outside now looks like a super cheesy seafood chain. 

however, i finally found myself back in the inner sunset and in front of pacific catch so i decided to go in, and was pleasantly surprised. the menu is much more versatile than i would have expected. a new country's cuisine is featured each month, and a 4 course set meal is available or you can purchase anything off the set menu a la carte.  i agree that the fried oysters are awesome. the sushi rolls aren't the most inventive, but i hadn't expected sushi on the menu at all, so that was cool. 

and the drink menu is pretty frickin impressive. inventive drinks (i got a tequila cosmo, which i've never thought to make) lots of different kinds of beers are available, including a hawaiian beer in a can, and happy hour is from 4-6pm and 10pm to close. you can't beat a deal like that, i would totally go back.
author: Mary Beth D.

description: I wouldn't come back to Pacific Catch.  Our meal was too expensive for what we got, which wasn't very flavorful.  The best part was the sweet potato fries.
author: Amanda H.

description: I'm usually pretty weary about "Asian Fusion" restaurants because I feel they are often over priced "Asian" inspired food like Betelnut. But, I am pleasantly surprised by Pacific Catch. This place is more like Hawaiian Fusion and the food is absolutely delicious! My all time favorite is the Spicy Ahi-Tuna sandwich with sweet potato fries on their lunch menu. The tuna is seared to perfection and the sweet potato fries is crispy and fresh! I also really enjoyed their Ahi Poke and their sushi rolls are BIG!! The wasabi rice bowls are also really good, it's kinda like a de-constructed sushi with rice, seaweed, some kind of fish or meat, ginger, and fish roe. If you are really hungry, then the wasabi rice bowl is the way to go. They also have fish and chip, island tacos, and fresh fish of the day entrees. Overall this is a great place to come with a group of friends and they also have a full bar for happy hour!
author: Annie L.

description: Came for dinner one night with my husband and 3 kids.  Service was horrible.  The food was okay but our waiter never checked in on us.  It took a reeeeally long time to get our bill--in fact we flagged one of the bus boys down to help us.  Not a pleasant experience at all and bad enough to make me write this review
author: Sarah S.

description: My mom and I went here starving after a trip to the Cal Academy.  It was very decent and very filling.  I had the Poke wasabi bowl.  The fish was a bit disappointing- scallions were overpowering and the fish itself wasn't the freshest I've had.  My mom had the taco combo with one chicken and one grilled fish of the day.  She liked them.  Definitely decent, nice atmosphere, great service.
author: Lauren H.

description: Came here with a group of about eight people. Had a reservation but got their early so we all hung out at the bar for a few beers. They did have an ok selection. There were a few I hadn't had before so they were more than willing to let me try a few things. After getting our tables the server we had was pretty nice. He was a little undertrained but did a fine job overall. The food was just ok. I was not expecting much. The menu had just about every way possible to serve fish. Thats a little ridiculous. The fish did not seem to be the best quality. I am sure it was pretty fresh but just not the best quality. And it wasn't the best tasting food. There was really nothing special about anything in this place. It was just mediocre food prepared the same way a couple other hundred restaunts prepare their food. If I am with a group who wants to go their I would try it again but I don't have any desire to visit again.
author: Sasha V.

description: Yummy specialty martini menu. Try one of each and cab it home! Food is good, though pricey. Service is above average. We enjoy sitting at the bar and talking up the 'tender. Park in the park.
author: Matt G.

description: so i was told by some friends that i should go here for dinner.  So we went the other night and wow, what a sh**thole.  I have never tasted such terrible seafood in SF.  The fish was frozen, so not fresh at all.  My friend had the Hawaiian ribs, which were just so so, nothing at all out of the ordinary.  Even the drinks we had were just so so.  Maybe i went on the wrong night, but i dont think i will be going back there anytime soon for any kind of fish.  If i want good seafood ill go to Scoma's or the Cliffhouse.
author: matt j.

description: and "meh" is right ....went here last night and we were seated right away...nice atmosphere and i was really looking forward to eating here...the menu is extremely strange...starters and sushi on one side and 3 choices of fish specials for the evening on the other. i went for the mahi mahi (california style) and mom went for the escolar. wait..before that we started with the califnornia rolls pretty basic but DEFINATELY not out of this world. the portions were big and i left full but not satisfied...i liked the bar area though and i will definately give it another try because i saw they had a bar menu and a full bar as well...
author: shannon b.

description: good friendly service, tasty fish and chips, nice lively ambiance and reasonable prices - its a great spot for a casual night out with some friends.  we will be back for sure.
author: Teresa T.

description: This place is great. Food is delicious, atmosphere is warm - and the only affordable place in San Francisco I know of with so much space. I highly recommend the wasabi ahi tuna sandwich!
author: Michael S.

description: I really like the food here. A lot. But the service is terrible. On my last visit, they screwed up my order twice. First, they forgot the fish (isn't this is a fish place?), then, they brought it back with the fish, but covered in salad dressing, despite my request for no dressing. I could live with this, but neither server was remotely apologetic about their mistakes or the significant delay it caused my eating companions.
author: Hillary L.

description: Took the family here for Father's Day (all fishermen and/or fish eaters) and we all loved it.  We ordered a variety of stuff with the kids mostly getting various fish tacos, adults ranging from the grilled salmon to beef salad.  I got a kamikaze bloody mary (haven't had a bm for about 20 years! and this was good, not too wasabe infused, not overly alcoholic) then the ahi poke rice bowl.  I was going to get the extra tobiko but forgot to order it.  Oh, man, that was a good bowl of food!  I'm not a sprouts eater but these were fresh and yummy and went well with all the other foods in the bowl.  And the poke was outstanding.  I wonder why I've never poke before--probably because this is the first place I've been to that has even mentioned it.  And, of course, there were desserts all around (I take cappuccino as my dessert of choice), which I'm told were incredible.  All in all, the food was excellent, staff was unintrusive but attentive, bathrooms were clean, and I think all was well worth the prices.  My one "complaint" was that it was too noise to really chat much with the folks not directly across or next to me.  I'm glad it's in my neighborhood since I plan to make this one of my regular "take out" joints.
author: Kai T.

description: We were going to the Japanese Tea Garden but before we went inside we decided to eat lunch first because we were starving. They only had cookies and tea in the garden and the nearby cafe was full of people and we didnt want to wait in line. They told us to walk along for 10mins and we'll find other food places so we did. The first restaurant we saw was Pacific Catch Grill. We decided go to in and check it out, we were excited to try their sushi. We ordered the California Roll and the Shrimp Tempura, we also had the sweet potato fries...yum i love those! Their sweet potato fries did not disappoint, my husband and I finished the whole basket! I can't say the same for the sushi rolls. After a couple of pieces, they did not taste right to me. I just didn't like the carrot in the California roll. Plus it seemed like they put wasabi in the actual rolls and I didn't like that since I don't eat wasabi anyway. My husband ended up finishing both the rolls but he didn't really enjoy it. So just 2 stars for the excellent potato fries.
author: Christine P.

description: I ate here the first time last Friday.  I usually go to Park Chow but saw this relatively new restaurant so decided to check it out with my friend.  I was pleasantly surprised.  First, it's kind of a Hawaiian fusion restaurant.  There are not a lot of these restaurants in the city so it's kind of unique for me. The only other place I can remember is Roy's downtown.  Anyhow, we ordered the Hawaiian Poke as appetizer.  You actually get a decent size dish for $8.50 -- big chunks of raw tuna, probably a little TOO big.  As entrees, we ordered fish from their chalkboard specials.  I think what makes it cool was that they give you some side dishes as well which sort of fill you up.  At other places like Aqua, you get just a piece of fish for like $30.  The fish was pretty good.  My friend ordered the scallops which was big and juicy as well.  We'll certainly come back again.
author: Amy V.

description: i came here again with my friend.. we got the calamari appetizer.. i think the calamari pieces were too small so it had a lot of batter.. and it was also soaked in oil.. (ewwww).. he got the salmon teriyaki and i got tacos again.. the tacos wasnt that good this time around.. maybe they had an off day?  my friend didnt think his order was that good either..
author: JUDY L.

description: Food was pretty bland, and the service was mediocre. The basic theme is fish and ships with an asian spin, but the end result is tame and not very flavorful.
author: Matthew V.

description: Came here for my bf's birthday.  There were a few tables open, but they wont seat us.  We had to wait about 15 minutes before they seat us on one of the open tables that were empty since we got there.  The food is great!  i love their sweet potato fries.  If you dont feel like steak, fast food, or just dont know where to eat....go to pacific catch!
author: Linda H.

description: the service for a lazy sunday afternoon around 4pm was very slow we waited 15 minutes to order and then it took 35 minutes and we only received 2 orders and the last one came 15 minutes later , terrible service the kitchen had 5 cooks too. food was good but hate to be there when they get busy
author: Joe S.

description: great service quality food and plenty of menu selection and they serve Kona Longboard parking is a bit difficult at certain times but this place is a great place to visit
author: Christopher C.

description: The space is cool but little of that has to do with the restaurant.  The building is cool just as it was cool when it was The Canvas.  There is little other reason to go here.  Plus, have you ever sat in the bar?  You can't fit your legs under the tables.  Stupid design flaw.  And I'd really like to know why I always get seated in the bar when other tables are available.  Anyway, It's fairly expensive for being a "reasonably priced" seafood joint.  The food is ok.  I've had the tacos, seared ahi salad and some sushi rolls.  All were just average.  For the location, building and food, I'd probably give this place a 3 overall.  One thing irks me enough to take it down to 2.  The staff.  I've been to this location 3 times and each time have been left in awe of the "too cool for school" attitude.  I can't really describe it, other than to say it's a terribly annoying egotistical tone the servers and bartenders use to talk to you.  No, you're not cute.  Oh, and minus points for $1.50 extra charge for tobiko on sushi.  Not cool.
author: M M.

description: Great bar selection, fun atmosphere (after work crowd) and really good food.  The bowls are worth trying.  All the dishes with raw fish are really good (tuna, salmon, etc...).  Recommend the ahi tuna bowl.  Nice location and reasonably priced.
author: Sanjiv B.

description: Don't let the 3 stars fool you - I love Pacific Catch!  I was super excited that this locale opened.  Unlike the one on Chestnut and the one in Corte Madera, this one has a full-service bar area and happy hour menu (4-6pm and after 10pm till close) - nice!  I always get their poke wasabi bowl with brown rice (delish!), but I've been pretty happy with the other dishes I've sampled as well.  Bartenders are friendly - very pleasant service when I've ordered to-go.  Unfortunately, my first in-house dining experience at this Pacific Catch couldn't garner more than 3 stars!  Our waitress wasn't particularly pleasant - hard to track down (and it wasn't busy), just looked at us strangely when we nicely told her the soybeans she gave us had gone sour (they had!)...I'll still be back because I do like their food; just hope my next visit will go a bit smoother.  Oh, and I'm itching to try that late night happy hour!
author: Joyce L.

description: Good service.  The lunch special fish was really good as was the salmon sandwich.  Didn't have to wait even though it was a Sunday afternoon during lunc time.  It's a lot bigger than their other restaurant on Chestnut.  The location is great for a walk into Golden Gate park after lunch.
author: Mich C.

description: This is my favorite restaurant for a normal (non-'fancy') out-to-dinner night, or lunch, or happy hour, or to take out of town visitors. The menu is varied enough to please all comers, with asian style, mexican style, and rotating specials. The wasabi bowls are an incredible value, so much delicious sashimi (or cooked salmon or crab or unagi) and seaweed salad, avocado and veggies that I can never finish it all. The sushi rolls are huge and delicious (try the shiitake/asparagus/miso roll!), and they have good prices on tap beers and unique cocktails. The house cured salmon is delectable. I love the baja style mahi mahi and sweet potato fries. You can sit outdoors if you have a dog, or if it's just a nice day. There's a teensy parking lot, but usually ample parking on Lincoln or in the park. The servers and bartenders are really nice. They take reservations. The only thing to avoid are the booths over by the bathrooms. Otherwise, what's not to LOVE?
author: L J.

description: Mix 'n match service with solid food sums it up.  Party of four, we decide to wait in the bar and get some drinks and a snack while waiting for the table.  The bar was really packed, but we found a great area to settle in and proceeded to try to achieve our consumables-related goal.  The waiter in the bar was spacey at best; he took a drink and food order from one of us (four people seated around a low table facing one another) and turned a left.  Hello?  The successful orderer had to chase him down to get him to come back.  Fortunately, we were quickly called to our table and the odd service became efficient and professional.
