The poke app was excellent, but the complete winner at the table was the fish and chips with the sweet potato fries.  Unlike 99% of fish in such baskets are caked with batter; generally by the time I've eaten one piece I have to peel n' eat.  This was like no other.  The fish was tender, and very lightly fried; probably the best I've had.   The sweet potato fries are terrific too, and a wonderful change.  Yum.
author: Gwen E.

description: first time going there... for lunch... not even pack.. i ordered their fish and chips( sweet potato)... it was delicious... i had the passion mango cheesecake... it was not too sweet... very refreshing.... and i finished it with my friend.. their decorations are nice,,, and very friendly service...
author: Lily T.

description:
I went to Pacific Catch because it was highly recommended by three of my coworkers.  They kept raving about the sweet potato fries and because I'm such a big fan of the "healthy" fries, I just had to taste it for myself.

I was warned about the lack of parking, but we got lucky when we found a spot in the restaurant's small lot in the back.  I never knew how booming the area was until Friday.  The weather was just perfect, even at 9pm.  There were so many people walking around 9th Ave. and around GG park in tshirts and shorts.  Pacific Catch was the perfect place to have dinner.  I loved the restaurant - very casual, big and it just reminded me of being in Hawaii.  I made a reservation on Open Table just 3 hours before and we were seated right away.

The hostess was nice and cordial, but we didn't get much quality service after that.  I have nothing really to say, nothing good or bad.  The conversation was kept at the bare freakin minimum.

My boyfriend opted to get a bunch of appetizers for himself.  The calamari, shrimp ceviche and coconut shrimp.  He originally asked for the crispy oysters, but they ran out (so he got the shrimp instead).  We were both surprised to find whole shrimp in the ceviche.  It was a refreshing dish, but could've used a little bit more flavor.  I ordered the Hawaiian BBQ Surf and Turf.  The asparagus had to be substituted with bak choy cause they were out of that, too.  I'd hate to hear what else they ran out of, but hey, it was hot and I'm sure they were busy all day long.  The shrimp was cooked perfect.  It didn't occur to me until I saw the medium rare steak strips that the waitress hadn't asked me how I wanted it cooked.  It would've been 10x more delicious if it was prepared the way I like it (medium well).  I wasn't a big fan of the pineapple fried rice only because I don't really like pineapples.  But my bf said it was good.

Now, onto the basket of sweet potato fries we ordered.  Again, my coworkers would not stop talking about them, so you can guess how excited I was to try them.  I wasn't disappointed, but I've had better.  The sweet and sour dipping sauce was a great condiment to go with the fries.  Just pour it from the store bought bottle and serve...so simple!  I believe the other sauce was wasabi something, but I couldn't really tell.  It didn't have much flavor.  I can't pinpoint exactly what I didn't like about the fries.  I mean, they were crispy, cooked fresh and tasty.  I guess my coworkers pumped it up so much that I was expecting a lot more.

Nonetheless, I'd go back.  I've read great things about the fish tacos and the dulce de leche dessert that I was too full to try.  And if you know me, you'd know that I live true to "there's always room for dessert."
author: Karen S.

description: why but oh why did they close the unique original quirky chill awesome Canvas Cafe and replaced it with a chain restaurant??? why? that sucks :(
author: virginie d.

description: my friend told me about pacific catch, but we would have to go the one in marine until the one on irving opened. the tuna poke is really good. they give u big portions fr a good price, but sometimes is a lil too salty. must get the sweet potato fries! its the best and there beef bowl is really good. the steak is so tender and flavorful, but the sauce for the rice is okie. must try this place and the prices are decent. very casual environment
author: Karen H.

description:
i came here once and will never come back again.

i'm not a fan of shellfish, but i have my moments when i'm craving seafood or will tolerate it. i wasn't picky this night and my sister wanted seafood...she normally comes here..but i shall NEVER return...EVER.

when i first came here, i ordered the mixed basket of fried things..i dont' remember what it was called, but i seemed like a good deal and i couldn't decide on a single item to order, so it seemed like a great decision...and then it was only $13.95. it also came with a side of sweet potato fries and a tiny scoop of coleslaw. my sister got two tacos, totaling about $12...kind of pricey for my taste, but it came with a super small salad and a tiny scoop of beans. i don't remember if she said it was good or anything, but i will never come back because i got food poisoning. 

my meal was free due to a mis-communication with the kitchen and our waiter, but food poisoning really takes those stars away. i went home feeling fine, but about 3 hours later started feeling a gag reflex. i felt it for abuot 2 hours and then i finally threw up...for about 15 minutes. it was disgusting. and it wasn't anything else i ate that day because all i ate was fruit...and i'm pretty sure it was the deep fried oysters because they tasted horrible, but for some reason, i was determined to finish one. i thought it was just because i didn't like oysters but they didn't seem too bad deep fried...little did i know, it ruined my experience of this restaurant forever. and since it was food poisoning, i would give this place 0 stars..but i'm obligated to give it 1 because of the lack of the 0.
author: Ryanne L.

description: Go for the Happy Hour between 4-6 p.m.  that includes bar bites.  Dinner was a little disappointing.  The poki (ahi tuna) was on the salty side and the fish recommended by the waitress was dry.  At $17.00 which included a slightly small piece of fish, veggies and potatoes, it was not worth it.  Fried fish and chips was nothing to brag about. Then, the ahi tuna salad was drenched in salty dressing.   My friend just ate what was sitting on top of the bowl.  We mentioned it to the waitress and she was apologetic.  Allowed us to order a dessert on the house.  Coffee was on the house too because the first round of coffee that came out was cold.
author: Di F.

description: BLAH SERVICE AND FOOD.  Been here twice now and my bf is/was a regular, but after he got soaked with ice water by our waiter and had the mediocre mixed fried seafood basket he left disappointed.  It was disconcerting that the waiter didn't even bother reseating us even though the water was all over the floor around us, we decided to up and reseat ourselves.  It was also disappointing that he didn't even comp anything (he thought he'd try a joke instead) or have the manager come to see if everything was ok.  SAY NO TO THE FRIED SEAFOOD BASKET- appeared nearly burnt and seems to have been sitting under a heat lamp as the sauces had a "dried skin" on them.  The ahi wasabi rice bowl was good for the first few bites and just got boring, too much rice not enough other stuff.
author: win c.

description: I love the atmosphere of this place! They have their own parking lot which helps on busy weekend days (although it only has like 8 spaces) and the feeling in the restaurant is super cool. I love how much natural light comes in. I dont really remember my food, shows how memorable it was, but I was more concerned with the fresh, crisp feel this place had than if my food was actually that great.
author: Sarah I.

description: The food here is great, the service here is great, but here comes the downfall! The parking here SUCKS! You're going to have to circle the blocks plenty of times before finding a parking spot here. Other than that, the place is really good. The service here is alright. Sometimes when you want to ask for something, they don't give you the undivided attention that you need. Maybe they don't hear me loud enough? Idk, I think i'm pretty loud. Anyways, the food here is great. I love getting the Ahi tuna salad, it's one of my favorite dishes here to get. It comes with tuna that is lightly seared with a bed of arugala and natural greens. It comes with daikon, pickled ginger and some wakame... I believe. Either way its great and I love getting it everytime I come here. The wasabi and teriyaki bowls are also really good here. The wasabi bowls come with alot of other stuff other than your "main" choice of meat/veggie. The teriyaki bowls comes with pineapple fried rice, yum... with some seared bok choy to go along with it! GREAT STUFF. The sweet potatoe fries are the best stuff that ever happened to this earth after tofu soup. I cannot describe how good they are. It doesn't taste like any old regular fries, it actually has it own distinctive taste to it. It comes with an asian sweet chili sauce which is so good with the fries to give it a kick, and it also comes with a wasabi mayo that is also really good. Yum... making me hungry just talkign about this stuff! I love to come here ever so often, i'm such a fan of this place and espically theres one across from where I work makes this stuff even better.
author: Johnny T.

description: Great Variey on Menu, Everything was fresh.  Great appetizers!  Loved the Wasabi bowls and sweet potato fries.
author: David L.

description: the food at pacific catch is perfectly ok. i had the wasabi bowl with ahi tuna - it was fine. not particularly delicious, and nothing to write home about. plus, there was WAY too much rice included with it. the fried oysters were pretty tasty, but it's not that hard to fry an oyster (or anything else). and my ginger yuzu cooler was bo-ring. in sum, you're better off getting a chicken quesedilla at gordo's or sushi at ebisu if you are eating dinner on 9th at irving.
author: oona m.

description: come on two happy hours???  awesome!  the seating is nice but small in the bar area, and the drink/ bar food menu is great!  i loved the sweet potato shoe string fries and shrimp ceviche (although it was more a guac than ceviche).  the bar tenders were super down to earth!  the poor guy had been there 10 days straight and pulled some doubles- plus he was dealing with an old cougar trying to flirt with bitchi-ness.  anyway.  the only thin that bugged me was that the wait staff kept crowding near the bar gossiping.  not really what i want when I'm trying to gossip with my friends at the bar.  totally recommend it!!
author: Gina N.

description: White I totally enjoyed the cheerful and upbeat atmosphere I can't say i enjoyed the food as much. I ordered the Rising Sun Roll and the Coconut shrimp. The coconut shrimp was really good and I'd go back for them, but the rising sun was filled with to much ginger and the shrimp inside was soggy. I went with a larger group and we decided to share some fish and chips. The fish wasn't so great and a little bland. The fries were good but not the best. All in all the place wasn't my favorite and not some place I would go out of my way to go to but I'd go back. So I say go for the atmosphere and the coconut shrimp but don't expect anything amazing.
author: Shelby G.

description: So delicious.  The service was a bit slow, but in the end it was worth the wait.  The sweet potato fries were to die for.
author: jennifer h.

description: I ordered the coconut shrimp, which was good.  Except  that everytime I went to dip the shrimp in their sauce the outer layer of the shrimp would fall into the sauce.  The fried calamari and the sauce it came with was really good.  The calamari was cooked perfectly and the sauce had a zing in it that you don't notice until a couple of seconds after you've tasted it.  The service was great and the employees were excellent!   The ambiance and decor of the restaurant was more inviting than when Canvas occupied the space.
author: Annette D.

description: Asian fusion fare minus the typical Asian fusion price.  Nice modern atmosphere and friendly staff.  A creative menu, fresh and delicious food, fun drinks, and a unique selection of beers.  I ordered the grilled Hawaiian ono with pineapple Hawaiian fried rice and fried Maui onion strings.  I paired that with one of the beers from a Maui microbrewery.  My friend ordered the Ahi three ways.
author: Justin Y.

description: food was excellent. had the calamari and thai coconut shrimp for starters then had the sturgeon with sweet potato fries and the hawaiian style surf and turf. for dessert had the mochi fondo and another dessert with fried caramel thingy with vanilla ice cream. wow. everything was soooo good. service was one of the best and the restaurant was very nice. it was realltybusy and our food still came out really fast. i couldnt stop saying "mmmm yummy" i would definately come back. i want to go right now again!
author: Cory Y.

description: I'd heard a lot about Pacific Catch and its local for me so I was pretty excited to try it.  Unfortunately I was disappointed and it won't be added to the neighborhood rotation.  The food was just so so -- I ordered the california crab salad and the crab didn't seem particularly plentiful or fresh, but the worst part was our server.  Didn't introduce himself, couldn't be bothered to answer a question about an item on the menu, and had an annoying tendency to walk away  as we were mid question/request.  In general seemed 'put out' to have to be bringing us food.  Not impressive.  Finally, for what it is, I think it's a bit expensive.
author: Sarah G.

description: Well I suppose I just had a bad experience here overall. I thought it would be good since the place was packed and we had to wait 30 minutes for a table, but boy was I wrong. After careful deliberation, me and my husband decided on a salad for him and miso for me for the appetizers. The miso was okay and the salad was mediocre, but to there credit they also brought us pretzel goldfish, which was probably the best thing I ate there. Then for our entrees he had a fish and chips platter and I had a rock n' roll (Unagi and Avacado). I tried a bite of his fish n' chips and it was about the same as Captain D's. My rock n' roll was kinda all bad though. The roll itself was loose, and the pieces we way too big, while the pieces of unagi itself were skimpy and flavorless. To beat it all there was a short black hair ( I know it wasn't mine b/c my hair is not that color) on the plate beneath one of the sushis (Suprise!) but I didn't complain b/c our dinner was free anyway. Also the last bite of sushi I had felt like fire in my mouth, maybe they accidentally spilled something on it? But I think I just ordered the wrong thing, the lady next to me told me her plate (a salmon dish I think) was delish...so I guess it all depends on what you order here.
author: Brittani H.

description: I have heard mixed reviews of this restaurant from people so I finally decided to check it out last night.  We walked in around 7 and even though it looked pretty full we were seated within a few minutes.  The whole placeis very open and you can see the kitchen or bar form anywhere in the restaurant which I really like.  We started out with the Cabo Calamari which was amazing. It had just the right amount of batter on it, not greasy and came with a delicous spicy aioli sauce for dipping.  They actually bring you a side of edamame and pretzels to start with which I thought would be an odd combination but its really nice together.   I ordered the mai tai which was kind of sweet but really good.  Their service was great, fast , friendly, not over bearing or neglectful, just the right amount of attention.  My boyfriend ordered the fish and chips and I ordered the coconut shrimp..MY shrimp was the perfect blend of sweet and crunchy and I actually used the sauce from the calamari which was delicious on the sweet shrimp.  It came with sweet potato fries which also were not greasy.  His fish and chips were delicious! The fish was perfect, not the kind that tastes fishy, but a good crisp light flavor.  Also the coleslaw was awesome.  Sometimes it can be too flavorful with too much mayo.  It was just a nice light refreshing accent to the rest of the dish.   Just everything was great, the service, atmosphere and food. i would definitely check this place out!!!!
author: Chelsey L.

description: For what it is, an american-asian-seafood fusion chain restaurant, I think this place is great.  The menu rarely changes but the choices are good and the prices are fairly reasonable.  The service is pretty good, usually with a nice smile and good attitude.  The bathrooms are usually clean.  The kitchen is visible from the dining room and looks clean too.  They have a microscopic parking lot but parking is often found nearby in Golden Gate Park without too much trouble (unless something is going on in the park that day) and the atmosphere is family-friendly, cheery, and open.  Not bad at all for a lunch or dinner with friends or family.  I like the chopsticks available on the table and the teryaki bowls.  My husband usually likes getting the fried fish and sweet potato fries.  The salads and sushi rolls and calamari are good too.  This is not an elegant choice but it's casual, comfortable, and consistent.  It's a relatively good value.  Also, pretty fast service.  Make a reservation or call ahead though to get seated quite a bit faster.
author: GG P.

description: this place is overpriced for the quality and quantity of food you get. you could get better quality and quantity at whole foods market or bristol farms. really. because thats what it reminds me of. i had a hawaiian poke wasabi bowl, which tasted just okay. also crispy catch of the day with their sweet potato fries which are good, but not thaaat good. so if you dont toss your money around like trash, stay away from this seemingly trendy fusion of a restaurant more like upscale fastfood joint.
author: Porkers T.

description: i just went there today. the food is okay. we ordered a chicken and salmon teriyaki bowl which the rice was way to sweet. the sweet potatoe fries were good.  the passoin mange cheese cake was good too. i wouldnt take big number of groups there.
author: jennifer z.

description: i think this place was over hyped and over rated.   the menu sounds really good, but some how the food was ok.  nothing special.  its asian american fusion..  i had the salmon sandwich, was kind of bland.  we also had chicken nuggents, again nothing special.  we had the tuna 3 way.  needs more flavor.  fries were warm, not hot.  kind of soggy actually.  the sweet potatoe fries were good, but it was kinda of soggy also.  you could tell they dont make the fries to order.  they make it batches and lets it seat.  dessert was great, had the mango chessecake.  i was the place made food like the dessert, fresh, vibrant food, and lots of flavor.  oh, the bloody mary sucks.  just tomatoe juice with some soy sauce, very very sad.  again, the menu sounds ggood but the food doesnt work.   the place looks great.  the service needs some more work.  slow.  you have to shag down help.  i would rather walk down to pack chow next time.
author: don j.
